name: Empoderadas: Latinoamérica
description:
A game of visual speed where we are going to get to know the Latin American Empoderadas and their traces of life. Whoever discovers the ones with the most matches first wins.


It is a game from 7 years old where you will get to know women and dissidents from Latin America who made and are making history.

Discover that personal power and the symbols that represent them to go together and united in the fight.

Empoderadas is a project that was born from the inspiration that the struggles of women and dissidents from all over Latin America awaken in us.

name: Star Astalos
description:
During the game, the player builds a deck of cards that represents a scientific base operating in alien territory.

The game switches between Relief Steps, where you choose new cards to add into your deck, and Combat Steps, where alien waves of increasing difficulty are fought. Both enemy waves and cards eligible to be recruited are randomized (drawn from a previously shuffled deck).

During Combat Steps, your military cards can be played to destroy aliens or to repair your defenses. Then, surviving aliens damage your base back, deactivating your Shields and eventually lowering its Constitution rating.

Your scientific cards grant victory points and useful abilities, but eventually clog up your deck leaving your base vulnerable. Pursuing sinergetic card combinations and keeping the right balance between scientific and military assets is essential.

Aliens cannot be defeated. Game continues until your base is destroyed (by reaching 0 Constitution) and the game is lost, or the player decides to evacuate, cashing out the acquired victory points into a final score rating.

From the moment the evacuation is requested until it actually happens, two more waves of aliens must be fought, so pushing your luck too far might end in failure.

-description by the designer

Aliens have no technological nor numerical advantage. Humanity is unable to stop their slow advance due to the strange dimensional energy that surrounds them, against which our weapons and defenses are unprepared. This Anomaly is an unknown force, that only our dreams and subconscious may perceive.

We're vulnerable to its terror and delirium, but our scientists claim that this weakness comes with the potential for mastering it. Many survivors of the invasion have been elevated to a higher psionic state.

Now we're focused on Astalos, a terraformed quadrant under enemy control, still wrapped in traces of Anomaly. Our plan is to deploy there different operational bases so that our scientific personnel can carry out tests and measurements.

Our presence will attract hostile response. General, your mission is to defend one of those bases to the best of your ability, so you can then withdraw with the maximum amount of data and samples. You'll be deployed and evacuated by a Class IV Frigate, that will be kept hidden in supraorbital location and therefore will only be able to provide limited support.

You'll get the details during the transfer. Dismissed.

-from the rulebook
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bridge City Poker: Stretch Promo
description:
An additional Promo Power Card for “Bridge City Poker”. This card comes free with each copy of Portland Game Collective’s Edition of “Five Three Five” that is purchased directly from the publisher. It was also given out to all backers of the “Five Three Five” Kickstarter. They are limited to 2000 copies and available until supply runs out.

Stretch description:
Discard one card. Draw any two cards from the discard pile. Score 4 points if played. May only be played alone/non-melded. Player does not draw for a loss.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Animus: Nemesis
description:
Necromensia, a once great world of wonder and fnatasy, has fallen into ruin. Evil Entities have set their sights on a new world: Yours! Gather unlikely allies and stand your ground against an onslaught of bloodthirsty minions and a ravenous evil!

Animus: Nemesis is a 1 to 4 player card game in which the players draft a team of 9 unique characters from among a spanning multiverse to battle the onslaught of evil Nemesis enemies and their Minions.

Play solo or cooperative with up to 4 players. Requires Animus core box to play.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Dead End: Deadly Expansion
description:
Dead End - Deadly Expansion adds more Enemies, more Bystanders, more Decoys, more Hazards, more Items, more Special Items, more Voices, more Actions, more... Well, pretty much more of EVERYTHING that was so awesome about Dead End. This Deadly Expansion even adds new stuff, like Helping Hand cards that allow players to do Epic Wedgies, Demonic Uppercuts, Purple Nurples, and even fear-inspiring Belly Button Pokes!

That's not all though. Now players will be rewarded or punished for their deeds with a Karma-based system. And if players find themselves overwhelmed and outmatched, there's still a chance, albeit small. The personification of Luck may be on their side!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Falconry
description:
Falconry is a card placement strategy game, where thinking ahead matters. As one of several competing nobles, players place markers, send out falconers and birds, and seek to outmaneuver other contestants for the grand prize.

Each noble begins by placing his or her falconer, and the race is on! Falconers and birds can be used to claim other players markers for themselves, and falconers can ambush other players’ birds. Players race to be the first to align 5 or 6 cards in a row (depending on the variant).

Variations include forming alliances between players that require new strategies, as well as asymmetric game play, where a single player faces two allied opponents.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Multi-Use Cards, Network and Route Building, Pattern Movement, Pieces as Map, Relative Movement, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: MEGA Mini Dragons
description:
Welcome to a world of floating castles, airships and dragons! Castles float by power of a mystic stone called Dragonite. Merchants and regents maneuver the skies in elegant airships. Dragon Lords dominate the clouds.

In MEGA Mini Dragons, players choose a dragon and interact with the merchants and regents who come to the valley to trade or beg protection. They come bearing dazzling gems, precious Dragonite or even a rare dragon egg - all being the preferred currency of the Dragon Lords. Gems are crafted into precious items like rings, necklaces and scepters. Eggs are hatched and the Dragonite hoarded. Dragon Riders accumulate these items to elevate their status in dragon society.

MEGA Mini Dragons is a 1-4 player, strategic board game of resource management with exclusive dragon meeples. Each turn, new merchant cards are dealt beneath the floating castle cards. Players spontaneously decide to which castle they send their Dragon Rider. If two or more players choose the same castle, the player with the higher status sends the contenders to a different castle. Castles and merchants offer different resources and crafting choices. Every turn, Dragon Council cards are dealt face down, which dictate item values at the end of the game. Players may choose to spend an action to sneak a peek at values, or even bribe a Council member - and switch a value card for one that pays proper respect to their pile of dragon loot!

Dragon Lords, take to the skies! The merchants come bearing gifts. Royalty from distant lands throw themselves at our mercy. The world is ripe. Can your Dragon Rider scale the peaks of dragon society in the clouds? Jump on your dragon in the next game of Mega Mini Dragons to find out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 领土争夺 (Territory Fight)
description: Players play cards to activate character abilities and use their strength power to take control of landmarks and score points. The first player to collect four farmlands or reach 20 points is the winner.

name: Wizard's Loot
description:
Wizards are mysterious and elusive. The evidence of their time in the world is scant save for their deep, labyrinthine dungeons. These strongholds are brimming with Loot - ancient relics, magickal baubles, mountains of gold - and guarded by fearsome foes and evil creatures of the wizard’s own dark creation. Should tooth and claw prove insufficient, these wizards have further reinforced their dungeons with wicked traps and magickal safeguards. The world is full of these hidden treasure hoards and your group of Adventurers has just found one.

Some wizards are richer, more magickal, and more cunning than others, yielding a greater bounty from their Loot-filled dungeons. But heed this warning - once you enter a wizard’s dungeon you must kill the Boss if you ever wish to leave. Of all the wizard’s creatures, none is more fearsome or more perilous than its most trusted and wretched enforcer.

But peril be damned, you’re an Adventurer! Now get looting!

Wizard’s Loot is a tabletop card game about exploring dungeons, slaying monsters, and hoarding loot! As you and your group of fellow Adventurers explore a wizard's dungeon together your individual goal is to be the Adventurer with the most Loot, but all of you must cooperate if you hope to leave the dungeon alive.

In order to escape with sacks full of sweet, shimmering Loot you must defeat Enemies, collect their Essences, and slay the dungeon’s Boss. Once the Boss has been slain, and the Adventurers escape the dungeon, the Adventurer with the most valuable Loot is the winner.

Each player will get a chance to lead the group, explore the dungeon, and make choices along the way. You can turn over every stone or previous looter's skull you come across in your insatiable search for Loot, or you can race from room to room hacking and slashing your way through the wizard’s hordes. Wizard’s Loot is a game about exploration and choices, and will reward - or punish - players for the risks they take. But choose wisely - your collective decisions will determine if all of you make it out alive with bags full of Loot, or if your corpses are added to an ever-growing pile in the wizard's dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading

name: 1848: The Springtime of Nations
description:
"Do you not feel, through a kind of instinctive intuition that cannot be analyzed but that is certain, that the ground is shaking once again in Europe? Do you not feel—how shall I call it?—that a revolutionary wind is blowing?"
– Alexis de Tocqueville, Souvenir (January, 1848)

33 years after the Congress of Vienna, Continental Europe still lives under the reactionary system designed by the Austrian Prince Metternich, the dominant figure of the age. Outside of England and France, absolute monarchy is the norm - and even in the latter, Louis-Philippe, the “bourgeois king”, is busy rolling back the people’s hard-fought liberties.

In the east, the empires of the “Holy Alliance”, Austria, Russia, and Prussia, enforce ruthless repression against progressive ideas - whether nationalist, republican, democratic, liberal, or socialist. But the time is ripe for revolution, and the conflagration of 1848 will shake this old system to its core in a whirlwind of insurrection and new ideas. “People’s wars” will rage.

1848: Springtime of Nations is a 2-player CDG depicting the unprecedented wave of revolutionary activity that swept across Europe in the titular year of 1848. Based on the hit area control system pioneered by GMT’s 1989: Dawn of Freedom, and Twilight Struggle, it pits the forces of “the Revolution” against those of the “Counterrevolution” in a struggle to decide the future of Europe, and the world.

The Revolutionary player controls the various insurgent and progressive movements trying to usher in a new order, while the Counter-Revolutionary player leads the forces of reaction aiming to preserve the status quo. They will fight over and across the empires and nations of Europe, attempting to suppress their enemy’s influence and extend their own through a combination of political and military force - all the while navigating myriad historical events of the time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tug of War

name: Two Degrees
description:
Two Degrees is a cooperative tile-laying game where you create a civilization that mitigates the rise in global temperatures. Grow Forests, build Wind Farms and Connect Cities via high speed rail to keep temperatures from rising by two degrees.

During the build phase, players take turns adding world tiles to their civilization. The department head of each department will record any progress. For example, if you place a tile that creates a Wind Farm, the head of the Department of Energy will move their tracker from 0 Wind Farms (red) to 1 Wind Farm (yellow).

After the build phase, players move into crisis mode where they must draw crisis cards and deal with whatever crises are on the cards. These crises will vary in severity based on a Report from a specific department. For example, the crisis card "Coal Power" will cause global temperatures to rise based on a Report from the Department of Energy. Temperatures would rise by 0.0 if the report is blue, 0.1 if the report is green, 0.2 if yellow, or 0.3 degrees if the report was red.

Your goal is to keep global temperature rise below two degrees for the duration of the game (10 rounds, each round has one build phase and one crisis mode). You'll score your civilization at the end based on the number of Forests, Wind Farms and Connected Cities you have.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Events, Map Deformation, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Return of Doctor Esker's Notebook
description:
Doctor Esker has left behind another mysterious book full of puzzles written in his own hand. Nobody has cracked his cryptic codes yet. Are you up to the challenge?

The game provides a deck of 83 cards which contain ten devious puzzles to solve. You can play through the puzzles solo or together with family and friends. Great for a party, a game night, or a lazy afternoon.

Each puzzle is composed of a set of cards. You can solve the puzzle by reading, comparing, arranging and pondering the messages, drawings, and artwork on the cards. Solving the puzzle reveals a sequence of numbers. When you think you’ve got it, gather the solution cards corresponding to the number sequence and flip them. If you see a message or image, you’ve solved the puzzle. Persevere to the end and receive Dr. Esker's greatest praise.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Puzzle, Word Game

name: One Breath Left
description:
You are an Explorer tasked with determining what happened aboard a now-abandoned spaceship. You’ll document what you find while trying to avoid a perilous end.

You will use custom deck of locations to build a completely unique ship with every playthrough. Start with a set of 20 Standard Rooms, which you customise with 10 Non Standard rooms depending on the different combinations of Contracts and Wrecks you can choose to explore.

To be able to explore the Wreck, you'll need to spend a limited resource: Oxygen. Every breath counts, and you'll need to think ahead as you explore. Delve too far, investigate too thoroughly and you might not make back out of the Airlock. However, spend too little time aboard the Wreck, and you risk failing the demands of your contract.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Jiruyo Catch!
description:
Jiroyu Catch! is the speedy-party game,
The first player who can play a card until there are no cards left in their hand wins.

Each card has different actions. which players must use both sensitivity and consciousness in looking at the situation

Easy to learn, fast to play, quick to finish if it hurts to lose. Start playing again.

name: Incubate
description:
Incubate is a number puzzle game.

The player must try to adjust the temperature (number) of the playing card to the value that the target wants.

The player who can reach the target value first And still able to maintain that status Will win

The game allows players to figure out ways to adjust each card's function. along with a special card in order to reach the goal as quickly and stably as possible

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Red Guardian & Ursa Major
description:
Mikhail Ursus is Ursa Major, who possesses the ability to transform into an enormous humanoid brown bear. His government may have initially made Mikhail a target, but he was eventually enrolled in a special agent program by the nefarious Professor Phobos. He was trained as the agent Ursa Major and fought for the government before parting ways with his former masters. No matter what team he’s affiliated with, Ursa Major fights for the Russian people with honor and a love for his country.

Nikolai Krylenko is the Red Guardian, a superhuman born in Russia with the power to withstand nearly all electromagnetic, kinetic, and gravitronic energy. The sibling of Darkstar, Krylenko has long served as the hero Vanguard. As the Red Guardian, he wields a modified vibranium shield that can capture and enhance his abilities. The eighth man to don the uniform of the Red Guardian, Krylenko’s reputation as an accomplished soldier and defender continues to grow.

Contents:
2 Miniatures
‣ Ursa Major
‣ Red Guardian
6 Bases
‣ 2 Round Scenic (50mm)
‣ 4 Round Scenic (35mm)
2 Character Stat Cards
3 Team Tactic Cards

name: Kong Ming's Northern Expedition
description:
"Now that the south has been set, and the armor is sufficient, the three armies will be rewarded, and the Central Plains will be set in the north."
"Chu Shi Biao", Zhuge Liang, Prime Minister of the Han Dynasty

The historical simulation board game Kong Ming's Northern Anabasis focuses on Zhuge Kongming, an outstanding statesman and military strategist in Chinese history, the embodiment of universally recognized wisdom, who combines loyalty, filial piety, righteousness, and strategy.
"Kong Ming's Northern Anabasis" is a two-player card-driven board game (CDG), which describes a series of military operations between Shu Han and Cao Wei in 228-234 AD, with the goal of competing for the Guanlong area.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deck Construction, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Bahamas: Trou d'air
description:
The holdup was perfect... A sound plan! Millions in a bag, fleeing by plane, yes, really, a sound one. Everyone begins to relax, but suddenly the engine sputters! Then the plane begins to fall... Yes, the holdup was perfect and they had anticipated everything — everything but enough parachutes to go around…

This expansion for Bahamas adds new playable characters, new action cards, a new turbulence cards module and money bags with holes.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Fig Tree/The Plant and the Stone Promo Cards
description: This is a promo set consisting of the Fig Tree Innovation card and the related The Plant and the Stone Settlement Event card. These were included with the Skrelle miniature, which itself is not part of the game.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Splintercard
description:
Splintercard is a 1 or 2 player science fiction wargame contained in a single 5x7 inch card you can print for free. Most games last less than ten minutes.

Try to destroy your opponent's city. Take turns playing cards which either control your forces, launch nukes, repair your city or skip a turn. There's more to it - the stakes grow as time moves on, there are multiple strategies to win, and a solo mode is included.

name: The Code Agency: Die Schatten des Luna Parks
description:
For the whole family - interactive and cooperative Murder Mystery board game for adults and children from 13 years.
Solve the riddle - Follow the exciting story of the burned out Figaro Theater in this riddle game.
Realistic Material - Work your way through 25+ realistic documents and examine real finds from the burned theater.
Fun for everyone - the criminal case can be solved alone, in pairs or in a team with up to 6 players.
Gift idea - The crime game is also ideal as a gift for Escape Room fans and friends of exciting board games.

name: Inferno sull'Isonzo, Bainsizza 1917
description:
Inferno sull'Isonzo, Bainsizza 1917 is two-player Operational level board-wargame on the 11th Battle of the Isonzo, fought from 18-28 August 1917 on the World War I Italian Front.

After massive bombardments and fierce combat, the Italian Second Army (General Capello) pushed back the Isonzo Armee (Gen. Boroevic)and conquering the Bainsizza (Banjšice) plateau). The Austro-Hungarians suffered 115,000 casualties against 158,000 Italian casualties.

Hex map, Brigade-Regiment level units, 1 day/turn.

Published in issue XI of Parabellum Magazine. Spring 2023.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Race to Ace:  An Aerocatures Game!
description:
Race to Ace is a fast-paced card game that throws three to five players into a swirling, free-for-all aerial dogfight. Each player pilots a high-powered jet fighter and must make split-second decisions to be the first to shoot down five enemy aircraft and become a fighter ace!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures

name: 31 Fireworks
description:
The Emperor wants the most entertaining fireworks festival to celebrate the end of the summer and his 31th birthday. He has made it known that there will be a competition for teams to show off their best firework routines to be included in the grand celebration. There are four major types of fireworks in use, and the debate over which type of firework is superior can be fierce. Are the heart shape fireworks the best? Or maybe it is the trefoils? Of course, balance is also important, and showing mastery of that aspect is to be rewarded as well. Each week, the teams submit bids (well, bribes) to the Chancellor for the opportunity to show off their firework routine. The team who makes the highest bid has the best chance to impress the Chancellor as they get to choose the dominant firework shape for the trial, but the penalty for failure is high. If you fail too many times, you won’t be able to participate in the festival at all!

31 Fireworks is a trick taking game that rewards aggressive bidding as well as clever card play.

Winning the bid allows you to determine trump, and just under half of the points available each hand are from the trump suit. The dealer has a small advantage in that they get the final bid and they can also force a second round of bidding - but this is not without risk - they could get stuck making a bid higher than they would like! Teams that win the bid more often should have a better chance to score points, but if you are overly aggressive, there is a steep penalty for missing your bid three times.

Unlike most trick taking games, trump can be played at any time. This definitely changes how you will approach the course of the tricks. Four of the five suits are shorter than usual (only 10 cards), so players will be void sooner than you think. The best partnerships will be able to provide useful cards to each other when one of them wins a trick.

name: Der Abenteuer Club: Auf großer Reise
description:
Get ready for new adventures taking place all over the world! During your journey you will solve numerous challenging and whimsical tasks - buckle up!

Gameplay:
Everyone gets 10 random cards of objects.

One player reads a chapter out of the “book of adventures” until he reaches a challenge. Now the person next to him must choose exactly 2 cards that he thinks are best suited to solving the challenge. The same player also chooses 3 other cards that he thinks are the most unsuitable for solving the challenge.
Shuffle those 5 cards face down and reveal them in the middle of the table. (Additionally, the 2 chosen items can be written as a proof on a secret tablet)
Now, all other players need to discuss and find the 2 chosen items.
The game ends after the group successfully solved 5 challenges or failed 3 times during one adventure.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: Zombicide: Celestial Knights
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy provides you with the Celestial Knights Survivors, with special rules to use in your Zombicide fantasy games. Get ready to bring the sky down on Zombies with each Survivor’s special Celestial Attack!

This Pack contains:

5 Survivors
1 Special Guard
6 Survivor ID Cards
6 Skill Reference Cards
1 Rules Leaflet

Each of the Celestial Knights Survivors has access to their very own unique and awe-inspiring Celestial Attack! These can be activated with a single action. The attacks are so powerful that they may even turn the tides of battle when it is most needed!

However, once a Celestial Attack is used, its power is depleted, and it must be recharged in order to be used again. During a Celestial Knight's turn, they can choose to spend 3 Actions to recharge their Celestial Attack by calling upon the stars. They may also choose to take a Wound for each fewer action spent.

Celestial Attacks may be used and recharged multiple times during the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Zombicide: Usagi Yojimbo Surivior
description:
Miyamoto Usagi is a beloved character in the world of Usagi Yojimbo, a comic created by cartoonist Stan Sakai. He first appeared in 1984 and has since become a popular icon, with numerous comic book series, toys, and even an animated television show based on his adventures.

Today, we’re bringing this honorable character into the world of Zombicide Fantasy for you to use in any of your Zombicide fantasy games!
You can add the Kickstarter Exclusive Usagi Yojimbo pack to your pledge!

1 Miyamoto Usagi Miniature
1 Survivor ID Card

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures

name: Hard Level
description:
Hard Level is print and play board game where you control your character in a stage like in console or PC platform game. Like in those games you will be controling your character on their way to the end of level. But instead of controler you will be using dice and pencil. You will face enemies, avoid traps, jump from platform to platform and do all the stuff you already know.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Set-up

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – T2E64 Super Pershing
description:
The American T26E4 Super Pershing is a Medium tank wearing Heavy tank clothing! With big Survivability and big Firepower this tank is ready to brawl with the heavies. Attach a full crew with a Mentor Commander and an Improved Rotation Mechanism to increase the Initiative and get a tactical edge.

Wave 10
Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ T26E4 Super Pershing
5 Tanks Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Churchill I
description:
The British Churchill I is a Heavy tank for the Budget conscious commander. Where it shines is its flexibility with Upgrade Modules - upgrade to the Churchill III turret, swap out for the QF 2-Pdr Mk.X or 75mm Vickers HV gun and you can build this tank to fill whatever need you have.

Wave 10
Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ Churchill I
5 Tanks Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – T-54
description:
The Soviet T-54 is an absolute monster of a Medium tank. It's fast, it hits hard and it can soak up a huge amount of damage. Add on a Turbocharger and upgrade to the V-14 engine for an Initiative boost, and don't forget to Fill Tanks With CO2 to avoid taking unnecessary damage. A late war design that never saw initial production until '48.

Wave 10
Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ T-54
5 Tanks Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: Realms of Enchantment
description:
Experience the epic battle in a solo, co-op, or competitive combat adventure with a series of challenges to defeat the dark force that has overtaken the Land of Enchantment. The three strongest wizards have lost their lives fighting for the nation which is now on the edge of survival.

In order to restore peace to the land, the Enchantment council has called upon the six legendary warriors. Choose one of those heroes with unique attributes and special cards with asymmetrical abilities. Construct a deck of spell cards and upgrade your powers with summon creatures and enchantment relics which can be purchased with Fortune gained from winning challenges.

With six different variations, each offering a distinct gameplay experience, you can eliminate players or team up with your opponents. The game provides endless replayability that will keep you coming back for more. It's designed for players of all levels, easy to learn but hard to master.

But that's not all - Realms of Enchantment is paired with a digital platform that lets you dive deeper into the game's universe. Discover character stories, lost letters, diary entries, and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Income, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bubble Net
description:
In the wild, most humpback whales feed by lunge fishing, which is relatively ineff-fish-cient. Some pods, though, have developed the "bubble net" feeding technique, where a whale dives deep below the fish and comes up, blowing a spiral of bubbles, confusing the fish and driving them into a tight ball, leading to a higher-quality bite!

This is what we are replicating in Bubble Net. Each player is competing against themselves to eat more fish than they lose out to sea.

Player boards are divided into segments that match the points of the compass.

Set-up: Place a Fish token on every marked space, and the starting Bubble tokens on their spots. Shuffle the Fish cards and place the deck in the middle.
On your turn, simultaneously with any other players, add one Bubble to the track. If the Bubble closes a segment, drive any fish present inward by one. All fish that are pushed into the very centre, which represents your Mouth, move into your Belly.

Next, place your two Podmate tokens. They cannot share a segment with a Bubble, but they close any segment where they are placed - a whole whale needs a whole segment.

The Fish respond: flip the top Fish card, and for every Fish icon represented, move all Fish tokens in that segment out by one space, unless the segment is blocked by one or more Bubbles, or a Podmate whale. Any Fish outside the spiral escape to the "Freedom" space, and can no longer be eaten.

Continue alternating moves between the Whales and the Fish until any player has made a Bait Ball (all Fish are within the center spiral), then all players Lunge. All Fish within the center spiral go into your belly, and any outside that area escape.

If there are more Fish in your Belly that escaped out to sea, you have won!

Bubble Net is a multi-player, meditative solitaire game that takes around ten minutes to play and can have as many players as have boards. Players share the Fish deck; each card affects all players, a bit like Bingo, so new players can join the game at any point, continuing when others reach the Bait Ball stage.

The interactive variant allows players to take on the role of their neighbors' Fish, with each person playing a Fish card from their hand face-down onto their neighbor's playing area before the Whales move, instead of drawing a single card that affects everyone from the Fish deck afterwards. Players may choose to score against each other instead of against themselves in this variant.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Chat GPT: Schlag die KI
description: The game consists of cards with silly and/or weird questions. On a turn, a player draws a card and reads one of those questions. Then everyone will write down an answer to the question. Afterwards, the same question is asked to ChatGPT. All answers, including the AI answer, are voted on – whoever gets most votes, wins the round. After 5 rounds, whoever won most rounds wins the game.

name: Ми-ми-мишки: Считаем с Кешей (Mi-mi-mishki: Count with Kesha)
description:
It is a versatile puzzle game for children and adults.

Indomitable Kesha glued together photos of himself and his friends to create captivating challenges. Help Tuchka and Lisichka solve them!

1. Place the task card in the center.
2. Gather the required set of friends on your cards.
3. Score 8 victory points and become the winner!

name: Sunrise at the Studio
description:
Spend your morning creating beautiful pottery at your local ceramics studio. Mold clay, apply glaze, and fire up the kiln to create objects that are both wonderful to look at and fit for purpose.

Over the course of Sunrise at the Studio, players simultaneously draft clay, glaze, and kiln resources to complete the various pottery projects in front of them.

Get ready to spend your morning creating beautiful pottery at your local ceramics studio!

Set up to play in a few minutes as you prepare studio challenges, projects, and your work area.

Experience the fun of working with clay as you chose how to use your resources!

What kind of work style will you choose? Find the right mix as you consider which resources to use... And which to pass.

Use resource cubes to mark your progress! Complete delightful projects and intricate showpieces.

See who created their next masterpiece! Pick up new projects to work on, find fun bonuses on advantage cards, and declare your pottery prowess with studio challenges.

After 3 days, admire the works you created, then see who scored the most points!

-description from publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sì, Oscuro Signore! Luxastra
description:
Aye, Dark Overlord! is a fantasy party game filled with humor that's fast to play and easy to learn.

Each player is an evil goblin servant of the evil Dark Overlord — Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils — and all of them are gathered at the Dark Overlord's knees to explain why they brought that last important mission, ordered by "His Evil Excellence" himself, to failure again. Panic wraps you in its freezing grip; what can you do to save your poor skin? Could you say you are not the one to blame, but your inept companions? Yes, of course, that's the solution! There is only one little problem: They've probably got exactly the same idea...and the Dark Overlord is not known for his mercy...

This roleplaying game is all about telling lies and shifting the blame on your poor fellow ones, so the righteous wrath of your Master can give them what they deserve!

Aye, Dark Overlord! Luxastra is a new version of Aye, Dark Overlord! that is playable on its own while also capable of being combined with the original game (red and/or green box).



==============================================Ciò che non sarà salvato, sarà purgato!

Mille fuochi fatui si illuminano, quando fai ritorno nella sala del Trono Profano dopo un’altra missione andata male. Il Sovrano Piumato, primo fra i sette Dèi Antichi, non ne sarà certo compiaciuto! Presto sarai dinanzi al Suo cospetto, ed Egli ti interrogherà su questo ennesimo fallimento.

Che fare per conservare integra la pellaccia? Magari potresti raccontargli che la colpa non è tua, ma di quegli imbecilli dei tuoi compari? Ma sì, certo! Ecco la soluzione! C’è un solo, piccolo problema: la stessa cosa sarà venuta in mente anche a loro.

Racconta panzane! Scarica la Colpa! Salvati dalla delusione senza pietà del Re Corvo! Fa il suo grande ritorno Sì, Oscuro Signore, party game dal tono scanzonato e umoristico, questa volta in salsa Luxastra: l’amatissima campagna di gioco di ruolo in streaming su YouTube del gruppo di InnTale. Veloce da imparare e facile da giocare, per Sì Oscuro Signore – Luxastra sono sufficienti alcuni amici e un po’ di fantasia. Gli incompetenti e inetti servitori del Re Corvo, Dio antico dalle motivazioni imperscrutabili, dovranno giustificarsi davanti al loro Signore, inventando storie improbabili e scaricando la colpa sui loro compagni di sventura.

Sì, Oscuro Signore! Luxastra è un gioco completo che può essere giocato singolarmente oppure può essere combinato in un unico grande gioco con il set rosso e verde di Sì, Oscuro Signore. Contiene nuovi modi di scaricare la colpa e un’enorme quantità di nuove e bellissime carte spunto.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Single Loser Game, Storytelling

name: Find Fam Fun
description:
Find Fam Fun is a card game that normalizes the different types of families, created to be a vehicle for inclusion in family, school and social environments. Created with the goal of developing values such as empathy, self-esteem, inclusion or respect for diversity.

Find Fam Fun is a triple memory game, familiar and fun, with a duration of between 15 and 30 minutes, with simple rules, to be played at any time and place, suitable for all audiences.
It is a game for 2 to 6 players, for children from 3 years old. It is dynamic and each one challenges himself and the other players.

Find is a multi-level memory game. Fam is a set collection game, where skill, strategy and calculation will be your allies. Fun is a fun game of "push your luck" where you will have to achieve the goals indicated on the card and not draw the forbidden color that throws you out of the round.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Space Explorers: Age of Ambition Promo Pack
description: The Promo Pack was offered in the Gamefound campaign for the Age of Ambition expansion. Each promo component is marked with a Saturn icon. The promo pack contains 2 new Project tiles for the base game (Freedom 7/Sputnik 2, Luna 3/Surveyor 1)—available previously as Space Explorers: Spacecraft Projects Promo—, 1 new Project tile for Module 6 of the Age of Ambition expansion (Saturn V/First Crewed Docking), 4 new Goal tokens for Module 4 (G9 in each player color), and 2 new Talent tiles for Module 5.

name: Munchkin: Squids
description:
Tentacles and suckers are everywhere!

Squid are supposed to be spineless, right? Then why are so many of them trying to kill you in this dungeon?

Everything is covered in slime, and even the food is attacking! Grab your Cuttle Bone, put on your Nautilus Shelm, and make sure to deliver some sorely needed Squid Pro Quo.

You'll want to seize Munchkin Squids with all eight of your arms – before it jets away!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cheezy Chase
description:
Cheezy Chase is a stop-or-go game for 2 to 5 mice ages 5 and up.

Dorothy the little mouse has a rumbling tummy. To stock up, she has to get out of her hole and explore the house in search of cheese. So she ventures out in search of delicious little golden cubes. But beware! The house is littered with mouse traps. And if that’s not enough, Kitty is on the prowl, ready to pounce on her and eat her up.

On your turn, draw a card and place it face up in the play area. Repeat this action as many times as you like, until:

You get caught because you have at least 3 traps or 3 cats in the game area. Your turn end and you lose the cards you have revealed.
You stop before getting caught and you win all the cards in the game area and place them in a pile in front of you.
You stop and win all the card in the game area if you find a 3 cheeses card!


The game ends when all cards have been drawn. Each player counts the cheeses on their cards that they have won.
The player with the most cheeses wins the game!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Armeria
description:
"Let the chase begin, shall we?"
Armeria is a cooperative game of witches vs. students. The goal is to escape from the pursuing witches.

The players are divided into students and witches, goal of the student is to ring the bell at the top of the school, witches try to stop them from doing that. To ring the bell, at least one of the students has to leave the 3rd floor. To do that they have to acquire keys to each subsequent floor.

In students' turns they roll the dice and use cards with magic to travel through a floor to search for keys, they can only leave if they find 2 keys.

In witches' turn they attack students and destroy corridors using magic.

name: 妹再生産 (Imouto Saiseisan)
description:
In this game you play as an older sibling and your goal is to summon younger sisters.

In each turn players' draw new cards from the deck, burn some to get IP(Imouto Power), and place other cards with special powers.

First player to get to a certain number of imouto wins.

name: Munchkin Deathly Pail
description:
We know you've been dying for another hearse-load of Undead. This 30-card set has more monsters, more Treasures, and more postmortem fun for any Munchkin game. We couldn't keep it buried any longer!

This is an expansion for Munchkin. It is not a stand-alone game. These cards originally appeared in Munchkin: Unicorns and Friends.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Clash of Corgis
description:
Clash of Corgis is a card game with three unique game modes.

Clash of Corgis - Original is a 2-4p card game where players aim to be the first player to get rid of all of their cards in their hand.

Clash of Corgis - Treasure Island is a 2-4p trick-taking card game where players aim to be the first player to gain 10 loot.

Clash of Corgis - Capture the Illusionist is a 2p card game where players take alternative turns in this luck, memory, and deductive game, revealing opponent's cards in attempts to capture the opponent's Illusionist twice.

- 55 cards, each with a unique artwork

- 2-4 players

- 10-15 minute playtime

- Ages 13+

- 3 unique ways to play

—description from the designer

name: Galaxy Eclipse
description:
This is a stop-type game similar to the Japanese card game "Daihugō" for two players, where insight and decisiveness are the deciding factors. Each player starts with a set of planet cards with stars and numbers drawn on them, and the goal is to outwit the opponent by playing the cards and gain control of the galaxy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Layering, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Unhappy King Charles
description:
The year is 1642 and England is torn apart by a civil war between King Charles I and his supporters, the Royalists, and the Parliamentarians. In Unhappy King Charles, a two-player card-driven game, you must choose your side and fight for the control of England’s regions and economic centres. You will use cards to play historic events, recruit troops, influence politics, raid enemies, and activate your generals – including King Charles and Oliver Cromwell – to move, battle and siege fortresses on the map.

Unhappy King Charles is highly acclaimed for the way in which it captures the unique aspects of the English Civil War: the high rate of desertions, the difficulties of controlling regional troops, and the growing strength of the Parliament forces over the course of the conflict.

The new PHALANX edition is more than just a reprint. It features:

Evocative and gorgeous new artwork that will immerse you in the war between the Parliamentarians and the Royalists!

Standees for Generals and Local Notables that will bring those historical figures to life and make it easier to read the board. You will also be able to use the basic markers provided in the box if you prefer so.

A new approach to presenting a point-to-point map, and control of areas and fortresses. You will have to plan your strategy carefully and adapt to changing situations!

Individual General cards and faction cards that will allow you to easily reference each General’s level, army size capacity, and special rules. You will have to use your Generals wisely and exploit their strengths and weaknesses!

Tracks for monitoring control of key regions and economic infrastructures, and ongoing sieges. You will have to balance your resources and your military actions to achieve your objectives!

—description from publisher
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Makan Mania
description:
It’s the most tense and competitive time of the day… That’s right, I’m talking about lunch time! Roll your dice and be the first to grab your favourite foods. Don’t forget to chope a table to enjoy your meal, you might even find some spare change for a refreshing drink… Battle your way through the work week and emerge victorious as the champion in… Makan Mania!

Makan Mania takes place in a busy hawker center at Singapore, where grabbing your favorite food during the crowded lunch hour, needs a combination skill and luck.

Makan Mania is a 2 to 6 player real time game that has players rolling dice to grab their favorite food, reserve the best table while looking out drinks and desserts that helps to give players additional abilities or multiply their points. The game ends after 5 rounds and the player with the most points win!

name: Murder We Wrote: Travel Edition
description:
As the host of the podcast, reveal the name of the victim for that round. Other players will assume the role of someone close to the victim, playing cards, and giving an interview on who they think murdered the victim and how. At the end of the round, the host will decide what the true ending is... but watch out, each player has a hidden twist card that can change everything! With hundreds of different potential victims, murders, deaths, and twists, there are infinite stories to tell!

The travel size includes 150/525 cards from the Premium Edition.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Player Judge, Role Playing

name: Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities – Here There Be Monsters
description:
Promo items from the Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities Kickstarter campaign.

Includes a new type of misfortune card (Arcane Flood) and alternate sets of ally and monster figures to supplement Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities.

Note: Requires both Atlantis Rising (Second Edition) base set and Atlantis Rising: Monstrosities expansion.

Includes: 12 screen printed wooden allies, 6 screen printed wooden monsters, 12 Arcane Flood cards, and 1 instruction card.

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Jagdpanther
description:
The German Jagdpanther takes the mobility of the legendary Panther and mounts a bigger gun in a stealthy Tank Destroyer package.

Use Markus Theissen's Intuition perk or the 10.5cm PaK L/52 Gun to boost Initiative, and take Sixth Sense to ensure this Assault Gun isn't flanked.

Includes a tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Tower Up
description:
Congratulations! Your architectural firm has been selected to renovate the city's downtown...but you're not the only ones. To pip your opponents at the post, you need to manage your resources and carefully plan your constructions. Be careful not to leave too many opportunities to your competitors!

Each turn in Tower Up, you either:


Pick a card and take the corresponding resources, or
Use your resources to construct a new building: choose an empty spot, pay the cost to adjacent buildings, place a roof, and earn the corresponding points.

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Legion of Doom Expansion Pack
description:
Banded together from remote galaxies are thirteen of the most sinister Super-Villains of all time: the Legion of Doom! This expansion pack adds 13 Legion of Doom Super-Villains based on the classic Challenge of the Superfriends TV series to any DC Deck-Building Game base set and comes inside a collectible box with foil cover.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Roo
description: Build combinations of jumps to eliminate your opponents, but be careful because those same combinations can be used against you.

name: Catch Sketch: Magic Hat
description:
You're about to become a magician with a magic hat and a magic wand, you're a magician who can make pictures disappear! But only the first person to grab the wand token can perform the trick! Will you be able to guess the words from the erased pictures?

Catch Sketch: Magic Hat is the expansion of Catch Sketch with new variant rule!
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Monsters Deck 1
description:
Monsters Deck is a collection of 24 tarot-sized cards, each with a monster for Four Against Darkness.
You may use these whenever you would roll on a table to determine which Vermin, Minion, Boss or Weird Monster you encounter. Instead of rolling, draw a card from the appropriate deck, play it and then reshuffle it into the deck. You can combine monsters decks together, expanding the variation of encounters with every new set released.

name: Bicharracos
description:
People come to camp, and the Patagonian species that inhabit the place want to hide!

In this game we must play and pass the cards from our hand to the other players, forming a personal grid on the table. In turn, each player will give a location where each player must place their next card on the grid, which can be above, below, left or right of another adjacent card. The objective will be to make the best score by choosing the hiding places common to all the players, which is not going to be easy, and whoever gets the best score will be able to claim victory!
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Modular Board, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Gen Con 2023 Promo Pack
description:
Injustice General Zod is designed for Injustice, Savitar and Avery Ho are designed for Rivals – The Flash vs. Reverse-Flash, and Birds of Prey fits well with most sets!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Peach Brawl
description:
In Peach Brawl, you play as divine beings and mythical creatures invited to the Peach Party by the Queen Mother of the West. Your goal is to snatch high-scoring food and secure victory, but you must at least grab one peach, or you'll be eliminated.

The game revolves around playing cards to obtain food. Each divine being or mythical creature card possesses powerful magic. Knowing when to strategically use this magic is crucial. Can you anticipate others' strategies and make the right moves at the right time?
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Triskaidekaphobia
description:
When the World is literally going to Hell in a recovered shopping cart, working together as a team is incredibly important...and getting _everyone else_ to work as a team on your behalf is even more so!

Triskaidekaphobia is the fear of the number 13 and, over 13 rounds on the night of Friday the 13th of an unspecified month in an unspecified year, you - alone - will attempt to shepherd, sacrifice and/or destroy, both zombies and survivors alike in order to survive until help arrives in the morning.

Each turn, you will draw 3 cards and postpone one of them (put it to the bottom of the deck) and then must put the others into play. Various effects can be triggered - resolved in the order of your choosing - which might result in gains and/or losses before you compare your Survivor Total against the current Zombie Threat Level: if you are being overwhelmed by this threat, your community will suffer!

Simply make it through the 13 turns of the game - see the Sun rise on a new day - and you will win...

Note: Triskaidekaphobia is the third game in Tony Boydell's "Infinity" solo game trilogy (along with Lux Aeterna and Aleph Null)

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Backlash!
description:
Backlash! is an expansion kit for The Lash of the Turk, The Lash of the Turk (ATO #30), featuring mounted die-cut counters.

Backlash! covers the multi-year campaign for the crown of Hungary which lasted from 1684 until 1699 (sometimes known as The Great Turkish War). The fighting concluded with most of Hungary, Croatia, Slovakia and Serbia becoming part of the Holy Roman Empire. Now the Imperial player (the Holy Roman Empire) can turn the tables somewhat and be the aggressor against a reeling Ottoman Empire!

Backlash! is a bonus game published in 2023, along with the game The Cruelest Month: Air War over Arras, April 1917 The Cruelest Month: Air War over Arras, April 1917, in the ATO (Against the Odds) Annual 2020.

name: The Dark Order
description:
The Dark Order is an immersive, confrontational tactical card game designed for two players.In The Dark Order, players delve into the intriguing backstories of these factions, immersing themselves in a world where desperate struggles for power, survival, and redemption unfold. It offers a unique gaming experience with strategic depth, as it eliminates randomness, providing players with complete control over their decks. Engage in intense battles, make tactical decisions, and unleash the unique abilities of your faction's characters. The captivating world, coupled with the distinct factions adds layers of immersion to the gameplay experience, ensuring that each game feels like a thrilling journey through a dark and enigmatic world.

The game features asymmetric factions, each with their own distinctive abilities, and undiscovered exploration cards that add an element of mystery and unpredictability to each battle. The player mat displays the exhaustion level, which must be effectively balanced throughout the game. Players construct their faction decks consisting of commander cards, units, support cards, and order cards. Recruiting cards from the deck to the hand allows players to deploy their forces in combat.

The game revolves around careful management of resources, including the exhaustion level of your commander, which is a pivotal factor in determining the outcome. To achieve victory, players must strategically dominate the exploration zone, exhaust their opponent's commander, or deliver a decisive blow on the battlefield.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Crimetime: Fall 003 – Schweigen ist Silber, reden der Tod
description: Case 003: A murdered journalist. Did she know too much? Take on the role of investigator and enter a swamp of lies, corruption and power. Travel from location to location, identify new suspects and collect evidence in multiple locations. Follow the trail of the victim and hunt down the evil! All you get for the solution is the collected evidence. The lines between reality and fiction will blur.

name: Actitudes sospechosas
description:
In Suspicious Behaviours one player is a Detective trying to figure out who did what on a mysterious crime while watching the physically and verbal cues that other players will do regarding their secret role, and all in real time.


This game was distributed as promo material and also included inside the box of Recreo Arcano preorder and June 2023 Ludoty Box games.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play

name: Peaks & Valleys
description:
This is a climbing/shedding card game where each round players will collectively create the victory points pool that is allocated to each person as they play all their cards. The deck is made up of cards 1-7, seven times each, or 1-8, eight times each, depending on the player count. Each card has tie-breaking numbers on them to allow creative options for players to play all the cards in their hands.

The size of the meld dictates the strength of the cards played. Peaks are 1 or 3-card melds, and the higher values on cards are stronger. Valleys are 2-card melds, and the lower values are stronger.

The player who best climbers the peaks and valleys of the wilderness will win the game by getting points equal to or above the goal!

—description from the designer

name: Fool's Blade
description:
Fool's Blade is a seriously fun and extremely chaotic multiplayer fantasy card game that's sure to have you and your buddies excited for that next game night! (If you remain friends after a few games...)

Starting in the tavern, your chosen character will assemble a sword from hand or stash cards, creating unique sword combinations in order to overcome the dangers in your chosen destination.

From there on you can either visit the forge to upgrade your sword with the available parts, go out for question and draw additional cards or test your strength and go for monsters.

Stacking parts effectively will create amazing swords, as long of you have a handle and not more then one type of item at the same time, meaning you can attack with just a pommel and handle or handle and guard.

Once you have looted enough monsters and the loot deck is empty, the game is over. The player with the highest scoring combination of weapon strength, counted by currently laid out cards, the gold value of defeated monsters and loot will win the game.

name: Dungeon Path
description:
A dimensional rip has allowed monsters to enter the worlds of Arkcantrix. Adventurers have entered the forbidden crypt with the hopes of conquering the new evil. The path is long and full of peril at every turn.

Each player chooses one of 18 characters that has their own weapon proficiencies, monster masteries and unique skills. Each player receives 5 cards to start their Path as well as their first Miniboss. Players will draw cards from their path or go to town to purchase weapons and spells, increasing their power, defeating monsters and Minibosses until they are strong enough to defeat the Big Boss encounter! Each card found will take them that much closer to glory. First to vanquish the Big Boss saves Arkcantrix.

On their Path, players may be stalled by Obstacles or other players. Players can build their hands in many different ways to gain the power needed to finish their hero's journey.

It's a game that is easy to pickup within a turn or two, but with over 200 cards in the Path deck, every play is different.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Arsuf 1191
description: The game simulates the battle of Arsuf that took place on 7 September 1191, which was during the Third Crusade. During this battle, a larger army of the Ayyubid Sultanate, led by Saladin, was defeated by Crusaders, led by Richard I of England.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Cards Against Humanity: Culture Wars Pack
description:
Every corner of American media is making huge profits fanning the flames of outrage, and Cards Against Humanity wants in on that action! Here comes the Culture Wars Pack.

30 all-new cards about the most important issues that America is totally incapable of having a productive conversation about.

—description from the publisher

name: Lucky Cats
description:
Lucky Cats is a frantic, fast-paced game of perceptiveness where everyone will be trying to catch the uncovered cat dream cards!
Deal all the cards among the players and put them in their feeders. Get five cards in your hand and reveal the cat dream cards. From then on, you simultaneously try to replace your cards from your hand by putting them back in the tray on the left. At the same time, you draw new cards from the tray on the right until there are two cards in your hand that match the picture of one of the cat's dream cards.
At this point, grab the cat's dream card as quickly as possible and take it to you.
Match the cards in your hand so that you have a total of five cards and continue exchanging cards. The other players can grab new cards without interruption.
Note the special cards!
When a card with a coloured fish appears, try to catch it as quickly as possible. It counts as an extra cat dream card. The card previously belonged to another player? No problem! Try to swipe it from under his nose before he realises!
Whoever is the first to get 7 cat dream cards is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Clank!: Bunny Mafia Promo card
description:
This card is a reward for the Growing Our Family! - Our Family Plays Games 2023 Kickstarter-Campaign.

Bunny Mafia
Companion
Cost: 4
1 Sword
2 Boots

1 Victory Point
1 Gold
You may take 1 Gold from an opponent. If you do, +1 Clank!
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: Robo Alarm
description: Don't get caught! Treasures sparkle in the museum at night ... In this action-packed hide-and-seek game, one person takes on the role of R0B0 the security robot. Whether inside or outside, everyone else is a thief and has to steal the treasures that are scattered everywhere. You have to hide well and be quick, because R0B0 is very close! However, he only sees something every few seconds ... Will you manage to get the treasures to the getaway car without being seen? Or will R0B0 catch you first?

name: Warsaw 1944
description:
At the end of July 1944, the Soviet army was gradually approaching Warsaw. However, the Germans used their panzer divisions to slow down the Soviet advance. The command of the Polish Home Army decided to start an uprising in Warsaw, hoping to take control of the city from the Germans. Then, they could act as real "hosts" on behalf of The Polish government-in-exile located in London to the approaching Soviet forces. However, Stalin stopped the offensive, which enabled the Germans to deal with the insurgents and destroy Warsaw.

"The game gives you the opportunity to check whether there was a real possibility to help the fighting and bleeding capital of Poland. A bold and risky strike by the Soviet and Polish armies seems tempting, but will the Germans watch it passively?" (from the publisher's website)

Warsaw 1944 uses the WB-95 (Great Battles 1939-1945) system developed by Taktyka i Strategia.

Scale: Division-regiment
Board: 2 x 50/70 cm
Scenarios: 3
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Connected Clues Uncensored
description: Based on the popular game show category "before and after". Each card contains an answer made up of two different parts that share a word which connects them together. Players take turns being the clue giver each round. The clue giver must come up with clues for both parts of the answer and tell the group. The group will guess the answer. The first player to guess correctly wins the round! Full of vulgar, taboo, and naughty cards that will have your friends blushing and laughing at the same time. The uncensored version offers a unique twist on the classic that’s best suited for adults.

name: 433 Ultimate Card Manager
description:
"Football, Bloody Hell!" (Game's tagline)

Set building card game based on professional football/soccer.

Each player has a 'Manager' card with two preferred formations. The goal is to build either formation with 'Player' cards. 'Players' have specific positions they play in, a point value from 5-20 points and also 'Managers' that they do not work well with. A manager is limited to the number of such players he can have. Each turn, a player draws a 'Player' card from either the draw deck or from the 3 face-open cards or discards a 'Player' card on top of one of the three face-open cards (thus taking the card below out of the game).

Once a formation is completed, a player may end the round by revealing his lineup. Points are scored for players in their proper position and bonus points for completing a team first and there's a deduction for having players who don't work with the manager. The player with the highest score wins!

name: One Card: Jardín Japonés
description: In One Card: Jardín Japonés you will seek to score points by making small decisions that make a difference, rolling dice to draw decorations and freely drawing ponds.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Escape Room: Sprout Edition
description:
Delve into something different this festive season - an escape room game with a sprout-themed twist. The perfect way to get into the Christmas spirit and have fun with all the family.

Successfully complete all 10 tasks in 45 minutes to escape those dreaded sprouts this Christmas.

—description form the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle

name: Castles of Aragon
description:
Castles of Aragon is a print at home roll and write game for one to unlimited number of players. In this game you will be shaping the land of Aragon as you please. Your goal is to create the most habitable land by putting forests, fields, pastures and houses around six Aragonian castles.

Game is very simple but challenging. During each turn you have to either draw a given terrain type (forest, fields, pastures, town) on the game sheet or add another castle. Terrains will be placed around castles, and each castle has its own rules for scoring.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: じゃんけんゴリラ (Junken Gorilla)
description: You are a gorilla. You want to win the best bananas. Each round, you can play a rock, paper, scissors, or gorilla. Note that you are a strong ape, but also, still an ape, so you cannot play a card again until you return the other cards to your hand. The highest unique card wins the banana on offer, following RPS strength, but Gorilla beats all others.

name: Murder at Merivale Manor
description:
On July 4, 1927, Astrid Pelham fell from the top floor balcony of the luxurious Merivale Manor, impaling her body on a statue below. The cause of her death remains a mystery, shrouded in whispers of murder, suicide, and even supernatural intervention. Armed with new evidence, it’s your job to piece it all together and work out who it was that killed the victim.

Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice.

30 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find police reports, suspect photos, witness statements, a manor guide and more.

SEARCH THROUGH AN ONLINE INBOX - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the case files, you'll need to access an online inbox to prove the prime suspect innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access to the online portal!

A GREAT NIGHT IN - With approximately 3 hours of game play (depending on your skill level) and a difficulty rating of 4/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller will provide a fun night in for all who choose to participate. If you can't crack the case without a secret clue, hints and answers are available online.

name: Shards of the Aegis
description:
Shards of the Aegis is a light strategy/take that/party card game that is simple to learn and inspired by Greek Mythology. The deck is made up of different Gods, Goddesses, and Creatures vying to restore the Aegis of Zeus.

Each turn you will draw one card and play one card and use the unique ability of the god or creature you’ve played. Some cards will give you the opportunity to claim a sought after shard or steal them, and others are disruptive or sabotage other players by discarding or rearranging cards. Other effects include exchanging cards, peeking at the cards upcoming in the deck, and much more!

Find the right combinations of cards and the right timing to collect the needed shards in order to be the first player to play an Aegis card and ultimately win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: L'Au-delà Bouteille
description:
Semi-cooperative card games for 3 to 6 players with an average duration of 60 minutes, Beyond the Bottle propels you into an offbeat, chaotic adventure.

In this biblical universe, rescue the wandering souls who have lost their way through the tunnel, limbo, and purgatory by repelling the attacks of the monsters roaming these desolate lands.

Build the challenges together, face them as a team, and share the loot, but keep in mind that only one of you can have access to paradise!

Goal of the game

You're dead and it's bad luck! But what's worse is having to wait in line for 423,673,417,998 minutes before you can pass into the afterlife. So you make the decision to become an interim soul smuggler.

Your job:

roam the tunnel, limbo and purgatory to find wandering souls. Beware of the events and creatures of these doomed places.

Cooperate to avoid the pitfalls, but beware, only one of you will win the premium skip-the-line pass giving access to the afterlife.

For the others, it's back in the queue.
mechanics: Alliances, Critical Hits and Failures, Take That

name: Летели дракончики (Dragons&Donuts)
description:
Dragons fly and eat donuts. Who will win and catch a gold?
Welcome to the little dragon race for the golden donut! And you can speed up or slow them down with the help of colorful donuts.
How to play?

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a secret objective card with three dragons. The winner will be the player who brings the most dragons from his card to the finish line and receives more victory points.
All the dragons are at the beginning, and 5 stacks of flock cards are placed in the center of the table. On his turn, the player performs 2 consecutive actions:

Selects a flight map.
Moves the dragon figurine.


The scales on the flight card always show what color the dragon and donut on the front of the card might be. The player moves the baby dragon shown on the flight card to the nearest donut of the indicated color.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Contracts, Point to Point Movement

name: Everything Ever: Booster Pack 1
description: The first expansion to Everything Ever including 15 new category cards.

name: Black Powder Epic Battles: American Civil War – Gettysburg Battle Set
description:
Fought over the first three days of July in 1863, the battle for Gettysburg proved to be the high tide of the Confederacy and the turning point of the American Civil War. The Confederate army of North Virginia, under General Lee, and fresh from victory over the Union at Chancellorsville, assaulted the Army of the Potomac under Union General Meade at the crossroads town of Gettysburg in the deadliest battle of the entire conflict. The battle ended following the near suicidal attack known as Pickett's Charge which led to the battered rebel army withdrawing from the field. Lee's invasion of the North has been halted.

This box set contains over 2,000 men. Each of the two armies are presented on colour-coded plastic sprues; the push-fit pieces are extremely easy to assemble - enabling you to quickly get to the business of gaming this fascinating era of history on the epic scale it deserves. You’ll also find some MDF scenery to lend your battles extra authenticity.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Terraflip
description:
In the distant land of Terraflip, the ruler has died. The four main families of the land do not wait long before claiming themselves as the new ruler. Will you be the next ruler of Terraflip ?

Terraflip is a competitive, tactical, tile placement and memory board game for up to 4 players set in a medieval land. In this eco-friendly board game you place and flip tiles to earn points. Each player has also access to basic and three special tiles. Once all players have played their tiles the player with the most points wins the game and becomes the next ruler of Terraflip.

Every component of the game, including the box, is entirely made out of engineered wood. It has been deliberately made without the use of plastic.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tile Placement

name: Nebel über Carcassonne: Die Bannkreise
description:
Nebel über Carcassonne: Die Bannkreise ("The Banishing Circles") is a small expansion for Mists over Carcassonne that introduces cats to your ghost-hunting team...although cats can sometimes be less helpful than you might think.

As with Mists over Carcassonne, the tiles in Die Bannkreise can be used in a regular competitive game of Carcassonne.

name: FLITZEN
description:
In this fast-paced archery tournament, you try to land the perfect hit yourself while trying to prevent your teammate from doing so. Whoever optimally combines the card value with the dice points will achieve the highest number of rings after 6 shots and thus win this speed bow tournament.

—description from the designer

name: Loco Luchas
description:
Loco Luchas is a fast-paced, 2-6 player, last-wrestler-standing game intended for players ages 10 and older. The game uses a simple mechanic that's quick to learn and there's just a enough luck and strategy involved that every game is different!

You don't need to be a fan of wrestling to enjoy the game (but you may get a few more references and laughs if you are).

Each game will take between 15 to 30 minutes to play (depending on the number of players).

—description from the designer

name: Keyflower: The Glade
description:
Keyflower: The Glade is a new village tile for the game Keyflower.

The Glade tile is being published at Spiel in October 2023 along side the new R&D game called The Glade. The same creatures can be found on the tile as are found on The Glade box lid.

The Glade tile is a winter tile. Score 5 points for each adjacent tile in the player's village that displays a summer icon.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Printing Press: Promo Pack
description:
Two new characters for Printing Press - Rafał Szłapa and Felix Catenberg.
One of them, at the end of the turn, lets you take the remaining frame or contract and choose which one to use.
The other one lets you choose a card that was left or lets you move the bonus marker at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Disney Winnie the Pooh: Snow Parade Game
description:
Help Winnie the Pooh and friends put together a holiday parade! Work together to match colors, moving the characters forward and backward. If you need an extra hand, Christopher Robin is always there! Get all the characters in the right order to win!


Delightful cooperative gameplay brings players of all ages together to succeed.
Original illustrations bring the snowy celebration to life on your table.
Use your cards to place the characters in the right order, or pair them with other players’ for more exciting moves!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Mythic Mischief: Appendix A
description: New Box, familiar factions. Collecting the Witches, Ghosts and Trolls into the same size box as Vol. 1 and Vol. II, complete with room for storing a neoprene playmat.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Penguin's Iceberg Adventure
description: Penguin's Iceberg Adventure Cooperative Game from Mudpuppy is a fun new game that builds community, encourages respect, and supports social emotional development. Players work together to flip tiles and match shapes to build an iceberg path; but be careful of revealing a snowflake tile and revealing an approaching storm. Help the baby penguin cross safely to his mama and everyone wins!

name: Deep, Abandoned
description:
The Age Of Heroes is dead.
The telling of past deeds has been outlawed. The tombs, mines and deep underworlds have long been abandoned, sealed off and forgotten. In spite of this, there are a small handful of criminals and outcasts who defy the law and (under the cover of night) find the opportunity to slip into the depths and search not for glory but treasure. Problem is, these dark places harbor the foulest of creatures. For hundreds of years they have preyed upon each other until only the most savage and cruel of beasts remain.

The Age Of Heroes is dead, yet a hero you are.
Deep, Abandoned is a miniature agnostic game. It relies on you to supply the miniatures and terrain for the campaign-based adventures contained within. Blank sheets are included for you to create your own adventures.

—description from the designer
