mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Virtual Revolution: Alternative Titles
description:
A small promo package with rules for them.

These 7 alternative Title cards are intended to replace the original Title cards in the game. They feature new abilities.

During setup you can either use these cards or the original cards or a mix of them and place them next to the board. Make sure to have only 1 card per district.

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Bergkrieger
description:
Grent, der Bergkrieger vom Greifenfels/Grea, die Bergkriegerin vom Greifenfels replaces Eara/Liphardus and plays with the purple materials (1 die, 2 wooden disks, 2 wooden cubes).

Rolling the die in combat triggers different special abilities depending on the value rolled, and with 14 willpower points, Grent/Grea can use the effect of a telescope without having to own one.

This hero board could be purchased at Spiel 2023 in Essen.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Saboteur: Deviation Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Saboteur.
Year 2023.

Preparation: At the start of the game, shuffle this card among the deck of cards.

Rules: When playing this card, you may displace the last played path card to another position in the maze lay-out, according to the rules of placing cards.

name: Patchwork: Dolle Decken
description:
Fan made challenge, as part of the Lookout magazine "Neues vom Ausguck", Edition 19, April 2023.
German rules only in the magazine; game idea Eric Fisk.

New starting, new patterns for the 7 bonus points in the end and some new rules.

—user summary

name: French Quarter: Tourism Expansion
description:
12 Vacation Cards - end game goals

Custom Bourbon Street Meeples

name: Path of Civilization: Godfather Promo Card
description:
An additional level 2 Leader card, given out during SPIEL '23.

Promo card GL-41

Level II Leader (Industry).
Will in play : Gain 2 Victory point by Industry development
In cemetary : Gain 2 Victory point by Industry development

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Beacon of Doom Supplement
description:
The 15-card A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Beacon of Doom Supplement is themed around the mysterious lighthouse on the coast near Tidewater and features the Tendrils of the Kraken, the new lighthouse location, and the first appearance of Tidewater town elders!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Hogs of War: The Miniatures Game – Team Lard Expansion
description: Ready to ramp up the fun? Hogs of War: The Miniatures Game – Team Lard Expansion is here to shake things up. Get your hands on a new squad of adorable, detailed piggy soldiers, each ready to battle in their own unique way. Team Lard brings a new set of rules and extra cards, adding unexpected twists to your Hogs of War experience. Just remember, you need the original game to join the hog wild fun with Team Lard. So grab your expansion pack and let the piggy pandemonium commence!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board

name: Krimispiel: Tatort Tonstudio
description:
A music producer is found dead in his studio. What do an aspiring singer, a pushy stalker and an enemy record label have to do with it?


Analyze interrogations
See deceptively real evidence
Research online
Find clues in emails and social media
Immerse yourself in real investigative work

name: Panzer Grenadier: Puppet Brigade
description:
In March 1939, the small, newly-created nation of Slovakia declared its independence from Czechoslovakia and immediately became a satellite of Nazi Germany. Slovak troops invaded Ukraine in 1941 and fought alongside the Germans for five years as the most minor of allies. The puppet government began mobilizing reservists just four days before the German invasion, and sent its troops over the border six days later. Those soldiers proved far less enthusiastic about the adventure than their proto-fascist leadership. Slovak formations performed poorly for the most part, with just one notable success.

Puppet Brigade is a Campaign Study for the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the battles of the Slovak Army’s Mobile Brigade. There are nine scenarios plus the brigade’s background story, and 88 die-cut-and-mounted playing pieces. This is not a complete game; you’ll need Fire in the Steppe and Broken Axis to play all of the scenarios.

Puppet Brigade is a partial reprint of our long out-of-print Slovakia’s War expansion, with just the first chapter from that book and the 88 pieces that first appeared in First Axis.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Dixit: Disney Edition – Princess Dress Promo Card
description:
Included in Dixit: Disney Edition – Promo Cards, but it was released/given out as a single card at conventions like Spiel Essen 2023.

Promo card for the game Dixit: Disney Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Attachments I
description:
Customise your Lannister armies with 11 new unit attachments! Enhance your troops with Guard Captains, Assault Veterans, the Clegane Butcher and more.

The limitless gold beneath Casterly Rock flows freely in the War of the Five Kings, hiring the best troops money can buy. House Lannister's professional soldiers are tough and disciplined, ready to shed their enemies' blood for coin. Kitted ou in the finest weapons and armor, these officers are adept at leading from the front and keeping their men focused on the battle. If there's a criticism to be levied at Lannister forces, it's that money can't buy loyalty. But, that said, money certainly buys a great deal of steel.

Contents:
11 Miniatures
‣ 2 Guard Captains
‣ 2 Assault Veterans
‣ 2 Champions of the Faith
‣ 2 Sentinel Enforcers
‣ 2 Turncoats
‣ 1 Clegane Butcher
11 Attachment Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Picture Perfect: Dice Tower Promo Set 2023
description:
Originally available in Pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Preference Cards: Shuffle the new preference cards with the original game cards and randomly remove 3 before placing cards in the guest envelopes.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Darkstar's Retinue
description:
A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Darkstar's Retinue gives House Martell players a hard-hitting unit for their army, a highly maneuverable unit that outflanks their foes, cutting them down swiftly before charging forward again onto the next foe.

Darkstar's Retinue are best employed on flanks and far from other units. There they dash forward to strike like vipers, inflicting heavy casualties and sowing panic. They can remain in the fight or retreat to the flanks to await their moment again.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Fairy Tale Files: Who Framed Mr. Wolf?
description:
Fairy Land's most famous granny has been savagely killed! Who could do such a thing? The main suspect is Mr. Wolf, but is the little girl in the red hood really so innocent? What could the motive be for such a heinous crime?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Bier Pioniere: Freitrank Promo card
description:
When you bought the game at Spiel 2023, you would get 2 free promo cards out of 6 available and this was one of the possible picks. If you'd pay 3 euro, you would get the remaining 4.

Ability: Pay 3 cards to build 1 brewery extension.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Classified
description:
Classified is a cooperative, code-breaking party game in which you need deduction, creativity and forward thinking to win. Which photo shows the next target? Scribble out numbers and spell words to give your allies clues. Can you pass secret messages to your field operatives and complete your mission and outsmart the enemy?

To set up the game, lay out 6 Mission Tokens and 6 corresponding Photo Cards. Each player will then take a Mission Card, which will indicate which Photo Card is theirs. Next, pick up a Code Card. In Special Ops 1, you must scribble a message on your Code Card to transmit to your fellow spies, this should be a word that describes your secret target Photo Card. If your Photo Card is guessed correctly then the target has been identified and you will win the Code Card.

In Special Ops 2, players can only use the code cards that you won in Special Ops 1 to transmit messages. Pick a target player, and shuffle the Mission Cards. Put one Mission Card face down in front of them, they must look at it secretly. The Photo indicated by the Mission Card is their target for this round. The target player may now use any of the remaining scribbled-on Code Cards to help everyone else guess the right Photo.
If the Photo is guessed correctly, the players win that Photo; however, if it is not guessed correctly the enemy will win it. Once all players have had a turn as the target, count how many Photos your spies have won and how many Photos the enemy has. If your team has more Photos than the enemy, then the players win, but if the enemy has the same number as your team or more, the enemy wins.

name: The City of Kings: Scenario Pack 1
description:
Scenario Pack 1 is an expansion for The City of Kings that adds 14 new scenarios, 1 extended scenario, and 1 special story to The City of Kings.

Discover more about the world and overcome new challenges set out by scenario specific rule cards.

The extended scenario allows you to explore the entirety of the Ageless Realms and Azure Rise through an epic 6 - 12 hour scenario.

For the ultimate adventure the special story allows you to create your own adventure as you fight old enemies and prepare for a battle like no other. But be warned, an epic adventure can easily take 12 hours or more to complete.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Campfire Smokeout
description:
A fast, fun, pocket-sized 18-card game for the whole family.

Don’t get stuck in the smoke! Each round use your limited Wind cards to move the Smoke card to another player. If you can’t move the Smoke away, you lost the round-–a Smokeout! When the game ends, the player with the fewest Smokeouts wins!

Its straight-forward rules make this a great game to break out at the campsite or living room when you're looking for light-hearted interactions between players. The youngest players learn the fun--and repercussions--of who and when they choose to send the Smoke. They'll quickly discover picking on any one player is a losing strategy!

—description from the designer

name: Fluxx: PB&J Fun Pack
description:
9-Card Expansion pack, featuring 8 new food-themed cards for Fluxx card games: an action, five goals, and two keepers, and one card for Choose One.

This expansion can be used with any version of Fluxx that contains Bread, Chocolate, and Cookies.

name: Yes, Chef!
description:
Yes, Chef! is a unique skill and action game where kids check the order card, use their spatulas to flip their plates to match the dishes shown, then race to be the first to ring the bell and fill the order. But if you see a cockroach, you must slap that order card instead to squash the bug. The chef who collects the most order cards wins in this fast-paced matching game!

Includes: 12 Two-Sided Plates, 4 Spatulas, 26 Order Cards, 1 Service Bell, 1 Instruction Manual.

name: Ransack
description:
Ransack is an exciting card game where players become crafty thieves trying to escape a dungeon with the most treasure. Players use cards to dodge monsters, steal from others, and strategize their way to victory.

The goal? Be the thief with the most wealth by the end of the game. It's all about clever moves and outsmarting opponents to claim the top spot as the ultimate treasure hunter.

Ransack is a 20 minutes game game for 3-6 players with
90 cards featuring, weapons, objects and monsters.
10 double sided Treasure cards.

—description from the designer

name: King & Peasant
description: An asymmetrical 2-player 18-card microgame in which one plays the king and the other the peasants. The peasants are unhappy with the king and have employed an assassin to "retire" him. The king has found out about the plot. He must try to protect himself and catch the assassin before he is taken by surprise.

name: Agropolis: Expansion Collection
description: A collection of expansions for Agropolis.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Layering, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: April, April
description:
The cheeky little goblin "April April" has had some fun and mixed up the seasons.

Suddenly, snowflakes fall in summer, colorful foliage sails from the trees in spring, pears ripen in winter and the first buds and flowers sprout in autumn.

Now it's time to master the chaos and be quicker than the little goblin.

The game is played directly in the packaging: the four seasons are depicted in the bottom part of the box and separated from each other by fixed hurdles. All the seasons shown are equipped with season balls, although these are mixed up and therefore not always in the right place. There are matching season chips on the table, among which four with the cheeky goblin are hidden.

Now it's time to reveal the first chip and bring order to the balls of seasons by blowing. With one breath at a time, incorrectly placed balls should be moved to where they belong. The game is played as a team against the cheeky goblin. If you uncover all four season chips with the goblin before order is restored, the game ends and "April, April" has won.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: MOMOJAN
description:
MOMOJAN is a card game that combines elements of Mahjong and Hanafuda and that challenges the two players to collect sets. The more sets you play, the more your hand is revealed — and the more your sets overlap, the more points you'll score if you win.

The opponent can steal your point sticks, however, and whoever holds the most point sticks at game's end wins.

name: Musket & Pike Battles
description:
Musket & Pike Battles is a free Print & Play Tactical level wargame simulating the art of warfare in Europe in the Seventeenth Century. The game presents the tactics and possible results of many of the battles during this period. These battles are shown as modules giving a mix of units which are moved and engage in combat on the mapsheet. It is an evolution of the Medieval & Renaissance battles rules to Seventeenth Century (https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/179616/medieval-renaissan...).

—description from the designer
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Zone of Control

name: Arcane Runes
description:
Arcane Runes is a dynamic board game where players lead Viking villages in a relentless quest for supremacy. Engage in strategic engine-building as you grow your forces with powerful Viking-themed cards each turn. The twist? Utilize mystical runes to enhance your own cards or disrupt your opponents' plans.

In this intense competition, players balance offense and defense, managing resources and runes to outwit rivals.

Arcane Runes combines cunning tactics, resource management, and a touch of rune magic. Will you be the chieftain who leads their village to glory, or will your rivals consign you to history?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Move Through Deck

name: Tekkadice
description:
In Tekkadice you fight with a tekka which is a Tantalium Enhanced Kinetic Killer Armor. You build your mecha unit and give it a pilot using simple rules. You need to print two A4 sheets of game component and some player sheets plus some D6s to play. You play on a hex grid arena battlefield on which also 16 obstacles are placed like explosives. Distribute your tekka's attribute points, then pick a Omega special move and a Pilot trait to gain advantages in combat.

You play the game in turns, all against all or in teams. You must manage your Ready dice, which are your tekka's energy, to perform the actions it is capable of. The dice used go on the matching attribute bar then in the Cooldown box, and sometimes in the Locked box. At the beginning of one's turn, the dice bubble up one box.

You keep track of the used Ready dice by placing them on the attribute bar that corresponds to the used action. The blackened letters indicate the attribute scores, which represent the limit of Ready dice that can be used per turn to perform the corresponding action. The used dice move from the attribute bars to the Cooldown box, and sometimes in the Locked box. It's better to keep some Ready dice to roll GUARD between turns, as the dice will be Ready again at the beginning of your next turn.

Game after game you'll increase your tekka's attributes, Dice pool (starting Ready dice) and MP (its hits points), and you'll have the opportunity to pick a second Omega special move and a second Pilot trait.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Retro Park
description:
In this particular amusement park, players will do everything possible to enter the attractions and collect the most stars.

Getting into the attractions is not that easy! There are a lot of people and the lines are not exactly linear. We will have to learn THE ART OF LINEUP.

With the cards, each player will try to place themselves in the exact place in the line that allows them to enter the attraction, but be careful, since the order of play changes in each round.

Whoever is in the right place will win the stars, and whoever collects the most stars WILL WIN THE GAME!

name: Two Crowns
description:
Two Crowns is a two (or more) player game, in the attack/defend, turn- and phase-based realm, that anyone can play with cards they likely already own. It employs mechanics that serve as a gateway to more complicated Trading Card Games like Magic: The Gathering and Pokemon, while striving to be easy to learn with hidden depths and strategies.

All that is required to play is a standard playing card deck with Jokers (4 regular six-sided dice are helpful to track damage, but not necessary as pen and paper work too). The goal of the game is to finish off your opponent's Kings by purchasing and playing Knight and Cavalry Cards, represented by Jacks and Aces. The attacking cards are procured using Coin Cards (5 through 10) from players' Banks, which are deposited into each turn. The other cards are various Effects and Instantaneous Use items that sway the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Investment, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Phase Order

name: Coffea Expand & Write
description:
The theme is coffea cultivation and harvesting.
Polyomino placement puzzle roll & write game
For 4 players only, play time 90 minutes
Write the polyominoes made by others (and the polyominoes you made yourself) on your own sheet.
However, polyominos gradually become larger.


Coffea — Expand & Write is a print-and-play game focused on tile placement puzzles. You are an owner of Coffea (coffee tree) plantations to plant, develop and harvest. Each round, you write several farms—figures within up to 5x5 squares—onto your plantation, expand your farms, and harvest coffee beans from the plantation.
Players have their own farms. Only the owner may expand their farm but it can be used by all players according to the die results. The bigger the farm becomes, the harder it is to write the farm. The key to win is how wisely you choose the farm each turn, and harvest as many coffee beans as possible!

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering – Lost Caverns of Ixalan
description:
In this expansion for Magic: The Gathering, players will explore the subterranean depths of the world of Ixalan, where lost civilizations have sealed themselves off from the surface and ancient threats stir from centuries of slumber.

The set also includes a tie-in with the Jurassic Park franchise. Set boosters and collector boosters have a chance to include unique cards based on characters, locations, and events from Jurassic Park and its various sequels.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Zappenduster
description:
Memory with cards that glow in the dark and an extra card that forces a player to shuffle all cards during a game when revealed.
Fun for kids from the age of 3 or 4 onwards, but also for adults.

name: Mot Coin
description:
Mot Coin is an auction-style game that uses dice to bid on a virtual currency that continues to undergo hard forks.

You can display as many dice as you like using the limited number of dice you have. The bigger the number, the stronger it is, so of course you can win the auction by setting all the dice you have to 6. However, the dice used for payment remain on the auctioned Mot Coin card and will not be returned until the dice count is reduced to 0.

How can I reduce it? Well that's a minor issue. On the contrary, it may even increase. By the way, if you don't get your dice back by the end of the game, you'll be in trouble.

name: Dizzle: Christmas
description:
In Dizzle: Christmas, players fill their level sheets with dice collected each round. Players take turns selecting dice from the center of the table, and the next die they collect must connect to the others. At the end of a round, players remove the collected dice and cross out those squares.

This might sound simple, but of course others will compete for the dice you need....

Can you decorate the Christmas tree (and collect ornaments, candy canes, and presents) to best prepare for Christmas Day?

—description from the designer

name: フランス革命１７８９ (French Revolution 1789)
description:
1789年に始まるフランス革命を、ボードを併用したキャラクター・カードゲームで再現。キャラクターは、マリー・アントワネット、ロベスピエール、ナポレオン・ポナパルト、タレーラン、フーシェなどフランス革命期に活躍した歴史上有名人物が３２枚のカードで総登場。
各派・各人物の思惑渦巻く過激にして混沌としたフランス革命の情勢を描いた、マルチプレー政略ゲームの傑作！


Recreates the French Revolution that began in 1789 and is a character card game using a board.
Characters include Marie Antoinette, Robespierre, Napoléon Bonaparte, Talleyrand, Fouché, and other famous historical figures who were active during the French Revolution, appearing on 32 cards.
Each player bids on those characters that appear every turn, and aims to win by the actions of the characters belonging to their faction.The unique feature is that the political system is decided by vote each turn. Actions then differs depending on the turn political system. For example, in an Absolute or Constitutional Monarchy, players can only vote, appease the aristocrats, and campaign in local areas, but in a Republic they can select radical actions such as arrest and execution, which expands the game at once.
In addition, characters who have been arrested can be freed with the "exile" action, however exiled characters cannot score except when foreign troops invade France. Therefore they will try to guide them through "military operations".

A multiplayer political game that depicts the radical and chaotic situation of the French Revolution, with its various factions and personalities.

Contents:
48 deluxe double-sided color cards (3 sheets)
192 counters
1 standard half map

Game period: 1789-1795
Area: Within France
Play time: 2-3 hours
Number of players: 2-5 people
Difficulty level (5 levels, 5 is the highest): 2

(translated and adapted from publisher's website)

name: Hunted: Kobayashi Tower (2nd Edition)
description:
It’s your wife Sharon’s birthday, so you decided to surprise her at work with some roses and that expensive chocolate she’s always craving. Your marriage has been in a bit of a rough spot lately, and you were hoping today would be a bit of a turning point. Little did you know that as you arrived at Kobayashi Tower, a group of terrorists were securing the building and rounding up everyone inside as hostages. You managed to elude them, but your wife has been taken and is somewhere in the building.

Now, you’ll have to work your way through the skyscraper, take out the terrorists, and rescue your wife while the terrorists try to hunt you down.

Hunted: Kobayashi Tower is a fast-paced solo game that constantly presents you with tense choices. All the cards are multi-use forcing you to make quick decisions about which ones to discard and which ones to activate. You'll have to balance running, fighting, and hiding if you want to save your wife and get out of the building alive.

The second edition features updated systems for events, tests, and HP, and it comes in a VHS case!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Five Parsecs From Home Compendium: Bug Hunt
description:
You’ve seen the stars, but have you ever wondered what is truly possible when we are out there in the black among alien suns?

The Five Parsecs From Home Compendium gives you all three expansions for Five Parsecs From Home collected into a single print volume for the first time, along with the fully updated standalone game Bug Hunt.

The new edition of Bug Hunt includes all the mechanics from the original, updated to fit into the core game rules. This includes features like alien spawn points, alien sub types like the spitter and screamer and alien leaders like the driver or lancer. With 6 sub-types, 6 leader types and 16 alien species to fight, there is a lot of scope for players who enjoy painting, building and converting cool miniatures.

Your troopers can be supported by any of 12 support units from the scientific survey team to a team of tough K’Erin assault troops.

Bug Hunt is a full campaign game with character progression as your troopers advance through their careers. You can even carry over characters from both games - take your crew members from Five Parsecs From Home on a Bug Hunt or vice versa, allowing your characters to experience a whole new level of adventures.

The only question that remains is whether you forgot to activate the security grid. They do say the vent crawlers are active in this sector...

The three expansions for Five Parsecs From Home allow you to experience a wide range of new adventures but also tailor the game to fit your vision of space beyond the Fringe, offering new characters, new mechanics, new options and new missions.

Trailblazer’s Toolkit offers a new introductory campaign, random name tables, new options to tailor the difficulty of the game, PVP and player co-op scenarios, new AI action tables, enemy deployment variables, escalating battles and the fearsome elite-level enemies.
Freelancer’s Handbook offers two new alien species: The Krag and the Skulkers, psionics, new equipment, non-miniatures combat rules. Expanded missions and quest rules, fringe world strife mechanics, expanded ship loan rules and the salvage job scenario type.
Fixer’s Guidebook offers terrain tables, additional rules for injuries both on and off the battlefield, a grid based movement system, faction mechanics and the stealth and street fight scenario types.

—description from the publisher

name: The Royal Limited: Expansion Collection
description:
A compilation of two previously released and two new expansions for The Royal Limited:


The Royal Limited: Murder On Board
The Royal Limited: Second Line
The Royal Limited: Vintage Engines
The Royal Limited: Conductors & VIPs
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trains

name: Monopoly: Star Wars – Light Side
description:
In this Monopoly: Star Wars Light Side Edition board game, players form as many Rebel alliances as they can to protect the galaxy from evil! The more alliances formed, the more credits a player can collect from other players.

Use Yoda and The Force cards for guidance, but beware the power of the dark side! Land on a Ship space? Jump to hyperspace and move to any Rebel hero between that Ship and the next one on the board. The last player with credits when all other players have lost theirs wins—and restores peace and justice to the galaxy!

—description from the publisher

name: Squeaky
description:
The squirrels living in the park have a magnificent view of the city... but they also have to find a way to stock up! Help them collect lollipops and candies. Will the den be full enough... or too much?

The players' goal is to collect different types of food while trying to remember what they already put in their burrow, because overfilling it could be a problem. The game contains two ruleset: a standard one, suitable for the whole family, and one for experts.

—description from the publisher

name: Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Gold Cloaks
description:
The bustling city of King's Landing is generally considered a safe place to live. the streets are regularly patrolled by the Gold Cloaks, named for their distinctive garb. They can be see almost everywhere in the city, keeping the peace, and ensuring rule-of-law as per the king's order. More specifically, to Lannister orders. Though technically under the control of the king, with the Lannister's deep coffers, they often just happen to be absent when any Lannister is breaking the king's own law, or appear out of nowhere to preserve Lannister life or purse (much the same thing).

Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Gate Warden: 40mm
Gold Cloak A: 40mm
Gold Cloak B: 38mm
Gold Cloak C: 42mm
Gold Cloak D: 45mm

Contents:
13 Miniatures (30mm Bases)
‣ 1 Gate Warden
‣ 12 Gold Cloaks
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and pre-assembled.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Pit Fighters
description:
Gladiatorial combat has a long tradition as one of the most popular and dangerous forms of entertainment, often performed by those enslaved by others. Man vs. man. Man vs. beast. Small squads against one another. Massive free-for-alls.

A gladiator must be ready for anything, despite their lack of formal training and in spite of the rudimentary equipment they're given. When Queen Daenerys freed the slaves, many Pit Fighters pledged their allegiance. And while each one has a slightly different style of fighting and isn't usually used to fighting alongside other troops on an open battlefield, enemy commanders would do well to underestimate these veteran fighters and their unusual tactics.

Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Fighter w/ Spear: 35mm
Fighter w/ Sword & Shield: 37mm
Fighter w/ Sword & Axe: 38mm
Fighter w/ Great Axe: 44mm

Contents:
12 Miniatures (30mm Bases)
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and pre-assembled.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: 斗牛勇士 (Brave Bullfighter)
description:
This is a children's game with 2-4 players.

Players take turns rolling 2 dice and move their bullfighter according to the dice results. And the bullfight might start.

When bullfighting, press the button on the bull toy, and the bull will move randomly. If the bull hits the bullfighter, the bullfighter must start again.

When a player's bullfighter reach 30 points, the player wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Unique Units
description:
Duel collectible board strategy with fast games (5-15 minutes).

You are one of the collectors collecting a variety of unique units.

For many, it's enough just to own a huge army of interesting creatures, but there are those who don't have enough of it. For people like you, they hold championships among collectors, where everyone can prove themselves, show their units and the ability to manage them.

Assemble a unique army and challenge the rest. Prove that you know the strengths and weaknesses of creatures of different races and professions better than others.

name: Magic Number Eleven
description:
Magic Number Eleven is an innovative sports game depicting the tactical confrontation of football games with simple rules.
It's a 2 player game, and each player becomes a coach of a football team, confronting each other. The game consists of two Rounds; 1st half and 2nd half. Each round consists of several turns.

In your turn, you basically place a Player Card on the Field Board. The meaning of Player Card placement is an expression of where the team is currently focused on and which player is the center of the tactics.
Each Player Card has semicircular tactical icons which can be combined with the icons on other Player Cards. Therefore, each team will have more tactical icons according to the combination of the Player Cards, as the turns go on.

There are 4 different type of tactical icons- Attack, Defence, Pass, and Press- and the action and the effect you may take in your turn vary according to the type and amount of the icons you have been made.
Based on the tactical icons you have, you may 1) attempt a shot, 2) draw Synergy Cards, and 3) push the Control Maker on the Control Track.

When you attempt a shot, compare your attack power and the opponent's defence power. Both of attack/defence power can be strengthened with the Synergy Cards that each player has. The Synergy Cards represent the teamwork and the passing play of the team. And if your Control is high enough, you may add more Synergy Cards to the attack power. If the total of the attack power is higher than the defence power, as a result, it's a goal!

In case you made the total attack power exactly 11, it called a Magic Number, or Wonder Goal, so the opponent can't defend the shot even with the higher defence power. On the other hand, if it exceeds 11, it's always no goal bacause the shot was too strong to be on target. Since there is always at least ONE unknown Synergy Card which has to be played from deck, so you can't guarantee the outcome of the shot!

A round ends when all the Synergy Cards run out. When the 2nd round ends, a team with higher score wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Tug of War

name: Scrabble Frenzy
description:
Scrabble Frenzy has 60 letter tiles, 45 word cards with partially-spelled words (e.g. ---ING, SP---, -EA-), and 10 Power Up cards that give benefits to players (e.g. Letter Swipe, Double Word Score).

At the start of a round the 60 letter tiles are divided face down among the players, and one word card is revealed for each player, plus one extra. Then players turn up their letters, and simultaneously try to fill out the cards with them. When they can they call out the word(s) for a card, claim it, and place the letters on the card; their remaining letter tiles can be used on other tiles. At the end of a round, each card with optional bonus spaces filled out earns the player a Power Up card that can give them abilities for a following round.

After six rounds, players total the points, and the highest total wins.

name: Lifeboats: Plank of Carneades
description:
Is it possible to escape by boat when a shipwreck occurs? The difference between sinking, swimming, and safely making it to an island may be just a vote away!

Gameplay in Lifeboats: Plank of Carneades is all about voting, which takes the form of both co-operation and betrayal over the course of play as circumstances change and you find your sailors on the brink of death. During a vote, each player chooses a card from their hand, then everyone reveals their choices at the same time. You have one card of each boat color — which also correspond to the player colors — as well as three captain cards. If you're the only person to play a captain card during a vote, you get to decide the result...but if more than one captain card is played, they're ignored. In either case, each captain card can be played only once.

To set up, take turns placing your officers and sailors in empty spaces on several lifeboats, each of which is heading toward a particular island. The game then proceeds in multiple rounds, with the lead player position rotating each round. Whenever a vote is tied, the lead player breaks the tie.

First, players vote on which ship springs a leak. Whichever color boat receives the most votes has an empty space filled with a water token — and if the boat has no empty spaces, the players on this boat vote to determine which occupant will be thrown overboard to the sharks to keep the boat from sinking. In this type of vote, officers are worth two votes, sailors only one. However, if a ship has more leaks than occupants, it sinks and everyone on board turns into shark chum.

Second, players vote on which ship moves forward one space toward its island. If the ship reaches the island, all of its occupants are safe and will score their player points based on which island was reached.

Third, players scramble to find better chances for survival. Starting with the lead player, each player removes one of their officers or sailors from their respective boat, placing its token behind the boat. Only one occupant can jump from each ship, so a player late in the round might not have to put someone in the water. Then in reverse order, players move their token to an empty space on a different ship...and if the swimmer can't do this because all seat are full, glub glub glub.

Keep playing until all officers and sailors are either safe or dead, then determine who saved the most valuable crew.

Lifeboats: Plank of Carneades differs from Lifeboats in that it allows for up to seven players to fight for seats on ships. In addition, in some circumstances the ships will move faster and more ships will spring a leak, making gameplay move faster. Finally, the captain card is more powerful as players can use it to keep any ship from springing a leak in a round.

name: Steal & Plunder
description:
A multiplayer card-based strategy game that pokes fun at the illicit ways of gaining wealth in a corrupt Mzansi.
Join our 2 corrupt citizens, “Steal” and “Plunder” as you plan your strategy and try to set yourself up for success at the end game.
Deploy Wealth cards, Wild cards and Power cards to challenge your opponents and build your Wealth stack.
Quick rules:
Accumulate R10 Mil in illicit wealth to be crowned king of the underworld.
Enrich yourself by building your own WEALTH stacks or by Stealing and Plundering your opponents’ ill-gotten gains.
POWER cards will help you in controlling the game and impeding your opponents progress, to tip the balance of power in your favour.
WILD cards will give you the upper hand in ‘negotiations’ and will add to your accumulated wealth after the end-game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Set Collection, Take That

name: Tape l'étape
description:
Tape l'Étape is a bicycle race run in stages. By getting rid of your cards faster than your opponents, get ahead and win the race!

The race takes place in a succession of stages, each with its specificities. The runners get rid of their cards one after the other. To win the stage, you must be the first runner to have all your cards in hand; the more cards your competitors keep in their hands, the more you gain in the ranking. Use the jokers to spice up the race and catch up or consolidate your lead! For a faster game, play in sprint mode, and for a longer race with more twists and turns, play in endurance mode. Other variations are possible: draw 2, 3, 4, 5... stages, take all the 5 stages but play only one selection per player. A five-minute race or a week-long race, anything is possible!

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Bishop & Nightcrawler
description:
Two iconic mutants join Marvel: Crisis Protocol in this new pack! With his mutant ability to teleport, Nightcrawler is able to land a decisive blow or help get his teammates out of the line of fire at the perfect moment. He is joined by Bishop, who wields advanced weaponry and his mutant ability to absorb and redirect energy in tandem. Together, they enhance any team, but especially the Uncanny X-Men and X-Force affiliations with their abilities and 3 Team Tactic cards.

Adds the characters Bishop & Nightcrawler to Marvel: Crisis Protocol
Both miniatures feature multiple assembly options
These characters enhance the Uncanny X-Men and X-Force affiliations
Includes 3 Team Tactic cards that give them even more options in battle

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Skullduggery
description:
Get ready to set sail and engage in a game of cunning and strategy with Skullduggery! This ultimate pirate-themed card game will test your skills as you work to divide the plundered booty and outwit your opponents. With every move, prove yourself to be a true sea dog and master the art of piratical pilfering. Arrr!!

Your aim is to get the highest four-digit number on your secret doubloon cards at the end of the game. All cards are face down, but you'll swap cards in and take sneak peeks as you play.

Every turn you draw a card and choose whether to discard that card for the action, or swap with one of your face-down cards and play that action instead. You could even use a skullduggery token to swap the card with one of your neighbours.

The cards will move as you play. Can you track the cards you've seen and discard the right one at just the right time?

—description from the designer

name: Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet – Paradox Rift
description:
Dive into the clouds and explore a land that appears to be unbound by time! With ferocious attacks, Ancient Pokémon like Roaring Moon ex and Sandy Shocks ex appear alongside artificial Future Pokémon like Iron Valiant ex and Iron Hands ex. Meanwhile, Garchomp ex, Mewtwo ex, and others Terastallize to gain new types, as Armarouge ex, Gholdengo ex, and more Pokémon ex join the fray. Adventure awaits as timelines collide in the Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet—Paradox Rift expansion!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: KeyForge Adventures: The Great Hunt
description:
Word has spread throughout Skyrealm that the Pale Baron of Aileron will once again host a Great Hunt, and to the winner will go all spoils. Will you and your intrepid crew risk your ship and lives for fame, glory, and Æmber?

You and your fellow Archons are about to embark on a dangerous adventure in the skies high above the Crucible. Taking command of a small skyship, you must hunt the legendary and elusive Skybeasts. Only the boldest, and perhaps reckless, skyship crews can hope to earn the greatest prize of the annual Great Hunt: the patronage of the Pale Baron.

KeyForge: Adventures is a cooperative game mode in
which one to three players work together. Each player uses a regular KeyForge deck from their collection and sufficient
counters and tokens. The players work together to use their skyship, Nantucket, to hunt powerful Skybeasts in the Crucible’s upper stratosphere (known as the Skyrealm). Each time the players defeat a Skybeast with Nantucket, they score a certain amount of renown. The players must also deal with aggressive Stormkin pirates who will persistently attempt to steal their Æmber.

Part of the Gamefound campaign for the Grim Reminders set.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Panam Palmer: Edgerunner Promo
description:
Panam promo. Kickstarter exclusive, comes in its own small box with its own product code.

Panam is an edgerunner whose ability is:
You may discard a combat card with at least 3 firepower to kill a unit in any district.

name: Chrononauts: The Rest of Row E Expansion
description:
This Chrononauts expansion pack fills out the rest of Row E—the 21st century so far. In the alternate universe you come from, did Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton win the 2016 elections? Did the Capitol Hill Insurrection happen or not? Did the Supreme Court overturn Roe vs. Wade or did we pass the Equal Rights Amendment? The Rest of Row E has three new timeline cards, two patches, one Sway Voting Inverter, and four new Identities that depend upon the new events. Expand your travels through time!

Timeline: Donald Trump Elected, Capitol Hill Insurrection, Roe vs Wade Overturned

Patches: Trump Jailed for Tax Fraud, Equal Rights Amendment Adopted

Inverter: Sway Voting

IDs: Armstrong, Orange, Brandon, and Slade

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rewind
description:
In Rewind, players play a must-follow, fixed trump trick-taking game, but rather than taking the cards played, they keep them for a second round. In the first round, they mark their rank in the trick, first through third (in the 3-player game) or fourth (in the 4-player game). Then, at the end of the hand, they play in reverse, trying to get the same rank they got before in each trick. If they don't, they get points, but low points win.

—description from the designer

name: Carcassonne: Mini-Bundle I
description: Four mini expansions for the Carcassonne base game combined in one bundle: Score points in a renewed way with well-known German monasteries, or build famous cathedrals and appoint your meeple as archbishops. Visit the markets of Leipzig and use different districts to your advantage. If you've always wanted to collect tolls, place your meeple as tollkeepers on the roads around Carcassonne.
publishers: 999 Games, Bard Centrum Gier, Devir, Hans im Glück, MINDOK

name: MEMO GAMES: Washington, D.C.
description:
MEMO GAMES Washington, D.C., is a family-friendly card game with hand-crafted illustrations. The game suits family nights, parties, and traveling. The card game is based on the classic memory-matching game, supplemented with special rules and cards with special action powers.
Perfect for 2-5 players aged seven and up. The game's got simple rules jazzed up with snazzy twists. Bamboozle your pals with special power-up cards. Keep things spicy and shuffle those last ten cards in the grid.

Embark on a fantastic journey through Washington, D.C., right from your chair!
Revel in 25 hand-crafted illustrations designed to tickle your fancy. Warning: uncontrollable drooling over our eye-candy artwork may occur! Develop and enhance your memory, cognitive, and visual perceptual skills.

The streets of Washington, D.C., are teeming with tales. Dive into these stories! Delightful details of city landmarks await in the MEMO-GUIDE, available as a handy booklet or a quick QR scan right off the cards. No heavy encyclopedias or endless online searches!

—description from the publisher

name: Louisbourg 1758
description: Louisbourg 1758 is a two-player game on the campaign to take the fortress. One side command the British while the other commands the French. The object of the game for the British player is to occupy the fortress of Louisbourg with their army or occupy Louisbourg harbor with their ships. The French goal is to prevent the British from achieving their objectives by the end of the game.

name: Большая Бродилка: На Пути к Трону Желаний (Big Adventure: On the Path to the Throne of Desires)
description:
Meet Большая Бродилка: На Пути к Трону Желаний! This game include the unique field, new heroes with their own abilities and a whole bunch of cards. And there are no rules here, because they are not needed! All of the most important things are contained in a short set of laws, and the rest is marked directly on the playing field. You can choose one of five characters with unique abilities. Roll the dice - we're starting!

—description form the publisher

Встречайте Большую Бродилку: На Пути к Трону Желаний! Уникальное поле, новые герои со своими способностями и целая куча карт, которые заставят соперников скрипеть зубами вам в спину. Как и в первой части, здесь нет правил. Да они и не нужны, ведь всё самое важное содержится в кратком своде законов, а остальное отмечено прямо на игровом поле. Бросайте кубики — мы начинаем!

—description form the publisher (Russian)

name: Royale: Party at Louis'
description:
Welcome to Louis XIV’s royal dinner! Play as a waiter serving rich and picky nobles at this extravagant party. At night you can immerse yourself in the thrill of the masquerade but do not get too distracted. Nobody likes to wait on their food!

In Royale: Party at Louis’ it’s up to you to serve the nobles their diner. In the middle of the table lies a serving tray with the diverse types of food each player can pick from. Pick a row or column and provide the food to your nobles. But beware! The nobles are picky eaters. If you serve them something that is not up to their taste, they will trash every other food item in front of them. Can you serve a complete meal they will enjoy, then you score points. Will you be able to serve every noble before the party ends and make the night a success, or will your nobles leave with an empty stomach?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Escape Room: Pakohuonepeli 2 – Punainen
description:
Collection of 4 Escape Room-games and one demo-game, all in Finnish. This is the Finnish version of Escape Room: The Game 2v and Escape Room: The Game 3 which both are labeled as "Red"-versions, do not confuse with these. Different versions contains different sets of scenarios, depending on version publisher.

Feel the thrill and enjoy the mystery from a escape game in your own home! As in the case in many Escape Rooms across the world, you are “locked in” in this game and the object is to find the codes to “escape” within 60 minutes by solving puzzles in riddles.

Puzzle scenarios included in this version;

• The Basement (Demo-game, Difficulty: 1,5/5)
IN YOUR HASTE THE HEAVY DOOR IS SLAMMED SHUT...
Your neighbour Jack Wright has been a pest controller for 30 years. Two years ago, his wife suddenly left without a trace. A lot of rumours have been told about the disappearance of Jack’s wife but also about why he was fired three years ago...

• Panic on the Titanic (Difficulty: 2/5)
THIS SHIP CAN'T SINK....
Out of nowhere a loud bang is heard! The ship crashed against a huge iceberg. While the waves are splashing against the ship, you start to wonder: “This ship can’t sink, or can it?”. When people start screaming, and you see water entering the ship, you know that you must leave the ship, quickly!

• Alice in Wonderland (Difficulty: 3/5)
A TALKING RABBIT!?!
Hey! A white rabbit in a uniform, very odd! He looks at his watch and says that a tea party will start soon. A talking rabbit?!? You follow the rabbit in astonishment and before you know it, the ground starts moving away from you! The start of a bizarre adventure…

• Dawn of the Zombies (Difficulty: 3,5/5)
HURRY, ZOMBIES ARE COMING....
“We interrupt this broadcasting for some alarming news. Zombies are walking through the city. This is no joke! Hurry to an evacuation helicopter as soon as you can, the city will be completely closed off, you have no time to lose. I repeat…”

• Another Dimension (Difficulty: 4,5/5)
STRANGE THINGS ARE HAPPENING...
It all started after the opening of a secretive research center. Strange things have been happening ever since. There have been reports of supernatural phenomena and mysterious disappearances. Shadows have been spotted that can’t possibly be from humans. What’s happening here?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., ToyRock Oy

name: Cyber Crash
description:
Cyber Crash is a card game for 2-6 players, where friends play against each other as hackers. Players take turns drawing cards from the Main Deck, and execute computer instructions.

There are 4 Crash Cards hidden in the Main Deck. If you draw a Crash card it's game over unless you can play a Debug Card or Lucky Break.

Mess up your friends by stealing their cards with Pull Request, or manipulating the deck with Out of Order Execution. Switch turns on them so they draw the wrong card.

Also, each player is trying to manipulate a shared number called the Accumulator to match a Target Number. Both numbers are represented with d10 (10-sided) dice. You use Operation Cards such as Add, Multiply, Divide and Subtract, along with Data (number) cards to change the Accumulator. To win, manipulate the Accumulator to equal the Target Number, or be the last hacker standing!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Drop Drive: Deeper Space Edition
description:
Instant Space... Infinite Possibilities!

Gather your crew and prepare to explore the vast reaches of infinite space! Your newly installed rocket drive will aid in mining valuable resources from nearby asteroids, while your experimental drop drive will let you jump to distant and unknown depths of space. Orbit strange worlds to sell your cargo, pick up passengers, and collect alien specimens, all while battling unscrupulous pirates hell-bent on profiting off your tireless efforts...

...it's time to drop into infinite space!

---

Drop Drive is a lightweight sandbox game for 2-4 players (5 with extra add-on pack), featuring a "drop-style" mechanic that assures no two games could possibly be the same. Drop Drive blends strategy with a novel spatial element that will challenge casual and hardcore gamers alike!

THE BIG BANG! At the start of each game, objects of all kinds are dropped onto the table from a height of 4 to 5 inches. This creates a galaxy layout with infinite possibilities. You will then assume the role of an alien starship captain, exploring space, upgrading your ship, mining asteroids for precious resources, and landing on mysterious worlds to sell your cargo, pick up passengers, and collect strange alien specimens!

---

This is a pre-bundled edition that includes the following:

Base game
Strange Signals expansion
5th Captain pack
Deluxe planet and planet tile upgrades
Luxury Links


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Events, Pattern Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection, Variable Set-up
publishers: Phase Shift Games, Tabletop Tycoon Inc.

name: Dungeon Drop: Dark Jelly Promo Card
description:
A kickstarter exclusive promo from the 'crossover pack' that was given to backers of the Drop Drive kickstarter campaign.

X=4, plus 2 for each pillar within 1 card lenght

Unexplained Force:
Move the closest 2 pillars 1 card lenght toward the dark jelly.
If any pillars are touching the Dark Jelly. Re-drop them outside the Dungeon Boundary.

Scoring: Score 6

name: Dragon at Sea
description:
Dragon at Sea is a simple and fast-paced strategy level naval wargame based on a what-if conflict in the Pacific in 202X. Game map is area based like the classic game War at Sea. Game map is A2 size. The game has 352 counters.

—description from the publisher

name: Realm Runners
description:
Creatures from all corners of the multiverse must work together to stop the time gods from destroying their world. But there's a catch. Once the time god is defeated, all who remain must turn on each other since the portal home can only fit one. Survive the realms. Collect epic loot to help along the way. Destroy the time gods. And get back home. No matter the cost.

Old-school rules-lite board game featuring the art of Skinner ? An epic combination of loot collection, boss battles and battle royale showdowns.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Xenolanguage
description:
Xenolanguage is a game about first contact with alien life, messy human relationships, and what happens when they mix together.

Play centers on the "Platform": a custom channeling board of mysterious origin. Use a planchette-like lens to channel over alien symbols as you receive and interpret messages. Players will progressively discover meanings for the alien symbols on the board, grapple with what they learn, and experience how it changes them.

The base game of Xenolanguage includes a custom channeling board with thirty alien symbols, planchette-like lens, story deck, and digital soundscapes.

name: Motel Nobody
description:
Murder Mystery Motel Nobody
One summer day in Florida, there was everything and yet nothing.

Motel Nobody is a motel with no guests.
No one can come and no one knows.
Five people gather in such a lodging.
Some people have curiosity, some have malice, and some have dreams.

There is nothing at Motel Nobody.
Still, they had no choice but to head there.
For them, Florida was the best and worst street in the world.

Like reading a mystery novel, players aim to uncover the truth of the case based on various clues.

Additionally, the criminal is also played by the player, and the player who is the criminal lies or acts so that no one knows about his or her crime.

name: The Great Race: Expansion 1
description: Expansion 1 add a new crew and five new modules to include in the game in any combination. The Suffragettes crew allows for five players to compete in the race. With seasonal changes come weather changes. The post office may ask you to deliver valuable mail to your next destination. Driving through so many nations will bring up diplomatic issues. Patronage will bankroll your efforts. And paddocks will add new scenarios to experience through vehicle customization.

name: Estimator
description:
How many pounds does an elephant's poop weigh? How many stripes does a zebra have? How many degrees is coffee served in a cafeteria?

In this game you will not find the answers, but you will surely be amazed by the hypotheses of your friends and family. Who will be the most exaggerated person? And who will fall short?

- - - -

¿Cuántos kilos pesa la caca de un elefante? ¿Cuántas rayas tiene una cebra? ¿A cuántos grados se sirve el café en una cafetería?

En este juego no encontrarás las respuestas, pero seguro que fliparás con las hipótesis de tus amistades y familiares. ¿Quién será la persona más exagerada? ¿Y quién se quedará corto?

name: The Great Race: Wild West & Far East expansion
description: This expansion provides USA and Asia mapboards, tokens, and a draw bag, plus certain stretch goals. It is not a complete game, and you need The Great Race to use it. This content is already included in The Great Race 2.

name: Замес: Русы против ящеров (Smash Up: Lizards Must Die)
description:
The wicked Lizards have invaded our native land. It's time to show them who the real Rus' People are!

About the expansion:
This box is full of heroic spirit, because 2 new factions collided inside it: the legendary Rus' People and the formidable Lizards! Yes, yes, you've definitely seen these guys somewhere, and now they're ready to come together in an uncompromising Smash Up with each other. Tip over a cup of Baikal water, and off you go!

Combine the Rus' People with the Bear Cavalry, and the Lizards with the Kaiju. Or make an unexpected alliance of the Lizards with the Rus' People and send them to fight other factions! Show your enemies how the slavonic clamp by balls is made!
—description from the publisher (translated)

•••
Ящеры нечестивые на землюшку родную вторглись. Самое время показать им, кто такие настоящие русы!

О дополнении:
От этой коробки так и пышет богатырским духом, ведь внутри неё столкнулись 2 новые фракции: легендарные русы и грозные ящеры! Да, да, вы точно где-то видели этих ребят, и вот теперь они готовы сойтись в бескомпромиссном "Замесе" друг с другом. Опрокиньте чарку водицы байкальской, и понеслась!

Объедините русов с казаками, а ящеров с кайдзю. Или заключите неожиданный союз ящеров с русами и отправьте их бороться с другими фракциями! Покажите своим недругам, как делается славянский зажим яйцами!

—описание от издателя
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bubble Stories: Tales
description:
Discover and explore 3 wonderful tales:

Look for the characters
By jumping from bubble to bubble
Help them in their adventures to have wonderful dreams!


—description from the publisher

name: Oh My Goods!: Big Box
description:
In Oh My Goods!, first released as Royal Goods, players are European artisans during the Middle Ages who produce tools, barrels, glass windows, and many other goods. Only if you make clever use of your production chains will you have the most victory points at the end of the game.

This fine card game was complemented by two editions, Oh My Goods!: Longsdale in Revolt (2016) and Oh My Goods!: Escape to Canyon Brook (2017). All three are part of Lookout Games' #greatgamesinsmallboxes series.

For the very first time, all the good-ness of Oh My Goods! series wrapped in one small big box.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Chaining, Contracts, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Then to the Maypole
description:
Come ye young men, come along
With your music, dance and song
Bring your lasses in your hands
For ’tis that which love commands
Then to the Maypole haste away
For ’tis now our holiday
Then to the Maypole haste away
For ’tis now our holiday
(from the popular folk song Staines Morris)

Then to the Maypole is an 18 card game that celebrates the festival of May Day and the tradition of dancing around the maypole.

The aim of the game is to move the dancers so that they're in their correct positions at the end of the dance according to the song’s specific requirements.
Each dancer has their own special ability that will swap the positions of 2 of the dancers. This must be used or it will cost you points.
When the dance finishes, stars are awarded depending on how well it was performed. There are 6 unique songs to dance to.
Can you earn enough stars to successfully welcome in the summer?

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Music, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: War of 1812: Designer's Edition
description:
The game provides an introduction to America’s first major war after independence in an easy-to-learn manner. Experienced players of war games will find a wide variety of situations that can be played in under an hour.

The Designer’s Edition compiles the three “versions” of War of 1812 into a single collection. This updated edition includes ALL content from The Early Battles, The Later Battles, and The Andrew Jackson Battles.

name: Slotters: Phantom Seven
description:
Slotters is a set collection memory game for exactly four players. Player receive a set of numbered cards, and must place their highest face down on the table in front of themselves.

Then, each player will reveal 3 cards on their turn; they can choose to have any player, including themselves, reveal their smallest or they can reveal one of the cards from the table. If all three match, the cards are collected and a reward is received. If the cards do not match, the same number of cards must be returned, but it may be different cards.

If a player collects the three 7s, they immediately win. Otherwise, the winner is the player with the highest rewards.

name: Heap-O-Sheep: The High Flying Game of Flingin' Sheep!
description: Taking turns, players use their springboard to launch their sheep onto the hook-and-loop sheep pen. Land them, stick them, pile 'em up! The first to get all of their sheep to stay in the pen wins the game!

name: Soda Pop Fridge Bundle
description: The complete four game Set of Cat-a-Comb, Light Seeker, Forgenesis, and Top Cap in one box set.

name: Establishing Empires
description:
You are one of up to 4 benevolent nobles looking to expand and develop your land in hopes of establishing a functional and fearsome empire.
You will collect resources and exploit the land; you will build buildings and develop your civilization through military, grace, population, and science tracks; you will explore ancient ruins, fight off troublesome invaders, and set up trade routes.

A shared pool of dice will be rolled. Those dice will then be drafted and used to activate your Buildings. These will in turn produce resources or move you up on development tracks which will give interesting bonuses. Clever management of resources will allow you to achieve various goals regarding expansion, exploration, exploitation, and extermination.

This game is 4X themed, but it is not a true 4X game - while it does include many elements of such games, the main focus is on resource management and expansion, with a closed exploration system.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Track Movement

name: Datos No Opiniones: Drogas Legales (Y de las Otras)
description:
Datos No Opiniones is that crazy and bizarre trivia game that you deserve as an adult. In Drogas Legales (Y de las Otras) edition you will have data, humor and a little irreverence to talk about one of the biggest taboos in our society. Find all kinds of information about drugs, those sold in the pharmacy and those obtained elsewhere, and about the fauna that surrounds them.

The deck has 102 cards with questions about drugs that are answered with some number. To start, they grab a random card, read it aloud and reveal the answer, that is going to be the starting point in the data row.

On your turn, you are going to grab the first question from the deck and, without seeing the answer, you are going to place it to the left or right of the card you used as your starting point. If you think the answer is a greater number than the one in the data row, you put your card on the left and, if you think it is smaller, on the right. When you have chosen where to put the card, you turn it over to see if you were right. If the card is placed correctly, it's the next player's turn, if it's wrong, you take it out and keep it. If you place two cards wrong, you are immediately eliminated.

Alert! As the game progresses there will be more cards in the data row and you will have to take them all into account when placing the question that comes your turn.

IMPORTANT: You can mix the three thematic editions of Datos No Opiniones and play purely Sex, Drugs and Rock n' Roll.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Datos No Opiniones: Sexo y Otras Chanchadas
description:
Datos No Opiniones is that crazy and bizarre trivia game that you deserve as an adult. In Sexo y Otras Chanchadas edition you will have everything you always wanted to know about the oldest of pleasures. Several things that you didn't (yet) dare to practice asking. Some others that you had no idea about and will awaken your curiosity while playing.

The deck has 102 cards with questions about sex that are answered with some number. To start, they grab a random card, read it aloud and reveal the answer, that is going to be the starting point in the data row.

On your turn, you are going to grab the first question from the deck and, without seeing the answer, you are going to place it to the left or right of the card you used as your starting point. If you think the answer is a greater number than the one in the data row, you put your card on the left and, if you think it is smaller, on the right. When you have chosen where to put the card, you turn it over to see if you were right. If the card is placed correctly, it's the next player's turn, if it's wrong, you take it out and keep it. If you place two cards wrong, you are immediately eliminated.

Alert! As the game progresses there will be more cards in the data row and you will have to take them all into account when placing the question that comes your turn.

IMPORTANT: You can mix the three thematic editions of Datos No Opiniones and play purely Sex, Drugs and Rock n' Roll.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Magic Trick: Teams
description:
A team-based expansion for Magic Trick. The gameplay is the same as the base game, but now players are on two teams of two players each, trying to collectively take tricks equal to their mid-hand bids.

There is also a variant to score extra points for deducing some cards out of the game.

Copies were handed out at The Gathering of Friends 2024.

name: Cohors Cthulhu: Tactics
description:
Cohors Cthulhu: Tactics is a horror-themed, solitaire/co-operative adventure wargame set in the Cohors Cthulhu universe during the height of Imperial Rome. You begin your heroic journey as one of a handful of survivors of an ambush, desperately trying to escape the Mythos-ridden mists of a Germanic forest. As your heroes grow in experience and power, you will fulfill your destiny, becoming the leader of a powerful legion and facing the avatars of the Outer Gods themselves in full-scale war.

The game is meant to fuse the strategic nuance of tabletop wargames with the immersive narrative of role playing games. Cohors Cthulhu: Tactics will feature a wide range of 28mm miniatures in both resin and 3D print at-home STL files. The miniatures range features Roman Centurions, scoundrels, nobles, hunters, priests, druids, assassins, soldiers, and warriors. Facing them will be the full might of the Outer Gods: The Cult of Mormo with their Priests, Servitors, Ghouls and Overlords of Mormo, Teufel Hounds, Fluttering Fiends, Sheehad, Elder Things, Chosen and Die Draugr.

name: Dictator Game: Rome Tyrant
description:
One player is chosen as a dictator, the others are senators, either loyal or traitors.

A game round starts with senators making proposals which are shuffled and revealed and cause the dictator possibly lose life; after which the dictator can use their cards to question the senators and punish them. The round ends with the senators having option to switch side and revolt.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: A Wayfarer's Tale: The Journey Begins
description:
A Wayfarer's Tale is a 1-4 player game of journey and discovery. Players navigate their own individual maps, collecting treasure and avoiding monsters as they explore new locations.

Turns are taken simultaneously as players chart their own course over 45-60 mins, racing to discover new worlds.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Treacheries of the Troublesome Towns
description:
Create cities as you explore them, one building at a time, with uniquely detailed inhabitants, ripe with danger and adventure. You can become a ruler, partake in conspiracies, burn heretics, haggle, buy houses, lead revolutions, hunt villain masterminds, marry into nobility, raise children, and much more.

Treacheries of the Troublesome Towns is divided into two tomes:

Tome 1 covers rules to generate towns.
Tome 2 collects all the tables and secrets to be discovered.


You need both books to play.
Requires Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Big Stompy Robots
description:
On the distant planet of Praxxis 5, giant mecha called Battle Supremacy Robots wage war over good and resources. Mercenary commanders use assorted units to make their way in a world conflicting mega-corporations.

Big Stompy Robots (BSR) is a fun and easy to miniatures game that features mixed unit tactics. It is meant to be accessible but still be full features. It is fast playing with games often being less than an hour.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing

name: Necklace
description:
Necklace is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). The top and bottom edges of the board are colored red; the left and right edges are colored blue.

A crosscut is a 2×2 area containing two diagonally adjacent red stones and two diagonally adjacent blue stones. A point is secluded if there is no free path along the lines of the board between that point and the edge of the board.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point. After your placement, there must be no crosscuts and no secluded empty points on the board. Passing is not allowed, but, if you have no legal moves available, your turn is skipped.

You win if there is a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Red instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Lost Lights: Kurak Promo Card
description:
The German Version of this Promo card was given with issue 2/24 of Spielbox Magazine

Effect: If you lose this fight, move your units in an adjacent instead of removing them,
categories: Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Sea or Shore
description:
Travelling from island to island, you and your fellow explorers search for mysterious treasure chests containing inconceivable riches. However, it’s a free-for-all: will you play the highest card of the right color to claim the treasure? Given the high stakes, the explorers only show either the color or the number of their card. Play the right card, bluff and dive into the depths to come up with the most treasures. Will you show the relevant island or unveil the underwater world you’re going for?

In Sea or Shore you aim to collect as many treasures as possible. You collect them by playing the right island card at the right time, while making the strategic decision to show either the sea (color)or the shore (number). The right choice could let your opponents guessing. If you play the highest card of a color, you could claim a treasure or even steal one from an opponent. There might not be a treasure in your color though, in which case you could activate an action card to gain an edge over your opponents. The game ends after two full rounds. The winner is the player with the most treasure points at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Arabian Struggle
description:
Arabian Struggle is a card-driven conflict game set in the Arabian Peninsula in the early years of the 20th Century. Three Players each play one faction seeking to gain power over Arabia: the Hashemites, the Rasheedis, and the Saudis. Each faction must deal with the other two factions, along with considerable interference of two non-player empires, the Ottomans and the British.

A two player variant uses only the Hashemites and Saudis- the Rasheed's become a non-player element, like the empires. A game consists of 3 ears: Pre-War, Great War, and Post-War. Eras comprise up to 6 rounds each, with each faction taking one turn per round.

The game can end early by competing an end-of-era win victory condition.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events

name: TREOS
description:
On a stormy night, rumor spreads about a luck potion that one can buy for 20 gold coins on the black market in TREOS. The realm is vast, its forests dark and the roads dangerous.

Courier runs pay richly, so each one dares to venture outside the protective walls of their home town...

Players have to choose among 4 asymmetrical characters, deal with highwaymen and other obstacles and - most of all - outmaneuver the competition.

The game is played over several rounds (called days), composed of 5 phases each. Movement cards are drawn and must be chosen wisely, because only the numbers on the cards will reveal the turn order. Each round you will be planning three turns, which you will then carry out one by one. This cycle repeats until someone collects 20 gold (or more), thus immediately winning the game.

As if that weren't enough adventure, the map offers a completely new world with every game: the game board can be arranged in more than 1.500 variations!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement, Programmed Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Arkade
description: Arkade is based on a simple and intuitive concept of dice rerolling with an Alien attacker seeking to reach the enemy defense lines, and a defender aiming to eliminate all opposing ships. Two game modes exist, a strategic mode with bonus tiles to unlock, and a frenetic arcade mode where both players will play at the same time.

name: Unstoppable
description:
On the city-planet of Ceres II, every alleyway invites a quick and quiet death. In the lush forests of Virenos, a single misstep could land you in the belly of a beast. The harsh wasteland of Mithras holds both grave danger and a great treasure for those who search its stacks of discarded rubbish. Amidst this chaos, you find yourself thriving, learning, and growing — a child of rank, touched by fate — but a new danger shadows the future of all three worlds. Gather your allies and sharpen your skills, for the darkest days are yet to come.
