Unstoppable is a solo or co-operative roguelite, momentum deck-building game. Use card crafting and deck building wisely in the face of unlimited threats, maintaining action and card-draw momentum to become unstoppable!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Achtung Panzer!
description:
The Second World War saw the rise of armoured fighting vehicles, in particular the tank, from experimental designs based on unfounded theories to fully developed war machines capable of incredible destruction. Wherever nations clashed, tanks could be found, often having a pivotal impact on the outcome of battles and campaigns.

Achtung Panzer! puts YOU in command of a tank platoon and thrusts you into the heart of the action on the battlefields of World War Two. Take charge, and lead your armoured forces to glory!

name: Rocket Punch
description:
In 20XX, the world was filled with excitement for robot battles! Win the battles divided by class and get the belt! Win the most belts and make your gym famous!

Rocket Punch! is a trick-taking game where the timing to take the belt is important. On your turn, you play the robot cards in your hand, and the strongest robot wins the battle and gets the belt. The round ends when you run out of cards in your hand, and the gym that owns the belt at that point receives fame points. The player who reaches the specified number of Fame Points first is the winner.

name: Alpha Clash Trading Card Game
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.




Alpha Clash is a superpowered, lore-driven, trading card game filled with fast-pace action and a unique comic book art style.

Based on the characters from the Alpha Clash universe, players will be pitted against one another, leading the fight with their Contender. Players will build a 50-card deck to support their Contender where the last one standing is crowned the victor!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Hannibal: Classic Edition
description:
The world shivers as the vengeful Carthage launches a devastating war against Rome, a conflict raging across Italian and Iberian peninsulas, Corsica, Sardinia, Sicily, and North Africa. Stand with some of the greatest generals in history – Hannibal Barca or Scipio Africanus – and lead your empire to victory and glory!

Hannibal is an award-winning asymmetrical card-driven wargame for 2 players designed by the world-renowned Mark Simonitch. Use Strategy Cards to maneuver armies and famous generals of the time, raise new troops, gain political control of provinces and regions across the Mediterranean, and play powerful historical events. Achieve victory by dominating both the military and political front, and make your indelible mark on the history of the ancient world!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: I Heart Manatees
description:
Play as a conservation expert! Your job, build your own manatee habitat, one tile at a time. Rescue manatees from the ocean, adding them to your habitat. Add their favorite food and fishy friends to score points. Watch out, other players can sabotage your habitat with the menacing bull shark…oh the hu-manatee! Keep your manatees happy to score points and win!

Players take turns choosing one of four ocean tiles and placing it in their habitat. Which column you take a tile from determines the special action you get to take, but the icons on the tiles themselves will determine how many points you get. Special actions include taking photo cards for bonus points, adding manatees to your habitat, moving manatees to better positions, and unleashing the bull shark in another player's habitat to steal their manatees.

At the end of the game, you'll score points based on how many manatees you have and how many completed food icons are nearby for them to eat. The player with the happiest manatees wins!

name: Aconteceris
description:
This game fuses the auto-battler video game genre with quick tabletop gameplay sessions. In Aconteceris you will draft a team, place them on the battlefield and watch them fight. Aconteceris aims to be a new tabletop experience that offers an easy-to-play but tactical and deep 1-vs-1 experience.

“Aconteceris” means “legends”, in Estremeñú, an ancient language from our homeland, Extremadura. Over a series of rounds you will pick creatures of the old tales and fables from this region´s folklore to make your team. Evolve your team to make them stronger and synergize between their elements and their alignments round after round. Try to win every fight but do not despair, for losing a battle does not mean to lose the entire war.

—description from the publisher

name: Ostsee-Schach
description:
The water stretches to the horizon.
But even though the sea sometimes seems quite calm, the animals of the Baltic Sea know how to pass the time.
Who is beating whom here? Does the starfish beat the seagull or the seal beat a cockle?

Ostsee-Schach is a refreshing, fast chess variant by Dirk Holdorf, in which 2 players aged 8 and up compete with Baltic Sea animals in a tournament.
You take turns and play until one of you scores 3 victory points and thus wins - or has only one piece left and thus loses.

You get victory points by stacking 3 discs or by moving your own pieces to the opposite edge of the board.
When it is your turn, you move one of your pieces according to the animal you see on it. The figure can consist of only one disc or of two discs, with the upper one belonging to you.
If you move one of your own pieces onto a square where there is already an opponent's piece, you simply place your piece on top of the other one and take it over. If it is then three discs high, you receive a victory point.
However, you may never stack more than 3 discs on top of each other.
Then it is your opponent's turn until one of you has collected the required three victory points.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Static Capture, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement

name: Blazon: Embellishments Promo Set
description:
Mini-expansion promotional set of 24 cards (21 Device and 3 Tincture) and a cloth bag.

These cards can be mixed in with the base game cards to add new unique Element cards to blazon your shields with.

The promos are not designed to be used with the solo variant.

The card titles are as follows:

Tinctures:
Murrey
Sanguine
Tenne

Devices:
A Bend Sinister
A Canton
A Chevron Reversed
A Fox
A Talbot
A Tyger
Bendy
Chequy
Courant
Dancetty
Delf
Erased
Four in Annulo
Four in Solitaire
Fusil
Gyronny
In Canton
Potenty
Rustre
Two Combatant
Voided

name: Paws and Padlocks
description:
The evil Slime Queen has stashed her most valuable treasures within her fortress known as Slime Castle. This has attracted many adventurers from far and wide, including yourself, to try and nab her majesty’s treasures! Will you be quick enough to get your treasure and escape before everyone else, or will you be trapped inside Slime Castle forever?

OVERVIEW
The adventurers are using keys produced by their Magic Key Ring to explore the castle. They hope to collect Krystal Keys, the only keys that can unlock the rooms holding all of the Queen’s treasure.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
The object of the game is to steal one of the Queen’s four treasures and be the first player to escape Slime Castle.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Hitler Turns East
description:
(from the ATO website "Black Swans" section)
Against the Odds broke new ground with the 2010 Annual. Four Roads to Moscow included four different, complete games from four top designers, each one taking their own approach to cover Barbarossa. There have been “quad games” before, but never like this.

While many people are thrilled to get all four, we figured a few folks might have a favored designer and only want that game. We aim to please. So, if you want to try just one or two of the “Four Roads,” the option is here.

Hitler Turns East by Ted Raicer is a classic-style, hex-and-counter wargame that uses chit-pull to keep things fluid. Hitler Turns East focuses on the difficulties of armies cooperating with each other, either for political or personal reasons (and Barbarossa saw lots on both sides).

The new printing of Hitler Turns East comes with 144 updated die-cut 9/16" counters, and a 17" x 22" full color map, plus updated rules and charts.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control
publishers: Against the Odds, Banana Games, LPS, Inc.

name: Négociateur Prise d'Otages: Edition Collector Intégrale
description:
The complete set of the famous solitaire game Hostage Negotiator, in a complete edition including the base game and all its expansions.

Contents of the box:


The base game Hostage Negotiator in its original box
Crime Wave Expansion
The first 8 expansions
A unique expansion set! (also available in the classic Crime Wave box).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boussanga
description:
Boussanga is a beautiful family game with a combinatorial strategy. There are 4 game modes : a competitive mode (1 vs 1), a team mode (2 vs 2), a cooperative and a single player mode.

Step 1 : Choose a combination card.
Step 2 : Visualize the position of your tokens thanks to the transparency of the cards.
Step 3 : Place your tokens according to the combination and create alignments of tokens to score points.

in a cooperative mode :

As soon as you reach 15 points (or more), the game ends. Count the cards in the discard area: if there are 12 or less, you win! To be a ‘‘Boussanga Scholar’’, the goal is 10 cards or less, and to be a ‘‘Boussanga Master’’, the goal is 8 cards or less!

in a competitive mode :

When a player or team reaches 15 points or more, or draws the last card or takes the last pawn of a color from the reserve box, the others play again once. At the end, the player or team with the most points wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Magnificent: Master Tiles
description:
Four new Master Tiles for The Magnificent. Can be used with expansion or base game.

At the beginning of each round, place all tiles face up in a supply.
-Each player takes 5 turns each round.
-One of the turns must be to take one of the remaining tiles (instead of a normal turn), and then...:
(A) perform the tile's action
or (B) flip the tile face down (pass)

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of Lima
description:
Legends of Lima is a tile-laying card game where players are competing to reach one of the world's largest lost treasures, the Great Treasure of Lima.

The game revolves around a valley at the center of the table where the treasure is reportedly hidden. Each turn players take up to three actions. Possible actions include drawing a card from the deck, playing a path card or moving your pawn. The first player to build a path to the treasure and reach it with their pawn wins.

Watch out! Ancient totems sprawled across the island give players special abilities with exciting twists.

The game takes place in 1909, after a large earthquake had collapsed the largest cave system on Cocos Island into a valley. It had been rumoured that the island's caves had been used by pirates for centuries to hoard their riches. Players take the role of famous treasure hunters that have raced to the island to explore it.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Maze, Pirates
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Time's Up! La Recharge: 2012
description: Time's Up! La Recharge - 2012, a French language expansion for any of the various Time's Up! games, includes 110 new cards with 220 names associated with 2012, but no sand timer.

name: A Viking's Tale
description:
A Vikings Tale. The competitive card game for 2-4 players.

Players choose a Clan and battle against creatures and other Players. Use Different Equipment Cards and Fate Cards to win the most battles in the game

If you get the most Honor Points at the End of the game you win.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mandarin
description:
[Note that this is not game of the same name by Mattel from 1991]

Mandarin is a Halma or Chinese Checkers variation from jean du Poel and Historien Spielgalerie. As du Poel did with Go Bang Plus and Tangram Duett, he has created a new game based on the principles of a classic game and the result a new design that works very well.

Mandarin is played on a long-ish board, and each player places their figures (servants) on their home court. Figures can move one space or jump over others, with the goal to bring all of your pieces to the other side.

The game works well because of two additions. First, each player has a Mandarin that starts on a temple space and must end on his opponent's temple. If the Mandarin is hit, it returns to its home temple. Second, the game includes seven blockade discs. These are placed at the beginning of the game, and the rules offer four variations on how to treat them.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Elspeth vs. Tezzeret
description:
Description from the publisher:

Before the Conflux of Alara, Elspeth was an optimistic young knight starting a new life on a new world, and Tezzert was a promising young artificer. Then the evil denizens of Grixis came, devastating Elspeth’s new home and bringing a wrathful Tezzeret to the doorstep of an ancient evil: Nicol Bolas. What will be the fate of Bant, and who will survive when these two fated Planeswalkers collide?

These two 60-card decks showcase some of the best spells white and blue have in their arsenal. The decks include twelve rares and six cards with new artwork, including foil art versions of two Planeswalker cards. Each card in these two decks is black-bordered and tournament-legal. They were designed to be played right out of the box, with no deckbuilding required.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Samurai Sunset: Triumph of the Will
description:
In this alternate history, Nazi Germany and Japan who won WW II have started WWW III in 1948.

In this game, Germany invades Japan.
The German have super elite troops such as some of the best and most well known panzerdivisions, heavy Maus tank units, US Marines, ME-262 fighters, the Kriegsmarine, Rommel, Guderian and Von Manstein and others. The Japanese have the numbers, but also Samurai divisions, Kamikaze, the Emperor.

The game uses the rules, map and many units of Samurai Sunset. It also introduces new units and additional rules.

Published in Command Magazine #5
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Garruk vs. Liliana
description:
Description from the publisher:

A hunter to the core and adept at summoning savage creatures, Garruk Wildspeaker pushes himself to be the ultimate predator. But now he faces his most dangerous prey yet: a fellow Planeswalker. Liliana Vess possesses charm and beauty that belie her crippling necromantic power. What will happen when a force of raw, untamed nature clashes against dark, demonic will?

These two 60-card decks showcase some of the best spells that green and black have in their arsenal as well as eight rare cards and six cards with new artwork, including foil art versions of two Planeswalker cards. Each card in these two decks is black-bordered and tournament-legal. They were designed to be played right out of the box, with no deckbuilding required.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Munchkin Mighty Monsters
description:
Munchkin Mighty Monsters is a fast-playing card game based in the world of Steve Jackson's best-selling Munchkin. You and your monster buddies are hanging out in the dungeon, just waiting to wallop some munchkins...but there are just too many of them! Play cards by matching either the rank or color of the last card played. Be careful – if you get stuck and can't play a card, bad stuff happens – the munchkins wallop you instead! Get walloped too often, and the munchkins defeat you. The first player who gets defeated three times loses the game, and everyone else wins!

Includes five Munchkin promo cards, because everyone needs more cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Sneferu: Builders of the Pyramids
description:
Sneferu was an Egyptian pharaoh who reigned circa between 2543 and 2510 BC. He was the only pharaoh who had three pyramids built. The first attempt to build a pyramid in Sneferu’s lifetime was in Meidum, but the structure collapsed. The second attempt, which came to be known as the Bent Pyramid, had its original angle of inclination changed during construction, resulting in an unmistakable shape. Finally, there is the Red Pyramid. The first successful attempt at constructing a smooth-sided pyramid heralded a new era of pyramid building and became the precursor to the famed Pyramids of Giza.

In the game, you become one of the Egyptian architects Sneferu called upon after two failed attempts. The pharaoh is wary of his inevitable demise and there is no room for error anymore. You must build a pyramid that will honor the great ruler. But only the pyramid that matches Sneferu’s greatness shall be chosen as the pharaoh’s final resting place. The builder of such a pyramid will be showered with gold and undying fame. And those who fail? They shall be trapped in the pyramids of their own making as they are torn down on top of their heads. Well… there is your motivation. So, get building!

Sneferu is a family-weight abstract game by Adam Španěl (Project L) where players attempt to win the great pharaoh’ s favor by building the highest pyramid possible from mined blocks (with each block being a combination of two of the five possible materials). The players get these blocks by spending the two resources in the game: food and time. Time, represented by your boat moving forward on the Nile, is a finite resource with no way to gain more. The boats’ position on the river also determines player order: it is always the turn of the player who has used up the least time and is the furthest back on the Nile. Players can gain food by completing sections of their pyramids with matching materials.

The blocks on offer change each round and it is up to the players to decide when is the best moment to invest a lot of time or food, or perhaps even pay extra for just the right block.

Throughout the game, you will travel up the Nile, from Cairo all the way to the distant Nubian Desert , and then back down. Along the way, you will visit famous quarries providing gold, granite, limestone, white limestone, and basalt. Can you seize the best opportunities these quarries provide?

The architect that builds the tallest pyramid wins! Or will you manage to build the entire pyramid in such a short time?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Ninjitsu: Sabotage
description:
15 card expansion featuring unique abilities and effects

Players scheme to be the first to reach 21 points. Each turn either play a card or draw 2 cards; cards can either be played as a treasure or as an action. Hidden treasures are treasure cards that are played face-down. Swipe hidden treasures from your opponents at any time, but watch out for booby-traps!

This is an expansion and Ninjitsu is required to play.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Police Precinct: Lying Politicians
description: The rules are short and easy to learn. The idea is simply that each time a player has the right to take a reward, they take a Lying Politician Card along with that reward (if they chose to take the reward). This addition to Police Precinct adds significant difficulty, variety, and replayability. The twists and turns of this new expansion are endless! It consists of a deck of poker sized cards, and begins with "Set A" which has 28 playable cards. More sets will be added in the future with the expectation that the total number of cards will eventually exceed 100.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition – The Wisdom of Bastet
description:
When you pick a Market stall that contains 1 or more Bastet cards immediately take the statue of Bastet and place it in front of yourself. Discard the Bastet card(s) and earn 3 Scarabs. If at the beginning of your turn you still have Bastet in front of you, then you earn 3 additional Scarabs.

Contains:

10 Bastet cards
1 Bastet statue


Is included in the Deluxe Edition, but was sold separately for integration with original version.

Note: The Bastet cards size is compatible with the old edition cards, however, the back will be different, so we suggest to keep them all face up in the main deck.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Snowblind: Desperation
description:
"When all hope is lost, let the dice of fate roll."

Snowblind: Desperation introduces a deck of desperation cards to Snowblind: Race for the Pole. During their turn, a player may choose to play a desperation card. Each card presents a number from 3 to 7 as well as a powerful bonus effect. If the player rolls the number shown or higher using an eight-sided die, they are rewarded with the bonus effect and the game continues. Should they roll below the number shown, their team is eliminated from the game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Endless Winter: Man VS Megalith Promo Card
description:
An Endless Winter promo card available through the Man VS Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter

Culture card (shuffle into the Era II deck at setup)

Effect: Spend 2 Tools to gain a Tribe card and place a Megalith
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Territory Building

name: Double Dutch
description:
In this game from the Netherlands, the game pieces are half-spheres in red, white, and blue – just as the national colors of our neighboring country. Each player has game pieces of one color.

The playing area consists of hexagonal spaces, each with a hollow in the middle.

Players alternate taking turns. You move one of your game pieces until you arrive at the edge of the gameboard or at a space occupied by another game piece, but the move has to be at least 2 spaces. After that, you place a new game piece, always with the flat side down.

If your move is more than 2 spaces, you turn the game piece over after your move so that it is now lying in the hollow with the round side down. This means that this game piece is fixed on this space and may no longer be moved.

With every turn, there are more and more game pieces on the board, which leaves fewer free spaces and therefore fewer moving possibilities.

Having to skip a turn does not necessarily mean that you have no chance of moving any more.
Who will make the very last move and thus win the game?

—description from the publisher

name: Slappy Hands
description:
Slappy Hands is a fun and unique dexterity game. Each person has a “sticky hand”. The hand is a small rubber hand that has a sticky film on it attached to a cord (actually all one piece of rubber). A chip is placed in the middle of the table with the participants sitting on each side of the table. Once someone says go, you try to grab the chip from the table with your sticky hand. Once a chip is plucked from the table, that person scores one point and another chip is placed and it starts again. Normally, the winner is the first to five points. Certain chips can be worth two points adding extra incentive in grabbing that chip.

- from co-designer

name: 신들의 정원: 신들의 변덕 (Four Gardens: The Gods' Caprice)
description:
The gods' caprice is in the realm of incomprehensibility. But if you seize the chance at the right moment, you can turn it into a blessing. Win the gods' favor before your opponents in the evermore unpredictable situations.

신들의 변덕 (The Gods' Caprice) is a promotional expansion for Four Gardens, and contains a dual-layer scoring board and 10 promo tiles.
-description from Publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Board Game Circus, Korea Boardgames, uplay.it edizioni

name: Sheriff of Nottingham: 2018 Promo Pack
description:
This 10 pack of promo cards includes 1 each of the following promos, originally given out at conventions:

Arcane Scrolls
Feast Plate
Gemstone
King's Decree
Master Smuggler
Prince John's Sword
Prince of Thieves
Royal Jewels
Royal Pardon
Royal Summons
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Unlock! Kids: Histoires de Légendes
description:
This is the third Unlock! Kids box, for children aged 6+.
6 new adventures in 3 different universes!

Au coeur de l'Afrique
Les Mystères de Chichén Itzá
Voyage vers l'Olympe

In addition, there is a tutorial to discover and learn the game mechanic.

name: Dust Tactics: Kampf Sturmgrenadieren Squad – "Battle Grenadiers"
description:
New expansion boxes for Dust Tactics will take your game to the next level! Featuring new tactical options for your Allied and Axis armies, these primed, unpainted miniatures will expand and enhance your existing forces.

The Axis’ Grenadiers stand ready to reduce enemy armored units to piles of twisted metal. Their Battle Grenadiers pack a punch against the toughest foes.

Battle Grenadiers are comprised of well-equipped veterans armed with a Panzerschreck, Panzerfausts, and rapid-fire assault rifles. This premium box fields an additional Panzerschreck figure and the Tank Killers unit card, allowing you to convert your Battle Grenadiers unit into an elite anti-armor squad.

(Publishers Website)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Atrapame si puedes
description:
Los jugadores encarnan a agentes de la Interpol que persiguen a los miembros de la banda SCOP por todo el mundo. Para ello dependeran de sus conocimientos culturas de los distintos paises por lo que el criminal va pasando en su huida. Ademas cuando le atrape debera tenerle correctamente identificado.
Ganara aquel jugador que requiera del menor tiempo posible para detener a sus objetivos.

Sistema de juego:
Los jugadores pueden Buscar pista o Viajar.
- Buscar pista: Los jugadores pueden investigar en las diferentes localizaciones de pais donde se encuentran. En esa localizacion le daran pistas sobre el paradero del criminal. Las pistas vienen en forma de costumbres o cultura del pais de destino. Adicionalmente, el jugador puede obtener informacion sobre las caracteristicas del sospechoso. Esta accion tiene un coste de 1 unidad de tiempo.
- Viajar: Cuando el jugador cree conocer donde se esconde el criminal va a ese pais. Luego se comprueba si estaba en lo correcto o equivocado. Esta accion tiene un coste variable dependiendo de la distancia recorrida.
Los jugadores en cada ronda deben recorrer 4 paises para atrapar al sospechoso y para ello disponen de 4 dias.


Players are Interpol agents that must arrest to the members of the CSOD criminal band. For this, they need a lot of knowledge about the countries for the suspect be in his flee.
When the player cath the suspect he must identify him correctly.
The player who need less time to catch his objetives win the game.Gameplay:

During the game the players can search clues or Travel.
- Search clues means that players investigate in the actual place in one location. This location give to the player a clue about the next destination where the criminal. The clue is about culture of the country where the criminal is. In addition the player can get information about the characteriscts of the suspect. This action cost 1 unit time.
- Travel means that the player knows where the criminal is hideway and go to the country. Then looks that his correct or wrong. This action cost variable time units depend of the distance.
To catch the criminal each round tha player must travel throught 4 countries and He has 4 days to arrest.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Print & Play, Travel, Trivia

name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Devastator Deck
description:
The Transformers TCG is a fast-paced trading card game for 2 players.

This DEVASTATOR Deck contains the cards for 1 player to command the Constructicon team - and combine them to form DEVASTATOR - right out of the box.

name: Catacombs: Shadowlithe Fist promo
description:
This promotional ability card was released for the Thief hero found in the Catacombs Third Edition base game.

According to the publisher's website, The Shadowlithe Fist (for the Thief) and the Teleport Chicken promo cards are included in the Catacombs: Wyverns of Wylemuir expansion.

name: Starfighter: Academy
description:
The alien Thrall have invaded the Sol system. Star*Corps has sent out a call for new pilots to fly the latest fighting ships against the most dire threat mankind has ever faced.

Starfighter:Academy is fast-paced game of strategy and luck for two or more players. As Cadets, players choose and customize their own "sim" ships for battle in the Academy's sim-pods as they train for an assignment straight from their worst nightmares.

A special deck of Starfighter cards and an assortment of dice enable you to create Academy simulator action on your own tabletop. The game is quick to learn, fast to play, and gives you a chance to try out a variety of Starfighter designs in your effort to find the perfect ship to take out against the enemy.

Home Page: http://starfightercg.tripod.com

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Umenzi Tribesmen Reinforcements
description: The Umenzi Tribesmen is the sixth faction for Battleground: Fantasy Warfare, the award-winning tabletop wargame in which cards, rather than expensive miniatures, represent your forces. The Umenzi Tribesmen draws inspiration from the great Zulu armies of earth as well as a cinematic take on Voodoo, adding a new level of magic to Battleground play. As with previous Battleground factions, the Umenzi Tribesmen is packaged in two decks. Starter decks include all the cards needed to play -- 18 units, the 30-card Command deck and two reference cards -- plus the basic rules. Reinforcement decks include 50 unit cards, including two types not found in the Starter, plus the advanced rules.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Kariba: Charmeleon Promo Card
description:
Kariba: Charmeleon is a promo card exclusively available in Brazilian edition.

The Chameleon is a wild card, and replaces any animal in the game, in any situation. The wildcard counts in your final score exactly like the other animals, worth only 1 point. If you bought the wild card from the table (along with other animals), it doesn't go back to your hand and counts only in the final score.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Siege of Tenochtitlan Game
description:
Siege of Tenochtitlan is a wargame on the Spanish Siege of the Aztec City of Tenochtitlan in 1521.
The Siege of Tenochtitlan is a low to moderate complexity wargame with a hexagon grid game-map.

One side commands the Spanish forces and their allies and the other side commands the Aztec forces. The Spanish units include swordsmen, arquebusiers, crossbowmen, war dogs, brigantines, cavalry and Tlaxacan allies. The Aztecs haves various knights, bowmen, javelinmen and war canoes.

The game takes about 90 minutes to play. There are 20 event cards which vary game play.

-description from designer

name: Splendor: Nobles Promo Tiles
description: Four new nobles tiles to be used for Splendor. Artwork includes three new male nobles: Jacques Cartier, Thomas More and Guillaume Budé and one female nobles: Diane de Poitiers. The bottom right-hand corner of each tile is marked with a "p" to indicate that it is a promotional noble.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance

name: Rolling Realms: Skoventyr Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Skoventyr.

To play this realm you must make your way through a dark forest in order to stay ahead of Gamle Erik. If he's catching up, you can sacrifice a tree to slow him down. Will you get to 6 stars while saving the forest?

-description from developer

name: Krimi Total Fall 5: Der Mythos der Familie
description:
Translation: "The myth of the family"

A murder mystery game playing in the 1930's in a little town near Chicago. Mobster boss Don Pedro Calliente is earning a fortune by smuggling alcohol. But in the last couple of days a lot of murders happened because of the return of the Morelli brothers.

Don Pedro has ordered important members of his family to his house for a secret meeting. The future of the family is at stake...

All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 optional m/f) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (who is the only person allowed to lie).

name: Orichalque: Règles du jeu solo
description: An official solo variant for Orichalque, offered as print & play. It includes a 2-page ruleset and a special board for the automa.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Race, Sudden Death Ending, Tile Placement
publishers: Catch Up Games, Pandasaurus Games, Pegasus Spiele, TLAMA games

name: In an Inn
description:
A man's body was found beaten to death in an open-air bath.
The suspects were novelists, editors, hot spring writers, and guests at hot spring inns.
"Five dancers from a nearby theater who happened to visit the inn, and a wet towel dealer who came and went."
While they were both suspicious, a pistol with a silencer was found in the victim's dressing basket.
Things are getting more and more chaotic...

name: Sheep in Disguise: NSFW
description:
Putting sheep in disguises to protect them from deadly predators seemed like a great idea... until we lost all the sheep. Now a new age is upon us! With demand soaring, sheep are worth their weight in gold! Build your Flock, build your fortune, and protect it all from predators and opponents alike. NSFW artwork on every card!

Sheep in Disguise is a vibrant and strategic card game about protecting adorably-helpless Sheep from being devoured by the many outrageous and dangerous predators of the world. Collect Flocks of Sheep, keep them safe from Attacks, and use Action cards to destroy anyone that gets in your way!

Players take turns drawing cards to collect matching sets of disguised Sheep and a variety of powerful Action cards. When a player has collected 3 Sheep of a kind, they must be placed face up on the table immediately. This set of 3 Sheep is called a Flock. In a 4 player game, the first person to collect 4 unique Flocks is the winner.

On their turn, a player may use as many Action cards as they like by playing them to the Discard. They may also make one trade with the Field per turn. The Field is a constantly changing group of cards in the middle of the table that players can exchange cards with to help them build a strong hand. The Field guarantees that the game isn’t completely luck of the draw and allows the player to strategize and build combo moves in order to progress their game.

Players can also target an opponent's Flock by placing an Expose card on top of it. This Action exposes the Flock's disguise, leaving them vulnerable to an Attack! Players must choose to take the risk of leaving their Flock exposed or pay to remove the Expose card, ensuring the Flock's identity remains a secret. When an Attack card is drawn, all Exposed Flocks are destroyed!

Be strategic and be devious. If you play your cards right, you can turn the Attack card into an extremely powerful tool to help you get ahead... otherwise, you may end up as the victim.

If you find yourself falling behind, don't worry! All players are in it until the very end and one big move is all it takes to flip the whole game on its head!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Empty Space Explorers
description:
"Red Commander, we are one hop away from the red exoplanet but our systems cannot tell us exactly what is ahead. Mission Control confirm that we need to land now if we are to be the first to set foot on a planet outside our solar system. The green team are due to land any moment...what shall we do Commander? Can we risk going for the landing? Commander, it is up to you!"

The aim of the game is to travel the universe with your space craft to find an habitable Exoplanet and colonize it. You do this by picking up cards to firstly build your space probe. Your space probe unveils the universe and you explore it (watching out for black holes) to discover an Exoplanet. Finally, send a rocket to colonize your Exoplanet to win the game - but watch out, as your opponents will be trying to thwart you and race to victory instead.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Find your way
description:
Find your way
A Christian board game

FIND YOUR WAY is a game where you have to find animals, plants and different objects from Bible stories. Where? On the roads of the network you build around the temple. Who is going to find the most objects? It doesn't only depend on luck, but also on how you find your way around the board. Making good decisions and working together will help. After all, the main aim of the game is to enjoy playing it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Chaos Isle: Deluxe Survivor's Kit
description:
What Has Come To Pass
It wasn’t long ago that Dr. Zycheck’s experiments for immortality went awry and he was transformed into the undead thing known as The Creator. Further experimentation with creatures both living and dead quickly caused the Isle to become overrun with his Zombi monstrosities. Many tried to escape the Isle and others barricaded themselves in their cellars hoping to ride out the storm, while a few brave heroes did what they could to end the madness. Most didn’t make it. Professor Mortimus Philbin, Dr. Zycheck’s former assistant, rose to challenge The Creator with his self-made army of Exterminators, designed to do battle with Dr. Z’s minions. Unfortunately, the Exterminators were nothing more than mindless Cyber Zombis who slaughtered the living when the walking dead weren’t available as targets.

Just when it seemed things couldn’t get any worse, the Virus began to transform and spread like a plague, holding the Isle hostage within its deathly grip. Zombis began to mutate and hordes of the undead were being driven by powerful new masters. The heroes fought valiantly to save the Isle, but the virus-fueled undead seemed impossible to overcome. The Virus had infected the Heroes as well, however, empowering them to perform amazing feats that could be used to stop the onslaught. But rather than using their new found abilities to save the Isle, they began to work against each other in a desperate struggle for self-preservation.

The Creator stood to reign triumphant as the Isle swiftly fell into the hands of the dead, but the Brood Mother emerged from a vile cesspool of the darkest Virus. A creature with an insatiable appetite for both the living and the dead, she began to even the odds. Now, in the Isle’s darkest hour, The Creator, the Brood Mother, and the survivors of Chaos Isle face off in a final battle to either save the Isle, or doom it forever.

Game Overview
Chaos Isle is a zombie-themed card game that can be played solo or by up to 6 players using just a single deck. The game is played using cards separated into 6 different decks, including Mission, Character, Equipment, Feat, Virus and Enemy cards consisting of Tasks, Events, Mutations and Zombis. Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck places each player in the role of one of the Characters, with each attempting to be the first to complete their mission and all the while fending off 14 different Zombi enemies.

What's Included:
Includes the Base Game and the First 4 Expansions!
8 Zombie-themed Dice and pouch in plastic case!
50 colored Glass Hit Counters and pouch in plastic case!

name: Don't Let the Wolves Eat Our Baby!
description:
On a blizzard ridden night, a family traveling home slides off a mountain road. Their car is seemingly stuck in an embankment. Preparing to wait it out, a pack of wolven Berserkers appear out of the falling snow. Are these crazed people? Or becoming wolves? Or worse wolves becoming man? One thing is certain, the family is now the prey, and must escape! As the beasts descend upon them a desperate cry is heard, “DON’T LET THE WOLVES EAT OUR BABY!”

Players will play as either a Hunted family or wolven Berserkers. The Berserkers must destroy each member of the family. A single family member must escape the North end of the map, while hidden to survive.

"Don't Let the Wolves Eat Our Baby!" is a tactical hex and standee game with each standee representing an individual character. Characters have sheets with some individual stats related to speed, strength and will to live. In the short game, the family can win if any of them escape the north end of the map while hidden.

GAME COMIC CREATED BY CHARLIE FOGEL!

Note: Don't Let the Wolves Eat Our Baby! is a FANGORIA MAGAZINE EXCLUSIVE. It was made for their Winter 2019 issue. And all files can be downloaded from their website as a Print and Play:

It is also the 4th game featured in our "Halloween Nightmares Horrorgame Magazine" series. A game magazine dedicated to Halloween and the Horrorgame genre.

Players will need to xerox elements and provide two D6 and pencils to play this game.
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination
publishers: Emperors of Eternal Evil, Fangoria Magazine

name: Catacombs: Wyvern Monarch promo
description:
This promo card was included in elzra.com online purchases in late 2017 and early 2018.

This is an alternate stat card for the Wyvern Monarch. Is included as part of a dungeon setup whenever a dungeon card instructs you to include it. Useful for both Catacombs 3e and Catacombs & Castles
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Humanity Resists
description:
This expansion brings a new wave of reinforcements to both sides in your continued tabletop battle for control of the Earth.
The Martians bring disciplined marines, sneaky stealth specialists and the powerful Attack Saucers, as General Tor steps up his campaign to obliterate Greenville from the map.

The humans get Novas Vira commandos, a truck and support weaponry as well as two new heroes – elite Novas Vira agents Natalya and Falco – to stand alongside the heroes and soldiers of the original game.
New scenarios see the conflict escalate as each side races to gain the upper hand. You will command endless armies of Martians as they hunt down every last hiding place of the resistance, or teams of elite specialists running behind enemy lines to sabotage the Martian war effort and even steal the invaders’ own weapons to use against them. Whichever side you pick, there’s one thing for certain – this is where it all gets real!

name: Legacy of Thracks: The Awakening
description:
Legacy of Thracks - The Awakening is an Euro-Ameri hybrid, competitive, epic fantasy game with unique semi-coop elements.

You control one of the clan Heroes (Warrior, Mage, Engineer) and your goal is to reach the legendary city of Dimara in 9 days, otherwise, the Shadows fulfill their destiny and destroy the world. Or control the Shadow Hero, and prevent the others from entering Dimara. Besides your Hero, there are Lost Souls, who you can control. But be careful because other players can move them too.

During your journey, hire Lost Souls to bring hidden crystals to the surface and collect relics. Use these crystals to complete secret quests and overcome magical barriers. Move your Hero and capture villages to take special advantages, build roads or capture a Fortress to increase your glory, or capture Castles to increase your income. Fight with other Heroes in the right moments, and via Portals surprise them in critical situations! Take specific actions to improve your Hero's special skills and use them wisely.

And don't forget: time is running out, and sometimes you need to make sacrifices together with other clan Heroes to slow down the Shadow!
categories: Economic, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement, Random Production, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Cóatl: Promo Cards
description: The Cóatl promo deck contains six new Prophecy cards and five new Temple cards. The cards have no text on them.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Contracts, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Centurion
description:
Players start the game by placing their Centurion in one of the two middle squares on their side of the game-board. Two Legionnaires are then placed next to the Centurion. Each turn a player may choose to randomly draw a new tile from the bag or move a tile already in play.

The innovative game-play feature at the heart of CENTURION are its double-sided PROFILE SYSTEM tiles. Each side represents a different posture--often considered defensive or offensive--and indicates exactly what the piece can do within the turn. At the end of a move (or use of a special ability) the tile is flipped to its other side, displaying a new offensive or defensive profile. Each maneuver profile conveys a file's different options for movement and attack. The full circle is standard Move, a hollow circle the Jump, an arrow provides for the Slide, the star a special Strike ability and so on. Defend your own troops while positioning yourself to capture your opponent's Duke, Jarl or Centurion tiles.

With thirteen different double-sided Soldier tiles and nineteen total pieces for each player, every game of CENTURION brings different challenges requiring new strategies. Add to that players can choose to play asymmetrically with the sets from The Duke, Jarl, or CENTURION, battling among all three armies. The variety of play is limitless.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Tile Placement

name: Pavé
description:
Pavé is an original kiwi strategy game.

A two player path building game played across a grid that is deceptively simple, emergently complex, and ruthlessly competitive, Pavé is a timeless game for all ages.

Pavé is a very simple game to play and understand. It has fewer rules than you expect.

To start the game each player grabs 5 Pavé tokens from the bag
Your goal is to use the paths on the tokens to connect your 2 board edges while your opponent is trying to connect the other 2 edges.

You alternate playing tokens, and top up after each turn.
Tokens may also be stacked to redirect the path.

The first player with a completed path to call "Pave" wins the round.

The core game concepts are:

Randomization
Hidden Information
Connections
A Dynamic Board State

Pavé tests the player’s skills of

Pattern Recognition
Spatial awareness
Strategy and Planning
Calculating Probability
Bluffing and reading bluffs
mechanics: Connections, Network and Route Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Wooden Shoes & Iron Monsters
description:
from Winsome Games:

"Wooden Shoes & Iron Monsters" is a Riding Series game by Han Heidema. WS&IM is set in the Netherlands and covers to history of the Dutch railroads from 1830 to 2006. WS&IM is for 3-5 players for about 2-3 hours. Players start railroads, capitalize them with shares of stock, build track from city to city, receive income and later merge smaller railroads into larger railroads. Prior games in this series include West Riding, Länderbahnen and Riding through England.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Star Wars: Legion – Phase I Clone Troopers Upgrade Expansion
description:
The Galactic Republic’s Phase I Clone Troopers are always armed with state-of-the-art equipment. For most clone troopers, this means carrying the powerful and versatile DC-15A blaster rifle, but a select few Phase I Troopers are trained in the use of even more weapons, ensuring the Grand Army of the Republic is prepared for any situation.

The Phase I Clone Troopers Upgrade Expansion contains four unpainted, finely sculpted soft plastic Phase I Clone Trooper miniatures to enhance your existing Phase I Clone Trooper units or to form one corps unit, along with new personnel and heavy weapon upgrade options.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Murano: Promo Cards
description:
A set of three promo cards one got when purchasing of the game at the Lookout stand in Essen 2014.


Campanile/Bell Tower: You receive 5 VPs immediately.
Markthalle/Market Hall: Every time you use the income action, you receive 2 more gold.
Ratsstube/Council Hall: You only have to pay 1 gold to purchase a special building.


These cards are included in Murano: Complete Edition.

name: Dakara
description:
Dakara is a high stakes game where risks and competition abound. It's easy to play and will keep you interested throughout. Experience the challenge of over 15 different games within a single game. Take a boarding pass and fly to international resorts and casinos, ski aspen, play golf in palm springs, roulette in Monte Carlo, try you luck in Acapulco, Madrid, Venice and more. Dakara is unpredictable, exciting and highly entertaining. It's a game you will want to play again and again.
The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player while traveling to exotic places around the world.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Klingon Armada
description:
Klingon Armada is an official conversion of the Setting: Star Fleet Universe to the Starmada rules. Players can fight one-on-one duels, but Klingon Armada is particularly suited for fleet engagements. The rules are simple, but not simplistic.

Each turn, players simultaneously write orders for all of their ships, and then the orders are executed in turn order. The mechanics for combat are simple, but there is large amount of variety in the weapon effects. Ships lose effectiveness from damage until they are expanding clouds of debris.

Klingon Armada can be played with miniatures or counters from the Game: Federation Commander series.

This book includes quick-start rules and 40 starship diagrams (from Klingon Border and Klingon Attack).

Additional books with more starships are planned.

Integrates with:

Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
Romulan Armada
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: Claim: Valkyries
description:
Alternate faction for Claim or Claim 2.

If the Valkyrie is played following another faction, it becomes that faction if it is valued 3 or higher than the first card played.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour
description: Imperial Armour - Imperial Vehicles for Warhammer 40.000 is a gaming supplement released by Forge World in 2000. The book has 80 pages and was first in the original soft cover Imperial Armour series until replaced by the larger, re-numbered hard covered editions. This volume focuses on the Imperial Guard tanks and heavy tanks.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Princess Malya
description:
Even a racing super-star has time to sit down to a game of Super Dungeon Explore. Princess Malya brings her love of speed into the Last Galaxy's favorite online game, zipping through the dungeon at a breakneck pace. Malya slays monsters with glee, but is always willing to lend fellow adventurers a hand with the help of some creation magic.

Contents:
Princess Malya Hero Model
25mm Base
Game Card

name: Spectre: Operations
description:
Spectre: Operations is a tabletop skirmish wargame from Spectre Miniatures which takes you to the cutting edge of modern warfare. Spectre: Operations introduces a world of action and intrigue, where special forces, intelligence agents and military contractors are on the front line, carrying out covert operations against a multitude of adversaries; including enemy nations, unstable regimes, ruthless warlords, insurgents, mercenaries and paramilitary groups.

The game mechanics within this book are realistic, fast paced and quick to learn, optimised for 2+ players with 4 - 40+ miniatures each side. It takes into account all modern battlefield factors such as ranged and close combat, infantry and vehicle combat, air support, covert operations and civilians on the battlefield. The game uses mechanics to realistically represent darkness, adverse weather conditions and how alert your troops are, as well as cutting edge equipment such as night vision, suppressed weapons and surveillance drones. Stealth, cunning, and the ruthless will to win is the only way to prevail; you must rely on tactics, cover and careful selection of your forces to plan your action and succeed in Spectre: Operations.

Spectre: Operations rules are part of the Spectre Miniatures brand. Painstakingly researched and designed with advice from military consultants, Spectre Miniatures has built a comprehensive range of extremely accurate modern 28mm miniatures, vehicles and rules to play action-packed, fast-paced table top wargames.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Lorwyn
description:
On this idyllic plane, fabled races thrive in a land of dense forests, meandering rivers, and gently rolling meadows. The sun never quite dips below the horizon, and winter is entirely unknown. Mischievous Goblins, ruthless Elves, or valiant Kithkin ... which tribe will you choose?

The first set in the Lorwyn-Shadowmoor block, Lorwyn features 301 cards with randomly inserted premium cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Aperitivo con delitto
description: "Aperitivo con delitto - Benvenuti al murder party" ("Aperitif with crime - welcome to the murder partty") is an introduction to murder parties. Several of them are provided, with 5 suspects speaking and one or more detective teams called to solve the case.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Rotarran Expansion Pack
description:
The I.K.S. Rotarran is Klingon B’rel-class Bird-of-prey. After suffering a number of defeats in combat with the Jern’Hadar, the morale of the crew was extremely low. General Martok assumed command and, aided by Worf and Jadzia Dax, brought honor back to this “cursed” ship. Martok later took the Rotarran as his flagship during many battles in the Dominion War.
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.K.S. Rotarran Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 19 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Oh Nuts!
description: A variety of marbles are hidden inside 20 identical plastic nuts. The object of the game is to accumulate 3 marbles of the same color.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Turn Order: Random

name: 5150: Star Army
description:
5150: Star Army is a rewrite and update of the military and bugs sections of the original 5150.

This game has a strong focus on military skirmishes of up to about a company, with a platoon being more typical. Each figure represents one man, alien or vehicle. There are three basic scenarios- patrol, attack and defend, which are each altered by a system for randomly laying out the board as well as generating opposing forces for solo players. Individual games can combine in a campaign where individual soldiers improve over time and new recruits might become available.
categories: Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: El Generale
description:
El Generale is a light wargame. Players are leaders of small countries, that want to reach a certain position on the international scene.

The main goal is to accumulate the most money at the end of the sixth turn of the game.

Every player starts with his own country, the same amount of money, people and the same infrastructure. And of course a handful of Generals for their army. During the game each player has to invest in the military strength (defense and offense), transportation and hospitals to see his country grow.

Attacking other players weakens their ability to generate money. But no one should forget about defense.
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Каркассон: Колесо фортуны
description:
This edition of Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune includes the Bridges, Castles and Bazaars expansion.

Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune is both a full replacement for the base game of Carcassonne and an expansion to the original base game. It includes 72 tiles, consisting of 63 tiles released in the original base game, 6 from Inns & Cathedrals, 1 from Traders & Builders and 2 from King & Scout. It also includes a special replacement start tile which depicts the Wheel of Fortune, a new mechanic unique to this edition of the game. The new start tile is the size of 16 tiles, arranged in a 4×4 square and is built using some of the tiles removed from the base game.

Nineteen tiles from the game have numbers printed on them allowing players to randomly spin the Wheel of Fate (between 1 and 3 spaces around the wheel). Otherwise, a player may choose to place a follower on the wheel if they decline placing a follower that turn. The results of the Wheel vary depending on which of the sixths of the wheel the pig lands on. Results vary from forcing all players to remove a follower from the board to rewarding the player who moves the pig with three bonus points. There are six outcomes in all.

Play of this game does not require ownership of any Carcassonne base game. All expansions are compatible with this game. This game can also be played with the base game as an expansion, using its wagon wheel watermark to differentiate it from the base game.

Bridges, Castles and Bazaars is the eighth expansion for Carcassonne. It allows players three new options while playing:

Bridges may be used to continue a road over a field tile, thereby allowing an incomplete road to technically run into a field segment. They are otherwise treated and scored just like roads.

Castle tokens are placed atop 2-segment cities and allow players a chance to cash-in on the next completed adjacent feature.

Bazaars are a new type of tile that allows players to auction off tiles in exchange for points.

name: Wolven
description:
You know the drill.
Werewolves terrorize the villagers by night. Fear crazed villagers run around lynching each other during the day and exercising secret powers in the darkness. Blah, blah, blah.
It’s all so deliciously cliché it makes you want to laugh out loud.
Except that you, the Slayer, have a secret.
After a particularly rowdy night at the local tavern last Friday, you woke up with stiff joints and a set of unexplained claw marks down your back. Ever since, you’ve been plucking your eyebrows twice a day and craving rare steak. Once, you even caught yourself trying to scratch behind your ear.
With your foot.
Last night, you heard howling in the distance and it made the fur… er… little hairs on the back of your neck... stand at attention…

Wolven is a solitaire hidden role deduction game in which you (as the Slayer) seek to identify and eliminate the werewolves before they overrun the village… AND before you sprout fur and claws!

The tokens in Wolven each have a picture of a villager on their front. Each unique villager has a special ability that aids the player in the process of deduction, earns silver, or helps protect other villagers against the werewolves.

The back of most of the tokens show picture of a Peasant, who is a sort of generic villager with a special ability of his own. A few of the tokens, however, have werewolves on their reverse sides instead. The object of the game is to identify which villagers have werewolves on the back and eliminate those tokens from play.

To spice up the deductive part of the game, one or more of the villagers might also have a Peasant on their front face. So when you see a peasant on a token, you're not sure if you're looking at the back of a villager token, or the front of a peasant token. If it's a peasant token,you're not sure if the reverse side is another peasant, or a werewolf!

The game is played by pulling tokens from a bag and viewing only one side, which is placed face up on the table. You may continue drawing tokens until you decide to stop, or until you place a token that show a werewolf.

You may then spend silver to use the abilities of any of the face up villagers.

If you stopped drawing tokens before you drew a werewolf, you may then select the token of your choice to remove from the game. Once it's removed from the game you can look at both sides to determine whether you've eliminated a werewolf or a villager.

If, on the other hand, you didn't stop drawing until a werewolf turned up, the token to be eliminated from play is selected randomly. Drawing a werewolf also advances a token on the infection track. If this token ever reaches the end of its track, another werewolf is added to the bag.

In either case, the tokens (other than that which was eliminated) are placed back in the bag and another round begins.

If, at the end of any round, all of the werewolves have been eliminated, the player wins. If, however, the werewolves ever outnumber the regular villagers remaining in the game, the player loses.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: How the West was Saved: the Russo – Polish War 1920
description:
"How the West was Saved: the Russo-Polish War 1920" is a two–player strategic wargame based upon the Russo – Polish War from April 1920, when the Poles were poised to attack Kiev, until October 1920 when the War effectively came to an end. One player commands the Polish and Ukrainian armies; the other commands the Russians (and their Lithuanian allies if Lithuania joins the conflict). Generally, each counter denotes a cavalry or infantry division or an artillery train; but, some smaller brigades and regiments are also represented.

This was a war of manoeuvre fought over huge distances with relatively small armies. As a consequence, even though both sides were well equipped for defence - possessing artillery, barbed wire and machine guns - a combination of vast open spaces and rudimentary reconnaissance meant that, unlike on the crowded battlefields of WW1, defensive positions could often be outflanked and overrun before reinforcements arrived.

The game mechanics are designed to reflect this fog of war. Players only have a certain number of resource points each turn to supply and to move units. As supply lines extend so, just as happened historically, they become increasingly vulnerable, and strategic options reduce. Players take it in turns to allocate Activation Markers to units that they wish to move; but, their orders may not be received or obeyed. The direction that a unit is facing is integral to the combat system, recognising the importance of flanking manoeuvres.

The war was a fascinating mix of ancient and modern. With cavalry operating alongside aircraft, armoured trains and tanks, and carrier pigeons alongside field radios. It also featured some of the characters who were to become icons of the twentieth-century: Churchill, de Gaulle, Lenin, Pilsudski, Stalin and Trotsky. This rich tapestry of equipment, characters and events is captured in Cards to reflect the random events and extraneous factors which the Gods chose to cast down upon those caught up in the tumultuous events which unfolded in Eastern Europe during the fateful year of 1920.

Box contents:
• 16-page Rulebook,
• Set Up Card,
• Two Six-sided Dice (2D6): One Red, One White,
• mounted 48 x 68 cm map showing territories between Warsaw and Smolensk,
• 216 unit counters and game markers, and
• 40 laminated Random Event Cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Turn Order: Random

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: The Lords of Vlachold
description:
In the shrouded realm of Vlachold, the monsters do not lurk in the wilderness. They rule from on high.

The people of Vlachold fear neither the Orcish warcry nor the Elvish arrow. They fear when their Lords look upon them, and smile. The vampiric Tepes Lords and Voivode Knights lead their mortal Voynik Swordsmen and Curteni Halberdiers to war, as likely to feast on their servants as they are the enemy.

The Lords of Vlachold is an army for Battleground: Fantasy Warfare, a points-based tabletop tactical wargame in which units are represented by cards. Each player builds their army, deploy their units, and assigns them orders. Once the battle begins, each player only has a limited ability to command their army. The player with the better plan can use their commands to inspire or enchant their units in combat.

Quick to set up, easy to store, Battleground is a game that can be played at your kitchen table and carried in your pocket. And yet Battleground is a deeply tactical game, where maneuver and marshaling your limited command resources are the keys to victory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Panda Game Manufacturing (PandaGM), Your Move Games

name: Star Trek: Away Missions – Q Organized Play Kit
description:
Q, an enigmatic entity from the Q Continuum, delights in spreading chaos in the lives of mere mortals, instilling valuable lessons in the process.

This Organized Play Kit has everything you need to play a four-game campaign for up to ten players. Perfect to bring your gaming group together for a big event or ongoing meetings.

The Q Organized Play Kit contains everything you need to support an event for ten players, including:

10x Q Miniatures

10x Q Character Cards

150x Cards

62x Tokens

name: The Rivals for Catan: Axel the Innovator
description:
This 2010 promo card for The Rivals for Catan was given out by Klaus Teuber at SPIEL10 in Essen (and can also be bought in the Catan Shop).

Ability of the card:

Reißen Sie ein Gebäude ab. Ersetzen Sie es durch ein anderes Gebäude und zahlen Sie soviel Gold, wie das neue Gebäude mehr kostet als das abgerissene. Baubedingung beachten!

Remove a building. Replace it with another building and pay the difference of the building costs in gold. Observe the building rules!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Panzer Grenadier: Indian Unity
description:
In September 1948, India invaded Hyderabad, the largest of the "princely states" and one of the few that had insisted on claiming independence after the withdrawal of the British from the subcontinent.

Indian Unity includes ten scenarios presenting battles from that brief, one-sided war, using the Panzer Grenadier system. The module includes 165 counters. Some of the scenarios require boards and counters from Eastern Front, Road to Berlin, Cassino '44, Desert Rats and Elsenborn Ridge.

Indian Unity is available as a print-and-play download or in a printed edition with laser-cut counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Anthelion: Conclave of Power – The Folk: Faction Pack
description:
Hailing from secluded corners of the galaxy, the Folk lived in peace until the galaxy went to war. Now they protect the sanctity of the Forest Moon with their wits and cunning.

The Folk: Faction Pack introduces the Folk faction into Anthelion.

Components:

4 Character cards (The Folk)
1 Location card (Forest Moon)



Released in the March 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk – Tracks in the Mud
description:
From the Publisher:

Tracks in the Mud is a boxed expansion for Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk. The expansion includes a new sheet of die-cut counters, including Jagdtigers, King Tigers, Jagdpanthers, T-34/85, and IS-3, to name but a few. There is also a new, 22" x 17" mounted mapboard, and several new scenarios, all packaged in an attractive box.

Better still, two of the included late-war scenarios pit the Americans against the Soviets in the interesting, what-if scenario that Patton Imagined. What if we had continued the war into Russia? These scenarios utilize American counters for Pershings, Easy-Eight Shermans, and infantry.

You get.

a full sheet of 1" counters
a 17" x 22" mounted map/gameboard
a scenario book with six new scenarios
an attractive box to store it in
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Thrash-Car
description:
Welcome to the wildest and funniest, "screw your neighbor" game for 2-4 players. It is a fun game you play with your friends, as you put them down one card and one lap at a time. Racing is the motif, but not always the main goal.

• Play as the Rednecks, Hippies, Soccer Moms or the Old Folks
• Each team has a unique flavor and sense of humor
• Use your hand of cards to help yourself and hinder your opponents – BEWARE THE TERNADER!
• 100 Action cards all with different art will ensure that you enjoy looking at, as well as playing this game
• This is a “screw your neighbor” game – play with your friends and destroy them

Game Summary
Every play gets to use a custom racing team of their choice. 16 teams to choose from, each with a unique racing team and car! You appear to be racing around a race track trying to be the first to finish the race (on one of 3 tracks), but really you are just trying to survive while you and your opponents try to wreck each other out of the game.

Each player has a hand of seven cards at the start of each players turn and when you are trying to move you are playing good cards on yourself while everyone else is playing cards to try to hurt your chances. It is a rough place to drive but oh so much fun.

When your turn is over you and the other players start trying to ruin the day for the next player’s turn.

Thrash-Car uses a combination of a hand of cards (resource management) and dice (roll for your life) to push the players around this track in the exciting race of their lives. You have to make sure you have enough cards to help yourself while still being able to mess with your opponents.

The first player to cross the finish line OR the last car running will be the victor in this game.

Key Features
• Play as a hilarious over the top character – own the persona and enjoy the ride
• Each team has a unique look and sense of humor
• You have to carefully manage your cards to ensure you can hold off the other players while still being able to wreck them out of the game
• Car art from over 10 unique artists make the game as visually appealing and unique as the game play itself
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Pax Illuminaten
description:
1776: Enlightenment era thinking has taken hold across Europe, setting the stage for the modern era, yet in Bavaria the Holy Roman Empire (H.R.E.) reigns supreme, suppressing the dissemination of revolutionary thoughts and ideas. Those wishing to undermine the H.R.E.'s authority and enact Enlightenment reforms must do so from the shadows.

University of Ingolstadt professor Adam Weishaupt, aspiring to mold Bavaria to the ideals of the Enlightenment, formed a secret society to make his vision a reality. His society was called the Order of the Illuminati.

In Pax Illuminaten, players assume the role of an Areopagus, a top ranking disciple of Adam Weishaupt's Order of the Illuminati. You are tasked with accomplishing a series of recruitment plots to extend the reach of the order and grow its web of sympathizers. Players will compete with each other to gain influence over this growing membership in a bid to accomplish Weishaupt's designs ahead of their rivals and become the highest ranked among the Areopagites.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Market, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Gallipoli: The Dardanelles Campaign, 1915
description:
"Gallipoli: The Dardanelles Campaign, 1915"

The land game is a battalion-level simulation of the landings at Cape Helles, Anzac Cove, and Suvla Bay. The naval game recreates the assault by British and French battleships on the Dardanelles forts.

It comes with:

Box
3 Maps (2 land & 1 naval)
Land Rules/Naval Rules (30 pages)
504 Counters
Charts and tables card
Allied/Turkish damage record sheet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: SHEEPLE: The Best Game in the Ewe-niverse
description:
A hilarious party game where you start as a sheep, and are trying to evolve into sheep-person.


Pick a category
Frantically Brainstorm for one minute.
Compare Answers – Items only score points if other players also put them down.


So to win, you must THINK LIKE A SHEEPLE!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Zockende Zauberer
description:
Gold doesn't mean much to wizards. Aside from being a smart-ass and always being right, they care about having magic artifacts and spellbooks — but these items aren't easy to get, so sometimes magicians just decide to meet and compete against one another in a refined bidding ritual to take items from others. Whoever first claims two spellbooks wins!

Each player starts Zockende Zauberer with three vials (life points) and three gems: two bearing a pearl and one bearing an imp. Players also receive two spells at random from a shuffled decks of magic cards.

Each round consists of four phases: lay down, call, confirm, and score. First, everyone lays a gem face down, starting with the first player and with this happening up to three times. The active player can call out how many pearls or imps they intend to reveal from among the played gems, and the next wizard can increase this call with a higher number. Once everyone passes on going higher, the player who made the call starts revealing played gems, although they can't reveal two gems from the same pile.

If the call was correct, the active player claims a spellbook; if not, they lose one of their vials. Collect two spellbooks or be the last wizard standing, and you win!

name: Space Explorers: Solo Rulebook & Tracker
description: This is a printed solo mode rulebook and punchboard tracker for the AI player in the game. It was included as a promo bonus for Kickstarter backers.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Galaxy Hunters: Stretch Goal Box
description: All stretch goals from Kickstarter (KS exclusives), including 4 news Mechas (Starfire, Maximus, Black Wasp and Lightning Angel), 4 new pilots (Maya G.A., Mina Nodtrian, Kan Utara, Vash Nightow), Corporations systems, along with new Mechas equipment upgrades and creatures to battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Bonaparte in Italy: The Castiglione Campaign, 1796
description:
In 1796, the young French Republic was no longer at bay, having knocked Prussia, the Netherlands and Tuscany out of the War of the First Coalition. However, the French were still facing their long-time and toughest enemies: England and Austria. Challenging England on the high seas was out of question, because the French fleet was no longer a match for the Royal Navy. Therefore, the French Directory ruled that the best chance for victory was a decisive land campaign to force Austria to sue for peace. Two large French armies commanded by experienced Generals Jourdan and Moreau were to advance into Germany toward Vienna. In the meantime, a small French force was to undertake a diversionary movement in Northern Italy. This operation, on a lesser theater, was entrusted to a young Corsican General named Napoleon Bonaparte.
