"Bonaparte in Italy: The Castiglione Campaign, 1796" is played on a point-to-point map representing the territory of the provinces of Mantua, Brescia and Verona and uses a simple system stressing the importance of command and supply. Game counters represent Brigades and historical Leaders that fought during the campaign. Combats take into account the role of leadership, cavalry and artillery. The players must carefully monitor the cohesion status of their troops throughout the campaign and choose the most appropriate time to use ‘Forced Marches’ and ‘Marches to the Sound of the Guns’ to win the decision. Additional chrome includes rules for the siege of Mantua, bridge destruction, garrisons, cavalry pursuits and optional rules for Leader casualties, the Fog of War and reconnaissance.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Introduction to Star Fleet Battles
description:
From the back of the book;
Introduction to Star Fleet Battles is a complete game, but is also the gateway to all the excitement which is Game: Star Fleet Battles.

User Description
The aim of this book is to introduce a new player to the complex game system of Game: Star Fleet Battles, but it can be used as a complete game in itself.

It takes the reader slowly through the rules by small scenarios and adding more rules to the game in each scenario played.

The game is played on a fold-out A1 hex map with die-cut playing starship pieces. Each scenario has its own goal for each player to win the game. The scenarios in the book start off with solo player games like piloting a starship through an asteroid belt, then later with two-player battle game scenarios.

Included with Introduction to Star Fleet Battles;

Step-by-Step Instructions.
54 Die-Cut Playing Pieces.
Game Map.


Re-implemented by Star Fleet Battles Cadet Training Manual
categories: Book, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Off-Plan
description:
In Off-Plan, we represent real estate agencies who compete to build the homes demanded by the market before our rivals and try to get the highest possible profit. To do this, get the room modules with all necessary equipment and invest in the neighborhoods.

The setup is very simple, a deck of houses and another deck of rooms. Four cards from each are deployed online. Players choose characters in a quick open draft and start the game with 3 fund tokens and 2 cards from the room deck.

A basic game turn would be to take a room, build a house or a public building and finally invest in one of the four neighborhoods.

It is important that every time we take a room (every turn) we can perform its ability. There are 7 different abilities that allow us to: draw more cards, discard houses, exchange houses, invest in the neighborhoods, steal funds previously invested in the neighborhoods, etc. This is one of the main interaction mechanics.

Another way to interact is with the constant investment in each of the 4 neighborhoods to which the houses belong. According to whether funds have been invested or corrupted in each neighborhood and according to the houses that each player has built, the value of these will increase or decrease.

The game has 12 asymmetrical characters that provide a goal to get extra points and a ability that will give us some advantage.

To speed up the game we have 4 event cards that benefit the players and 6 special cards that allow us to draw cards to fill the players' hand.

When it comes to scoring, the value of the houses built, the bonus icons we have among the cards, the funds tokens in our reserve, having fulfilled our character's goal and the funds invested in each neighborhood with respect to the houses we have built will be important.

Off-Plan has 1 standard game mode (with two variants) and 2 solitaire modes.

One of the variants includes the Vulture Backgrounds card, which is shuffled into the housing deck and causes an abrupt ending.

-description from developer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Events, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Romance of the Nine Empires: Arcane Fire
description:
This description's a bit tricky, so let's take it in stages...

Countermay: The Tapestry of Worlds, the crossroads of civilizations beyond imagining. After a thousand years of war, Countermay is dying. Battles, curses, extraterrestrial parasites, demonic influence, and other hazards have ruined much of the planet. The food is running out, and the threat of starvation looms. The only way to save Countermay is to seize undisputed control. Until then, armies march, fed with the ever-dwindling food as they churn farmland into mud with their boots.

In the game, players assume command of one of the vastly different warring factions — including steampunk aliens, displaced WWII-era American GIs, or a risen empire of the undead — to expand, glorify, or defend their empires.

The plot of the 2013 movie The Gamers: Hands of Fate revolves around the fictitious game of Romance of the Nine Empires. Within the movie itself, AEG was the publisher of the game, but as a result of Kickstarter funding for the film, it decided to create a real-life version of R9E, as an expandable card game.

Romance of the Nine Empires: Arcane Fire is the first expansion to the card game featured in The Gamers: Hands of Fate. This box contains a complete play-set of cards necessary to build two new factions, as well as brand new cards for the five existing factions of Countermay.

Wield the power of guardians, extraplanar heroes summoned by wizards, with the Magocracy of Arcanix, or strike down your foes with the dueling Tuatha! This expansion features a new card type and mechanics and opening up more from the exciting world of Countermay. The Romance of the Nine Empires: 15th Anniversary World Championship Edition is required to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Azzelij
description:
The arabic word "Azzelij" means "small polished stone" and is known as the historical origin of the world "Tile".

In Azzelij, two to four players compete to build a beautiful tile panel, trying to get more points with your own colors.

Each player have 12 tile pieces at their stock pile that are used do form circle patterns, like an artist trying to get the best part of the pannel! At first round, each player get 3 tiles from their pile and than draw one each subsequent round, maintaining 3 options to play at almost all time. In your turn, you must place one tile (considering that you cant extend the panel mor than 7x7 tiles away) and optionally rotate 90º clockwise another placed tile (only if the rotated tile is not forming a circle pattern yet). The turns goes until the 7x7 panel is created.

You score one point creating circle patterns with absolute majority of your colour and 3 points if the circle created has only your color. You also score bonus points (1 for each circle) if the scored circle is created only by your pieces.

Ar fisrt glance, Azzelij seems to be a simple tile placement, but as the game flows players faces lots of hard decisions to make: May I get a point or avoid another player to get a better position? May I close the 7 piece limit to stop opponents to grow at one edge or stay creating my pattern? May I risk to get a full-colored circle of mine or get two or more majority-only circle points?

As the game flows, the decisions ar harder to take and the panel gets its 7x7 piece formation, that increases the difficulty and fun!

name: 姫と騎士 (Princess and Knight)
description:
The stage is "Principality of Italy".

For the next big election, the aristocratic princess will perform "social", "trade" and "audience" of the political affairs to appeal her existence.
The knight who serves her princess uses her limbs to support her in the "workshop," "carriage," and "factory."
The influence of one action will increase the value of the other action.

However, the hearts of the princess and the knight are still passing each other.
When that heart passes again, the princess and the knight will be able to stand in their favor by releasing their hidden powers.
Throughout the Grand Duke, the aristocratic family recognized as the most suitable will be the next Grand Duke.

name: Hornet Leader II: Cold War
description:
Overview:

Cold War is an expansion to the Hornet Leader II game system. To use this expansion you must own Hornet Leader II. Ownership of Carrier Air Group is also highly recommended.

This expansion adds several new types of aircraft including the A-7 Corsair II and RA-5c Vigilante. Two new WWIII campaigns are included: Atlantic 1980 and Mediterranean 1980. Also included are 2 new F-14 Tomcat pilots, and 2 new A-6 Intruder pilots.

This expansion also adds more 2 Promotion levels of cards for each of the pilots from Carrier Air Group. This gives you a huge number of possible squadron pilot and aircraft selections!

Key Points:

- Cold War is a solitaire game expansion. No opponents needed!
- Play high stress campaigns against the Soviet Union and Warsaw Pact during
World War III of 1980.
- Command a mix of aircraft types.
- Each mission can be played in under 30 minutes.

Component List:

- Built-in Tutorial and Help Windows
- 81 Full Color cards
- Full Color counters

Game Formats:

Virtual Tabletop
PDF Download

Other Leader series games by Dan Verssen

Expands

Hornet Leader II
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Tales of the Crystals
description:
Tales of the Crystals is a unique imagination game for up to four players. It features an exciting audio cassette to guide you and your friends through four amazing adventures. There are five basic steps that you will do when playing an adventure. They are:
1. Listen to the audio cassette and turn it off as directed.
2. Complete the challenge the audio cassette has asked of you.
3. Complete the task on a card.
4. Write down the highlights of the adventure in the Journal.
5. Return to the audio cassette and listen to its next segment.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Fog of Love: Country Fair
description:
A Sweet Scene for Fog of Love. Created as a promotional item and given away at conventions. Thematically it revolves around what to do at a country fair.

Included in Kickstarter copies of the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Who Goes There: Barclay and Benning Character Expansion Pack
description: Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them. With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters. Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fleet Commander: Salvation
description:
Fleet Commander: Salvation

After decades of fighting, the factions at war realized that it was of the utmost importance to be able to provide support directly in the battle zone. Furthermore, 'Electronic Warfare' slowly took more importance, but the systems installed on the warships were revealed to be not effective enough, except on the battleships -- but at the cost of not choosing a destructive special weapon. At that stage, specialized ships started to appear in the battles: the Tech Ships.

Salvation is an expansion for ''Fleet Commander: Genesis'' that introduces technical support ships, new terrain tiles, scenarios, and a campaign builder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Hogan's Heroes
description: Hogan's Heroes, The Bluff Out Game. From the original CBS TV series Hogan's Heroes featuring playing pieces starring actors John Banner, Werner Klemperer and Bob Crane. Each player in this game plays Col. Hogan and tries to help a man escape. Your man must be equipped with money, a passport and a map. You use colors for passports in order to move around the camp. When you have collected a money card, a passport card and a map card for your man, you will learn where there is a sentry off-duty. Sneak your man out under that unguarded fence position and win. The game comes with 48 Color Code Cards, 4 Hogan Figures, 4 Plastic Stands, a plastic duffel bag and 18 equipment cards.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: Steam Expansion: Sicily & Malta
description: Sicily & Malta is a Steam map for 2 players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: 1825 Development Kit D1: Additional Tiles
description:
From the packaging:
This 18xx kit augments an existing game. It supersedes previous Kits K1 and K6 and contains more tiles, 36 instead of the 15 in K1 and 12 in K6.

Contents:
Yellow Tiles: 2 each of nos. 7, 58 & 115.
Green Tiles: 3 each of nos. 10 & 11.
1 each of nos. 17,18,20,21,22,30,31,82 & 83.
Russet Tiles: 2 each of no. 174.
1 each of nos. 35,36,37,38,39,40,43,44 & 47.
Russet/Green Tiles: 2 of no. 119.
Russet/Brown Tiles: 2 of no. 200.

name: The Silver Lion: The Great Battle of Tong Pass
description:
Han dynasty, August AD 211. CaoCao arrived at the front lines at Tong Pass, facing the main army of Ma Chao. His sole purpose is to eliminate the force of Xi Liang and conquer the vast area of western China. Facing a huge force at the border and short of supplies and opportunities for alliance, MaChao must overcome the biggest crisis of his life. How can you make decisions in right way? How can you find the weaknesses in Cao's incredible army? Every step you make will absolutely influence the battle's destiny. Will history be repeated? Everything is in your hands! The duel of fate is today!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tong_Pass_(211)

The Silver Lion has three campaign scenarios. They usually take 40-120 minutes.

Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 3 days.
Unit scale: Each step equals 2500 men or cavalry.

name: Table Air Combat: Ki-84 Frank
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ki-84 Hayate. Known as "Frank" to the allies, the Ki-84 design was a departure from the agile and delicate Zero. The Frank was less maneuverable, but was much faster and had pilot armour and self-sealing fuel tanks.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Table Air Combat: Fw-190A8
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Focke-Wulf Fw 190A8.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege Belaphoss Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was added to preorders of the Faerûn Under Siege Starter Set.

Card text:
When fielded, remove 1 Experience token from all Adventurer cards. When Belaphoss attacks, for each Adventurer card die in your opponent's Field Zone, remove an Experience token from an Adventurer card.
MAX: 1

Die stats (field cost/ attack / defense): 1/5/5, 1/6/6, 2/7/7
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The King's Will: Extension
description:
The four extensions The New Buildings, The Fertile Land, The Fine Arts and The Bad Times can be played individually, all combined, or in any combination together with the basic game.

The New Buildings contains four new buildings(two green, two orange ones) which improve actions permanently.

The Fertile Land consists of six fertile land terrain tiles for easier access to resources. Each peasant on these terrain tiles can harvest or exploit both resources if the action tiles harvesting or exploiting are chosen. These terrain tiles do not have building sites.

The Fine Arts add the four gemstone mines to the terrain tiles of the basic game and four new buildings to the other buildings. For these a player can get additional victory points according to the gemstones.

The Bad Times consists of nine bad times tiles for experienced players. They offer new challenges as individual actions become temporarily worse.

name: Small Star Empires: Fate of the Galaxy
description:
This mini-expansion features the following items:

Galactic Trade Station and Galactic Citadel Council cards

These will be used to trade minerals for power and vice versa! They will can be pretty handy for the next stuff that will come in the mini-expansion and that is:

Superweapons and Galactic Wonders
Each of the two expansions will contain 6x Superweapons/Wonders cards, so let's take a look!

The galaxy is now even more dangerous place, thanks to the technological advancements made in the era of Discoveries. Will the civilizations now choose the path of destruction or the path of technological and cultural enlightenment? It’s up to you to choose if your civilization will focus on building a weapon of mass destruction or a galactic wonder of peace!

In order to build a Superweapon or a Wonder you would need to first complete all of the upgrades on your Battle/Research station cards and acquire some types of Technologies as indicated in the right corner of the card. After you complete it, you gain its effect immediately! Pretty powerful stuff!

—description from the publisher
categories: Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Unstable Unicorns: Disaster Relief Unicorn Promo Card
description:
Being part of something bigger! 100% of the proceeds of this card were donated to United Way Worldwide in response to Hurricane Florence.

Magical Unicorn Card
Play text:
"When this card enters your Stable, each player must SACRIFICE all Downgrade cards. Search the deck for an Upgrade card and bring it directly into your Stable. Shuffle the deck."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: War for Chicken Island: The Cackle of Cluckthulhu
description:
Chicken Island has been immersed in war for years now. Seeking for new powers in places where no chicken was meant to go, a new threat rises: The Cult of Cluckthulhu. Silent wanderers are called to a profane celebration. Their goal: to invoke unthinkable horrors out of this world or any other! Now, the Leaders of the chicken army must become Chickenstigators to fight together this dread terror or perish in darkness.

The Cackle of Cluckthulhu is a cooperative scenario for War For Chicken Island for 1 to 4 players.

Suggested by backers, created by Draco Studios & Detestable Games.

name: Sagrada: Promo 11 – Game Store 2020 Window Pattern Card
description:
A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window in. Shuffle into the deck with the other player cards during setup and proceed as normal.

A 3 & 6 level difficulty card made available to Friendly Local Game Stores in late 2020.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Kamigami Battles: The Stars Are Right
description: Among other things, Kamigami Battles: The Stars Are Right contains six new gods and one new location for use with any Kamigami Battles standalone game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: A game about stuffing balloons as a team, without talking. But it's a card game - there are no actual balloons.
description:
A game designed for release at UKGE 2022, to celebrate the fact that Bez would be literally stuffing games into balloons.

Players co-operatively fill 10 balloons with objects. Each object card has a weight and spikiness.

Each pile must have a card from every player, but most of them have to be played face-down! Also, you can't talk.

By using facial expressions and intuition, and learning the nature of the deck, you will learn what your teammates are likely to play and play better cards.

If any 'balloon pile' has a weight or spikiness rating that's too high, the balloon has burst, and the game is over.

Try to fill 10 balloons to win the game!

-description from designer

name: City of Fury
description:
The streets of this broken city are crowded with Boss Man's thugs, corrupt cops and rogue cyborgs. It's time someone took out the trash. City of Fury is a 9 card solitaire homage to classic Beat 'em Ups like Streets of Rage and Double Dragon. Choose your vigilante then patrol the streets, itching for a fight, while scrolling ever rightwards. Can you defeat Boss Man and his criminal sidekicks?

Setup: 5 Street Cards are laid in a row, randomly but with the Boss Card on the right, to form the Screen on which your Vigilante and Enemies will fight. The other 2 Enemy Cards are placed face up on the right Street Cards as your initial Enemies, and your Vigilante is placed on the leftmost Street Card. This initial shuffling is the only random element in the game.

Your Skills Card contains the Actions you can take on your turn. Your Vigilante has 4 Skills (Punch, Kick, Shoot and Dodge), which each have 4 levels of Charge; higher Charged Skills are more powerful. On your turn you activate one of your Skills, performing the Actions of its current level, then reduce that Skill to the lowest Charge Level. Then, you pick two of your Skills and increase their Charge by 1. Actions include movement (which can involve swapping places with adjacent Enemies), melee attacks against adjacent Enemies, shooting attacks against non-adjacent enemies and healing.

It is then the Enemy turn; at any one time there are usually 2 Enemies on the Screen. Each Enemy Card has two unique Behaviour Boxes, showing the Behaviours they will take based on whether they are to the left or right of the Vigilante, so each follows a unique AI and requires different tactics to beat. Some enemies may back up and shoot, others close in and punch, others may prefer to get behind you.

At the end of the turn, once your Vigilante and any Enemies have acted, if an enemy has been killed then the Screen Scrolls Right; the dead enemy card is placed as a new Street card on the right, and the leftmost Street Card is flipped and placed to the right as a new Enemy. To win the game you must defeat the Boss Man.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Wortwerk
description: Speed is required at Wortwerk. 7 randomly drawn letters are in a row and varied categories ensure long-lasting fun: With the help of the series of letters, all players simultaneously form a word that fits the category. The trick: Letters may be omitted or added as desired. Thus, the existing series of letters "SNNBLME" quickly becomes "sunflower". The more letters are used, the more points there are. Eloquent players can combine cleverly and secure the most valuable points in front of the others. An innovative word search with brains that should not be missing at the next game night!
categories: Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Speed Matching, Spelling

name: The Grimm Forest: All Hallow's Eve Promo Card
description:
The English version of this promo card was given out during PAX Unplugged 2018.

Card text:

When Revealed: Play on a Location (Stays in play until discarded.)

End of Gather Phase: Any player who is alone in this Location searches the deck for a Monster card and puts it in their hand.

Discard All Hallow's Eve if there are 3 or more Monsters in play at the end of the Gather Phase.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Last Level, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: Seapower II
description:
Seapower II is one of the older naval miniatures simulations games and covers the period from 1885 to 1945. Fairly comprehensive, it treats ships rather abstractly and includes rules for aircraft, torpedoes, and many other variables. The booklet Seapower III, which is not a standalone game, ups the complexity quite a bit with rules for weather, coastal forts, and deck armor penetration.

Game time is variable but I recall this game not playing too slowly.

From the Publisher's Website:

SEAPOWER
"Alnavco's super-realistic game of WWI & WWII naval warfare; One of the oldest and most widely used systems, it encompasses all aspects of naval warfare incorporating the actual capabilities of warships, aircraft and weapons, both offensive and defensive. It has been designed specifically for wargaming with 1:1200 & 1:2400 models but frankly is interesting reading even if not used for the purpose for which it is intended!"
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Marianas 1944: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
Panzer Grenadier:
Marianas 1944

In June 1944, American marines and soldiers began the conquest of the Japanese-held Mariana Islands. After a bloody 24-day struggle for the island of Saipan, next the Americans invaded Guam and Tinian in late July. Guam fell after 20 days of battle; Tinian, after eight. B-29 Superfortress bombers soon arrived on the islands to begin the strategic bombardment of Japan.


Designer Jay Townsend brought you the battle for Saipan in the game Saipan 1944. Panzer Grenadier: Marianas 1944 is an expansion book for Saipan 1944, studying the battles for Guam and Tinian in 30 new scenarios. Ten of them take place on Tinian, and twenty on Guam – one from the 1941 Japanese invasion, and the other 19 from the 1944 American assault.

Everything you need to play all 30 scenarios is included with this book and the boxed game Saipan 1944 - no other games or supplements are needed to play any of the 30 scenarios.

Marianas 1944 includes two new maps by Guy Riessen – numbers 100 and 101 as Panzer Grenadier’s map collection bursts into the triple digits. These are used with the four maps from Saipan 1944 for the book’s 30 new scenarios, but are fully compatible with other Panzer Grenadier maps.

There are also 24 new laser-cut, scorchless and sootless playing pieces featuring additional unit types: Japanese truck-mounted anti-tank guns and heavy coastal artillery, Marine flame-throwing Sherman tanks and the entire Guamanian order of battle for World War II.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Hathaway Expansion Pack
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Hathaway Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 20 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Hathaway is a Constellation class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game – Street Fighter V Character Expansion
description:
Street Fighter V adds 4 characters and battle decks to Street Fighter: The Miniature Game.

Nash, Rashid, Negulli, and Laura join the fight to become the World's strongest street fighter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Thiefdom
description:
In Thiefdom players represent competing thief guilds who steal from the rich medieval town called Bacharach to declare the most skillful thieves guild. It is a strategic, interactive and thematic pickup & deliver game for 1-4 players.

Each player controls a team of three cunning thieves, each armed with their own set of equipments. But be warned, the city guards are on high alert, and it's up to all players to control their movements to avoid detection. With items like grappling hooks, climbing tools, and smoke bombs at your disposal, you'll have to use all your wits to avoid getting caught. In case of a detention, a thief loses all their loot and some victory points.

The game is played over 6 nights (rounds) and the player with the most victory points is declared the winner.

One night contains:

Planning Phase: All players simultaneously plan the order in which they want to move their three thieves and the neutral figurines they control that night (city guards, carriage, nobles). Then they reveal at the same time.
Action Phase (Night): The players carry out the actions in the predefined order from the planning phase.
Administration Phase (Day): Cleanup and preparation for the next night.


The town setup includes 8 modular and double-printed town quarters, resulting in a unique pickup & deliver puzzle in each game. There are 12 different equipments thieves can buy to gain new abilities, and 36 unique guests in the tavern to support your guild.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Eagles of the Empire: Medina de Rioseco
description:
(from Compass games website :)

The Battle of Medina de Rioseco, 14 July 1808, was fought during Napoleon’s War in Spain between two Spanish Armies under the commands of General Joaquín Blake and General Gregorio García de la Cuesta, and Marshal Jean-Baptiste Bessières in which the Spanish force was defeated after a closely fought, but determined assault by the French.

Medina de Rioseco was the sole French triumph in the initial invasion of Spain, which failed to seize the country, ultimately requiring a fresh campaign by the Grand Armée under the command of Napoleon himself to (temporarily) secure Spain.

Medina de Rioseco is the fifth game in the Eagles of the Empire series, and is a stand-alone add-in battle to Spanish Eagles (Talavera, 27th and 28th of July 1809, and Albuera, 16th of May 1811.) and is completely playable by itself. Medina de Rioseco features both a historical and alternative battle that allows players to recreate the engagement as it was fought or to bring in additional Spanish forces available but not present at the battle.

name: Extra Innings Baseball
description: A Baseball simulation board game played by rolling three six sided die. When the die were rolled the "first roll chart" is consulted. That directs the next sequence of rolls to determine what happens to the batter. Straight forward basic baseball simulation game.

name: Eindekker
description:
EINDEKKER simulates the era of the "Fokker scourge" on the western front in 1915 in the First World War.

You are in the role of a famous German fighter pilot such as Max Immelmann or Oswald Boelcke, flying a Fokker EI in France.
Play takes place over a one week period, the aim being for you to dominate the skies over the battlefield while on combat patrol, trench patrol, and trench support missions. Includes full rules, 31 counters, map, and historical commentary.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flames of War: Dogs & Devils
description:
Inside this supplement for Flames of War you will find the history of the Allied liberation of Italy from Messina to Rome.

Options to field a rifle company from the 3rd US Infantry Division, the Canadian and American First Special Service Force (the Devil's Brigade).

Options to field three different companies of the Hermann Goring Fallschirmpanzerdivision. Options to field companies from the 362nd and 715th Infantry Divisions resurrected from the ashes of Stalingrad and re-equipped with the newest and best Germany has to offer.

Painting guides and color plates are provided for the forces covered by the rules.

There is also a scenario covering the key battle of Cisterna.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Airfield Accessory Pack
description:
Quonset huts are a new type of structure introduced in Operation “Icarus.” Extremely popular in the world of Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare, quonset huts can be erected quickly and provide soldiers with a sturdy shelter against the elements. They can also be joined together to create longer structures with a variety of strategic arrangements.

Operation “Icarus” comes with four quonset hut sections, and the Airfield Accessory Pack allows you to further enhance your battlefields with another six sections. Add more cover. Develop new arrangements for your structures. Take your battles in all new directions.

name: Battle over Britain
description:
Battle over Britain is the first in a game series featuring single plane-vs-plane air combat in WW2. Play is driven from a standard deck of cards (which you supply), one die, plane ratings (Speed, Agility, Firepower, Performance, Durability), and your skill. Includes 20-page illustrated rules (standard rules, optional rules, solitaire rules, and "roleplay" options for customizing pilot flying abilities), historical scenarios, Battle of Britain (1940) campaign game, and set of 16 airplane counters, Dogfight Display, and Reference Card. Planes included are Supermarine Spitfire I, Boulton Paul Defiant, Gloster Gladiator, Hawker Hurricane I, Me-109E Emil, Me-110C, and Ju-87 Stuka. Fast, furious, and fun... Tally Ho!

Each plane is dealt a hand of cards, the number of cards dependant on the plane's speed. Each turn represents just several seconds of real time. You play a card from your hand each turn to try and establish "Advantage" over the opponent... the side with Advantage may (depending on the values of the cards played) be able to fire a burst at the enemy. You will need to consider two main things each turn: your relative altitude (which is suit dependent), and relative fire position (which is card value dependent). When you find yourself "disadvantaged" (tailed), you can try to break off.

Plane ratings make a great deal of difference... for example, faster planes have larger hands, those with superior performance are tougher to tail and tougher to shake once they are tailing you, and an agile plane can "yank the stick" more effectively in a pinch. Firing a burst means you compare the relative fire position cards, roll one die, modify the roll by the plane's firepower modifier, and check the Fire Combat Table to see if you cause any damage (and/or critical hits) to the enemy. (And watch out for those rear firing gunners.)

If you find yourself damaged or out of ammunition, you can always try and disengage. When the deck of cards is exhausted, the game is over. You will quickly be able to "read" each plane's strengths and weaknesses from their ratings. Superior planes are stronger, of course, but anything can happen, and one false move might see you suddenly dodging bullets rather than dishing them out.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Beyond Baker Street: Promo Cards
description:
Set of 3 cards given with game pre-order from publisher, and some conventions. Includes 2 new characters and a new suspect.

New Suspect card is The Napolean of Crime. He has a Lead value of 21 (!!), but ANY combination of Evidence cards may be played to him.
"You can play any combination of Evidence cards to this Lead. He is the only Lead Suspect card place during setup. You cannot Pursue a new Lead Suspect."

The new Character cards are labeled EX1 and EX2.

EX1: Dr. John Watson, physician, (0 pipes) "Move the Holmes marker twice when you take the Assist action."

EX2: Mycroft Holmes, Agent, (4 pipes) "When you Assist, do not move the Holmes marker."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Jace vs. Chandra
description:
Description from the publisher:

Which Planeswalker will prevail: Jace Beleren, the prodigy of mental magic torn between good and evil, or Chandra Nalaar, the sharp-witted pyromancer with a smoldering chip on her shoulder? Both carry a vast arsenal of devastating spells—and neither accepts defeat. Ever.

These two 60-card decks showcase some of the best control and burn cards from fifteen years of Magic history. The deck set includes two mythic rare cards, six rares, six cards with newly commissioned artwork, a strategy insert, three tokens, a learn-to-play guide, and two deck boxes for storage. Each card in these two decks is black-bordered and tournament-legal. They were designed to be played right out of the box, with no deckbuilding required. A Japanese reissue of this product featured new, manga-style art for the two Planeswalkers.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Tanks: Tiger I
description:
The German heavy Tigers were the tank the Allies most feared when they landed in Europe. With exceptional armor and mounting the impressive 8.8cm gun they were almost unstoppable, having taken a toll on Allied armor on the Eastern Front and North Africa where T-34 and Sherman tanks were incapable of stopping them.

Contents:
* 1 Unassembled Tiger I tank
* 1 Tiger I tank card
* 2 Hero cards
* 1 Crew card
* 2 Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Small Star Empires: Civilization and Tiles Pack
description:
Includes:
2 Civilization boards (Argon Marauders and Thorian Assembly)
4 Main sector tiles
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: GoblinFever
description:
GoblinFever is an easy, funny, interactive cardgame where you can set up the dungeon where your Heroes enter to sweep away the horde of green creatures...
The more Goblins you crush, the more you win!
A Minotaur, a Mage, a she-Elf,a Dwarf, a Dragonman and a mysterious creature will show their... Goblin Fever!
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Guerres Indiennes Volume I: Custer
description:
"Les Guerres Indiennes" ("The Indian Wars") is a series of solo games feigning all the conflicts which set the federal government of the United States against the Amerindian tribes throughout the XIXth century. The first volume of this series is centered on one of the characters the most known for this epic, colonel Georges Armstrong Custer.

In this game, three game boards represent the historic space of three major fights which delivers this hero of the western conquest to tribes Lakotas, Cheyenne and Arapaho: Washita (in November 27th, 1868), Honsinger Bluff (in August 4th, 1873) and Little Big Horn (in June 26th, 1876). On these maps, 1 cm represents approximately 200 meters and a game turn represent approximately half an hour of time.
The lenght of this game is 10 turns, it is the time which you have to manage the 7th of cavalry, the famous regiment of Custer, and allow him to fil his mission in spite of Indians warriors which will oppose you vehemently.

You can repel the American Indians who threaten your survival? You will try to replay history, but you can also explore new tracks by following the thread of the numerous proposed hypothetical scenarios. The task is difficult, but glorious. One thing's for sure, trust, it is a good day to win!
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flamme Rouge: Le Grand Baroud (Team Direct Énergie)
description: Promotional card offered by Gigamic. New stage card.

name: Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Crimson
description:
Description of 2008 (print-and-play) 1st Edition:

In the 1920s, United States military planners hatched a scheme for the invasion of Canada. Called War Plan Crimson, it was a subset of War Plan Red, the plan for war with England, the largest, most detailed and most amended of all the U.S. war plans. A war with Great Britain and the British Commonwealth would be a world-wide conflict, easily making the term “Second World War” appropriate.

Even without the expected aid from Japan, the powerful British navy would threaten U.S. interests in and control of the Philippines, Alaska, Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, Cuba and Puerto Rico as well as the Panama Canal. In exchange for these losses, the U.S. planned to conquer Canada. This would be a crown to Manifest Destiny and a platform to rebuild and eventually regain all that would be lost elsewhere.

Canada would be invaded even if neutral. The Canadian government would be abolished and the conquest held in perpetuity. It would be made clear to Canada she would suffer grievously for resistance. The British peoples were seen as tough adversaries capable of fighting against odds to the finish. Use of poison gas was authorized from the start of hostilities. It would be a terrible war where populations would be on the front lines.

Experience had taught the British the advantage of naval control, and geography provided an inland ocean. The Great Lakes would be a shield of the Canadian Dominion and another sword to cut and bleed the United States of America. A long period of tension during which both sides made military preparations would include building naval forces for the Great Lakes.

Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Crimson is the most unusual game ever published in our popular naval series. While we've created games based on wars that never happened, fought with ships that were never built, in each case military planners thought about these battles and the ships at least reached the planning stage.

In this case, designer Milan Becvar has created a game in which neither the ships nor the plans have a "real world" analogue. That allows for a wide-open strategic situation, in which friendly and enemy bases are so close together that fleets cannot hope to elude one another.

There are 80 "long" ship pieces, using a larger size than usual for our naval games — both to make it easier to assemble them and because they're just plain cool. This is further supplemented by 264 square pieces for smaller ships, aircraft, fleet and other markers. The American and Canadian fleets are almost exclusively composed of "lake battleships," similar to the coast defense vessels of other navies, with shallow draft and anywhere from four to seven big guns. There are also a handful of cruisers and a large number of destroyers.

The map, by Guy Riessen, covers the Great Lakes basin at the usual 32 miles per "sea" zone. All of the lakes are covered, linked by canals, both those that existed and those that could have been built. Both sides of the lakes are dotted with ports, with the American side hosting many vulnerable industrial centers and the Canadian shores within easy reach of the Dominion's vulnerable east-west lines of communication.

There are 13 scenarios, or separate game situations, included, with many more likely to join them in future Daily Content segments. The game uses the regular Great War at Sea rules, with some special rules to address this unusual situation.

U.S. Navy Plan Crimson is our first print-and-play game: The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor are the maps and rules printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game's components. The game isn't for sale; it's free to all members of our Gold Club.

name: Ancient Battles Deluxe Expansion Kit 3: Strange Ordnance
description:
Added to the stench of battle is a foul new reek, the stink of sulfur! Now small formations of light gunners armed with the early Arquebus, and heavier formations of Coronelias and Tercios can lay fire across the field of battle. But they are not alone, for early cannon such as the Culverin, clumsy as they are, have also been introduced. Now as these strange ordnance add a thick smoke to the battlefield and hasten the twilight of ancient battle tactics.

This expansion kit the the Ancient Battles Deluxe: From Guts to Gunpowder series of tactical warfare introduces early gunpowder units: Light Hand Gunners, Heavy Hand Gunners, and early Cannons plus the rules for integrating these into the game system.

Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 6 on a 9 scale
Time scale: Each Game Turn equals 45 minutes
Unit scale: Dozens to hundreds of men, beasts and equipment

Scenarios (41-56):

41. Megiddo (Thutmose III vs the King of Kadesh, 1457 BC)
42. Issus (Alexander vs Darius, 333 BC)
43. Pydna (Perseus vs Paulus, 168 BC)
44. 2nd Adrianople (Valens vs Fritigern, 378 AD)
45. Catalaunian Plains (Aetius vs Attila, 451 AD)
46. Lechfeld (Bulcsu vs Otto I, 955 AD)
47. Dorylaeum (Kilij Arslan vs Bohemond, 1097 AD)
48. Kalka River (Jebe vs Mstislav, 1223 AD)
49. Kutna Hora (Sigismund vs Jan Zizka, 1421 AD)
50. Habry (Jan Zizka vs Pipa, 1422 AD)
51. Malesov (Jan Zizka vs Borok, 1424 AD)
52. Aussig (Prokop vs Boso, 1426 AD)
53. Lipany (Prokop vs Borok, 1434 AD)
54. 2nd Kossovo (Murad II vs John Hunyadi, 1448 AD)
55. Formigny (Thomas Kyriell vs Comte de Clermont, 1450 AD)
56. Cerignola (de Cordoba vs d’Armagnac, 1503 AD)

name: Special Ops Issue #4
description:
Special Ops Issue #4 includes

ASL/ASLSK articles:
· Into the Land of the Rising Sun by Chas Argent
· Exit...Stage Right! by Daniel M. Preston

ASL scenarios:
· O7 Broken Wings (Pete Shelling)
· O8 Crucifix Hill (Pete Shelling)

ASLSK scenarios:
· S54 Operation Natzmer (Joe Gochinski)
· S55 The Fire Brigade (Joe Gochinski)

Scenarios for "It never snows":
· 5.9 The Red Devils & The Free Poles
· 5.10 All Americans
· 5.11 Screaming Eagles
· 5.12 The Guards

The magazine also contains the game What Price Glory? and articles on MMP's other game lines.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Twilight Thong
description:
A gear card that was included with the Pinup Order Knight miniature, which is not part of the game.

Twilight Thong (Waist; 0 Armor; It's fabric responds to you: stress causes intense constriction. Do not suffer brain traumas (ignore this if you have destroyed genitals)
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Tyvenes By
description:
City of Thieves (Tyvenes By) is a semi-casual game for 4 players. It incorporates aspects from both sides of the spectrum - from advanced to easy and family friendly.

You control a gang of thieves in a medieval city. Your thieves are represented with cards, reaching from 1 to 4 in experience. 4 being the best.

The city consists of 4 shops and the kings castle. The butcher, blacksmith, the market and the bank are all available targets to rob each round and hold a fixed amount of gold coins.

The goal is to steal these coins, which all four gangs compete about - or sometimes have to split. The core elements are bluff, strategy and luck, as you put down your theif-cards face down, and mix their experience with dice rolls. The dice are put on top of the cards, showing only the half truth of what you are up against.

In the beginning of each round a "day card" is drawn and read aloud. This will have an effect on the city or a specific shop. The same thing happens at the end of a round with a "night card". These two random effects often lead to fun combinations.

At the end of each round, the underground auction house opens, allowing you to spend your coin on new thieves for your gang.

Ultimately your goal is to grow your gang big enough to steal the kings crown jewels from the castle - in a similar way to how you steal from the city shops.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: AME: the Corrupted Affliction Pack
description: A special jumbo-sized crossover affliction from Champions of Hara, featuring cards for both games. Includes a side quest consisting of an Off-road event and Rumor cards, as well as her affliction card for Folkore.

name: Small Railroad Empires: Red Company
description:
Expansion for Small Railroad Empires featuring 5th player pieces, and extra components such as: new achievement card, and 4x new train (wild) cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Les Diadoques
description:
Alexander the Great is dead. His six generals fight each other to become THE Successor.

This diplomatic game inspired by Diplomacy and Machiavelli is published in Casus Belli #61 for the map and basic rules, Casus Belli #62 for advanced rules, Casus Belli #63 for optional rules and Casus Belli #64 for alternate scenarios.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Perpetual Commotion Silver & Gold Edition Cards
description:
An expansion for Perpetual Commotion which contains 2 additional decks in silver and gold colors. When added to the base game, this allows for up to 8 players. (or 10 if you also have the Black & White expansion)

Expands:

Perpetual Commotion
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Who Starts This Mess?
description:
Who Starts This Mess? is a trick taking game.

The goal of the game is to end up with the most points at the end of the game. The game lasts four rounds (hands) with seven tricks in each round. Each trick is represented by a tile (which can be positive or negative). All of the tiles are known and in the order they will come out.

A round consists of drafting your hand from all the available cards. You can also get chips that count towards end game points in the drafting process. After the draft, the hands are played out acquiring point tiles. At the end of each round, player with the most tiles/tricks gets bonus points. Also, you will be carrying over three cards into the next round.

End of the game, more points are gained by being in the top three in the number of tricks, highest total on your three remaining cards and the number of chips gained from drafting.

name: Pelegrinus
description:
6th century ... Saint-Benoît has just finished writing his rule. He describes in 73 chapters how the life of the monks should be managed. Here comes the time of the monastic orders. They will organize themselves and seek to develop their influence.

In Pelegrinus, you lead one of them, launch yourself into the spiritual conquest of Europe. Consolidate your influence by building commandies across the continent, then erect powerful abbeys to assert your power in different regions. Do not forget the intrigues of the papal courts, for the support of the sovereign pontiff will often be valuable to you. Lastly, gather under your protection various relics and maintain a firm control over the lucrative pilgrimage routes. However, you are not alone; other orders intrigue in the shadows to double you on the path of power.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Medieval, Religious, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Triassic Terror: Limited Edition Predator Tiles
description:
From Kickstarter Update #2

"These two tiles show the T-Rex and the Raptors at their most vicious, and are used for creating a more violent game where these two predators are more devastating:

1. The new Raptor Tile allows each Raptor, after it moves, to eat 2 Dinos and scatter 3 Dinos.

2. The new T-Rex Tile allows: 1) if T-Rex moves 1 area it eats 6 Dinos ; or 2) and if it moves 2 areas it eats 4 Dinos.

This makes each of the new tiles a bit stronger and perhaps more desirable to choose than before, but doesn’t imbalance the game play."
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric, Territory Building

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Orcland Raiders – Orc Blood Bowl Team
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Raiders started out as the Severed Heads, but changed their name following a relocation to Orcland after financial trouble. Under the fierce coaching of Ogre ex-torturer Cruel-Eye, the Orcland Raiders won the first Blood Bowl Open Championship, and they are now looking for their second open title.

Field the Orcland Raiders on your Blood Bowl pitch with this resin and plastic kit – in it, you’ll find a plastic Orc team (actually the Gouged Eye, but who’s counting?) and the resin components needed to upgrade them into the Orcland Raiders. These components simply replace their plastic equivalents, with the arms, heads and armoured shoulder pads giving you that authentic Orcland Raiders look with a minimum of fuss.

There are also 2 coins and 2 markers included. In all, the kit comes as 76 components – 40 plastic, 36 resin – and includes 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Orion: The Board Game – Stego Advisor Promo Card
description:
Activation

Discard 2 cards in turn, getting their effect of operation
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Harry Potter: Death Eaters Rising – Dolores Umbridge
description:
This card was handed out at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

Special ability: If Voldemort is present, add a [Damage] to the [Hogwarts] Wizard with the most [Damage] in each location.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Star Trek Fluxx: Archer Expansion
description: 16 new cards for use in any Star Trek Fluxx title. This expansion adds Captain Jonathan Archer from the television series Star Trek: Enterprise to any copy of Star Trek Fluxx.
publishers: Gale Force Nine, LLC, Looney Labs

name: VIVO
description:
Puppies dream of joining the prestigious "VIVO Puppy Choir". You are a music school teacher who raises such puppies. Today is the day of the long-awaited entrance exam. In this year's entrance exam, puppies with "energetic, loud singing voices" and "small, cute singing voices" will be evaluated.

VIVO is a trick-taking game where the follow format changes every trick! Find out which song the puppies will be tested on and send them out on stage so they can bring out their unique talents.

name: Snowdonia: The North Pole & The Great Bridge Scrapyard Promo Tile
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 21.

From the rules:

North Pole
When your surveyor moves on to this tile put a scoring marker on an available space: you will gain 28 points at the end of the game. Additionally, you may move your Surveyor to any available action space and take that action immediately. Return your surveyor to Llanberis; you may move your Surveyor up the mountain again.

Scrapyard side
Take a build action and discard your train to place a score marker on a spare space: counts as 1 track for game-end scoring OR immediately take 2 steel OR gain 8 points at game end.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement
publishers: Frosted Games, Surprised Stare Games Ltd

name: Dungeon Saga: Dwarf King's Quest – Der Zorn der Blutkrähen Promo
description:
This is a promo that was (if memory serves) handed out with a purchase of the base game at Spiel 2016 by Heidelberger Spieleverlag.

The box (which resembles a VHS case) contains:
1 exclusive scenario sheet
1 hero sheet
1 resin hero miniature (Runar)
1 item card

(German) Fluff from the publisher:

Grimmig und stoisch wie die Nordlande selbst, herrscht Runar mit eisernem Griff über seinen Stamm. Als Zeichen seines Mutes trägt Runar, der als einer der gemeinsten Häuptlinge der Varangur gilt, einen aus den Knochen eines Jabberwockys gefertigten Speer. Unter seiner Führung erlangte der Stamm der Blutkrähen den Ruf rücksichtsloser und blutrünstiger Krieger. Gnadenlos lässt Runar seine Mannen aus den Schatten angreifen, um seine Gegner hinterrücks niederzustrecken. Runar und seine Gefährten jagen einen Höhlentrollschamanen durch das verfluchte Tal des Todes. Doch nicht alle von ihnen wissen, warum …

name: Alien Squad Leader
description:
"Alien Squad Leader" is a Science-Fiction Squad-Level wargames rules-booklet with the emphasis on the abilities of ordinary troops - no on those of heroic characters

Simple game mechanics that are easy to pick up with clear victory conditions, but which reward careful play.

Includes rules for inferior infantry, regular infantry, power armored infantry, heavy weapons squads, robotic infantry, heavy droids, battle mechs, fighters, shooters, riders, beasts, crewed weapons, floaters, defense turrets, close flyers, distant flyers, light vehicles, light transports, armored vehicles, armored transports, main battle tanks, refugees, police units & psionics

Six army lists provided - Human Imperial, Human Colonial, Alien Imperial, Alien Enslaver, Mechanoid & Hive Mind, each with their own special rules and some with unique unit types.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Roman Glory
description:
From the publishers website:

Roman Glory was created specifically to fill the worldwide demand for an ASLComp Historical Module depicted Italian forces on the Eastern Front.

Created by Italian Andrea Garello the set consists of four highly replayable scenarios, special rules sheet, and historical map of Nikitovka.

Roman Glory is not a complete game. You will need to own Beyond Valor and Hollow Legions to use this product.

Roman Glory Series — This product is the first of a series of ASLComp. expansions depicting the Italian Army on the Eastern Front of World War II. Designer Andrea Garello is currently completing two new expansions, depicting actions at Novo Orlovka and Orlovo Ivanovka and providing new maps.

Expands:

Beyond Valor
Hollow Legions
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Rommel's Obsession
description:
Rommel's Obsession is a block game that covers the 1941 battle for Tobruk and the British counterattack known as "Operation Crusader". The Axis had besieged Tobruk and were holding the Halfaya Pass into Egypt. The Allies launched a wide sweeping offensive through the open desert with the goal of relieving Tobruk. This is a battle with no clearly defined front line. Historically, British and Axis formations criss-crossed each other in bewildering patterns.

Blocks in this game are mostly regiments and brigades and each turn represents two days time. Great effort has been made to duplicate the feel and decisions the commanders faced in the battle. Smart aggressiveness is rewarded. The Germans have the superior units, but the Commonwealth can more readily replace losses. Victory is determined not only by possession of territory, but by those casualties.

Why call it Rommel’s Obsession?
Tobruk became the focal point of Rommel’s attention, both during the time span of this game and the following year. As historian W.G.F. Jackson describes Rommel’s mindset before this battle,

“Contemporary evidence suggests that Rommel became more and more obsessed with the problems of attacking Tobruk and refused to accept the possibility of the British forestalling him.”

Before the battle began, Italian proclamations that the British were about to attack were dismissed as “excessive Latin nervousness.” Indeed, even after the battle began, Rommel refused to believe that it was anything more than a reconnaissance in force. He only changed his mind when he heard an announcement of the offensive on a British radio broadcast out of Cairo! It was this mindset that led to some of the unique circumstances of this battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Abande²
description:
Abande is in fact playable on very different game board topologies. The square board and snub square board are two options.

The square board is larger (7x7 spaces) and offers more spacious connections - introducing slightly more strategy into the game.

Gameplay on the snub square board is quite different: the unusual connection lines are sometimes surprising and compacted space leads to more tactical capture moves.

name: Drachenfaust: Der Illusionist
description:
A further special character for Fist of Dragonstones that allows you to make two bids, and then choose which counts after all other bids are revealed.

Published in the German card game magazine Kartefakt, issue #42.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Six: 3055 'Mechs
description:
From the back cover:

"3055 has ushered in a new breed of BattleMechs designed specifically to counter the technological advanced weapons used by the Clans. Be ready for battle with record sheets for these bold new designs.BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Six: 3055 Mechs contains filled-out record sheets for all of the new Inner Sphere BattleMechs, Clan OmniMechs, OmniFighters and second-line Clan Mechs in BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055."

User comment:

Published alongside volume 5 of the record sheet series, this record sheet pack was the last one to include a volume number; future record packs simply listed a Tech Readout number. It also includes an Errata section for BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055, as well as combat values current at the time of printing. Even with the errata, the T-IT-N10M Grand Titan still isn't a legal 'Mech, though.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Tropic Lightning – Armoured and Airborne Combat in Vietnam 1965-1971
description:
Free with Wargames Illustrated 282 (april 2011)

Tropic Lightning is a 40-page book covering Tropic Lightning: Armoured and Airborne Combat in Vietnam 1965-1971. Adding tanks, armoured cavalry and mechanised infantry for the Americans and some more heavy weapons and RPG-7 rocket launchers for the Vietnamese and two new missions.

Inside You Will Find:

Rules for using Flames Of War to refight the battles between American airmobile and armoured forces and the People’s Army of Vietnam (or the North Vietnamese Army as the Americans called it).
Field a Tank Company equipped with powerful M48 Patton tanks firing ‘beehive’ ammunition.
Mount up and move out with an Armored Cavalry Troop packed with M113 ACAV assault vehicles and M48 and M551 Sheridan tanks.
Lead a Rifle Company (Mech) in M113 armoured personnel carriers on a Search and Destroy mission.
Strike from the skies with a Rifle Company (Airmobile) mounted in UH-1D ‘Slick’ helicopters.
Ambush the Americans at the head of a Tiểu Đoàn Bộ Binh Infantry Battalion.
Inspirational colour photographs.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Phantoms of the Ice: Expansion Card Set
description:
This is a 100 card expansion for Phantoms of the Ice. It includes 25 offense and 19 defense players as well as 11 new goalies and 42 cards of playing money and 3 position card, one each for goalie, offense, and defense. There is no box and no rules.

Initially this was planned to be released as a new version of Phantoms of the Ice called Power Play and published by Fun Connection. There were new rules for trading and a player market. Although Fun Connections decided to stop producing anymore games, White Wind was able to get the cards printed with their logo on the back and sold those 100 cards as an expansion sets.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: The Chu–Han Contention
description:
The Chu–Han Contention is updated and commercial edition of Chuhan War, a historical wargame of Chu–Han Contention from 206 B.C. to 202 B.C.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chu–Han_Contention
The game includes three short scenarios and one long scenario. Each player plays the role of Xiang Yu, Liu Bang or Han Xin (only in 3-player scenario).

name: Saga: Age of the Wolf
description: SAGA: Age of the Wolf is the SAGA Dark Ages Campaign book. It contains a campaign system for two or more players in which rival Warlords lead their Warbands in a bloody struggle for land, wealth, and reputation. There are many ways to come out on top in the campaign and claim the crown. How you do it will be up to you and the motivations of your Warlord - unless, of course, your opponents have other ideas.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Xibalba: Tactics Expansion
description: Tactics is the first mini expansion for Xibalba. It adds 32 new event Cards to your regular games of Xibalba and offers a lot more interesting choices and possibilities.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Kill Team Mordelai: Deathwatch Starter Set
description:
Deathwatch kill teams are made up of veteran battle-brothers drawn from the ranks of numerous Space Marine Chapters. Each brings his own strengths and specialist skills, forging a whole greater than the sum of the kill team’s parts. Kill Team Mordelai is a perfect example of this approach.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 5 plastic miniatures, a scenery set (with exclusive rules!), and brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- A 5 Deathwatch Kill Team: supplied on brown plastic, these can be used to represent Kill Team Mordelai or your own Deathwatch Kill Team. This kit includes a vast array of weaponry – 5 boltguns, 5 power swords, 2 thunder hammers, a frag cannon, 2 storm shields, 2 shotguns, an Infernus heavy bolter, a Stalker-pattern boltgun, 2 power maces and a xenophase blade – along with 7 different heads and 18 Chapter-specific shoulder pads;
- A set of 3 Barbed Venomgorse: a scenery set made up of 3 individual plants. There are 3 trunks and 3 sets of flora, which go together to make the wild and strange-looking plants – there’s a lot of scope for variety, and no two Venomgorse need look the same;
- 11 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 4 Deathwatch Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Deathwatch Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Deathwatch kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating them into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing Kill Team Mordelai, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their deployments;
- 5 datacards for Kill Team Mordelai, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Limited Edition
description: The Limited Edition was the first core set for Magic: The Gathering.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Epic Card Game: Lost Tribe – Wild
description:
The Lost Tribe is a set of four 15 card packs, one for each alignment (Evil, Good, Sage and Wild). Combine any two packs to create a 30 card, two-color deck and you are ready to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Harry Potter: Death Eaters Rising – Madam Hooch
description:
This card was handed out at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

Special ability: If you have a [Dumbledore's Army] Wizard on your team you may move to Voldemort‘s location without discarding a die.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: 1718: Fall of the Swedish Empire
description:
1718: Death of a King is the second game in The Scandinavian Wars Trilogy from Pantero Games. The game is a strategic level analysis of the invasions in 1716 and 1718, with units being battalions and regiments, with a few squadrons of cavalry and dragoons thrown in. The game will use the same basic set of rules as the other games* in the series and also has a few separate rules to account for the time period and way of war in the early 1700's. The map depicts the border area in southern Norway and Sweden, from Trondheim to Gothenburg.

As the Swedish player your goal is to force a Norwegian surrender by capturing Christiania (modern-day Oslo) and at least two major fortresses. And keep your King alive,of course. As the Norwegian player, your goal is to force the Swedes to retreat back into Sweden defeating units, destroying supplies and, if you are lucky, kill King Charles XII.
categories: Age of Reason, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

description:
Includes:
- 1 set of PVC play mats
- Solo Mode mini-expansion
- Milkshakes mini-expansion
- VIPs mini-expansion
- Merch mini-expansion
- 3 promo cards

Promo cards
Humpy from Sunset Heights, Alex from Mt. Timber, Patrick from the Rose District.

Merch mini-expansion contains 9 unique Merch Tiles.

Milkshakes mini-expansion contains 9 Milkshake Tiles (4 vanilla, 3 chocolate, and 2 strawberry)

VIPs mini-expansion contains 9 VIP (foodie, Influencer, Tv Host) Tiles (3 identical tiles) for each of the 3 neighborhoods - Mt. Timber, Sunset Heights, Rose District.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Golem: Promo Cards
description:
This small promo expansion adds 3 new Characters cards to play with the base game.

B1: Carry out the action of 1 available Rabbi tile.

B2: Move your Golems a total of 2 steps & move your marker up
the Study track I step & activate 1 Golem (lay it down).

B3: Activate all your Golems (either standing or laying) without laying them down OR earn 5 VP.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Drafting, Income, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: At the Helm: Lazarette
description: The Lazarette expansion for At the Helm provides 6 new market cards to add to those from the Base Game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Not Another Word Game
description:
Get rid of your cards first in this fast-paced card game. Replace, add, subtract, and rearrange letters to make new words.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Le Barricate: Parma 1922
description:
Parma citizens strike and revolt against fascist violence in Summer 1922. 10.000 blackshirts come to sedate the revolt, but the city manages to resist.
In Le Barricate - Parma 1922, you will experience what life was like for a common citizen during those days of resistance against the government.
At the start of the game, players are secretly and evenly divided into 2 teams (with a couple of adjustments for games with an odd number of players and 2 player matches) and each player has to fulfill missions to gain access to barricade tokens, which will ultimately be the deciding factor for declaring a winning team.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Roles

name: Rudolph the Red-Nose Reindeer: Snowstorm Scramble Game
description:
Journey with Rudolph, Hermey, and Yukon Cornelius across the North Pole. Scamper through snowstorms to outrun Bumble the Abominable Snow Monster! Work together and help all three friends reach the end to win!


Quick-paced cooperative play brings everyone together to remember clues and push your luck!
Find the characters’ matching tokens to move them forward…but watch out for Bumble in the storm!
Play solo or on a team of up to five players!


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Motor City: Kickstarter Bonus Content
description:
A set of two expansions that were given out during the Kickstarter campaign for Motor City.

—user summary

The Certicates Expansion introduces unique new certifications that replace those on the scoresheets. Each player gets a unique set of
certifications! All normal rules for unlocking certifications still apply. The unique effects of the new certifications are explained below.

The Bobs Expansion asks the important question: What would you say you do here? It offers unique new bonuses — subject to the whims of the auditor!

When the auditor die is rolled, place it on the space that matches the rolled symbol. The two bonuses adjacent to that space are available for the following round. If a player triggers either of the available bonuses during their turn, they may place their key token on the matching space and gain it once. Each player may only gain one of the two bonuses per round. Return all key tokens to players at the end of each round.

—description from the designer

name: Ascension
description:
A cooperative survival game in three acts that uses two regular decks of cards (more if playing with more than two players). Players choose a character out of four classic RPG heroes and try to defeat a deck of enemies.

The story, set in Greek mythology, focuses on two villagers in the outskirts of Athens who find their village under attack by an army of men and monsters. When helps comes unexpectedly, they are given the chance to fight back - and they take the fight to the very Gods who are wrecking their beautiful land.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Move Through Deck, Variable Player Powers

name: POH!
description: POH! is a game about creating good stories with the cards you have. In the card you'll find Chilean slang words. There are two modes, collaborative and competitive, in both, each player has to add more details to the story that previous player narrated.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Guilds of Ravnica
description: Guilds of Ravnica is the 79th Magic expansion. It was released on October 5, 2018. Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three that is set on the same world, unofficially called the Guilds of Ravnica block.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Glutter of Ravens: Warfare in the Age of Arthur – Rules and Resources for Wargames in the Period AD400-AD700
description:
"Rules and resources for wargames in the period AD400-AD700."

The name comes from a line in the Welsh epic Y Gododdin, "He glutted black ravens on the walls of the fort, but he was no Arthur."

Daniel Mersey, the designer, is a British archaeologist who wanted a set of miniature wargame rules that specifically captured the style of warfare in Dark Ages Britain in the period between the Roman departure and the coming of the Vikings; the age that was dominated by the legendary war-leader Arthur.

The armies represented in the rules are mostly the British kingdoms that arose after the Romans left Britannia. However, there are also the external enemies of these kingdoms: the Irish, the Picts, and the Saxons. There is also an army list for Romans.

Figures are mounted in multiples on stands that represent warbands. Warband types can be Heavy Cavalry (HC), Light Cavalry (LC), Heavy Infantry (HI), and Light Infantry (LI). The warbands are further distinguished by a set of three "characteristics" that play an important role in movement and combat. These characteristics are Formation, Aggression, and Strength and are represented by a numerical value that can fluctuate during the game. Based on warband type and nationality or kingdom, there are set maximums for each of these characteristics. If the value for any one characteristic decreases to zero, the warband is lost.

Players control their armies through Command Points that are determined by a die roll. Using his Command Points, a player can move his warbands or increase their Formation and Aggression values up to the maximum allowed. (The Strength characteristic represents the number of warriors in the warband. Once a Strength point is lost, it stays lost.)

Armies are divided into two distinct categories of warband. The Comitatus represents the personal retinue of the leader, the trained warriors whose only job is to be fighters. The Contingent represents levy troops who are not primarily warriors but can be pressed into service to swell the numbers of an army. The maximum Formation and Aggression values for the Comitatus are higher than those for the Contingent.

When choosing the warbands that make up his army, a player must use all the Comitatus warbands in his army list (there are always five). However, he may choose any number of the Contingent warbands from none to all. The number of warbands in the army is a critical pre-game decision a player must make. The starting values for Formation and Aggression are assigned to the warbands from a pool of 30 Command Points that a player starts with.
