In the game, the player controls the members of the expedition to Ecuador and, using scarce Action Points, must triangulate the distance between Quito and Cuenca and perform gravity measures, with the best accuracy possible. If the player manages to triangulate a distance long enough and with good accuracy, the mission will be considered a success.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Smile Life Trash
description:
Bite into vice to the fullest in this extension where all shots are allowed. For better and especially for worse!
All shots are allowed... For better and especially for worse!

Corrosive and politically incorrect humor.

Trash extension contains 55 new cards !
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Calderilla
description:
Small coins bother in our pockets or purses ...
Here you have a game in which these inconveniences are useful. Think about your strategy to collect coins, but beware for thieves and broken pockets.

Watch your wallet well, take advantage of the bonus cards and ask help the police if necessary. Have fun with Calderilla!

In his/her turn each player can play penny cards, get coin tokens, use a thief card against another player or buy a wallet to protect your money.

The game ends when the pile cards is over or when a player gets the 5 Euro card.

Points are the penny coin cards used. If you have got bonus cards you will increase your score.


A todos nos pesan las monedillas en los bolsillos o carteras...
aquí tenéis un juego en el que estas molestias son útiles. Amasa calderilla dándole al coco, pero cuidado con los ladrones y los bolsillos rotos.Vigila bien tu cartera, aprovecha las cartas de bonus y pide
ayuda a la policía si es necesario.¡Diviértete con Calderilla!

En su turno cada jugador puede jugar cartas de céntimo, conseguir fichas de moneda, usar una carta de ladrón contra otro jugador o comprar una cartera para proteger tu dinero.

El juego termina cuando acabe el montón de cartas de robo o cuando un jugador consigue el billete de 5 euros.

Los puntos son las cartas de monedas de céntimos utilizadas, cuantas más uses mejor y si has conseguido cartas de bonus aumentarás tu puntuación.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Onyxia's Lair Raid Deck
description:
Features the black dragon Onyxia.

Raid Decks represent struggles involving large numbers of players against epic foes. Raid Decks are specially designed pre-constructed products used for a cooperative experience. They combine elements from the World of Warcraft (the team-based questing), and Dungeons & Dragons (the Raid Master). One player, the Raid Master controls all monsters and foes, while 3-5 other players control the characters participating in the raid.

A Raid Deck typically contains epic boss cards, decks for the boss characters, tokens to represent minions, custom rules for the raid, and a treasure pack, intended as a reward for players who are victorious in the raid. The treasure pack contains holofoils and sometimes contains a random insertion of a loot card. Upper Deck Entertainment also made treasure packs available from their UDE points store, although the cards in these packs are not holofoil.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Of Montreal's Songun
description:
A game that defies explanation, the ultimate goal being whatever you make it to be. Teams of 2-players take part in this party-style game by moving across a board and performing one of four actions from a specified deck of cards:

Mime Medium: help your partner guess the clues on the card by miming it to them

North Korean Trivia: guess the correct answer to a collection of erroneous and admittedly falsified questions

Illustrative Efforts: using drawing only, get your partner to guess the clues

Thespian Affronts: using any means necessary, except for saying the exact clues themselves, help your partner guess the clues on the card

Each team also has a collection of dominoes, which can be played after each card action is performed. The game being played with these dominoes should be agreed upon before the game starts (the rules recommend playing "double sixes"), and the scores should be kept track of on a piece of paper.

Whether the result of each card was successful or not, a word from the bottom of the card is written down, and at the end of the game the group tries to come up with a poem using these words.

The end of the game should be agreed upon by all players before starting, or by setting up a house rule to that effect.

name: Nature
description:
Nature is a modular game system that allows you to build and explore a unique ecosystem each time you play. Experience a dynamic ecosystem where food is scarce and predators lurk. Adapt your species with traits like Fast to evade predators, Nesting to grow your population, or Climbing to reach fruit high in the canopy. Welcome to the beauty of Nature, where every game brings new worlds to explore!

Nature is easy to get to the table. The modular system means Nature can be tailored to any group. Do you want a more aggressive environment? Add the Jurassic module to assert your dominance with a huge apex predator. Do you want a less aggressive environment? Add the Flight module where flight brings the freedom to evade predators and fly to a safe haven island to raise your brood. Are you introducing Nature to casual gamers? Don't add any modules and the game can be taught and played in less than an hour. Each module adds a layer of complexity and 15 - 30 minutes to the game time. At launch, the Nature game system will support 22 unique configurations of modules.

NorthStar will support the Nature game system for the next decade with 1 - 2 modules a year. The Climate module and the Disease module is slated for release in 2026. After the release of Climate and Disease, the Nature game system will have 71 unique configurations to explore. Each new module added to the system will generate an explonentially increasing number of combinations!

—description from the publisher

Get notified when the Kickstarter goes live:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/northstargames/nature-a...?
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Prehistoric

name: The Grimm Forest: No Permit Promo Card
description:
The English version of this promo card was given out during Gen Con 2018.

Card text:

End of Gather Phase: If you are alone at a Location, no players may build house sections during this round's Build Phase.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Last Level, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: Skirmish Wargaming
description:
Donald Featherstone is one of the cornerstones of modern miniatures gaming. His first book was published in 1962 and the last one I've seen was published in 1998, but there may be later ones, too.

This "game" is only a book - no figures, terrain, dice, etc., are provided. It contains his rules for skirmish miniatures gaming. In skirmish wargaming, each figure represents one man (or woman or animal). Consequently, they tend to represent small action warfare.

The book has a chapter of basic rules common to all the scenarios, then provides detailed scenarios (even with an entertainingly written fictional account) and special rules for the following eras:

The Vikings (850 AD)
English Archers in France (1429)
English Civil War cavalry action (1643)
Pirates in the Caribbean (1715)
The Peninsular War (1813, Napoleonic)
The French Foreign Legion in Mexico (1866)
British Colonials vs Zulus (1879)
The Old West (1888, USA)
First World War trench raid (1916)
Street fighting in Cassino (1944)

A typical battle will feature 8-12 men per side. Team play is possible.

The basic system requires a player to issue orders to his troops, such as seize a certain objective. It may take a few turns for the troops to get there, and in the meantime, the situation may have changed. It takes a full turn to issue new orders, during which the troops continue towards the old objective!

Rules are given for movement, ranged combat, melee combat, wound levels, troop quality levels, morale, etc. A record sheet is needed to keep track of these things (plus orders), but due to the small number of troops, it's not a problem. Very fun system if you have access to miniatures and terrain.

Microbadge:
categories: American West, Book, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Pirates, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Aussie-ASL '98 Pack
description:
10 Advanced Squad Leader tournament-style scenarios from the Paddington Bears.

Scenarios are:

Raiders of the Chaco - Nanawa, Paraguay - Sept 1932
Morire in Belleza - Dibra, Yugoslavia - April 1941
Panzerkriel - Luchki, Russia - July 1943
Gurkhas and Grants - Ningthoukhong, India - April 1944
First and Inches - Uttweiler, Germany - March 1945
Steamrollers - Lake Balaton, Hungary - March 1945
Evening Rush Hour - Bondeno, Italy - April 1945
Peningkibaru Push - Tarakan, Dutch East Indies - May 1945
Block at Anui - Anui, South Korea - July 1950
All Aboard! - Seoul, South Korea - Sept 1950

Contains a cut-out Railroad Overlay, PBRR1

Part number CH 9829, scenarios numbers PBP #21 - 30
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: 18EC: USA East Coast
description:
18EC is a new 18xx gamekit published by Wolfram Janich in 2005. Available in kit and ready-to-play form, in both English and German, the game is set between the east coast of the USA and the Mississippi. The game has a larger-than-usual bank and a very large map, leading to a long game, even for 18xx titles.

May be purchased directly from the designer in kit form or ready to play.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Plomo y Salitre
description:
Spanish ship-of-the-line game heavily based on Wooden Ships & Iron Men, but set as miniatures rules.

The period covers the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars at sea and the rules have a complete list of ships available for play of different nations: Spain, Great Britain, France, Portugal, the Ottoman Empire, Russia, Sweden, Holland...

Also includes turns and fire templates for cut and use with the ships.

Home Page (Spanish): http://www.plomoysalitre.com
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Setting up a Wargames Campaign
description:
"Almost all new wargamers start their careers by fighting a succession of single, unconnected battles;...but before very long he begins to feel that something is lacking, that these individual games...need some connecting link to make them more satisfying and to give an objective other than just trying to destroy the other fellow's army. In their words, the desire to fight campaigns rather than battles." ( From the authors introduction)

A practical book on setting up a miniatures campaign for a variety of eras stretching from ancient times to WW2, with chapters on map making & movement, contacts and battles, umpired games, supply and finance, creating worlds and characters, campaign newspapers, political skull drudgery, with full rules for the authors Hyborian Campaign set in the world of Robert E. Howards' Conan the Barbarian.

Soft cover publication. 76 pages, with one illustration and numerous tables.
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Nautical, Political, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout – Vehicle Annex
description:
UNSUNG WORKHORSES

MechWarriors receive all the glory; aerospace fighter pilots a close second; vehicles are considered the workhorses of any military; infantry are even given their day in the sun in the minds of the common citizen. But no battle could be waged, nor won, without the mammoth apparatus of support vehicles that feed the war machines of the Great Houses. From cargo trucks to tank airships, airborne MASH to communication satellites, armored transport rails to coastal patrol boats, hauler exoskeletons to LoaderMechs, even hover and wheeled police cruisers or civilian vehicles conscripted into the military: the support vehicle is the true backbone of any military machine. Built using the construction rules found in Combat Equipment, Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: Vehicle Annex provides a never-before-seen look at the support vehicles behind the militaries of every faction, as well as a slice of every day life in the BattleTech universe. From tracked land-trains to police cruisers, Luxury VTOLs to Fix-wing passenger planes, satellites, super-heavy naval surface ships, IndustrialMechs and more: the gamut of the BattleTech universe, fully illustrated for the first time.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: One Up!
description: A word building game for players to form words from a common pool of letter tiles. The pool begins with three blindly drawn letters. Subsequent letters are similarly drawn one at a time. At any time a player may call out a word that can be formed from the available letters. Upon making a word it is placed in the scoring area of the respective player. Additional words can be formed either by using only letters from the pool, or by poaching one or more letters from the pool of an extant word in another player's scoring area. If a player uses another player's word, that word is taken and given to the player forming the new word. When no new words can be made, each player scores the words in their area. A word's score is equal to the number of letters in the word minus one.

name: BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Three: Heavy 'Mechs
description:
From the back cover:

75 tons of devastating firepower. Nothing can stand in a BattleMech's way, except another 'Mech! This book compiles for the first time the BattleTech statistics for the variant Inner Sphere & Clan 'Mech designs. Some are rare, others unique, and each could be that extra surprise you need for victory.

BattleTech Record Sheets Volume 3: Heavy 'Mechs contains heavy 'Mech variants from the 2750, 3025, and 3050 eras of BattleMechs. Included are record sheets for over 45 'Mechs, each with full technical statistics. Included are:


BMB-12D Bombardier
CHP-1N Champion
EXT-4D Exterminator
GLT-5M Guillotine
LGB-0W Longbow
Loki A OmniMech
Mad Cat B OmniMech"


This record sheet pack is one of four that cover all of the 'Mechs detailed in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 2750, BattleTech Technical Readout: 3025 and BattleTech Technical Readout: 3050. It also includes the current Combat Values for the 'Mechs, as at the time of printing.

Although the copyright date states that this publication is copyright 1991, it was actually published in 1990. Despite stating that it includes the Longbow 'Mech record sheet, it actually doesn't the Longbow is an assault class BattleMech, and was actually included in Volume Four of the series alongside the other assault 'Mechs.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Map Set 6
description:
User Comment:

One of 6 map sets released by FASA to expand the available terrain for BattleTech, BattleForce and CityTech.

This paper map set contained the maps "City (Downtown)", "City (Residential)", "City (Skyscraper)", "City (Suburbs)", "Wide River", "Woodland", "Box Canyon" and "BattleForce 2". This Map Set was bundled up with Map Set 5 and maps from various other expansions and re-issued as one item by FanPro, as the Classic Battletech Map Compilation 2.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Recon...by Fire: Issue 4
description:
Issue 4 of Heat of Battle's ASL magazine.

The magazine has 44 pages, contains 176 vehicle counters for ASL, 14 new scenarios for ASL, a new Deluxe ASL map (named BF1), a sheet with Deluxe ASL Rubble Overlays, and an APC Player Aid, as well as various articles about ASL.

From the table of contents:

Notes from the Command Post - Editoral
German use of Soviet Tanks - Red Steel
Rules Analyses - Slopes in ASL
Designer's Notes - Onslaught to Orsha
Chow in ASL - The German Gulasch Kanone
Scenario Analysis - RBF-17 Hot Spot
Heat of Battle Errata - HOB Errata and Q&A

The following scenarios for ASL are included:
RBF39: THEY REALLY KNOW HOW TO DIE; 14 September 1939; Brochow-Solchaczew, Poland
RBF40: KING'S GAMBIT; 9 April, 1940; Copenhagen, Denmark
RBF41: VATUTIN'S RIGHT HOOK; 14 July, 1941; Sol'sty, Russia
RBF42: KEYSTONE BEFORE MOSCOW; 26 November, 1941; Istra, Russia
RBF43: BLOOD FACTORY; 24 October, 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
RBF44: STEELINGRAD; 26 October, 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
RBF45: LONE BRIDGE OVER THE VOLGA; 14 October, 1941; Kalinin, Russia
RBF46: TEMPEST AT TOMBE; 1 July, 1943; Tombe Village, New Georgia, Solomon Islands
RBF47: SPLITTING THE SEAM; 30 July, 1944; Sept-Vents, France
RBF48: THE NARROW FRONT; 13 October, 1944; Würselen, Germany
RBF49: FROM BAD TO WÜRSELEN; 15 October, 1944; Würselen, Germany
RBF50: A PERFECT MATCH; 25 December, 1944; Foy-Notre Dame, Belgium
RBF51: FINAL GLORY; 3 May, 1945; Lampertswalde, Germany
RBF52: CHOU EN-LAI'S PROMISE; 6 October, 1945; Along the Tientsin-Peiping Road, China
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: The Duke: Swashbuckler Promo Tile
description: The Duke: Swashbuckler is a tile for the abstract strategy game The Duke that was initially available only to participants of The Duke tournament at Gen Con 2013. It is available as a light and dark tile with the same front side, but the two backs are a mirror reflection of each other.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Battle of the Bulge: Crisis in Command – Volume 1
description:
John Butterfield's Battle of the Bulge is an analog version of the popular iOS wargame published by Shenandoah Studio. This printed version was made available as a Kickstarter incentive to supporters of Shenandoah's project.

Game covers the entire area of the conflict, and runs from December 16th through the 28th. Units are generally divisional in scale, with some brigade and regimental units. Map is divided into areas, regulating movement and combat. Multiple turns during each "day" are performed IGo-UGo, starting with the player having initiative for the day. A single area is activated, and the units within are given the option of moving. A player may also choose to "pass". Each "day" begins at 0600hrs, with an interesting mechanic of rolling for the amount of elapsed time for each turn, where a turn can be as short as zero minutes to as long as three hours. Each "day" ends when the time record for the day passes 1800hrs (or both players pass). Combat occurs at then end of any turn where units of opposing sides occupy the same area. Combat is done by rolling 10-sided dice for each strengthpoint of either infantry or armor in the combat, with simultaneous losses. Victory is gauged by the accumulation of points for enemy casualties, objective spaces, and Axis across the Meuse/exiting the western map edge, with daily sudden-death victory point levels.

Components consist of an 11' x 17" mounted map, 180 mounted counters/markers, a 12-page rule booklet, terrain effects chart, hours in the day and victory point charts, plastic bags for counter storage, and four ten-sided dice.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Auf geht's!
description:
This game is based on 6-Tage-Rennen by the same author. Everybody has the same hand of movement cards. Each player plays one cards and moves his pawn accordingly. If he lands on the the spot as fellow player he may move the same number again immediatly.

Instead of a bike race however, Auf Gehts! simulates a race of Biathlon. The card play is similiar to 6-Tage-Rennen, but the track features slopes and hill where slightly different rules apply. Every round there is a shooting, which is simulated by a real-time-dexterity element using a small "Marble gun".

First to cross the finish line is the winner.

name: Crisis on the Right: Plancenoit 1815
description:
Crisis on the Right: Plancenoit 1815 is a two player wargame at the division/brigade level simulating the struggle that took place near the village of Plancenoit as part of larger Battle of Waterloo. The game puts the Prussian IV Corps against Napoleons right flank and rear units.

The game is played over 12 turns in which players rally troops, place reinforcements, bombard their opponent, move troops, and conduct combat.

Victory is determined by control of key areas and number of troops activated. Napoleon wanted to save as many men as possible for his main fight against the Allied forces so the Prussian player earns victory points based on how many of Napoleon's troops are activated.

name: Mage Wars: Spiked Armor Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized Play.

Spiked Armor

Equipment

Cost 9 Mana

Mage gains the Lighting +1 trait, a Damage Barrier, and armor +2.

Armor +2
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Asterion
description:
Asterion, the Minotaur, awaits in the centre of the labyrinth. His labyrinth is strewn with treasure chests… and wings plucked from his more mythical victims. You can work together or against one another to ensure that the minotaur's horns impale your opponents' people, while your own flee or fly away with all the treasure they can carry.

Dare to enter the labyrinth, find its treasures, discover the true nature of your opponents, and escape before they can lead Asterion to you.

MATERIAL

- 68 labyrinth cards (17 for each player)
- 1 minotaur card
- At least 20 black counters
- Box

GAME PLAY

Players take turns placing a tile on the table, trying to connect their prisoners to the treasures and the outside of the labyrinth (or at least two wings) but not to Asterion.

The player that escapes with more prisoners and treasures wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Mythology, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Zombicide Survivor: Gabriel
description:
"Zombies are reflections of our fears and failures. Tame your inner zombie and you’ll achieve half the victory. The other half lies in rapid-fire weapons."

A man of action, Gabriel grew from a rank-and-file policeman to a respected anti-drug cop. Fighting zombies well before the real zombies came, he designed a very efficient intervention method to deal with drug-laced thugs in close-quarters. A zombie tide destroyed the society he was fighting for and soon made him a legend among survivors: a wise gunslinger willing to help anyone meeting him with a good cause to fight for.

This promotional Survivor is available as a prize for the map/scenario design contest sponsored by Guillotine Games, which can be found on their website. A zombie version (Zombivor) is also available.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Guillotine Games

name: Pegó el Zonda
description:
The main objective of Pegó el Zonda is to protect your home, secure every door and window, even the ceiling against the Zonda.

The game is played in turns, each player’s turn has two phases:

Roll the dice. It represents the Zonda attack.
After the Zonda attack, draw cards from the deck, to protect your house.


The first player who succeeds in stopping the wind, wins.

Description in Spanish:
Protege tu casa del Zonda, si tienes la casa mejor protegida ¡Ganaste!
¡Pero cuidado! el Zonda es un viento traicionero...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: Baumland
description:
Baumland, a.k.a. Bauland, is a communication and negotiation game in which the parties involved — industry, agriculture, construction, ecology, and politics — all try to nab the most valuable sites for themselves. The first four parties try to grab the best ground, with certain locations having different values for certain parties, while the politicians try to win together with one party (without being too obvious about it in order to avoid new elections).

Different versions of the game make play more complicated through the introduction of secret collaborations. Be as honest or as mean as you like — it's up to you...

name: Flipeek: Medieval
description:
In Flipeek: Medieval, you race other players to finish as many quests as you can. It's a combination of memory game and strategic game. The game contains three different game modes.

"Flipeek Classic" is a classic memory game in which you look for required objects to solve a quest. "Flipeek Solo" is a timed game mode in which you try to solve as many quests as you can in five minutes. "Flipeek Strategic" is a more advanced game mode of "Flipeek Classic" in which you can use tokens to reserve an object to solve a quest.

The theme is about the dragon king and the king of men warring against each other and issuing quests for players to solve.
mechanics: Action Points, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection
publishers: Aqua Terra Ventus Production, Coralis Entertainment

name: Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire – Tech Tools Promo Pack
description:
Kickstarter exclusive Promo Pack.
This promotional pack includes 3 TechTools cards + 1 instruction card.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Space Exploration

name: Young Marshal: Xi'an Incident
description:
Young Marshal is a historical political conflict game for 3 players. Players play the Chinese leaders of Kuomintang KMT, Chinese Communist Party CCP, and Northeastern Army NEA in 1935, respectively. You need to manage your lead and staff cards to win more victory points in every meeting.

There are 6 meeting round in one game and 2 phases in one round. In the “Negotiation” phase, players play leader and staff cards from their hand to get the control of military, economic, political and diplomatic issues. In the “Action” phase, players use military and economic issue to eliminate enemy units and produce friendly units and use political and diplomatic issue to change the relation table.

Units can control victory points areas and relation table can trigger important historical event. Players need to cooperate and rival with each other to get more profit in the game. The one gets more victory points win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Pub Battles: Monmouth
description:
Monmouth is a Military Strategy Board Game where 2 players fight this desperate rearguard action from the American Revolution.

This Entry Level game is a perfect, low cost way to check out the Pub Battles system. The small map and few blocks come with an affordable price tag; but you still get the highly acclaimed Pub Battles features:

Short Rules
Quick Play Time
Tense Action
Monmouth also makes a great demo game for players new to wargaming.

—description from the publisher

name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Man vs Meeple Duke Promo Cards
description:
2 Duke promo cards that were packaged together and offered during the Man vs Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Shuffle the cards into the Duke deck at the start of the game and proceed as usual.

Drakkenstrike: At the end of the game you score 1 VP for each helmet, 2 VP for each Domain, and 1 VP for every 4 resources.

Waybright the Wise: At the end of the game you score 1 VP for each hammer, 2 VP for each Domain, and 1 VP for every 4 resources.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: Daily Magic Games, Lucky Duck Games, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Football Highlights 2052: Expansion #2 – Pittsburgh & Atlanta
description:
This expansion includes 2 teams (Pittsburg & Atlanta) each consisting of 5 core star players and an additional 10 team cards for 30 cards total. They can be played straight out of the pack without an initial draft, or you can add all of the team cards into the Play Deck to start with only the 5 core Star Players and draft an additional 10 cards before you play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Distrito 6
description:
In Distrito 6, each player represents a construction company building the 6th District of Dadópolis, following the district planning, earning points during the game; fulfilling secret goals, which are revealed and scored at the end of the game; and having majority on each floor, earning points at the end of the game.

The game lasts four rounds, divided into four phases each: rolling, players roll all their free dice; allocation, players gain benefits from place their dice into spots on the board; construction, players earn point by constructing dice into the district; and cleaning, players prepare for the next round.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: 7 Wonders: Gamers Guild Promo Card
description:
At the end of the game, gain 1 victory point for every 3 Coins in your neighbors’ Treasure (limited to a maximum of 10 victory points).
This card was originally distributed by boardgame stores.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Doomsday Project: Episode 2 – The Battle for the Balkans
description:
The Doomsday Project is a subseries of the Operational Scale System featuring wars that never happened. There will be games on the Persian Gulf, the Balkans, the far north, the Far East, the strategic naval war, and of course, a game of total nuclear war. Episode Two, The Battle for the Balkans game, as you will see in all additional games in The Doomsday Project, will add another facet to the mechanics of the system. Sophisticated political rules will make their appearance. Players will have to contend with heads of state and their positives and negatives in play. Rules to retrofit these rules into the Germany game will be provided as well.

Product information

Complexity: 7 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10
Time Scale: 1 day per turn
Unit Scale: Divisional/Brigade/Regiment
Players: 1-2
Scenarios: 5 (+1 massive campaign game with The Battle for Germany)

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: 7 Wonders: Cities – Shadow Guild Promo Card
description: At the end of the game, gain 1 victory points for each Black card in your neighbors’ Cities.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: The Last Doge
description:
Explore the dangerous ruins of post-apocalyptic Venice to bring back its legendary treasure !

It is the not-so-distant future, and humanity has come close to extinction. Numerous ecological disasters and incessant wars have caused it to regress to almost prehistoric levels. Nature has reclaimed its rights, invading the former world, the remains of which are barely visible under the luxuriant vegetation. Yet, little by little, a new civilization is emerging. And it is sending explorers to the ruins of the old world to try to discover its secrets. One of these cities, which was once Venice, is the focus of much interest. For a long time, it was inaccessible, almost entirely submerged under waters teeming with predators. But a few months ago, the sea level began to drop, revealing an ancient city just waiting to be explored. Several tribes have sent their best trackers to follow rumors of a mythical treasure and numerous artifacts from the past. But the city holds many threats, including a mysterious half-man, half-machine guardian known as the Doge.

In The Last Doge, you play as the champion of one of six tribes living on the outskirts of the city, each with a good reason for wanting to explore the city and find the treasure, the nature of which changes according to their legends. This will not be easy, but you can also be satisfied with bringing back artifacts from ancient times, or simply getting in the way of the other champions...or at least escape with your life !

To win, you must be the player with the most trophies at the end of the game but also survive long enough to escape the wrath of the city's dreadful guardian.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Variable Player Powers

name: Mochileros
description:
Get ready for an unforgettable adventure throughout Chile! Discover and collect postcards of its culture, flora & fauna, cities and history. Manage your ‘chauchas’ and build your itinerary strategically, to achieve the most spectacular postcard collection of Chile’s immense natural and cultural wealth. Compete with your family and friends to be rewarded with the highest amount of ‘Copihues’ at the end of your journey. Embark in this adventure through unimaginable landscapes, delight yourself with Chile’s delicious typical meals, and tour the most majestic parks and pristine reserves. Sign-up for various tours, and expand your collection to become the most intrepid Backpacker!

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Prepárate para la aventura en un inolvidable viaje a lo largo de Chile! conoce y colecciona su cultura, flora y fauna, ciudades e historia. Gestiona tus chauchas y arma tu itinerario de manera estratégica, para lograr la más linda colección de postales de la inmensa riqueza natural y cultural Chilena. Compite junto a tu familia y amigos en busca de ser premiados con la mayor cantidad de Copihues al momento de finalizar el viaje. Embárcate en esta travesía por paisajes fuera de serie, deléitate con ricos platos típicos y recorre los mas majestuosos parques y prístinas reservas. Apúntate en diversos tours y expande tu colección para competir por ser el mas intrépido Mochilero.

—description from the publisher

name: Muzykanci z Bremy
description:
Four animals decided to take fate into their own paws and set off to Bremen to join the city orchestra. Unfortunately, on their journey, they encountered some robbers...
The clever animals thought up a good way to scare them: they stood in a high stack, on each other’s backs, and began to roar loudly.

In the game, you gather your group of animals and try to lay them long enough to overcome the robbers. You win if the length of animals tiles you collected are longer than the robbers tiles.

—description from publisher

name: Bonfire: Big Box
description:
Bonfire Big Box includes Bonfire base game and Trees & Creatures Expansion.

The bonfires are sources of light, energy and warmth created by the guardians of light in order to brighten the cities on the otherwise dark planet. The residents of the cities however, took the bonfires for granted and exploited them for their personal gain. Disappointed the guardians of light retreated and let the bonfires extinguish. The citizens could no longer live in the now dark cities and were forced to leave.

You are a group of gnomes living close to the cities and you also need and the light of the bonfires. Missing it now, you try yourself to visit the cities and learn how to ignite the bonfires once again: You must visit the guardians of light on their holy islands and ask for tasks to prove your good will. For each completed task, they will re-ignite one extinguished bonfire. Whoever manages to earn the greatest trust from the guardians and manages to brighten their city the most will win the game.

The engine for Bonfire are the three-coloured tiles you will be puzzling onto your player board. When you manage to place the same colours adjacent to one another, you will receive more action tiles of that specific kind. This will allow you to specialize in certain types of actions and pursue different strategies.
You can use the tiles to perform the following actions:

Move your ship to an island
Receive a task from an island by spending two resources
Invite a guardian of light into your city
Trigger a procession of guardians through your city and gain resources.
Add a landscape tile to your city (this is where the processions take place)
Recruit a gnome gaining a special ability or victory points
Find support by the last bonfire, gaining portals, resources or action tiles


You will play in turn order until a fixed number of tasks has been solved, after which each player has 5 more turns. During final scoring, you will receive points for your completed tasks (the bonfires) and any improvements made there (portals, landscapes or guardians).

—description from publisher
mechanics: Market, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Lunar Base: Kickstarter Limited Edition Extra Cards
description:
A Kickstarter-exclusive set of 12 extra cards for Lunar Base.


4 Stations (Braun, Kafka, Korolev, Tipu)
8 Influences (Blood Moon, Credit Reform, Free Market, Longevity, Metamorphosis, Moonstone Cops, Transparency, Welfare)
1 Descriptive card (not playable)


just for the 2078 backers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: King's Forge: Glassworks – Christmas Ornament
description:
This is a single foil promo card mailed out by Tabletop Tycoon for the holidays 2016

It is a new "recipe" for the game King's Forge.

name: Tank On Tank: East Front – Red Storm in the Valley
description:
Tank on Tank: East Front – Red Storm in the Valley is a new expansion to our Tank on Tank: East Front series. In this expansion, Tank on Tank fans can delve into catastrophic armored clashes between Germany and the Soviet Union. This expansion includes two maps and many customized scenario rules to add to your gaming experience. Within these ten scenarios, the Soviets confront the Germans in huge armor battles in valleys, depressions and over railroad tracks in order to achieve victory for the Motherland. Also included for owners of Tank on Tank: West Front is a special bonus scenario, “The Bear at the Rhine”, which has Soviet forces attempting to push the US and Germans back to the Rhine River. Enjoy hours of added gameplay with this expansion. It’s fun. It’s tactical. Get in a turret and take command!

You must own Tank on Tank: East Front to play Red Storm in the Valley.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Honour Alone: Hong Kong 1941
description: Company-Platoon level. The Imperial garrison of Hong Kong knew that they could not hold out against the advancing Japanese army. But if they could delay the Japanese at Hong Kong, then Singapore and Rangoon would have better chances. The Japanese must force a landing on Hong Kong Island and defeat the British, Indian, and Canadian troops deployed there. 300 counters, 20 x 24 map, 12 pages of rules. Ziplock edition only.

name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Bureaucratic Tome
description:
The Bureaucratic Tome gives the controlling player an additional victory point for each other card in their deck that has three or more lines of game text.

This card was offered as a promo item at the Renegade Game Studios booth at Gencon 2019 and at Spiel 2019,
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck
publishers: Dire Wolf, Lucrum Games, Penny Arcade, Renegade Game Studios, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Dubai Race
description:
From the Kickstarter Page:
"The game is an unlimited multi-player board game to build the highest building in Dubai. The winner is the player who has the tallest building at the end of game."

Players first lay out their 10 hexagonal base tiles one by one in Phase I.

In Phase II they place one of their wooden polyominoes onto each base tiles of their color.

In Phase III each player moves one of their polyominoes in a straight line onto another tile, forming a tower. These movements are only legal, if the pieces are set higher than they started their movement.

If a tower tumbles, all the towers belonging to the player are removed from the game, meaning bankruptcy for the player.

The player who own the last tower, wins the game!

name: The Shared Dream: The Crux Collection
description: The Crux Collection adds 6 unique solo scenarios, each of which will help immerse you in the lore of The Shared Dream.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling

name: Valhalla: Warriors of Asgard
description:
Warriors of Asgard Expansion

Asgard is a world of the gods, called Æsir, and Asgardians who live there and serve the gods. The majestic world is a big palace protected by a wall with Heimdall standing as a gatekeeper to the land. In Ragnarök, the nine worlds of Yggdrasil collide and people of Midgard, giants of Jotunheim, Dwarves of Svartelfheim, Elves of Alfheim, Odin's riders of War and warriors of Asgard clash in the battle.

Warriors of Asgard is a 40-card deck and an enormous, detailed miniature of Heimdall. The deck adds a brand new type of units, that possess magical powers, shared by Æsir gods with their people. The new type of warriors is supporting other warriors by making it easier to activate them. There are different types of Asgardian warriors, each wielding one kind of weapon. But each of them, when activated, affect other warriors who require the same type of weapons. Some warriors make it easier to activate others, and some just automatically activate a specific type of weapon. So you can imagine the combo possibilities with that expansion. If you build up a team that works well together, you can easily activate much more cards than usual. We've playtested that expansion and we love the way it affects the decision-making in the game!

And the other thing the expansion brings is a Heimdall miniature. There is a rule change, where the losing player gets the Heimdall after the battle. Heimdall protects a player's team for one round, and also may give him/her special powers if he decides to attack. The expansion has special cards in the deck, that affect Heimdalls movement as well as his powers. One expansion brings new, big things that add a lot to the game experience and expand the replayability even more!

--description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Wonder Woman 80th Anniversary Miniatures Game
description:
Standalone awesomeness! Play up to 8 campaign scenarios for 2 players where results matter from session to session or sit down for a head to head single match of raw power! Each of the 10 beautiful ready to play figures comes with two different ways to play for hundreds of different combinations. Excellent point of entry for the first time miniatures player! Map components are thick double sided and the box includes everything you need to play!

This miniatures game contains everything 2 people need to play HeroClix:

A meaty multi-session campaign for 2 players that pivots and turns based on the results of the last session
10 Premium Quality Pre-Painted Miniatures each with TWO ways to play for beginner or advanced play
20 Character Cards
18 Object, Terrain, and Bystander tokens
6 Double-Sided Thick Map Tiles. No folds!
2 Custom Wonder Woman six-sided dice
2 All-new Powers and Abilities Cards with Wonder Woman imagery
1 All-New Full-Color HeroClix Core Rulebook (2021 edition)
This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix! Existing players will definitely want to pick up this product since it includes tournament-worthy figures as well as an updated Rulebook and Powers and Abilities Card available for the first time ever!

Wonder Woman is the Champion of Themyscira, one of the strongest people on Earth, hero to all Amazons, and a connection between Gods and mortals. What perils will face her on the HeroClix tabletop?!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Trekking
description:
Are you ready to have the time of your life hiking, but without actually having to go out? With Trekking, you’ll be able to spend the whole day out in nature and spot different animals as you climb the best mountains. Throughout its 12 rounds, you’ll have to manage your energy carefully, resting when necessary and having a cup of coffee at the shelters.

Your GPS will keep track of your route and everything you do, so at the end of the day you can compare your routes with the other hikers. Prove to them that you are the best trekker and show off your achievements during the route.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Munchkin Gets Promoted 2
description:
Munchkin Gets Promoted 2 is a 15-card booster pack for use with the Munchkin base game or any other standalone titles in the Munchkin family. This booster contains fifteen previously released promotional cards that are now out of print, specifically:


Angry Bards
Boa Constructor
Book Wyrm
Cloak of Anonymity
Club of Fighting
Deodorant Stick
Ear Worm
Game Mechanic
Go Down a Level
Go Up a Level
Lightning Bolt
Oil Derek
Pub Knight
Rollback
Wand of Dousing

name: Fire on the Volga
description:
Fire on the Volga is a company level game of the struggle for the southern sector of the city of Stalingrad. Together with the companion game, Battle for the Factories and Streets of Stalingrad expansion set, players can recreate the epic conflict that is considered one of the turning points of the Second World War.

Fire on the Volga comes with over 800 unit counters representing every different type and formation taking part in the battle, a 21" x 36" full color map of southern and central Stalingrad in exquisite detail, three scenarios, multiple players aids, a die, and complete rules for the basic and advanced level of play.”
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Rum & Bones: Mercenaries – Zee: The Poet Tyrant
description:
From the 2016 Dice Tower Kickstarter Promo Pack B.

A transition from stage to the high seas might seem like an unusual career choice, but there's more piracy in acting than one might realize. Both jobs require a certain presence, both require a flair for the dramatic, and both require an encyclopedic knowledge of ropes and rigging (sets don't build themselves, after all). That said, acting doesn't pay the bills (like, ever).

For Zee, the chance to perform his greatest works across the Seven Seas appeared when their troupe was embarked on a voyage to the New World. Their ship came under chase by pirates, who would certainly have taken the hapless merchantman, had not Zee stood upon the taffrail and delivered a glorious ad-hoc discourse on the nobility of all free-thinking peoples in the character of Brutus from Caesar. The pirates, so moved by the amazing performance, threw money, LOTS of money, and offered Zee a job. Zee made his choice, and has never looked back!
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Skylands: Queenie 4
description: Skylands: Queenie 4 is a mini-expansion for Skylands that adds six multicolored island tiles to the game.

name: Button Men Originals
description: Button Men Originals contains fifty first-edition Button Men characters that were originally released as pin-back buttons in the 1990s, with these characters now being presented on playing cards. Included are the complete Soliders, Vampyres, Fantasy, Samurai, and BROM sets, along with a few other surprises!

name: Catacombs: Wyldlands
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

A new promo pack that can work with both Catacombs (third edition) and Catacombs & Castles, includes:

Monsters: Malvern, Wraithvern, Djinn
Heroes: Morinda, Surlafeure, Rha, Bo
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: The Grimm Forest: Enchanted Ale Promo Card
description:
The English version of this promo card was available through the Secret Cabal 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

The card text:

When Revealed: Shuffle your unused Gather Cards and randomly choose a new one. At the end of the Gather Phase, if you are alone in a location gain 1 resource of your choice. If you are in a location with another player gain 1 Friend.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That
publishers: Druid City Games, Last Level, Lucky Duck Games, Mirakulus

name: Arc of Fire: Squad to Company-Level Infantry and Armor Battles from 1900 to 2000
description:
A modern arms miniatures game that seems to have grown out of the advances made in the BGWWII rules. It includes scenarios for WWI, WWII, Angola, Vietnam, and the Boxer Rebellion. The scale is 1:1 skirmish.

Arc of Fire (AoF) is intended for games employing forces up to company level, with from one squad to three platoons on each side using 10mm-28mm miniatures, often with armor or artillery support. One of the prime design goals of AoF was to find a level of detail that was fun and easy, but still captured the flavor of skirmish gaming. If rifle magazine capacities, tanks’ power-to-weight ratios, or the quantity of high explosive in particular shells are the type of factors you really want in a game, you should probably not be looking at this book. The basic assumption of AoF is that leadership, training, organization and motivation are more important than minor technological advantages in deciding who wins. By concentrating on these rather than on ‘kit’, AoF produces a fast and exciting game that is more realistic than many games that obsess about technical detail.

Expanded by:

The Face of Battle: The Hill Battles – Khe Sanh, Vietnam: 1967
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Insecta: Desert Hive
description:
The Desert Hive Pack is a supplement to the Insecta game Mutant Kit edition. It consists of the original 2nd edition Hive deck, which when combined with the Mutant Kit is equivalent to the full 2nd edition package minus the color cover and rubber bugs. This enables play of the Hive Game, pitting a player team against 70+ desert-adapted bugs in a five-level fight for survival.

Expands:

Insecta (Mutant Kit edition)
categories: Animals, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fat Messiah Games, Sierra Madre Games

name: Go Forward Together: Complete Guide to the Fighting Men of the British Commonwealth
description: This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII system adds details for including the Fighting Men of the British Commonwealth in your games.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: World in Flames: 94/95 Annual
description:
(from ADG's website:)

The World in Flames 1994/95 Annual is a 72 page Annual including tips, hints and after action replays of World in Flames, Days of Decision II, Ships in Flames and Planes in Flames.

It also includes 2007 Mech in Flames, a 200 counter sheet expansion for World in Flames that adds engineers, mechanical and motorized corps, city based volunteers, Soviet Guards banner armies and divisions, early and late war aircraft, ship funnies, supply units and forts to spice up your next game of World in Flames.
It is playable with both WiF5 and World in Flames: the final edition and has been completely revised to be fully compatible with WiF:Final.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Hospital
description:
Hospital is a game of 2 to 4 players, which aims to become the new manager of the hospital. For it, we must know how to manage the money that our clients pay to us, equipping to the hospital of the best services as well as of the hiring of the best professionals. The player who obtains the greater number of points, will be the winner of the game.

Components
-1 board.
-48 counters (12 by player, 10 to mark the property of the dependencies, 1 for score and 1 for I+D).
-3 neutral counters (1 to mark the rounds in the clock of the time, 1 for the change with the bank and the last one for the rounds of the urgencies).
-28 cards of personages (7 by player).
-1 card of patron.
-40 counters of patients.
-23 counters of workers.
-40 coins (30 of 1 euro and 10 of 5 euro).
-1 card of initial player.
-1 dice of 6 faces.

This game is one of the finalists of the 2007 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creació de jocs.Since then, I think I've improved it.
source: game designer


Hospital es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores, que tiene como objetivo llegar a ser el nuevo gerente del hospital. Para ello, debemos saber gestionar el dinero que nos pagan nuestros clientes, dotando al hospital de los mejores servicios así como de la contratación de los mejores profesionales. El jugador que logre el mayor número de puntos, será el ganador de la partida.
-1 tablero.
-48 marcadores (12 por jugador, 10 para marcar la propiedad de las dependencias, 1 para la puntuación y 1 para I+D).
-3 marcadores neutros (1 para marcar las rondas en el reloj del tiempo, 1 para el cambio con el banco y el último para las rondas de las urgencias).
-28 cartas de personajes (7 por jugador).
-1 carta de mecenas.
-40 fichas de pacientes.
-23 fichas de trabajadores.
-40 monedas (30 de 1 euro y 10 de 5 euros).
-1 carta de jugador inicial.
-1 dado de 6 caras.
Este juego quedó finalista en 2007 en Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creació de jocs.(España) Desde entonces, creo que le he mejorado.
categories: City Building, Economic, Medical, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Role Playing, Worker Placement

name: Urbania
description:
A game for the people and their right to protest! Here you have it! The board game of rally, riot, protest and riot control, not necessarily in that order. What would you do? If all the people in a city that have something to protest about, actually did? Seven different rally groups are marching the streets and numerous heat squads are trying to maintain order while tension rises to a peak. Reporters are exposing the facts in the media sometimes in a good way, other times in a way that seems like slander to some. In Urbania, you are in control of a group of people that march to protest about their rights. During that march you will clash with heat squads, reporters, other rally groups and the ultimate choice: to lead your group to vindication, or accept the rule of the system and maintain order in your city. Order and chaos in a game of urban instability.

Contains: 24 city squares 7 player’s groups 110 cards 2 six sided dice 35 tokens 63 markers 1 victory track 1 rulebook

AWARDS.
Urbania has been awarded with the best theme and best game mechanic award in BGG's 1st Greek board game design contest.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Octopus' Garden: Diver
description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Add 1 Diver into the tile pool for each player. Before Planting newly bought tiles the Diver picks all your Garbage and Relics and then swims away. The Diver and all Garbage and Relic tiles (just bought and in your Garden) are removed from the game. Garbage and Relic tiles with a Sea Star on them are still picked up but the Sea Star tile is left on the Garden. The player then places his remaining newly bought tiles.

name: Civilization: The New World
description:
This is a standalone variant for Civilization. Its rules are based on Advanced Civilization more than the original Civilization. Included are more civilization advancements (both quantity and type), which give the players new options for advancement, as well as a slightly restructured commodity trading round, which has new resources and disasters to be traded.
Included in the complete package is a new map, different cultures, new trade cards and calamities, a new AST board for the cultures, and a few new advances.
This does not require the original game to play as everything for it comes in a new package for you to Print and Play.
Variant Designed by Martin DeOlden, User Tawnos76
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Trading

name: Empresarios: corruptus in extremis
description:
"EMPRESARIOS - corruptus in extremis" is a game of strategy and political negotiation in which each player assumes the profession/role of one of the wealthiest characters of the city. Votes, fraud, alliances, revenge, and management of funds make this game one of the most hilarius games ever. Players will have Millions of Pesos (M$) to negociate between the players and buy new buildings. The Player whom ends with more money in the personal bank account will win.

GAME-PLAY
"Empresarios - corruptus in extremis" is played in turns, which for the purposes of the game represents 1 year of government. During each turn, players follow a sequence of the game that consists of eight specific phases (see Reference Dashboard). Each phase is resolved by all the players always starting with the Mayor, followed by the player to his left (clockwise), up to complete the turn.

1) Each player must choose one of the twelve cards of profession/role. Each player must read the information and abilities of their respective profession card.
2) Each player receive the initial money and the initial cards that indicates the profession/role card. This will become part of your "pocket money".
3) At the end of each year (game time), each player may have up to six cards in the hand. In case of having more than six must immediately play or discard to reduce his hand to a maximum of six.
4) The game begins with the Democratic Election of the Mayor. All players votes their candidates (with Votes cards) and the candidate who receives the most votes is elected Mayor. The Mayor may decide how to use the funds received by the Taxes of other players Buildings.
5) The game have two different types of cards: 81 "Buildings" and 99 "Situations". The combination and the diversity of each card makes the real fun and estrategic of "Empresarios".
6) The only safe money is the money that has been deposited in a Personal Bank Account, and the only way to get to the bank is making a "Bank Deposit" with some special Situation cards.
7) The key of the game is the negotiation between the players to gain votes and cards. The Players whom ends with more money in the personal bank account will win.
The goal is to amass the greatest wealth in your Personal Bank Account.


EMPRESARIOS - corruptus in extremis® es un divertido y emocionante juego de estrategia y negociaciones para 3 a 8 jugadores. Cada uno encarna el papel de un adinerado empresario que deberá realizar diferentes construcciones de Edificios para poder reclamar las Ganancias que les brinden dichas inversiones. Además podrán realizar diferentes negocios ilegales que también aportarán Ganancias, pero que a diferencia de los negocios legales no pagarán impuestos al Alcalde de turno.
El cargo de Alcalde de la ciudad será elegido por votación entre todos los empresarios mediante una Elección Democrática del Alcalde. Así, utilizando las respectivas influencias políticas de cada uno, quién obtenga el cargo pasará a tener muchos beneficios políticos y monetarios. Puesto que es una democracia, cada dos años de mandato deberá volver a realizarse una Elección Democrática del Alcalde pero sin la posibilidad de reelección.
Además de las inversiones, la diversión del juego se centra en las diferentes Situaciones y Eventos que cada empresario podrá utilizar para frenar el avance monetario de los demás jugadores.
Así, quién finalice con la mayor cantidad de dinero en su Cuenta Bancaria Personal será el ganador.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Matzakoman
description:
This game is one of a series of games which uses a dreidel in lieu of a d4 and is themed for the Jewish holiday of Pesach or Passover. Each move taken and resource cards added to or taken from a common pool for any spin are related to the traditional Dreidel game. Movement can be modified by use of desert cards. That movement is round the six points of a star or magen David, and an action is associated with each space on the board.

Each time a player completes a cycle round the board, a plague is turned over which restricts actions in the game, and the game lasts until all ten plagues-- based on the traditional Jewish view of the plagues described in Shemot or Exodus-- have been played out. During the coarse of the game, players free slaves, but they also have to make matza with which to feed the freed slaves.

The winner is the player at the end of the gave who has the most freed slaves who also have a corresponding matza.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trading

name: Iron Curtain: Red and White – A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Shortly after the Allies jointly vanquished Nazi terror, the former partners settled into two mutually opposing camps and began a four-decade-long Cold War. At the heart of that protracted struggle lay the fate of the central and eastern European countries "liberated" by the Soviet Union. One of those unfortunate countries, Poland, had been cynically divided between the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany via the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact, as the opener for World War II. Despite the valor and sacrifice of over 200,000 Poles fighting for the Allies, their interests were betrayed at the Yalta and Potsdam conference, and as a consequence, the Soviet Union ruled Poland through a puppet Socialist government for the next 45 years.

Unlike most other Panzer Grenadier titles, Red & White explores one of the "what ifs" of history; in this case, what if the Poles had been able to return home and set up their own government in the postwar era? Looking at the turbulent history of uprisings in the territories under Soviet rule, perhaps a conflict would have emerged pitting a rearmed Poland, supported again by America and the rest of NATO, against the Red Army. We offer you some more historical background, and 40 scenarios to see if Poland can keep its sovereignty against the Soviet Union.

Red & White includes 77 mounted and die-cut Polish playing pieces. The 40 scenarios require the use of the pieces and boards from our Cassino, Elsenborn Ridge, Hammer & Sickle, Patton's Nightmare and Road to Berlin games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Gauntlet: Operation Pedestal, August 11-13, 1942
description:
Gauntlet is a two player game on the epic naval and air battles for the largest Malta relief convoy of World War II (although solitaire play is easy to do). In August the Malta garrison was on the ropes, with critical supplies nearly exhausted. Allied forces were in full retreat towards Egypt following their defeat in the Gazala Campaign. The Axis forces realized the Pedestal Convoy could very well be the battle for "all the marbles" and mobilized tremendous air, submarine and surface fleet assets to contest its passage. The Allied convoy was savaged but enough ships made it through, including the tanker Ohio whose ordeal was a true epic of wartime heroism, to enable Malta to hold out.

Can you do better?

name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Rodney the ambassador
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2014 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

The promo card reads: Gain +2 for each different nationality of your family members.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: The Task of Ezrok: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Chest of Seth has found its way into the heartland kingdoms. Fortunately, King Morem has ordered the destruction of this evil relic. Your aim is to oversee Ezrok and his companions as they transport the chest far away from civilization. This task will take you through the Swamps of the Black Dragon, the Hills of Vorkin, and deep into an icy wasteland where the chest must be destroyed in the Eternal Chasm.

This game uses a tile laying system to move Ezrok and his companions across the different regions toward their goal. It is after this point that Ezrok can arrive at the Eternal Chasm to destroy the chest and begin the second challenge- the return trip.

This compilation includes the base game, a new deck, and favored expansion components to create the ultimate solitaire tile-laying adventure. The edition includes:


Tile Cards
Character Roster Cards
Quest Cards
Cosmic Boost Deck (new)
Wandering Threats Deck
Wild Cards Deck
Power Cards Deck
Enhanced Reference Material
Rulebook and Bonus Booklet
Printed Box


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: Peanut Farm
description:
A fun, quick paced game for 3 to 4 players.

Take turns drawing and playing cards to build up (or steal!) peanut producing resources. After the deck runs out, the player with the most peanuts wins!

Takes mere minutes to learn and seconds to set up. Fun with family and friends! Simple yet with meaningful decision making.

name: Guild Ball: Brewer Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Brewers are tanky. Plain and simple, they are incredible at soaking damage up.

But their play style is more than just being hit. They excel in late game as they generally have superior numbers left at this point, but their mid-game is also strong due to their knockdowns and board control.

Not the most synergistic in terms of combo play, they do enjoy some degree of team buffing. Brewers generate the most momentum when pushing opponents in to and out of position with buffeting blows and plays.

Relatively slow up and down the field, the Brewers rely on long reach weapons and easy access to pushes and knockdowns, thereby giving them huge board presence and control.

Drinking and Guild Ball have always gone hand-in-hand. Most of the big championship matches will have street vendors selling a range of home brewed poisons to the gullible and the desperate. The Brewer's Guild has elevated the twin arts of drinking and playing far beyond the familiqar stumbling of the Sunday league drunks. Fueled by the pure amber nectar produced and aged within their secret distilleries, a Brewer's team is a maelstrom of physicality, a drunken wrecking ball staggering its way across the pitch.

Using the Brewer's Guild is a lesson in violence and survivability. They can both absorb and deal out a tremendous amount of damage, whilst all the time knocking their opponents to the floor and sticking a tactical boot in. Tapper, Hopper, and Friday are an alcoholic powerhouse that are at their happiest in the center of a brawl.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Brewer's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: Mason Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Masons’ play style is all about balance and subtle flexibility. They have strong but not outstanding offensive and defensive options available to them. With a good mix of buffs and debuffs forming the foundation of their combo play, they need each other to excel.

They are equipped to play well during all phases of the game without a definitive focus on any key area, which is why they are the most flexible of teams to play. They have the tools and the play style to adapt to every situation, as long as you can piece them together properly.

Mason rewards players who can see and build play to effect combos, and then take advantage of any situation.

Nothing great was ever constructed without strong foundations. The Mason's Guild knows what is true in industry holds true on the Guild Ball pitch and their long history of success is a testament to this philosophy. Taking to the field with the finest equipment money can buy, the Masons display their wealth and influence through the impenetrable armor plates that time and again frustrate the most powerful attacks of their opponents.

The twin sisters Honour and Harmony have become a force to be reckoned with since taking the field for the Mason's Guild. Well advised by the grizzled old veteran Mallet and firm favorites with the crowds they catch unwary teams off guard with their ability to work in perfect synchronization, interrupting the flow of any opposition.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Mason's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: The Union – Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Union play style is one of role specialism and individual play. They have an array of strong options across attack. Their defensive game isn’t as strong due to their focus on assassin or surgical removal style play. You need a game plan; set them up to deliver it and you will win. Think of these like a team of precision scalpels - just don’t try chopping down trees with them!

Their strength and flexibility comes from matching the right players to do the job you need before proceeding. Each model is simply strong at what it does, and doesn’t require assistance to do it. This is a team with little to no buffing. Want a big tanky guy taken down, send in Decimate … Want their backfield defensive midfielder to stop playing out buffs everywhere, Snakeskin will deliver … Just want someone messed up, Gutter’s the girl.

No one knows where Blackheart came from and no one knows how he accumulated so much power in such a short time period. What they do know is that The Union is a major player and here to stay. On any given day it is impossible to predict the style of play you will be up against. The Union has both the power and the skill to pound you into the ground or dance around you like leaves on the wind.

Variety is the spice of a Union coach's life. Able to call upon the services of a wide range of degenerates, thugs, assassins and ballplayers, you must weigh up the options and make the right choices. The mysterious and deadly Blackheart can often be found in the company of his psychotic, fanatically loyal first mate, Gutter, and frequently employs the deadly blades and footballing talent of the mercurial Decimate.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Union.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: Hunter Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Hunters are patient. They silently watch and wait until the perfect time to pounce. When they strike, it is with swift decisiveness and devastating results, before slipping back into the shadows.

Extraordinarily mobile and with dangerous ranged threat on both life and goal, the Hunters excel at controlling the flow of the game and piling pressure on their opponents.

The Hunters make the Guild Ball pitch a dangerous place to play. Traps and pitfalls snare unwary opponents, leaving them vulnerable and exposed to a swift knife-cut to finish them off. Lacking remorse or compassion, their opponents are only prey after all; the Hunters bring a wild new playstyle to the worlds of Guild Ball.

This box contains a full Hunters Guild Team and is all you need to start stalking your way to Guild Ball glory and fame.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: Heralds of the Winter's Moon
description: Light on their feet and menacing as the cold, this pack of hunters brings the sharp sting of winter to the sport. Their fearsome captain, Skatha, commands the pitch with slick footwork and a passing game as unrelenting as winter's howling winds. Opponents had best be wary with the ball against her pack. One misstep and their watchful protector Snow will fetch the ball and pass it to their feral striker, Ulfr. This lone huntsman lives for the rush of an ambush, targeting prey who stand between him and the goal post. To ensure their striker makes the shot, Veteran Hearne lies in wait, ready to ensnare his prey and show them the cruelty of winter. His furs now matted with frost, Hearne proves even the most ardent supporters of the Sun Father can be swayed by the Winter Queen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Magic: The Gathering – Future Sight
description:
The time rifts that are tearing Dominaria apart have reached into the future, and what comes spilling out is wholly unexpected. Phyrexian horrors flood Dominaria through a rift in time. Planeswalker allies band together to help—some even sacrificing themselves. Meanwhile, a secret evil may destroy all their valiant efforts …

The third and final set in the Time Spiral block, Future Sight features 180 cards, including 81 with a frame treatment from an alternative future timeline, and randomly inserted premium cards. Some “timeshifted” cards from this set have appeared in later expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Doom Patrol Team Pack
description:
The DC Comics Dice Masters: Doom Patrol Team Pack includes classic members of the Doom Patrol: Elastic-Girl and Robotman, and allies like Plastic Man. Team Packs each include 24 cards and 16 dice, representing eight different characters, and can be combined with any Dice Masters boxed set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cats are Scientists
description:
All throughout history, cats have theorized the idea of gravity. Now, cats from all over the world are testing the principles of gravity by knocking objects off of tables and recording the outcome. It is up to you to successfully conduct enough experiments to formulate enough evidence to prove the Law of Gravity. The cat who can successfully complete this task first will forever go down in history as the cat who discovered gravity!
The idea of the game is to collect 6 or more science points to be deemed the "Greatest Science Cat of All Time!" In order to conduct an experiment, you must knock a card off of the table using your Scientific Method. You then apply the rule on the card to the game and MUST follow it to the best of your ability. If you fail to follow a rule in play and another player calls you out on it, you must return a card back into the pile. See who can follow the most laws of science by stacking up more and more rules!

name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Rapscallion
description:
Promotional card offered in the Scrappening Reward Deck.

This card can be added to the Allies deck.

+ 3 Hits in Combat, discard after use.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Fight! Chicken
description:
There are a lot of chickens on the farm, and the same color chicks are willing to play together. If the two chicks are just a pair, they will produce a new chicken...

Fight! Chicken support 2-4 people to play at the same time, the main mechanism of the game is splicing and collecting, players stitching their own plate in the game, at the same time to collect more new chicken as much as possible.

It's a family game. It's very suitable for adults to play with their children. Children play with grandparents, and grandpa plays with grandma.

name: Three Kingdoms
description:
This is a war-game that simulates historical battles during the Three Kingdoms period in ancient China. To win the game, each player should choose different lord and try to control more territory.

Components
A1 size board x 1
Counters x 819
Game card x 65
Hint card x 4
Dice x 4
publishers: Kilovolt Design, The Later Han Games

name: III: Tres
description:
III - Tres is a mix between real time and strategy/city building games set in the wild west. Build your city, hire the best characters and attract the most settlers.
The game uses a realtime action card mechanic, so no player is sitting around an waiting, but makes decisions all the time.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Card Game, City Building, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Phase Order

name: Munchkin Zombies: Grave Mistakes
description:
This looks safe . . .

No one ever thinks to hide in the cemetery when the zombies roam the streets. With your sensible heels and a personalized gravestone, what could possibly go wrong? Add these 30 cards to your Munchkin Zombies game to find out!

—description from the publisher

A 30 card mini-expansion pack for Munchkin Zombies that adds 5 new monsters, a new mojo and new items and events.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The World Undone: 1914 – Galitzia
description:
The World Undone: 1914 Galicia covers the Galicia Campaign using The World Undone original system inspired by the late John Young’s take on the Marne by SPI.
Units are divisions and smaller, turns are 1 day each, and a simple, low complexity rules engine makes it possible to
simulate the entire campaign in less than 2-3 hours.
