Draw hands of hollow cell cards to either equip on your character or play to damage your opponent. Roll dice both in defense and attack while you dodge deadly planet wide events sent by the Hedonix watchers to speed up the match.

Take cover in builds and raid forgotten caches of weapons and armor to best your opponents in an all out free-for-all battle where only the luckiest and the most skilled will survive to claim victory!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Pitch Bowl
description:
Pitch Bowl is a small print (400) game, self-published by a French designer. Rules are in English and French.

The game use the mechanics of the finger pitch to simulate a American Football game.
Each player directs wood tokens that represent Runner or Quarterback and different rules simulate Interceptions, Passes, etc.

The goal is to score 3 touchdowns.

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Season 2 Exp #5 – Dura Lex Duc Rex
description:
This window box expansion contains 4 new figures with cards for use in Krosmaster: Arena.

Four new figures (Doo Rex, Anne Gupp, Henual, Moe Lawr)
Four Character Cards
Four "Bonus Elements" -- terrain & tokens
2 "Tacturret" tokens (for Anne Gupp)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Quests for the Brave: A Solitaire Fantasy Game
description:
Quests for the Brave is a light “dice placement” or “dice allocation” solitaire game which tasks the Player with helping six Heroes to achieve 12 treacherous and difficult Quests. This is an accessible game which is quick and easy to play but Players will still be challenged by the circumstances of each Quest, so expect a tough time out there as you try to defeat goblins, rats, snakes and other horrors and avoid traps, lava, icy water and other terrors on your way to defeating the final Dragon.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Каркассон: Наука и магия
description: Каркассон. Наука и магия is the third collection of expansions for the game "Carcassonne". It consists of seven expansions: "The Flying Machines", "The Messengers". "The Ferries", "The Goldmines ", "Mage & Witch", "The Robbers" and set "The Corn Circles". To play it you need the basic game "Carcassonne" or "Carcassonne. Wheel Of Fortune"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Memory, Tile Placement

name: Tiger Leader: Blitzkrieg! Expansion #1
description:
Blitzkrieg! is a double expansion pack with 98 cards and 14 counters to reinforce your Tiger Leader game!

The Expansion includes:


More Commander cards x60
More Enemy Battalion cards x14
More Special Condition cards x05
More Mission Event cards x11
More Objective cards x03
More Campaign cards x05
One two sided counter for each Battalion card x14
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bide
description:
Bide is a combinatorial, abstract strategy game for 2-6 players played on a hexagonal or square board which is initially empty (hex-hex base 5 is recommended). Bide was designed by Alek Erickson in May 2020.

Players can skip turns to get extra turns later:
Players take turns placing stones of their color in the hexagonal cells. At the beginning of your turn, you are given a new stone. You can either play it, or "bide" (meaning wait). If you bide, set the stone aside and your turn ends immediately. The stone remains in your hand. If you play the new stone while having at least one stone still in hand, you may "release" (meaning play every stone in your hand in succession). If a player releases, all opponents must immediately release next turn, including their stone for that turn.

Stones create shock waves:
When a stone is placed, it creates a "shock wave": all adjacent stones move one space in the direction radially outward from the placement. If there are multiple connected stones adjacent to the placed stone, positioned directly in the line of the shock wave, they all move one space. If this movement causes a stone to bump into another stone directly in the line of the shock wave, that stone also gets pushed one space (becoming adjacent along a different grid line does not count). However, stones cannot be pushed past the edges of the board, and lines that are full between the edges and placed stone do not move.

Players get points for owning the center:
When the board is full, players score the position. Each stone is worth points equal to its distance from the nearest edge (starting at zero). Groups consist of connected, adjacent stones of a single color. Groups are worth the sum of their stones. The player with the highest scoring group wins. If tied, remove the outer-most ring of pieces and re-score, repeating this process until there is a winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Connections, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, King of the Hill, Lose a Turn

name: Adventure Land
description:
Lights, Cameras, Action! 2-5 adventurous tycoons compete to build the most attractive movie park. With a jump start, you take control of a small park. Bid & choose from various attractions in different themes, employ your favourite staff members, and execute special actions to increase your control. Secret assignments contribute to the high tension in the game. When your park becomes prosperous, it attracts celebrities, which are valuable influencers to promote your park further and increase your income. But beware, other tycoons are anxiously looking at your progress and want to sabotage your plans… literally. This exciting game is one big adventure! Buckle up and go for it!!

—description from the back of the box

name: Flamecraft: Lucky Lake
description:
The dragons are all fired up to have a picnic at the lake and see their feathered friends. Expand your Flamecraft town with the Lucky Lake promo shop in participation with Lucky Duck Games and featuring new art by Sandara Tang.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Aladino y la cueva de las maravillas
description:
ALADDIN AND THE CAVE OF WONDERS
A game by Manu Sánchez Montero
Relive the tales of the Arabian Nights together with young Aladdin. Go into the Cave of Wonders and get great treasures with the help of the Genie of the lamp, the Magic Carpet and Titi, Aladdin’s loyal monkey friend.
To be the winner of the game you need to get the most Treasure points on your board at the end of the game. In order to do so, you must explore the Cave of Wonders moving Aladdin with the help of the four-sided die.
The game contains to cave of wonder board, players boards, treasure tokens and one pyramidal dice.
—description from the publisher (English)

ALADINO
y la cueva de las maravillas
Revive la historia de las Mil y una Noches de la mano del joven Aladino. Adéntrate en la Cueva de las Maravillas y consigue un gran tesoro con la ayuda del genio de la lámpara, la alfombra mágica y tu fiel amigo mono titi.
Ganará aquel jugador que, guiando al joven Aladino, consiga recopilar más puntos de tesoro en su tablero de juego al final de la partida. Para tal fin deberá explorar “La Cueva de las Maravillas” con la ayuda del dado piramidal.
El juego contiene un tablero de la cuevas de las maravillas, tableros de jugadores, fichas de tesoro y un dado piramidale.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Apocalipsocks
description:
The washing machine has gone crazy and wants to destroy all socks! Terrified by the situation, all the socks have run away, but in the midst of the chaos everyone has lost their family and friends.

In Apocalipsocks you'll have to help the socks find their pair, the only issue is that all of them are very similar. Beat the other players finding the pairs of socks the fastest, activate their special powers and become the great hero that stopped the Apocalipsocks.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Speed Matching

name: Maracaibo: Founding Spirit Promo Card
description:
Founding Spirit is a career card that was available as a promo at Spiel 2021 in Essen.

It gives you doubloons and points based on:
Quests
Victory Point Income
Number of bought cards
publishers: Capstone Games, dlp games, Ediciones MasQueOca, Game's Up

name: Ranger: AO Victor Expansion Kit
description: An expansion for Ranger, the solitaire simulation of modern patrolling operations. Adds eighteen new missions reflecting long range patrols and including new mission types. Components include a card of supplemental tactical event paragraphs, two laminated mapsheets, extended mission card, and a play-aid card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Down in Flames: Wingmen Expansion
description:
The Down In Flames-Wingmen Expansion includes Wingmen cards for all the fighters appearing in DiF: Aces High and DiF: Guns Blazing.

Wingmen aid your Leader in attacking, and help to protect him when under attack. The Wingmen rules are simple and easy to incorporate, fitting on to one sheet of paper. These include the rules for incorporating Wingmen into Campaign games.

Component List:
160 Aircraft Cards
1 Page of Rules
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Giant City
description:
After several centuries sleeping, the giants Monta and Monty have awakened. To their surprise, the beautiful
valley that they enjoyed looking at is now a big city, which has brought foul smells, pollution, and too much noise
even for two angry giants. Their first visit to the big city is going to be rough.

The game is divided into 2 phases: The “Build the city” phase and the “Destroy the city” phase. During the “Build the city” phase, players will build a city by playing their city tiles to create the map for Monty and Monta to roam about. During the “Destroy the city” phase, the players will take turns to move the giants and will play cards to try to destroy as many city tiles as possible. But be careful, if you forget which ones are your own player tiles, you could end up destroying them and losing points!

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Subsidized Merchant
description:
A Ship Deck comes with 81 cards:


1 Ship Card
20 Adventure Cards
60 Captain's Cards


Each deck is distinct, containing its own list of cards, though some may be common to multiple decks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Ninjitsu: Promo Pack
description:
13 New cards for Ninjitsu
Released alongside Kickstarter base game

name: Berry
description:
BERRY

Blue. Red. Yellow. Make all Blinks one color on your turn or be the first to score 10 points and you win. This unique strategy game favors the clever and punishes the greedy.
Blue, Red, Yellow. This is the order the Blinks cycle.

SETUP:
Each player starts with 3 blue Blinks in their hand. To change the color of a Blink, click it once.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns placing Blinks, connecting them together into a cluster. After placing their Blink, a player clicks each adjacent Blink, advancing it to the next color.
Attaching to 2 or fewer neighbors
If there are 3 or more adjacent Blinks, the player must also click the Blink they placed.
Attaching to 3 or more neighbors
After the first 6 turns, players begin each turn not by placing a Blink from their hand, but by removing a Blink from the cluster, then placing it in a new location.
Not all Blinks can be legally removed from the cluster at the start of a turn. Blinks with neighbors on opposite sides are “locked,” as are Blinks that, if removed, would fracture the cluster into more than
2 pieces.
SCORING:
Examples of locked Blinks
At the end of each turn, the active player earns points for the presence of certain shapes in a singular color.

WIN CONDITION:
The first player to score ten or more points is the winner. However, if a player ends their turn with all 6 Blinks set to the same color, they are the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

name: Munich War: World War II in Europe 1938
description:
Munich War: World War II in Europe 1938 is a two-player game. One player commands the Axis, controlling Germany and the countries aligned with Berlin. The other is the Allied player, who controls the anti-German forces. It is an operational level simulation of a hypothetical World War II in Europe that began in the fall of 1938. The assumption is that the British and French governments did not back down at the September 1938 Munich conference when Hitler demanded the Sudetenland from Czechoslovakia and instead went to war with the Third Reich. The ensuing conflict finds the powers partially prepared for war. In Munich War, alliances are determined at the start of the game, representing the wider political-military situation. Each turns represents one week of operations. The game covers the first two months of the war, since beyond that time the onset of winter and logistical shortages would have brought an end to operations. The objective is for each alliance to seize a position from which it can then dominate Europe in the ensuing war. Each hex on the map represents 65 kilometers or 40 miles from side to opposite side. Units are at the corps and army level.

—description from the publisher

Published in World at War magazine Nr.74 (Oct-Nov 2020)

name: Nine Knights
description:
In a battle between knights, who can reach their secret goal first?

In Nine Knights, players need to reach goal tiles with the matching knight in order to win. The numbers a player puts on a knight do not only represent their goal tile, however, but also their strength in battle with enemy knights. Choose wisely whom to move, and try to figure out the numbers of your enemy knights before they know yours.

Nine Knights is the second of three games of the game series Wizstone, developed by Go grandmaster Lee Sedol.

name: Ex Libris: Artifact Promo Pack
description:
A promotional pack initially offered with pre-orders of the Ex Libris: Expanded Archives expansion, comprising 6 "bookend" artifact cards & a rules card.
Note that this promo pack is not usable without the Expanded Archive expansion.

name: Level Up Loot 2
description:
Level up your collection of Renegade titles with these promo items! They have been hand-picked to add new and unique experiences to your games — some through new game play and some through added ambience.
Contents Summary:

• Altiplano: Alpaca Rider Role Tile
• Architects of the West Kingdom: 2 Promo Cards
• Clank! In! Space!: Cruel Doctor Promo Card
• Upgraded Ex Libris: First Player Marker
• Gates of Delirium: Sacrificial Fire Mini Expansion
• Junk Orbit: Tours Mini Expansion
• Lanterns Dice: The Legendary Lakes Scorepad
• Paladins of the West Kingdom 5 Promo Cards
• The Tea Dragon Society Card Game: Jasmine First Player Marker
• Terror Below: Renegade Racer Pawn
• Time Chase: Time Travel Car Pawn
• Rules Sheet

name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Spider-man
description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Spider-Man Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Spider-Man Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Spider-Man!

—description from the publisher

Spider-Man

Spider-Man is always looking for danger. His power reflects his commitment to deal with Enemies. Use his Wild Cards to make players flip Danger Cards and move around Enemies. Sometimes you will want to take an Enemy from another player so that you can defeat it in order to set up your character power.


Included in this add-on pack:

One Uno Ultimate Spider-Man Deck
Character specific Wild Cards
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Renegade Legion: Interceptor – The Golden Medusas
description:
The Golden Medusas is an expansion for the Renegade Legion Interceptor game published by Fasa in 1987.

It describes some of the deadly space battles between the Witches of Defiances fighter wing against the Orca squadron of the TOG's Death Express fighter wing. Included are histories of both fighter wings, with briefing on their personalities, skils and personal backgrounds. There is also a unit history, combat readiness and 15 scenarios for you to play.

The book (80 pages) and adds colour and flavour to Renegade Legion: Interceptor.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Clash of Empires: Fire on the Iser
description:
Expansion to Clash of Empires from 1984.

Expands:

Clash of Empires
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: 5150: Infestation
description:
This is an expansion for the base game 5150.

From the publisher's website:

Infestation introduces the “tactical role-playing game” side of 5150. Players can use Infestation to “flesh out” their characters, giving them an almost life-like feel. Infestation blends the traditional RPG with fast and easy to follow combat on a personal level. Combining these two aspects allows players to enjoy the cinematic aspect of role-playing while keeping the excitement of a miniatures wargame.

Infestation covers...


Fast movement
Firing while fast moving
The H'DAN CORPORATION flash-bang grenade
New grenade throwing procedures
Explosions in confined spaces
Delayed explosions
New ranged combat chart
Specific hit locations and damage
Cover handled in a different way
Variable damage to figures
New melee system
Man Down check
Computers and hacking
New equipment
Encumbrance
Psionics with new QRS
"Half Deads"
Complete scenario that introduces new movement system
New "in encounter" encounter system
New variable time clock for encounters
Covert Operations Group with new QRS
Covert operations
Security robot - with new QRS HAFER-2 Security Bot
Xeogs are refreshed to use in the scenario if needed - with QRS
New way to play solitaire or same side two new aliens with QRS
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Legends of Time and Space: Oasis
description:
From the back of the booklet:

You sign on with the Andromeda Mining Corporation's reverted worlds reclamation project--a high paying gig with few risks. When tasked to recover an errant probe, you look forward to another boondoggle until you land on Oasis, and find that it isn't what you bargained for.

Oasis is a Ready/Play role-playing adventure for solitaire or group play. It is suitable for one to four players, age 12 and up. This complete game includes the adventure book, rules, pieces, and game board. It is compatible with The Fantasy Trip (R) and GURPS.

This is the second game in the Legends of Time and Space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: AT-43 Army Book: Cog
description:
A 64 page supplement for the pre-painted miniatures game AT-43 with background and rules for using the collectivist and revolutionary Red Blok army in the game. Adds complete details for the first new army not found in the original game. Printed in full color.

It contains everything you need to know to play with or battle against the Cogs:
- Exclusive information on the history of the Cogs, their
lifestyle of their clones and the lines they create;
- The army rules of four Cog factions: A-volution, C-naps, G=nocrat and T-regulator;
- The story and rules of the Original ones;
- The rules for the Cogs’ genetic resources and armored fighting vehicles;
- Revelations concerning the evolutionary perspectives of their species!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Things
description:
This first expansion for The Thing adds cards, a 5th & 6th player, new Encounters, specific Blood Testing of other players, and other ways to expand your adventures in Antarctica circa 1982; cards like: "I ain't going with Windows. I ain't going with him," "And everybody watch whoever you're with - real close," The Thing on the Ceiling, "If you are all these Things then you just attack me right now. So some of you are still human," and " This Thing doesn't want to show itself, it wants to hide inside an imitation." Also, a new mechanism has been added whereby up to 2 Outpost players that have been assimilated, may reveal their alien nature and actively work alongside the original Thing, against the remaining humans.

The 5 and 6-player game plays slightly differently, in that the Thing player does not draw 5 or 6 cards per turn - she draws 3 cards, but has 3 new elements with which to thwart and upset the Outpost players:

Bad Blood: Each turn, during the Blair-saucer phase, one player (chosen by the El Capitan) must put a card from their hand under the Bad Blood card. Failing to do so makes unpleasant things happen....

Thousand Miles to the Coast Like the Blair-saucer, this is a play-area objective, giving the Thing another path to victory. If the players ignore for too long the lone dog's run for the coast, they may very well find that humanity is in deadly peril of being assimilated.

Somebody blew a fuse in the lab: This can be a particularly harrowing encounter for the Outpost players, if they're not ready for it. During this stage of the game, infected-player-Things may have the opportunity to infect another Outpost player, unbeknownst to the others, while the lights are out...

Due to the cost of printing the number of cards required for the base 2-4 player game, it was decided to release the additional player cards as a separate card expansion. Most of the cards can be added straight into the decks for 2-4 player games - with only a handful of cards designed specifically for 5-6 player games.

Please note: This game is strictly for adults - with profanity and horrific imagery on many of the cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Pocket Stalingrad
description:
PocketStalingrad is a print-and-play game for two players (see the files section below). By David Laufle The game is free, and might even fit in your pocket.
It's 1942 in war torn Russia, head into the besieged city of Stalingrad and fight your way to victory in 30-45 minutes. The game uses several dice. Roll the dice and set aside unit deployment, tactics, events or command points, using at least one die per roll. Add units to the 5 major city locations or to Gumrak Airfield or the Volga Crossing, add in Fortifications, Pioneers, snipers, infiltration, Luftwaffe attacks, night, Guards and more; and you have yourself a battle.
Control of 3 of the 5 major locations by turn 5 is a winner, otherwise the most City Areas wins.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling

name: Monopoly Live
description:
Hasbro describes it as:

"Go live! In this fun version of the classic MONOPOLY game, the electronic talking tower calls the plays! With motion sensing, sound effects and even surprise mini games, the tower guides the game from start to finish while you wheel, deal and call the shots! Slide the cab around the track to take a shortcut, play a quick game and then manage your cash at the ATM. With so many things to do, the “real estate market” is more thrilling than ever!

Includes electronic talking tower, gameboard, 4 game pieces, 4 bank cards, 4 card slots, cab and track, title deed cards, 32 houses, 12 hotels, 2 “green” pieces and startup guide."

Played with an IR tower containing a camera and reflective pieces and option spaces it seem to remove the need for book keeping, dice rolling, cards. And there's no money either. Kinda like a video game version just in real life.

name: One Day International
description:
Statistical cricket game with over 120 players rated in areas like batting, bowling and fielding. When this was designed, One Day International matches would last for 50 overs to be bowled by both sides. There is a certain hit and hope element when compared to full Test Matches. In 50 overs you don't have time to build an innings. So a player's One Day rating will be very different to a player's Test Match rating. This designer designed games for both codes of cricket.

Play is straightforward. A player metaphorically bowls a ball which has to be checked with dice against his rating, to see the outcome. Then a batsman rolls dice, against his batting ability, to see if he has hit it. Chances of 'Outs' could be decided by a briiliant delivery, or a mis-timed hit or a fantastic bit of fielding.

name: Koschupa
description:
Koschupa is a hand-crafted three-player-game by Dieter Zander from Historische Spiele Zander.

Koschupa is short for "KOsakenSCHUbs-PArty" (jostling-cossacks-knees-up).

It's an Finger Flicking Game. The board is a circle whose outer parts are subdivided into the three player-starting-positons. Each player starts with nine pieces in his colour at the outermost of the board.

You flick your pieces to kick the opponents' pieces off board. If you manege to kick at least one opponent's piece off board while your own piece stays on the board, you can flick again. After the muximum of three consecutive flicks, your turn is over. The next one's turn starts.
If you're "Last-Man-Standing" you start the next round with eight instead of nine pieces. Your starting position will be one circlet further to the centre of the board. If you've reached the fourth circlet and you win the next round, you've won the game.

name: Exodus: Generals
description:
Exodus: General is an expansion which requires the base game Exodus: Proxima Centauri. The main component of the Generals expansion is the pack of 14 unique Ability cards, which add a special, once-per-game, special ability to each faction, adding an unknown factor to the game.

These abilities are designed to influence the normal course of the game while still preserving the balance.

The extra Centaurian Resistance cards are also part of the Generals expansion and they should be used together with the base game resistance cards. They provide more challenging Centaurian opponents and offer more important rewards.

name: Promi-Klatsch
description:
A memory and action card game in the "Freche Mädchen" series by Kosmos.

48 autograph cards (3x16 pictures) are shuffled, and randomly laid out on the table, face down. Players take turns revealing one card at a time. The cards stay face up. As soon as a picture is revealed that is already on the table face-up, players try to be the fastest one to slap the first card of the pair (not the newly revealed one). The successful player gets to keep that card.

The game ends when there are no face-down cards left. The player with most cards wins the game.

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Cleophee Promo
description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: Achtung! Cthulhu
description:
An Achtung! Cthulhu expansion for the Heroes of Normandie base game. Note that this Heroes of Normandie expansion predates Shadows over Normandie. The idea later evolved into the Shadows over Normandie base game.

Contains:
• 3 double-sided special terrain tiles (a graveyard and two dungeons, the other sides have regular grassland and forests).
• 2 units punchboards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Hammer and Forge
description:
Hammer and Forge is an expansion for Advanced Song of Blades and Heroes or for Fightin' Fungi (the two rule sets are identical except that Fightin' Fungi has additional rules specific to fungus creatures).

Hammer and Forge provides additional rules, background and profiles for the Dwarf race and its allies and enemies.

The Hammer and Forge supplement was originally released through a Kickstarter campaign which also funded the production of a line of miniatures (primarily Dwarves), but as is standard in the Song of Blades and Heroes system, players can use whatever miniatures they prefer or have on hand.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dare Duel
description:
Dare Duel is a card game where players take turns drawing cards and selecting words or phrases to create sexy dares to act out.

Players also compete for points when creating their dares, and the first player to reach 25 points wins the game.

The winner then gets to decide how climax is reached using words and phrases found on special reward cards.

With hundreds of different words and phrases to choose from, the combinations are almost endless, making every game unique.

Sexual preference does not matter, and players can either enjoy the game with their partner or a group of friends.

name: The City of Kings: Okol Costume Promo
description:
A promotional card originally released at UK Games Expo 2018.

This promo introduces a new equipment card to the game and is part of the 'Costume Pack' of promotional cards.

Equiping this item will increase both attack and heal, along with health and worker movement making it a truly multi-role item.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Ballpark
description:
Pocket Ballpark is a 2-player baseball card game with a 1-player variant. It is aimed at the ages of 7 and up. Playing time is around 20 minutes for a 3-inning game.

Each player plays a pitch and a batter card - the total of the numbers on the cards determines the outcome of each play. Players can strategize by keeping track of what cards their opponent has played, as well as taking advantage of opportunities to steal bases.

The game comes with 4 base cards, 3 outcome table cards, 7 pitch cards, 7 batter cards, 2 score cards, and 1 count tracking card.

name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – Solo Mode Expansion
description: 'Dark Rituals: Solo Mode' is an expansion that contains all the cards and rules you need to play Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum as a single player. You will play the Witch Master, controlling the Legion of Darkness against the Heroes controlled by AI Cards. Summon powerful Creatures and Minions to do your bidding and bring Neemoss to Earth.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Djinns of the High Desert
description:
You are a Sultan in ancient Arabia who has heard whispers about neighboring Sultans who are about to invade your territory with their armies. There are even rumors of Sultans who are summoning Djinns to their court hoping to obtain their power to conquer you. You have decided to summon your own Djinns to protect yourself and defeat your foes. The Djinns exist in clans, however, and will seldom work with another clan; they will often actively sabotage the efforts of the other Djinn clans. The only exceptions are the noble Jann Clan, who ally themselves with any of the other Djinn clans. Summon your Djinns for victory, but watch out for their trickery and the cunning of your neighbors.

Object of the Game: The object of the game is to have the highest total points from the cards in your Palace (the play area in front of you) at the end of the game.

Turn Order: On a player’s turn the player may Summon (play a card) with its associated actions) or Make a Wish (discard 3 cards). At the end of the player’s turn he/she draws a card from the Draw Deck.

Game End: The game ends when a player begins their turn with 8 or more cards in their Palace. One more round is played and then players calculate their scores. The highest total score is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Hegemonia Senki
description:
Unique clans fight for supremacy of the Hegemonian continent. You are the leader of the clans. Your goal is to lead your citizens and gain supremacy over Hegemony of Hegemonia. Lead your citizen, fend off other clans, occasionally negotiate, gather resources, expand your power, and eventually make your mark in history as the King of Hegemony.

To win:
The player who builds the first four bases wins.
How to play:
At the beginning of your turn, you turn over resource cards from deck and place them on the corresponding land.
Next, you take control of the land by moving your citizens and driving out your opponent's citizen.
If your clan controls over half of the power in the land, you will receive the resources in that land.
You can also diplomatically trade your resources with other players.
You can use these resources to expand your power by increasing your citizen and your base.
However, don't let your guard down, they will expand their power as well.
The first clan to build four of their own bases by repeating their turn while taking advantage of their own clan's strengths is the winner.

The international complete edition will include 10 clans instead of 5.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

name: Lockpick
description:
Lockpick is a solo game in which the player attempts to work with randomly-drawn cards to create Rummy-style sets of three in various columns. The theme is one of breaking in to a security system via lockpicking and computer hacking. Designed for the Looney Pyramids family, Lockpick requires a Zark City deck (or other five-suited deck from with values from 1-13), 15 pyramids in five colors, and two dice: a standard D6 and a specialized color die.

In more detail, the card deck is separated into five piles by color with space left below each pile to form a column. Space for a discard pile goes off to the side. Each turn, the player begins with an empty hand and rolls the two dice. The numeral on the D6 determines how many cards the player must draw, and the color die determines what color pile the player must draw from. With these cards in hand, the player must now distribute them among the columns beneath the color piles, using a mancala-style distribution that wraps around and will cause newer cards to cascade down, partially covering previously-placed cards. Any three-card sets that are created within the columns are now removed along with the colored pyramid that sits above that column.

Once a color pile is depeleted, subsequent die rolls of that color allow the player to remove a matching color card from one of the columns and reposition it at the bottom of any column desired, thus allowing for the possibility of sets being created through the joining of two previously unconnected groups of cards within a single column, along with the rare opportunity for two sets to be formed at once. Victory is achieved when a player has successfully defeated all 15 security measures (represented by the 15 pyramids). Defeat occurs when all the cards have been depleted while there are pyramids still standing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Mancala, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Navios de Linea: Aboukir, 1798 – 2nd Vol.
description:
The Battle of the Nile, also known as the Battle of Aboukir Bay, was a major naval battle fought between the British Royal Navy and The First French Republic Navy on August 1-3, 1798, at Aboukir Bay, on the Egyptian Mediterranean coast.

This volume also contains The Battle of Algeciras Bay, the Battle of Lake Erie, and the battles of the American super frigate USS Constitution.

Box contents:

27 ship miniatures
90 removable sails (81 + 9 extras)
9 boards (297 x 210 mm)
1 rules book
2 turns and tables player aids
6 reference cards
3 counter sheets
1 sheet of stickers
6 six-sided dice
1 scenario book

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and some assembly may be required.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Huis Clos: Saison 1 – Le Manoir Winsbury
description:
In the heart of middle-class England in the 1920s, murderous passions are unleashed. The Yard sends you. Read the statements of the seven suspects and sort out the truth from the falsehood. Your goal: to identify the culprit.

Huis Clos: Season 1 - Winsbury Manor is a cooperative literary investigation game built like a detective series: 10 episodes, 23 characters, 10 victims. It's up to you to investigate!

Nearly twenty personalities will pass through the doors of the manor. The lure of money, the conquest of power and rivalries in love are all conducive to murderous passions. The local police immediately called the Yard, which sent its best detectives to help. That's you!

Players are guided by the instructions given on the cards. There are 7 suspects per investigation. For each character, the players have an identity card and a statement to read aloud and try to be the first to deduce the murderer in each "episode".
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Argent Adept – Dark Dynamics
description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the Multiverse.

HP: 23

Power: Reveal the top card of any 2 decks. Put 1 card into play and the other into the trash.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Caripelas
description:
Surprise all your friends by imitating iconic moments in the best way!

In Caripelas you will have to imitate and try to guess other imitations of the funniest and most remembered memes. We can find some like "Bad luck Brian", "Ya wey!" and others of famous people caught at the right time.

With each hit, Martin Fierro chips will be distributed, in order to determine who wins the game when it ends.

name: My Precious!
description:
A single card dextery game where only one thing matters: have the ring card!

If you don't have the ring, take it from whoever has it. If you already have it, use your reflexes to avoid other players.

As the ring bearer, you must keep the ring for several turns if you want to win the game, but it will cost you life force. If you run out of life force you will lose. And as a non-ring bearer, your efforts will be concentrated on stealing the ring, and recovering life force.

You can also use character cards to boost your skills and actions during each game.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Deduction, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Castles by the Sea: Riptide Expansion
description:
Castles by the Sea: Riptide Expansion introduces a new mechanic to the base game.

The Riptide Expansion is played exactly like the base game, but with one addition to the Hazard step. At the end of each player's Hazard step, they must roll the Tide Die and move the tide around the board!

This expansion can be mixed with the base game components, and includes options for prebuilt Kingdoms.

The base game is required for this expanion.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Modular Board, Square Grid, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Reign of Hades
description:
Reign of Hades immerses players in a visually stunning and modern interpretation of Greek Mythology with its captivating blend of dungeon crawler elements and action-driven storytelling. In this enthralling, co-operative campaign game, you will take on the roles of fallen heroes who were once mighty Olympian Gods. Imprisoned in Tartarus by the cunning Hades, you and your fellow players must set yourselves free and navigate the treacherous realms of the Underworld together. Starting as mortal shadows of your former selves, you will fight to reclaim your divinity and strength, with one ultimate goal in mind: confronting Hades and taking back what's rightfully yours—Olympus.

Reign of Hades introduces a novel Dice-Grid System, which allows you to enhance your attacks by turning a combat die to a better facing or
upgrading it to the next level. You will interact with the game by playing cards into your limited number of card slots, which allow for infinite variability and interesting choices while keeping the gameplay simple, intuitive, and easy to pick up. While the core gameplay focuses on the cooperation between teams of two, there will be a dedicated three-player variant and a thrilling solo variant for those seeking solitary adventures.

Will you and your fellow gods overcome the trials of the Underworld, reclaim your divinity, and restore balance to Olympus? The fate of the gods and the very fabric of the mythological world hang in the balance. Embrace your divinity within and embark on a quest you will never forget!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombie Chickens
description:
Zombie Chickens puts you in the boots of a farmer battling nightly waves of zombified chickens!

The game can be played three different ways:

Competitive - The last farmer standing wins!
Cooperative - Band together for survival!
Solo - Are you brave enough to go it alone?


Gameplay flows between Day and Night. During the "day" players build defenses on their farm. (Eg, set booby traps, stack hay bales to build a wall, load their shotgun, etc.) During the "night" zombie chickens attack & perilous events threaten each player's survival. Zombie attacks increase in intensity each night, because an increasing number of Night Cards are dealt as the game progresses.

Zombie Chickens includes 16 unique zombie types that have different sets of traits, making each zombie vulnerable to some defenses and immune to others. Therefore players should manage their defenses wisely, and remain prepared for the various events that can occur (lightning storm, blood moon, squirrel stampede, heavy rainfall, etc.)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Thiên Mệnh
description:
The king passed away, and other generals and princes began to rise creating a chaotic period full of intrigues. In the name of protecting the people, each of them took their territories and power one by one, dreaming of the throne.

As a person who holds the Mandate of Heaven, each player will become a force in this turbulent time. Use your strategy to bring your power to the top of them all. Raising fame, launching wars, using infiltrators, etc all to achieve the one goal "Fullfil the Mandate of Heaven, unifying the land"

Set up: Each player is dealt

2 character cards, choose one and use the other to present the Supply ( health )
1 Thien-menh card ( reshuffle card )
and 5 playing cards


On your turn:
A player has 2 action points to perform 3 types of action
a) Council meeting: draw a card ( if you use both 2 action points for this type; you will get +1 bonus card )

b) Build or upgrade buildings ( play a card to your playing zone in front of you and pay the cost )

The cost of playing a building card is calculated by subtracting the number on the new card from the number on the previous card. For example: to upgrade a number 3 red building to a number 6 Red building, you have to discard [6-3 ] = 3 cards from your hand.

The same type of buildings are stacked into one column, from the lower to the higher card.

c) Govern buildings
There are 4 types of buildings ( Attact supply, Gain Victory points, Draw more cards, and Regain supply.

Each building can only be activated once in a turn.

The game will be played in many turns until one player achieves 1 out of 3 winning conditions

a) You are the only player who remains in the game, others have been eliminated
b) You has achieved 50 Victory Point
c) When the drawing deck runs out, players will play their full turn in that round. Then who has the highest Victory Points that are still in the game win?


You can use the Thien-menh card to combine and reshuffle the discard + drawing deck hence stopping the ending condition (c).
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Earth: River Otter/Turtles Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

River Otter (Lontra canadensis):
3+ Bush, each with a Wet habitat

Turtles (Testudines):
3+ Herb, each with a Sunny habitat

name: Mabula
description:
In Mabula, each of the two players start with 12 marbles in their color on the perimeter of the playing area. Placement of the marbles is randomized as long as no color has more than two marbles in a row, even around a corner.

On a turn, a player chooses a marble on the perimeter of the board, then moves it as many spaces as they wish across the board. If other marbles lie in this line, push them ahead of this marble, with the only restriction being that you can't push a marble so far that other marbles are pushed into the perimeter of play. Keep taking turns until no player can go. Whoever has the largest orthogonally connected group of marbles wins.

Alternatively, you can decide before starting that a player's score will be the product of the sizes of all of their groups. In this situation, the maximum score is 81 (3x3x3x3).

name: Salad Bowl
description:
"The entertaining game that is energizing and challenging, yet easy for everyone to play. Professional acting ability is not required, though quick wit and good memory are essential to success. Come find out if you've got the right ingredients to win!"

Names of famous people are secretly written on pieces of party at the beginning of the game. There are three phases: Say Anything, Triple Threat and Charades. A representative from the playing team gives clues to get their team mates to guess the name. In Say Anything, players can give any clues but the name on the paper or initials. In Triple Threat, only three word clues can be given. Charades require only acting, no words. Each round, correctly guessed names are placed in the next round's bowl. Players who have been playing close attention the previous round are at an advantage.

Equipment includes three bowls, marked for each round. Perforated tablets for writing names. Pencils. Timer. Dice. Gameboard (place holder for bowls).

Essentially the same game as Celebrities or Time's Up!

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Shadow Lass & Cyclone Promo Cards
description:
These promo cards are included with Crossover Collection 2.

Shadow Lass
Hero
Time Travel
Foes cannot avoid your next Attack this turn.
If you own this card, +1 Power.
Promo Crossover 3
1 VP
Cost 3

Cyclone
Super Hero
Each time you play a Hero, you may discard a Punch. If you do, draw a card.
Promo Crossover 1
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Princess Wonder
description:
Princess Wonder consists of four of the following games:

1. Marionette Kingdom
2. Greedy Kingdoms
3. Love Letter
4. Love Letter to Lady Luck
5. Goita

The first two games are new versions of the existing games by the same designer, Hayato Kisaragi, featuring new art and fixes to the games. All the expansions and promo cards are included in this version.

Love Letter is basically the same as the version the one designed by Seiji Kanai, but the Minister has now been replaced by the Countess from AEG's version. There are three new alternative princesses, each with their own unique power, to create variation to the game.

The 4th game, Love Letter to Lady Luck (LLLL) is the sequel to the widely acclaimed game, Love Letter. As it shares the same background world setting, the art and layout is the same as "Love Letter". However, it plays differently from the original.

Using the cards from Love Letter to Lady Luck, a 5th game, Otome Goita can be played. Otome Goita is based off a traditional Japanese game from the Noto Peninsula, Goita.
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Montenotte
description:
The first of the SB (Small Battles) series is also the first dedicated to the Napoleonic age. The game covers both the battle days with optional rules for the second one, making it possible for the Austrian player to avoid the moronic placement, lethargic leadership and pathetic planning of Argenteau that condemned the Austrian forces to a complete defeat.

Based on activation chits and operative orders, the game system features the different effects of formations on movement, fire and melee, forcing players to change their plans and to adapt their unit line of battle to respond to the enemy. Counters represent single batallions, batteries or skirmisher units.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: The Invincible Armada 1588 AD
description:
Of all the "what ifs" in History, few can compete with "What if the Spanish Armada had succeeded?" The Protestant Reformation might have faded early. Colonization of the New World (and the rivalries there) certainly would have been very different.

Award-winning game designer Mark McLaughlin brings us a new look at the Armada. Players will use both a Strategic and a Tactical map. While there are few physical unit counters in play, many information chits and dozens of "Event Chits" influence play.

name: RE-LOAD
description:
RE-LOAD is a major Expansion and Reprint to already existing LOAD Game.

RE-LOAD is basically a Miniature-Expansion to LOAD Base Game and comes with ~25 additional Heroes (Miniatures). Includes around 20 new items that Heroes can equip and adds additional forest cards to the main deck. The game mechanics and rules are not changed.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Compendium
description:
While many kill teams, such as those of the Deathwatch Space Marines, are made up of hand-picked, specially trained warriors, others are taken from the rank and file of the galaxy’s many armies. While these impromptu operatives are often given little more than a mission description and a firm pat on the back, the harsh conditions of a killzone quickly turn them into hardened veterans in their own right.

Kill Team: Compendium is the definitive 168-page resource for bringing 19 different factions into the world of tabletop skirmish combat, featuring almost every major faction from Warhammer 40,000. From daring Tempestus Scions to disciplined T’au Hunter Cadres, armies from across the galaxy can now put forward their best and brightest to undertake dangerous missions behind enemy lines.

Inside, you'll find:


Datacards, Ploys, and equipment for 19 factions ranging from Adeptus Astartes to Genestealer Cults
Details about fire teams, the small groups of operatives that make up a full-size kill team
A stunning collection of model photography and artwork featuring kill teams and their operatives


The full list of factions available in this book is as follows:
Space Marines
Grey Knights
Imperial Guard
Forge World
Ecclesiarchy
Talons of the Emperor
Traitor Space Marines
Death Guard
Thousand Sons
Chaos Daemons
Craftworld
Commorite
Troupe
Greenskins
Tomb Worlds
Hunter Cadre
Cadre Mercenaries
Hive Fleet
Brood Coven

—description from the publisher

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Lost Rites Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Forbidden secrets and dark rituals alter the face of reality in Lost Rites, the fourth Asylum Pack in the "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. As the game’s different factions race to discover, learn, and master forgotten rituals, players gain two new conspiracies that grant new control over the struggles they will face during the game's story phase.

Lost Rites immerses players in the mythos of Lovecraft's eerie fiction, enriching the game's synergies between dark Tomes and the daring Relic Hunters who seek them. Scientists, cultists, and monsters scour the libraries and haunted woods for powerful Tomes and the arcane knowledge they contain. Will the magical forces they unleash hasten the end of days? Or will heroic government agents and Miskatonic University faculty be able to force the Ancient Ones back toward their eternal slumber in distant realms?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Penciltown
description:
Penciltown is a solitaire town-building strategy game with heavy random elements. It's print-and-play, and uses a pencil, an eraser and two d6s.

It's played entirely on a mostly-blank sheet of paper: you draw the town yourself. The writing is thematically dense, and is more or less low fantasy.

Each round, you roll to see how productive your town is. You then get to forage for additional resources, spend accumulated resources to improve your town, or mount a quest. You also roll to see whether an event occurs each round. Events are interactive, and can involve a decision. Many of them also include an attack on your town, which you need to prepare for adequately or suffer the consequences.

The goal of the game is to make it to the final round without your town being destroyed, while also fulfilling the objective you rolled at the start of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Reforge
description:
2-6 players battle it out battle royale style in a race to craft the strongest weapon! Players play the role of a warrior that must combine different grips, guards, and blades to create a fantastical weapon!

Game Prep:
Each player has a space in front of them known as the Forge where they place different card types including blades, grips, guards, shields, and gadgets. Each player starts with an Adventurer blade and wooden grip in their Forge. Each player starts with an attack die (starts at d4) and a health die (d20 set to 20). The Armory (draw pile) is shuffled and 6 cards are dealt to each player. A starting player is chosen.

Gameplay:
The objective of the game is to be the last player standing after all others have been defeated. The goal as the game progresses is to place grips and guard onto your blade in order to Reforge. This allows you to upgrade your attack die (d4->d6->d8->d10->d12), giving the benefit of more possible damage and allowing you to use more powerful blades (Forge level requirements are marked on cards).

Attacking is done by selecting a target player and adding up all the attack modifiers (red number) on your blade, grip, and guards. This is your base attack. You then roll your attack die and add it to your base attack to determine the total attack. Subtract your target's defense (blue number) to calculate damage dealt to the target player.

Blocking can be performed if the defending player has at least one part (guard or grip) in play attached to their blade. To block, both players roll their attack die (blade and part modifiers are ignored). If the defending player rolls higher, they take no damage. If the attacking player rolls equal to or higher, the defending player takes the damage they would have AND discards a part of their choice from their Forge.

Shields can be placed on a player's turn. If an attack meets or exceeds the shield's stability (marked in the corner of the card), the shield is discarded and the defending player takes no damage (there is no overflow damage to player). If the attack is less than the shield's stability, the player takes no damage and the shield remains. The stability of the shield is reset after each player's turn (it does not decrease like health).

Turn Flow:
1) Draw a card.
2) Recycle (discard two cards to draw one).
2) Use gadgets (as many as you'd like).
3) Place or replace a part (one per turn).
4) Reforge or attack (you cannot attack if you Reforge).

When a player's health reaches zero, that player is out. The player that dealt the killing blow "loots" the defeated player and takes all cards that were in that player's hand and Forge.

-description from designer

name: Velikiye Luki: Stalingrad of the North
description:
The Battle of Velikiye Luki, sometimes called The Stalingrad of the North, was fought during the Winter Campaign of 1942-1943. It was part of the northern pincer of the Rzhev-Sychevka Strategic Offensive (Operation Mars). The Soviet objective was to liberate the Russian city of Velikiye Luki and to cut the north-south rail line to the west of the city.

Rather than attacking the town directly, the Soviet forces advanced into the difficult terrain to the north and south of the town. Despite heavy losses, they successfully cut the land links to the city, trapping the garrison. Hitler demanded that all the surrounded formations hold out while relief forces counterattacked to open a route to the encircled units. The garrison held out against repeated and determined Russian assaults. In the meantime, Soviet attempts to take their main objective, the rail lines at Novosokolniki, had been frustrated by the counter-attacks of the relief force. An attempt by the Germans to reach Velikiye Luki in late December ran into stubborn Soviet defense and was halted. The German garrison finally surrendered on January 16th.

—description from the publisher

name: King of the Hill
description:
A historical Module adaptable to Advanced Squad Leader. Covering the battles for and around Hill 112. June 27th through July 15, 1944.
This module contains a 28 by 49 hex full color, single piece map of Hill 112. Also included are 10 scenarios, a 6 Scenario Campaign Game, and rules covering the unique Features of this battle.

Expands

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Forces of Evil
description:
The kingdom is at peace, protected by the Forces of Good, but they have grown lax and weak. The Forces of Evil gather to overthrow them. But who shall rule in Good’s place? As a Force of Evil yourself, it is up to you to emerge from the conflict supreme.

Forces of Evil is a dungeon-building strategy game for 2-6 players. You and your friends are working to defeat The Forces of Good. You need to build a dungeon, hoard treasure, and recruit minions (as well as keep them happy). However, The Forces of Good will rally against you and attack! You must successfully defeat these ambitious adventurers or they will ruin your plans! At the same time, you must find ways to undermine the other Forces of Evil to insure your own victory. When the last hero falls, the most powerful Force of Evil will rule the land!

Players use actions from cards placed on the gameboard to persue their strategy for winning. Players draw new cards to advance their position or hinder others'. Tokens are used to represent units in players' dungeons as well as heroes fighting against them. The combat element of the game is resolved using dice.

The game ends when either the last Castle Garrison falls or the last Card of Light is drawn, triggering Armageddon. Players are awarded bonus influence points for achieving certain strategic goals. Then each player tallies his power, wealth, and prestige as measured in influence, treasure, and defeated heroes. Whoever has the highest total claims rulership over the kingdom and wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Tactics Module
description:
Modules require ownership of base games, Day of Days for German and American modules, or Red Devils for German and British modules.

The Tactics Modules are a new addition to the SMG line. These modules includes Team Panels in which you match up qualifying soldiers to make cohesive Teams that get added abilities and equipment.

Included are 16 Team cards that may include Command, Teamwork, React and all new Equipment cards.

Current Modules exist for:
- German Light Infantry
- US Paratrooper
- British Airborne

Contents:
4 to 5 - Team Panels
7 - Smoke and Fire Markers
16 - Battle Patrol Cards
1 - Rules for Equipment and Tactics
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: Arcania
description:
Arcania is a war game for 2 to 4 players. Each player is one of the Arcanis, a powerful mage that is the ruler of its own Realm in Arcania.
As one of them, you'll use powerful spells, command troops, magic creatures and fleets of ships. Everything to win the race to conquer the lost Arcane Towers of the missing Zairon, the Last Maximus Arcani.

The object in Arcania is to conquer a certain number of areas, according to the number of players. Each player play his turn, which is divided in 4 phases:

1. Deploy
2. Movement
3. Battle
4. Dominion

1. Deploy: This is the phase where the active player can summon his units to the board from his supply. To do so, he need to spend power.

2. Movement: Here, the active player can move and use abilities from his unities already in the board. Each unity has a different power, and each Realm has different units.

3. Battle: If the active player moved to an already occupied hex by other player, there will be a battle. Each player sums all unities' strength in that hex and roll a die for additional strength. They compare strength and the loser must discard a unity from that hex. The battle goes on till only one player or none have presence in that hex.

4. Dominance: If the active player fulfilled the object of the game, then he is the winner. Otherwise, he just gain power according to the number of towers he has, and his turn ends and the next player plays.

This go on till someone emerge victorious from the war and claim the position of the Maximus Arcani, the ruler of Arcania!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Time Masters: Expansion
description:
A set of 16 new cards for the game:


Crystallization x2
Permutation x2
Renunciation x2
Dismissal x2
Soul Exchange x2
Transposition x2
Omniscience x2
Echo x2
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics
description:
Night Fight: Solitaire East Front Tactics is a solitaire wargame in which you command a Kampfgruppe group of German panzers infiltrating and attacking Soviet forces at night while the system runs the Soviet forces. The first scenario is based on an actual night action from the Battle of Kursk during elements of 6th Panzer Division infiltrated behind Soviet lines. There are also several other scenarios representing other night fights on the eastern front in 1943.

Each vehicle counter represents up to five tanks or other vehicles, depending on the scenario. Each map hex represents 30 meters. Each turn represents anywhere from two to 15 minutes depending on the tempo of your activities.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters

Magazine: World at War #44

name: Catan Geographies: Rickshaw Run
description:
A special map for playing Catan in India.

The game follows the usual Settlers of Catan rules with three major differences:


Settlements and roads may only be built on marked spaces
Victory point chits are put on some crossing points marked on the map; they are claimed by the first player who builds a road there
Special Rickshaw Run streets which give additonal victory points
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Pack Ice & Solar System
description: Age of Steam Expansion: Pack Ice & Solar System features two maps for 3-5 players. Solar System is particularly hard to master as the city-planets revolve around the Sun, while in Pack Ice the map disappears round after round.

name: The Lost Provinces
description:
The shocking defeat of France in 1940 created a unique opportunity for Thailand to regain territory it had lost decades before. When Vichy France refused to give it back, fascist leader Plaek Phibunsongkhram launched a blitzkrieg attack in January 1941. The fighting stopped eighteen days later, and with Japanese mediation, Thailand won back her lost provinces.

This obscure conflict is the subject of designer John Gorkowski’s The Lost Provinces. This is a simple, small, and soloable game that can be played in an evening with new wargamers and grognards alike. It often utilizes traditional mechanisms but with twists and nuances that make them fresh again. For example, combat strengths are compared, to arrive at odds ratios, but those ratios are expressed via a die roll modifier rather than a column on a CRT, which results in greater uncertainty about how a given battle might turn out.

The attacking Thai forces use army, artillery, and air power to bear in along three separate thrust lines. The French forces are more concentrated and have the advantage of defending along interior lines. They’ll have to know when to retreat and when to make the Thai Player fight for every hex.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Masters of Elements – 2nd Season Pack
description:
This pack contains cards for the Masters of Elements expansion for Vikings Gone Wild. This 2nd Season Pack contains 52 cards:

- 24 God cards (to use instead of your Master of Elements)
- 10 Divine Favour cards
- 6 Artifact cards
- 6 Odin's Path cards
- 3 Mission cards
- 3 Event cards
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: This War of Mine: Boardgame Room
description:
Promo card from the Man vs. Meeple Season 2 Kickstarter Campaign.

Setup:
Place this card on the board instead of any chosen furniture.

(Any number of characters at the same time)

Roll a black die twice for each character here. If the total result is higher than 10, lower misery of character by 1. If lower than 10, raise misery if character by 1.

After the first roll, you may choose not to roll a second time to avoid change to misery.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Modern Warfare, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Storytelling, Worker Placement

name: Monkey Duel
description:
Your goal in Monkey Duel is to accumulate points by leaping one's monkeys from bamboo stalk to bamboo stalk across the board. Monkeys that reach the opponent's side of the board score points. Knocking opposing monkeys off the board also scores points.

Players take turns rolling and exchanging dice in order to bring new monkeys onto the board, move their monkeys, or throw coconuts at opposing monkeys. Monkeys move in one of two ways, either climbing directly up their current bamboo stalk or leaping to the next one while dropping down one or more spaces in the process.

Monkey Duel is a game of positioning and timing. Monkeys positioned higher up the bamboo stalks hold an offensive advantage, but every move requires giving up some altitude. Monkeys can also keep one another safe, so deciding when to stick together and when to make an individual break for it is key to victory.

name: Charlotte Future City-Building Game
description:
In this fun and easy game, 2-4 players each build their vision for the future of Charlotte. Players choose their objectives, what to build, and where to build it. The player with the best city wins the game! This game was built as a part of the Charlotte Future 2040 Comprehensive Plan public involvement process.

On your turn, a player takes two cards from the central play area. A player may take a Framework Policy card, which provides victory points for fulfilling its objectives; or a Place Type/Projects & Programs card to place in their city to meet Framework Policy objectives.

After a player selects their two cards, they discard a specified number of cards from the play area, based on the number of players. Empty spaces in the central play area are then filled with new cards. Play then proceeds clockwise.

The game ends after 11 rounds, or a total of 22 cards for each player. Players score their own Framework Policy cards and shared Bonus Point cards. The player with the most points wins.

name: Postaw na klocka
description:
Postaw na klocka is a board game in which players try to construct the building shown on the card as quickly as possible. Some of them are individual challenges, but most of them require you to join teams temporarily with the players indicated by the card. You should demonstrate not only dexterity here, but also good communication and perceptiveness, because the buildings must be constructed according to the pattern and color. The fastest player or team gets one point each.

When a player's pawn stands on a special field, he must draw a difficulty card. From that moment on, he must play a given grasping technique, e.g. using only his thumbs or not bending his elbow.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game

name: Murder at The Movie Theater
description:
MURDER AT THE MOVIE THEATER
A murder has been committed in a port town on Fidalgo Island in America's Pacific Northwest. Movie Theater owner - Chris Hodgson - was found dead in his office with multiple lacerations to the chest and a slit throat.

The evidence has been collected for you, and it's your job to piece it all together and work out who it was that killed Mr Hodgson.

Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice.

27 PIECES OF PHYSICAL EVIDENCE - Inside the case file, you'll find newspaper articles, crime scene investigation documents, suspect profiles, a beer mat, police reports, a poster, CCTV footage, phone/text records, a coroners report, a map, witness statements, photographs and more.

SEARCH THROUGH A POLICE DATABASE - In addition to the physical evidence supplied inside of the box, you'll need to access an online police officer's digital file storage system to prove the suspects innocent or guilty - but it's not easy...you'll need to be a smart investigator to gain access!
You will be required to access the internet to view other important evidence linked to the case.

A difficulty rating of 3/5 this "whodunnit" style thriller.

name: Hollywood Lives
description:
From the widescreen epic Ben Who? to the mystery and dark intrigue of The Lebanese Sparrow. From the musicality of Calamity Kate to the fantastic horror of The Night of the Lemming. These classic movies and many more come to life once again as YOU make them in an evening of Hollywood Lives.

A glittering galaxy of Hollywood’s finest talent are here tonight! Is that Errol G. Swash escorting the lovely Rita Bargot? And are the rumors surrounding Olivia de Lancaster and Humphrey Geucart true? You’ll find out at YOU become the stars for the night in Hollywood Lives.

Internationally noted game designers Reiner Knizia and Kevin Jacklin have put their wealth of experience into creating this simple yet exciting live-action party game!
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: Convivium Publications, Esdevium, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Cloak Hunk Promo
description:
PR-010, included with the RE: DBG promo kits sent to stores. This is an additional character card which players can use to add variety to the RE:DBG games. While he was introduced with the Mercenaries Core Set, he is useable with all versions of the game.

Health: 90
Level 1 (2 decorations): At the beginning of your turn, you can Reveal your Hand. In that case, if you Revealed 2 or more different card types this way, Hunk deals an additional 10 Damage during this turn.

Level 2 (5 decorations): During your turn, while Hunk is exploring, Hunk deals an additional 20 Damage if you have 4 or more Actions in your Play Area.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Alps
description:
First Part of the Age of Steam 2013 set released by Alban Viard

These expansions take place in the Alps. For the first time, players will use the box to simulate the mountains.

This expansion features stickers to make tunnels and to pass throughout the box.

Both maps make use of this very innovative concept.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation

name: MERCS: Recon – Unnamed Assimilation
description: This expansion to Mercs: Recon - Counter Threat and Mercs: Recon - Assassination Protocol introduces a new faction: the EIC.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Dark Vlad Mount
description:
Krosmaster Dark Vlad Mount is a promo expansion used with the "Dark Vlad" Krosmaster figure who comes in Krosmaster: Arena – Dark Heroes.

The top half of the Dark Vlad figure comes apart from his legs, and then can be attached to this figure, resulting in him riding his mount. To represent this, the game comes with a new card that reflects the addition of the mount.

name: Dice City: Scrap Builder
description:
Dice City: Scrap Builder is a promo card for Dice City with the following ability:

Deactivate an active location in your city to get 1 resource of each different type in its cost.

Scrap Builder is an economic location with a build cost of 3 Iron, a Defense value of 4 and VP value of 2.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Dystopian Wars: Hunt for the Prometheus – 2 Player Starter Set
description:
Dystopian Wars is a tabletop wargame of naval battles using highly detailed miniatures to represent huge engines of destruction on, above and below the high-seas. Set in an alternate late-Nineteenth Century called the Dystopian Age, super-science fuelled nations clash over resources and power.

Pick your faction and fight for dominance over the seas and skies with incredible machines of war fuelled by extraordinary technology - dread marvels of the Dystopian Age.

Dystopian Wars is set in the Dystopian Age. From the Badlands of North America to the icy realm of Antarctica, the world of the Dystopian Age is a wild and dangerous place.

This box set not only provides everything you need for two players to start playing Dystopian Wars, but it also contains a campaign that details the theft of the prototype Hypatia Class Generator ship by the Russian double agent Helsinki Markov.

The Commonwealth Intelligence Service (known as the Okhrana) have seen a chance to acquire Enlightened secrets and add new technology to their arsenal in order to better defend the Commonwealth. They risk reprisals from the Enlightened but as long as the technology is theirs it would be worth the consequence. The Covenant guard their secrets jealously and losing the Generator ship will cost them years of research and development.

Contents:
30 Highly Detailed Plastic & Resin Miniatures
1x 14 Ship Covenant of the Enlightened Fleet
1x Descartes Class Control Ship
1x Hypatia Class Generator Ship
3x Copernicus Class Heavy Cruisers
Each Cruiser can alternatively be built as either Antarctica, Chatelet, Lovelace, Stiletto or Ulysses Class
9x Merian Class Drone Frigates
Each Frigate can alternatively be built as Germain Class
1x 16 Ship Commonwealth Fleet
1x Borodino Class Battleship
5x Kutsov Class Cruisers
Each Cruiser can alternatively be built as either Norilsk, Oleg or Sineus Class
10x Rurik Class Frigates
1x Rule Book
1x Campaign Book
2x Victory & Valour card Decks
60 Cards in each deck
1x Template Set
40x Action Dice
12x Critical Dice
2x Condition token sets
1x Iceberg & Physeter Construction Token Set
3x Medium Bases
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hell's Bridgehead
description:
Advanced Squad Leader accessory scenario and map pack concerning aspects of the great tank battle of Kursk in 1943.

Krasny Oktabyr-Kliuchi, Russia, 11 July 1943: After a long night of struggling to secure little more than a tentative hold on the north bank of the Psel, the Totenkopf’s Panzer Regiment received orders to expand the bridgehead and explore the Russian defensive positions in the region. Unbeknownst to them, the reinforced 95th Guards Rifle Division was moving into positions overlooking the village of Krasny Oktabyr. As the Germans moved up from the river’s edge, the two forces collided under a summer squall, mutual surprise giving way to ferocious fighting. The Russians charged through the rain into the midst of the German force. Fighting was at point blank range; tanks often shot each other at less than one hundred meters. Both sides lost several vehicles before they each fell back. The Germans aimed themselves at Hill 226.6, which clearly dominated the local landscape. This fight was only the first of several fought this day as the Russians struggled to hold them back...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Dumpster Brawl!
description:
• Play as one of the 6 cool animal characters – Iscratchu the Enforcer Cat, Rings the Criminal Raccoon and many more.
• Each team has a unique story and special trash affinity
• Battle the other players for the 13 different types of trash - BEWARE THE SLUGS!
• 91 Trash cards, 12 custom dice and various booster and blocker cards
• This is a dynamic card game using dice based combat and YES, rummaging.

Game Summary
Dumpster Brawl is about rolling around in the alley against your opponents and trying to collect the sets of trash you need to claim victory from the other animals.
Players meet in the alley of the city and take turns fighting for the control of the dumpster (where the trash is) and the right to rummage through it looking for what they need to complete their collections.

To earn the right to rummage the dumpster, and the other players' hands, you need to defeat the other players in dice based combat and win your rumbles. The attacking is rolling for crowbars and the defender is trying to get enough trashcan lids to defend.
