Suitable for any scale miniatures from 2mm right up to 28mm (including 6mm, 1/285, 10mm, 12mm, N Scale, 15mm and 20mm) and no re-basing required.

The rules are available as a 140-page A4-sized book (either a perfect bound hard-copy full-colour book, a print-on-demand monochrome book or a full-colour electronic PDF document) with over 45 pictures that illustrate how to play the game. These feature real miniatures as you see them on the gaming table not diagrams that belong in a physics textbook! You also get a double-sided A4-sized quick reference sheet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Ten in a Bed
description:
Spin a +1, +2 or +3 to collect 1, 2 or 3 toys. Land on -1 and it's "ten in a bed and the little one said roll over so they all rolled over and one fell out" and a toy is lost. A fun counting game with an introduction to adding and subtracting.

—description from the publisher

name: A Dark and Dastardly Fight: The Battle of Tippecanoe, November 7, 1811
description:
“Sleep with your moccasins on. Them Red Devils are going to fight before day.” –Comment by a member of the Indiana Militia on the evening of November 6, 1811 at the Tippecanoe Bend of Burnett’s Creek, near Prophetstown.

By early 1811, tensions in the western portion of Ohio and the remaining Northwest Territory were increasing almost daily. Conflict with Great Britain loomed, and the Native American inhabitants were also alarmed regarding increasing US settler encroachments on their lands in violation of the 1795 Treaty of Greenville. Tecumseh and his brother, Tenskatawa (who many Americans nicknamed “Prophet”), traveled amongst the various tribes and nations seeking to unite the diverse native inhabitants into a force that could counter the growing US threat. Many of the followers of the brothers’ messages flocked to Prophetstown, where Tenskatawa took up residence, in the Indiana Territory. US General William Henry Harrison, alarmed at the growing force of Native American warriors, assembled an army and began moving towards Prophetstown.

Tecumseh counseled that war had to be avoided until the British initiated hostilities with the US, which he believed would occur in 1812. However, Tenskatawa claimed in his visions that an earlier battle with Harrison’s army would be successful. When Tecumseh set out in late October 1811 to travel one more time to meet with the Native American leaders that were not at Prophetstown, the Prophet took the opportunity to order a daring night time attack on the American army encamped nearby. One of the most epic battles fought between the US and the Native Americans was about to take place. Can you do as well, or better?

Each copy of A Dark and Dastardly Fight is composed of the following:

• One 8.5 by 11 inch map with Turn Record Track.
• 90 double-sided counters.
• This set of rules with Game Turn/Record Track.

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards (a custom card set for this and all of the other games in the Battles of Old Northwest series is available from the publisher) and a six sided die are needed to play the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Le Torri di San Gimignano
description:
San Gimignano is a small city in Tuscany, Italy famed for the 72 medieval towers built by families to exhibit their wealth and influence. In Le Torri di San Gimignano, a.k.a. サン・ジミニャーノの塔, each player represents a noble family in medieval Tuscany who is trying to build more towers that are higher and more beautiful than those of your rival.

Players start with five cards in hand and four cards in a face-up market from a deck that contains five 5s, six 6s, and so on to ten 10s. They draw and swap cards from an open market, looking to lay out cards of the same value (a plain tower) or of rising values in a run (a colorful tower). Players can add to existing towers, too. After building a plain tower, they receive a bonus effect (a donation) based on the rank of that tower. Players can complete towers by setting them aside as an action; they can no longer add to these towers, but each scores an additional 5 points at game's end.

In the final scoring, players score for having the highest tower, for plain towers that are taller than the opponent's tallest tower in the same rank, and for their colorful towers (# of towers x # of floors total in these towers). The player with the highest score wins.

The game also includes a set of noble cards for an advanced game, with the nobles having special effects in the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Munchkin: Destruye la Navidad
description:
This product is a compilation of these expansions for Munchkin:

Waiting for Santa
Santa's Revenge
Reindeer Games
Naughty & Nice

It has a total of 60 cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #66 – Guadalcanal #2
description:
Flies swarm to the scabs...No strength to brush them away...Fall down and cannot move...How many times I've thought of suicide. - Sergeant Kashichi, Imperial Japanese Army.

Drawn into a battle Japan did not expect or want, Guadalcanal blunted the expansion of the empire. Overly confident and initially dismissive of the fighting prowess of the USMC the bravery of each individual Japanese soldier could not compensate for gross misjudgments and poor planning among the senior officers. Recreate the drama, bloodshed and futility of the night assault over Alligator Creek and the desperate Banzai charges intended to pierce the Lunga Perimeter and reach Henderson Field. Fight for control of the Matanikau River and ambush unsuspecting marines in the deep, dangerous jungle of Guadalcanal. Fight through key locations such as the Maruyama Road, the Bowling Alley and Coffin Corner commanding the great warriors Masajiro Furimiya and Masao Tamura.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #66 – Guadalcanal #2 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions, including new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, and Skills.

2 x PS
2 x NPS
2 x SQS
3 x Skills
9 x Weapons and Gear
2 x Situations
4 x Missions
4 x Objectives
12 x Locations
16 x US Hostiles

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Disney: Hidden Mickeys
description:
The out-of-your-seat game with two ways to find Mickey! Play hide and seek with the colorful Mickey Markers, plus look for Hidden Mickeys on the cards! Two clever activities in one fun-filled game! On your turn, flip over a card from the pile. If you flip a Mickey card, one player hurries to find the matching

Hidden Mickey Marker in the house or yard! Bring it back in time to score a card! Once all the Mickey Markers have been found, search for Hidden Mickeys on your reward cards! Find the most Mickeys to win!

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Dothraki Hrakkers
description:
Taming one of the great white lions of the Dothraki Sea is a feat accomplished by only the mightiest khals. The Hrakkars are powerful beasts that match even the famed Stark Direwolves in terms of conferred status, and in war is just as fearsome a sight on the field. Fast, deadly, and above all stealthy, troops facing the Dothraki should beware of sudden attacks from unsuspected quarters by lurking Hrakkars.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Dothraki Hrakkers unit box gives you new options fielding options for your forces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Army of the Dead: A Zombicide Game
description:
Army of the Dead: A Zombicide Game is a standalone game in the Zombicide franchise based on the movie Army of the Dead (2021) directed by Zach Snyder.

In the tabletop adaptation, players take on the role of the well-equipped and well-trained mercenary company as they infiltrate into zombified Las Vegas and search out the bank vault. Each of these mercs has their own, unique skill set based on characters from the movie. As players make their way through the game’s many scenarios, they’ll be recreating scenes from the film, as well as venturing into many “off-screen” situations designed specifically for the game. But be careful, the zombies of Las Vegas aren’t going to just shamble slowly towards them. This will be a non-stop fight if the players expect to get away with the money… and their lives.

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Guillotine Games, Netflix

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Road Tiles
description:
This supplement for Car Wars Sixth Edition allows you to create custom arenas and scenarios. Add these new cards to your core set and mix and match the road tiles to make a variety of new arena designs!

This supplement includes:
-18 two-sided chipboard tiles
-30 game cards
-One counter sheet (turning keys, control tokens, ace tokens, and damage tokens)
-Rule sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Okupa tu també!
description:
In Okupa tu també! (Let's squat!), each player is a group that lives in the neighborhood, but the scam of unbearable rents and multi-life mortgages has left you and your people homeless — or at least homeless until now because you have said enough is enough, and you are determined to find a place to live and build your project by whatever means necessary, facing if necessary judges, police, thugs, renters and vulture funds.

In the game you represent one of sic groups: Okupat Social Center, Housing Union, Casal Popular, PAH, Neighborhood Family, or even the Mafia. By drafting cards, you accumulate resources (money, tools, training, and networks) in order to enter and occupy one of the empty houses on the game board. To do this, you need to spend the resources that the housing cards demand. Once inside, you have to resist for as long as possible police and law enforcement in order to try to win the game.

But wait! You can't do it alone. If you want your project to survive thugs and speculators, you need the support of your teammates, either because they're good or because they have no choice. They will give you resources, they will help you to overcome the letters of order and law, and they will (sometimes) even give you their victory points. Resisting an eviction for as long as possible and helping your teammates earns you points, and that will be the key to victory.

•••

A les vostres mans estarà escollir un dels sis col·lectius: Centre Social Okupat, Sindicat d'Habitatge, Casal Popular, PAH, Família del barri o fins i tot, la Màfia.

A través d'una selecció de cartes en forma de draft. Haureu d'acumular diversos tipus de recursos (diners, eines, formació i xarxa) per poder entrar i okupar una de les cases buides que hi ha haurà sobre el taulell de joc. Per fer això, hauràs de gastar els recursos que les cartes de casa et demanin, només així el teu projecte okupat començarà a caminar.

Un cop dins, haureu de resistir el màxim temps possible a les forces de l'ordre i la llei, per tal d'intentar guanyar la partida.

Però ep! No ho podreu fer soles. Si voleu que el vostre projecte sobrevisqui a matons i especuladors, necessitareu el suport de les vostres companyes, ja sigui per les bones o perquè no els hi queda més remei. Elles et cediran recursos, t'ajudaran a superar les cartes d'ordre i llei i fins i tot et podran arribar a cedir els seus punts de victòria.

Resistint el màxim temps possible a un desallotjament i ajudar als teus companys et farà sumar punts, i això serà la clau de la victòria.
mechanics: Events, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Aquarium: Goldfish & Castle
description:
The Goldfish expansion adds 4 goldfish to the base game, each with a new unique action. There's also a Net to help you with its own special action.

The Castle expansion is used together with the Goldfish expansion for an even bigger aquarium. It has (you've guessed it) a castle as well as an extra fish of each species which means larger schools and higher points targets to aim for.

Each expansion consists of 5 cards plus a rules card and both expansions will fit in the base game box.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Chaining, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Artlink! Farnesina
description:
Will you be able to collaboratively choose paintings and statues for a perfect exhibition, without knowing what themes the others have received?

In Artlink! Farnesina the players are called upon to set up exhibition routes with works from the Farnesina Collection based on certain themes, with varying degrees of difficulty. The aim of the game is to get the other contestants to guess the themes. ‘Artlink! Farnesina’ allows you to try your hand at the typical challenges of a curator’s work

name: Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares – Bone Hunters Expansion
description:
A set of eight dice and one instruction card for Lucidity: Six-sided Nightmares. The Bone Hunters Expansion was part of the deluxe edition through Fox Tale Games's Kickstarter campaign, but is now available as a separate expansion for the retail version of the game.

These dice are extremely powerful but extremely dangerous, so use them wisely!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: Fox Tale Games, Renegade Game Studios

name: Dungeon Hero: Volume One – Starter Set
description:
Dungeon Hero is a simple, fast, solitaire RPG game in a print-and-play "zine" format.

Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then select an adventure 'zine.

Each adventure 'zine packs a lot of adventure for such a little size! Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the dungeon will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two dungeon elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two dungeon elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue deeper. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects!

If you can make it through the dungeon, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to bring out of the dungeon – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

Volume One of Dungeon Hero contains three eight-page 'zines that you print out, cut, and fold yourself:


Dungeon Hero Core Rules – The core rulebook for playing Dungeon Hero. Explains the rules for character creation and gameplay, and provides an example of play.



Castle Charon – Robed cultists have been seen filing into the ruins of King Charon's castle. Chanting has been heard, and demons have been sighted. Can you set things right?



Fortress of the Frost Giant Jarl – Freezing and starving, you find a Viking outpost, but to stay with them for the winter, you must help them put down the Frost Giant jarl.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Planepita
description:
Planepita is a dexterity game where players flick discs onto a central playing area. Discs in inner rings are worth more points than discs on outer rings.

One side of the discs is magnetic, as is the board. After a player flicks their disc, they may turn it face down, so that the eye of the piece is not visible and the disc is more firmly attached to the board. A face up disc is more valuable than a secure face down disc.

However, after all players have flicked their discs, any discs that are face up in the same ring as a neutral piece are removed from the board. Then, by ring, players score points for having the most value of discs present.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

name: Catapult Feud: Dice Tower Game Mode
description:
Originally available in pack D of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Contains 4 Dice Tower Actions cards and 1 Rules overview card

Actions cards:
- Rebuild
- March
- Rapid Shot
- Traitor

During Setup: Players build their castles as they see fit. No rules apply! Then place their troops on TOP of bricks. Do NOT give action cards to players.

Start of each round: Shuffle the Dice Tower deck and reveal a card. This action card is available to ALL players during this round.

Tactics Phase: You may resolve the Dice Tower action card.

name: Entrenched
description:
Entrenched is a deck-builder with a standard deck of 54 cards — but with abilities and stats on the cards — in which the objective is to either eliminate your opponent or score 9 points. The game is played on a board with six rows, representing trenches in World War 1, split between two sides: red and black. Players use the abilities of their cards and points to buy new cards, with each card having a value to buy other cards. The first three cards are free, while the other cards must be bought with the value of the cards in the player's hand.

Entering the opponent's territory earns the player points, with the closest rows to the opponent's base earning more points. The turn sequence is to play card actions, merge or unmerge units, buy units with points, and draw up to a maximum hand size of three. Cards can be used to attack, to go into a defensive position, or to move a card up or down one row.

In summary, players use their cards and points to buy new cards and attack their opponent or defend themselves on a board with six rows representing trenches. The game ends when one player is eliminated or when a player scores nine points.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Wild Tiled West: The Surveyor Promo Card
description:
All Pre-orders directly through the Dire Wolf web store, FLGS+ retailer program or an affiliated retail partner, are eligible for the exclusive “The Surveyor” promo card.

This is an additional Partner card to add to your games of Wild Tiled West.

It provides 4 for each of the following:

5 or more buildings
5 or more tombstones
A pasture with 5 or more cows
A second pasture with 5 or more cows

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Crypt of Blood
description: Warcry is a fast-paced skirmish game between two battling warbands, set in the fantastical realms of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. This boxed set contains everything you need to get started, including two full warbands and scenery to fight over – the noble Stormcast Eternals of Xandire’s Truthseekers, and the fiendish Soulblight vampires of the Crimson Court. The box contains a double-sided folding game board, a set of scenery pieces, tokens, dice, a range ruler, and a Crypt of Blood booklet with rules, lore, and scenarios to get you started.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers

name: Herd Mentality: Booster Pack
description: 200 all new questions for Herd Mentality. Be the first player to collect eight cows but be warned that if you've got the pink cow the winner can't be you!

name: 1817WO
description: A new map for 1817 that shortens the game, and makes it more suitable for 3 players
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Lands of Evershade
description:
Lands of Evershade is a hybrid RPG/board game experience that lets 1-5 players enjoy grand, richly narrated open-world adventures without a dungeon master, while keeping the game approachable and easy to learn.

Start by building your perfect character using an immersive player's handbook. Choose from unique races and origins, dark secrets, and exciting classes with interesting advancements and specializations that ensure no two characters are the same. All decisions made during character creation — as well as later in the game — change how the world reacts to you, both in story and combat. Were you a nobleman or a common thief in your past? What's your secret or personal quest you hide from other players? New stories, interactions, and combat opportunities unlock at every step.

You can explore the game's multiple standalone story modules and scenarios in the order of your choice to create your own campaign that will lead you to different areas and significant events in the vast universe of Lands of Evershade. When necessary, engage in fast-paced tactical combat in which enemies react to your actions. Enjoy dozens of high-quality models that bring life to your party members and enemies.

Lands of Evershade is more than a game; it's a universe built over many years, a world of secrets buried in the shadow of the goddess Luada that will grow and expand with new content for years to come.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: GoodCritters: Royal Dice Promo Card
description:
Royal Dice loot card worth $6,000

Distributed by the Dice Tower at GenCon 2018

name: Talisman 2nd Edition: Le Héraut Citadel #4 Cards
description:
As part of an advertising feature for the 2nd Edition of Talisman, the French hobby magazine, Le Héraut Citadel (The Citadel Herald), which was a magazine like the Citadel Journal, released a set of cards in French for the game, in Issue #4.

The cards comprised the Résurrection, Transmutation, Faiblesse, Débilité & Amitié Spells and Piège, Lance-Feu des Skaven, Chaos, Troglodyte & Roi Crapaud Adventure cards.

(* Resurrection, Transmute, Weakness, Feeble Mind, Friendship, Trap, Skaven Flamethrower, Chaos, Troglodyte and Toad King!)

Resurrection and Transmute had already appeared in Issue #72 of White Dwarf magazine, however Weakness and Feeble Mind appeared later as part of Talisman City.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Games Workshop Ltd., Le Héraut Citadel

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Molten Core Raid Deck
description:
Includes ten epic bosses, from Lucifron to Ragnaros the Firelord.

Raid Decks represent struggles involving large numbers of players against epic foes. Raid Decks are specially designed pre-constructed products used for a cooperative experience. They combine elements from the World of Warcraft (the team-based questing), and Dungeons & Dragons (the Raid Master). One player, the Raid Master controls all monsters and foes, while 3-5 other players control the characters participating in the raid.

A Raid Deck typically contains epic boss cards, decks for the boss characters, tokens to represent minions, custom rules for the raid, and a treasure pack, intended as a reward for players who are victorious in the raid. The treasure pack contains holofoils and sometimes contains a random insertion of a loot card. Upper Deck Entertainment also made treasure packs available from their UDE points store, although the cards in these packs are not holofoil.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
publishers: Cryo Interactive Entertainment, Upper Deck Entertainment

name: Uprising: Warsaw 1944
description:
The Warsaw Uprising was a major World War II operation, in the summer of 1944, by the Polish underground resistance, led by the Home Army, to liberate Warsaw from German occupation. The uprising was timed to coincide with the retreat of the German forces from Poland ahead of the Soviet advance. While approaching the eastern suburbs of the city, the Red Army temporarily halted combat operations, enabling the Germans to regroup and defeat the Polish resistance and to raze the city in reprisal. The Uprising was fought for 63 days with little outside support. It was the single largest military effort taken by any European resistance movement during World War II.

Game covers whole uprising, since the first to the last days of fights, giving players a chance to see if there was any way to win this possibly pointless battle. German player controls Whermacht, SS and eastern collaboration forces, while Polish player controls all the major underground resistance units as well as pro-soviet Polish People Army that tried to help the uprising.

Game is drived by command points - each player has a limited number of these. Players spend command points to perform certain actions like movement, attack, resupply, introduce reinforcements, pacify, ruin or build the barrickades. There also cards depicting various events that happend throughout the uprising.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Rulebook
description:
Heavy Gear Blitz! is the latest (2006) Heavy Gear miniatures game from Dream Pod 9. A much more streamlined version of the original tactical game but in a very new design. Still holding true to the Silhouette game system old players should find the game very familiar and new players should find it fast and easy to learn. Its eliminates the hex based maps and uses a to-scale terrain system familiar to most miniature games.

The rulebook contains an introduction to the world of Terra Nova, the revised and streamlined rules, basic field guides for the forces on Terra Nova, a random scenario generator, 28 data cards covering all the standard vehicles in the field guides, as well as an assortment of counters for tracking the battle status of your army.

name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Organized Play Kit #1
description:
Upper Deck release Organized Play Kits to support its Marvel: Legendary Deck Building Game.

Included is the kits are:


1 Acetate Loki Mastermind card
25 alternate art foil Unleash The Power Of The Cosmic Cube Scheme cards
5 foil Thor Rare cards
1 Loki Vs The Avengers 32” x 14” playmat
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Patton's Third Army: Spearhead of Victory
description:
Patton’s Third Army is a solitaire game system where the player takes command of General George Patton’s Third Army during the campaign across France in 1944. The game begins immediately following the Falaise Battle and continues through to 15 December, at which point Third Army was sent to fight In the Battle of the Bulge. Your goal as a player is to surpass Patton’s original record, thereby possibly forestalling Germany’s Ardennes Offensive and thereby gaining glory as a great general.

In the game, you control US and other Allied units assigned to the Third Army. The game system plays the Germans. You will have to deal with a wide variety of situations, from battling against fierce panzer counterattacks, to figuring out ways to extend your lines of supply. Your objective: Germany!

The game has two levels: the Standard Rules, which gives a quick wargame, and the Optional Rules, which give more realism for more complexity.

While Patton’s Third Army is a solitaire game, multiple players can play as the US team, making decisions by consensus, or each managing operations along one of the “Axes of Advance”. However, one player should always be the Commander of Third Army, and his decision is final!

Patton's Third Army FAQ

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Magazine: World at War #43

name: Nord: Jarl Expansion
description:
In Nord, each player leads a tribe. He orders workers and fishermen, performs attacks, unites settlements and provides his fighters with raw materials and food.

Nord: Jarl Expansion adds four special Jarls to the game: Ragnar, Eirik, Floki and Thorstein. These Jarls can substitute neutral jarls. They are placed during the setup before the players' jarls onto a central settlement.

For each of them exist a small overview tile and a szenario tile with the rules. There are 4 big wooden jarl meeples with different colors which can be substituted with some meeples of your own or by marking the standard neutral jarls.

For Ragnar is a big settlement included which can be crafted or substituted by 2 adjacent standard settlements.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ancient Brass Dragon Expansion Pack
description: The Ancient Brass Dragon Sivart is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wing Leader: Victories C3i #29 Scenarios
description:
Two scenarios and 30 counters for Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942, included in C3i Magazine, Issue #29.

Scenario 1 - Cry Havoc, Tunisia, 21 March 1943.

Description: As Patton's II Corps began to push out of the passes through the Atlas mountains and descend on the Axis flanks, low-level raids were launched against Mezzouna and motor transport columns behind enemy lines, II/JG 51 was the spine of the air defence, but also had the task of covering close air support attacks on the American spearheads.

Fierce fights began to break out near Maknassy, with American raids colliding with German Raids travelling in the opposite direction.

Scenario 2 - Supercharge, Egypt, 4 November 1942.

Description: The second day of Operation Supercharge saw a general breaktrough on the ground. 51st Division and 4th Indian Division cleared the anti-tank screen, allowing 1st Armoured Division to get through. Abandoning the Italian divisions in the South, Rommel ordered a withdrawal to Fuka. Throughout the day the Western Desert Air Force mantained a continual bombardment and strafing of the mass of vehicles retreating along the coast road. The hairpins climbing the scarpment at Fuka and Mersa Matruh proved a deathtrap for the Axis. German and Italian fighters were thrown in to stem the tide of Allied bombing. Small clashes developed all over the sky.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Marvel Knights Promo Cards
description:
Black Widow, Daredevil, and the Punisher don't always work together, but when they do it's in the pages of Marvel Knights - or on your next Dice Masters team! Contains 3 cards. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for Marvel Dice Masters contains three cards:


Black Widow: Stinger (Alternate Art for card from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man)
Daredevil: Marvel Knight
Punisher: Marvel Knight


Black Widow and Daredevil use the dice from Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man, Punisher uses the die from Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Knight Tales: Last Stand
description:
The Last Stand expansion contains more additions to the base game.

It contains more knights for players to choose from, more monster factions and bosses for players to face, and additional components and rules for advanced modes of play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Charmed and Dangerous: Fairest in the Land
description:
She is vain. She is wicked. And with thirteen words, she changed the land of myth and fable for all time. The Evil Queen failed to kill her hated stepdaughter once and Snow White is more beloved than ever, but the Queen's hatred has not softened over time. She has amassed a new army and new plans dedicated to destroying Snow White and her new allies. You and the other Princesses will have to band together to brave the traps and minions of the Jade Fortress and bring an end to the terrible reign of this legendary Villainess. The Fairest in the Land expansion for Charmed and Dangerous also adds 2 additional Villainesses to the game, a bonus lair, new Princesses and a brand new keyword mechanic for the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Conspirations
description:
You reside in the kingdom of Phénistoria.

Vast, sumptuous and undeniably the wealthiest the world has known.
Until the fateful day when the Great Thenos, king of Phénistoria and hero of the battle of Shred was overthrown by his son Uhl.

Now, 4 factions are trying to regain power: Republicans, Royalists, Satanists and Plague victims.

You will have to play as one of the 14 characters in the game, each with a unique skill that will allow you to cunning, bluff and conspire to succeed in defeating the other factions. With up to 5 different "double jeu" cards representing the dark side of your character as well as a multitude of action cards, you will be able to commit crimes in order to eliminate the other characters and make your faction win.
But beware ! Each crime is punishable by the great Tribunal of Phénistoria. And the tribunal judges are the players (and of course they are flawless and impartial).
Investigate, uncover the crimes committed by others and persuade the players to follow you in your accusations in order to eliminate your opponents.
However, beware: In Phénistoria, Justice must be perfect and a bad accusation will lead you directly to prison ...

Citizen of Phénistoria, will you succeed in conquering the Kingdom with the help of your allies?
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Fugitive: Event Cards Expansion
description: Event Cards are random events that get shuffled into the hideout decks and have an effect whenever they get drawn by either player.

name: OLLO l'original
description:
OLLO is an abstract game that can be played by 2 to 4 players.

Played on a board with 12 marbles glass of each color, the goal is to align 4 marbles of its color.

The rules are very simple, the first player put a marble glass on a corner of the board, then the other players must put their marbles on the board by pushing one or multiple marbles from the outside of the board.

Second and last rule, no marbles can be ejected from the board.

—description from the designer

name: Alien Frontiers: Mercury's Angels Faction
description:
Mercury's Angels is a mini-expansion for Alien Frontiers: Factions. The Mercury's Angels faction is an organization that thrives on the power of the individual over a corporate and collective power structure. They believe that the greatest successes can only be achieved with a diversity of minds and talents. As such, the Angels provide bonuses for owners who have a variety of ships, making them especially useful during the crucial opening stages of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Formule Dé Circuit № 2: FRANCE – Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours
description:
Second course for Formule Dé by Ludodélire.

36" x 21"; 208 spaces; 8 corners (one "3", one "2"); straights 47, 25, 17; longest straight ends in "3" corner

PLUE : 1 A 6 VARIABLE : 7 A 11 SOLEIL : 12 A 20

Re-implemented by:

Formula Dé Circuits 7 & 8: Magny-Cours & Monza

name: Dice City: Game Store
description:
Dice City: Game Store is a promo card for Dice City with the following power:

Roll a Die:
1: Get 1 star
2-5: Get 2 stars
6: Get 3 stars

According to designer, promo should include 3 copies of the card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Time's Up! Academy 2
description:
Time's Up! Academy 2 is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring old TV series, music and movies and chooses some of them. Each player's cards and shuffled to form a deck, and this deck is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many names and titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Warhammer: The End Times – Nagash
description:
From the publisher's website:

Nagash was the most powerful and feared of the necromancers of old. Now he has returned, and the Warhammer world will be forever changed.

This volume details the fateful events following Nagash’s return to unlife, and his plans to unite all the Undead of the Warhammer World under his supreme command. This terrifying new chapter in the history of the Old World is revealed over two softback tomes.

Warhammer: Nagash Book 1 is a 296-page volume which provides a narrative sweep of the events surrounding the return of Nagash. From Bretonnia and the Empire, to Nagash’s birthplace in the Land of the Dead, vast battles are fought, the dead rise and nothing will ever be quite the same.

Warhammer: Nagash Book 2 is a 96-page volume that contains new scenarios and rules based on the events in Warhammer: Nagash Book 1. It includes the full rules that will allow you to field Nagash and his loyal subjects - along with all-new rules for some of the most powerful heroes of the Old World, such as Valten and Vlad von Carstein - in your games of Warhammer.

Armies of the End Times can also field more Lords - to up 50% - and the brand new spell lore - The Lore of Undeath - allows every wizard, mage and sorcerer to wield the fell magic unleashed by Nagash. There are also army lists that allow you to create a unified army of Tomb Kings and Vampire Counts known as the Undead Legion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Vrax Expansion Pack
description:
The I.R.W. Vrax is a Romulan Valdore-class starship. Along with its sister ship, the I.R.W. Valdore, the Vrax joined forces with the U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-E to battle against the Reman Warbird, Scimitar, at the Battle in the Bassen Rift.
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.R.W. Vrax Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 17 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Arty
description:
A promo figure and card for Krosmaster: Arena. He is a playable character.

His flavor text reads:

"Thunder-Bubble! Is your town assailed by Evil? Call Arty! He'll transform into a giant dragon and send Evil back home to its mama! But don't summon him if you particularly fond of your buildings - he has a tendency to break a lot of things while fighting..."

His power is "Bububble" - Arty and the allied Krosmasters adjacent to him gain "Unfazed" during the adverse player's turns.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The Plot Thickens: Romance Edition
description:
The Plot Thickens is a storytelling game for quick-thinking, imaginative folks just like you and your friends. The object is to take your hand of story cards, (people, places and things) and lay out the tale of your character, and their fate! You’ll earn plot points for every card you use to build your story, and every time you interweave with other’s narratives.
The storyteller with the most points gets to craft the ending as main character, while the person who connected the most to their cards gets to name the epic as the Author. What will your story be?

The Romance Edition throws you into your favorite paper back romance novel with muscle bound heroes, Manic Pixie Dream girls and a hooker with a heart of gold!

The different genres of The Plot Thickens can be combined to increase the player count and give you more story options.

name: Mistfall: Winter's Hold
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 17

Contents:
1 Location Tile (Winter's Hold)
2 Winter Treasure tiles
1 Rules (in English & German)

The location tile is double sided. English on one side, German on the reverse.

The Winter's Hold Location Tile can be added to any game of Mistfall or Heart of the Mists. It provides you with an extra Location which you can decide to visit on your Quest for some greater rewards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: "The Naturalist" Scenario (fan expansion for Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island)
description:
New scenario for Robinson Crusoe

Scenario Overview:
You have been assigned to the crew of the scout ship HMS Beagle and will participate in the famous 1831 survey voyage of discovery. Help the ship’s naturalist, Charles Darwin, catalog the diverse flora and fauna of the cursed island, by gathering as many wildlife specimens as possible. Your ship has departed to restock provisions on the mainland and will return at the end of the 12th round to transport you and your findings home. Gather what you can and survive to tell your tale.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Rocker
description:
Was part of the pledge level for backing the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign. Also included in the Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Promo Pack 1.

An ally card.

Text says:
In combat, you may reveal a second raider card (replacing the first)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Fury Hardball
description:
Fury Hardball is a fast-playing alt-sport strategy game designed for one or two players. Arrange your team to suit your play style, and call your plays to outsmart your opponent. And when we say fast playing, we mean it— Fury Hardball can be played in as little as ten minutes, perfect for playing through a league or season! Available in both hard copy and print-and-play formats, its the perfect fit for any game collection!

Fury Hardball has elements of baseball, cricket, and plastic vent-ball. Set up is simple. One or two players select a slinger (pitcher), two fielders, and four batters for each team.

The game only lasts for one inning of nine outs for each team. The visiting team bats first and scores as many runs as they can before the home team comes up and tries to outscore them and win the game. The slinger can throw heat, junk, stuff, or try to catch a person on base who is stealing. The batter chooses between no swing, a reach swing, or a big swing. A roll of a d10 determines the result of the play either from the main game card or from one of the players: slinger, fielders, or batter.

There are ways to score multiple runs on the same play and to record multiple outs. The action is fast and furious. If the home team can score more runs in the bottom half of the inning than the visitor managed in the top half, they win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Big Five
description:
Have you always dreamed of going on safari? Now you can be the guide yourself!
You drive tourists around the park in search of beautiful landscapes and beautiful views, but especially to spot the Big Five! It is your job, together with the other guides, to find all the animals. But watch out! Setbacks are coming your way: forest fires that drive away the animals, severe thunderstorms, extreme heat, a flat tire, a herd of hippos in the middle of the road and too little fuel or food are all factors that make it difficult to find the animals. Each guide has their own qualities. Help each other to find all the animals. Can you manage to spot all five animals? Then you have won this game!

The big five is a cooperative Eurogame for 2 to 5 players. Players ride around the board with a number of actions to spot all 5 animals. In the meantime forest fires and other problems trouble the players and they need to solve them before all animals leave the area and all players loose the game. When all players have spotted all 5 animals they win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map

name: Riga: Lubeca
description:
Now it's time to trade with Lubeca, the medieval name of Lübeck, with you specifically wanting to trade salt and fur from Novgorod to build a market hall and taverns in a new color.

The Riga: Lubeca expansion includes twelve new buildings in a new color (white) and ten new commodity cards: four fur (with a value of 6 ducats) and six salt (which doubles the value of one other card). A new type of Riga card — "Brunnen" (well) — completes the card deck for a fresh game experience.

Finally, the expansion contains replacement cards for the misprinted market halls in red, green, and yellow. The additional cards allow you to play with five players.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Posthuman Saga: The Outcast Promo Pack
description:
The Outcast promo pack has 4 cards in it:

1x Mutated Follower (The Outcast)
1x Half-Moon Club
1x Crossbow
1x Outcast's Map
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Pitchstorm: Creature Feature
description: A horror movie expansion for Pitchstorm. "For all the horror fans out there. This deck is full of characters and plots to add a dose of gore and suspense to your pitches."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Constellations
description:
OBSERVATION, SPATIAL AWARENESS AND SPEED GAME

The astronauts are lost at the edge of the galaxy: let’s help them pick out a path through all the stars!
An observation and spatial awareness game, where each player is given a board and cards that they need to place based on the colours shown on the 3 dice. The fastest player wins the round.

+++ Multiple difficulty levels offer something for everyone and the chance to progress!

—description from the publisher

name: Unsurmountable: Rescue Mission
description:
Danger strikes all too often on the mountain. When you get a distress call from a trapped climber, you don’t hesitate to help!

This 3-card expansion adds Rescue cards. One of these is placed midway through the Mountain deck at start to mark the stranded climber. Rescue cards work like Mountain cards, but cannot be discarded for an action and must be included in a successful path up the mountain.

name: Ave Roma: Essen expansion
description:
You received this little expansion when you picked up your kickstarter edition at the booth at Spiel 2016.
The card was personalised with your name.

This card is placed next to the board. During your turn you may place a worker on one of the available action slots and carry out any action. You can not play 2 or more workers with the same value.
mechanics: Set Collection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Spartacus!
description:
For Caesar: Conquest of Gaul, we have Spartacus! with five scenarios by C3i GBoH Editor Dan Fournie.
This article will feature the Battles of Salinae, Mount Garganus, Picenum, Camalatrum and Silarus River.

Spartacus! will introduce the new ‘gladiator swordsmen’ unit, and pits the ragtag slave army against a series of Roman commanders and legions. The scenarios for Grumentum and Spartacus are presented for both standard GBoH and Simple GBoH rules.

name: Golem Arcana: Durani Empire – Scions of Honor Expansion
description:
The Durani are the old power of the world, and their empire has spanned a thousand years unbroken.

Arcanum Durani animates Golems carved from stone and forged from precious metal by tapping the Mana trapped within huge gems found only in the Durani homeland. Atop these glittering behemoths, the Durani war masters of old spread out, conquered, and solidified the borders of their Empire. They built roads, towers, and castles to fortify their captured territories.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Budapest 1945
description:
Game covers several battles fought around the capital of Hungary at the end of 1944 and at the beginning of 1945, along with all three "Konrad" operations.
Game uses division/regiment scale system "Great Battles 1939-1945".

name: Dungeonology: Rigor Mortis
description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion that adds the following:

- 4 Scholar Models
- 1 Boss Model
- 6 Zone Tiles
- 3 Standard Cards
- 7 Tarot Cards
- 15 Mini Cards
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pagode
description: This is a placement game played on a 9 x 9 grid. The grid is a repeating pattern of 3 different colors, yours, your opponent’s and a neutral color. Your goal is to create patterns using your pieces to score points. If the patterns are made by pieces on your colored squares, you score more points. Patterns enclosing larger areas or shapes score more points. Your opponent can also be forced into negative scoring patterns.

name: War Machine
description:
From the publisher:

War Machine combines economics, trade, diplomacy and elements of land, air and sea power into an easy to play game. The object is to gain control of the three major cities on each of your opponent's boards. It takes some luck and a great deal of skill. Strategy depends on you alliances and whether you have a Land, Sea or Air Nation. Each Nation has an advantage in either land, sea or air capability. Deciding what to produce, where to deploy and when to attack will determine your success or failure. You can become an effective player after one game and a master player after only a few games. War Machine is designed for two to three players, but can be expanded to four players by borrowing a board from a second game.
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: First Manassas: July 21st 1861
description:
1861 - First Manassas (American Civil War in 3D)

The first battle in our series of the American Civil War games in 3D sees the Union army under General McDowell meet the combined armies of the Confederation under General Beauregard and General Johnston. The battle is fought just north of Manassas Junction across the stream called the Bull Run. The Union hope for a swift victory to end the war, but a delayed attack by the Union has allowed the Confederates to combine its two armies. The Union still outnumber the Confederates, but only just, so let the drums roll and the flags fly, it’s time for brother to meet brother.

The game can be easily played over 2-3 hours and there is a 16 bound time limit on it. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period. A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?
Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in four quadrants, the First Manassas six page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you start this great series of battles with a victory? Play North or South in this the first of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Alchemy Bazaar
description:
In the worker movement game Alchemy Bazaar, 2-5 players are rival alchemists who jointly own a growing bazaar of alchemical shops. Each round, new shop tiles are added to the bazaar, and the players then take turns moving their apprentices around the various shops to collect coins, alchemical ingredients, formulas and special actions.

Each apprentice can move to one adjacent shop for free, after which the player can pay a coin to have the apprentice move to another adjacent shop, then two coins for another shop, and so on. Once an apprentice is finished moving, the shop where the apprentice ends it turn is unavailable for other apprentices to use, but other apprentices may move through that shop freely.

Formulas can be completed with certain combinations of ingredients, resulting in the alchemist gaining wisdom (by drawing wisdom cards). Each player also has a secret goal card, which will give bonus points at the end of the game. The player with the most wisdom and bonus points at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Naval Battle of the Sino Japanese War
description:
Naval Battle of the Sino Japanese War is a Chinese wargame on the naval battles of the Sino - Japanese War 1894-1895. The components include 4 hexagon grid maps, a set of counters, two dice, a rule book, two charts and three record table.
The game has four scenarios: Fengdao’ battle, Yellow battle, battle for Weihai and Yellow battle decisive battle. This is an introductory nautical board-wargame, easy to learn and easy to play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Peace at Any Cost
description:
The future of Rokugan hangs in the balance with the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

As dark forces move throughout Rokugan in Peace at Any Cost, every clan is tempted to dabble in the forbidden arts of mahou, which requires fate to be spent from players' own characters. Hand-in-hand with this comes a new keyword, dire, which triggers when a character has no fate on it. As with previous cycles, every Dynasty Pack of this cycle offers sixty new cards, with new options for each of the seven Great Clans of Rokugan, split between strongholds, provinces, dynasty deck, and conflict deck.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: What's Missing: Purple Version
description:
What’s Missing? Purple version is a drawing game that contains 240 cards with line drawings, sorted by difficulty (level 1: a belt, level 4: Pegasus for example).

In a round, each player takes a card, places it under a transparent paper - making sure to hide it behind the cardboard screen - and draws on it things that would help other players to guess what's on the card.

After finishing the drawing, the drawer removes the card and shows only the transparent paper to others. The other players have to guess what's missing on the transparent paper, in other words, what was on the drawer's card. The player who first guesses correctly earns 1 point, with the drawer losing 1 point if no one guesses.

To win, being clever is more important than being a good artist. Young drawers can give other players a clue based on what kind of things are on the card.
For those who own the first yellow version of What’s Missing?, you can double the number of cards up to 480, the number of players up to 12 and the fun with this second version!

—description from the publisher

name: Family Plot: Reapers Expansion Pack
description:
We lovingly refer to this pack as THE KILL DECK. It’s ALL REAPERS and when you have a deck filled with killers, it’s going to change the game up in a big way!

This pack of 20 ALL NEW cards will bring a darker element to the game, creating even more havok and chaos with new, creative elements that will make your game even more devious than usual. Even the Reaper Angel has some twists and this deck has the most powerful card we’ve ever created. Are you dark enough to put it in your deck?

Only you can decide if you’re brave enough for THE KILL DECK!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: The Great Escape: Recon
description:
The Great Escape Recon is a mini solitaire card game played in 3 stages and an expansion for The Great Escape.

Stage 1
At night you must escape the compound by making your way between huts avoiding any guards and searchlights. Reach the blind spot in the fence and, with a good pair of wire cutters, you should be able to make your escape.

Stage 2
Pursued by guards you must make your way across various terrain and either head straight for the border and safety or spend some time gathering vital information that will aid your fellow campmates should you be captured.

Stage 3
This stage combines the cards from The Great Escape with any knowledge of the surrounding area that you might have gained in Stage 2. Armed with this information the POWs from The Great Escape should now have a better chance of escaping.

Good Luck!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Roll-Z
description:
Will you survive? Roll-Z is a Solo Survival Time Challenge, in Print and Play format, but with colorfull high definition PDF files, and that's not all! You will need the Oficial Game Aplication that not only complements game immersion, with chilling original music, sounds and graphics, it also enhance the gameplay WITH RANDOM ENCOUNTERS making it a REAL TIME CHALLENGE.

In Roll-Z you represent a survivor who must find pieces to fix the car, place them, and at the same time repel a horde of zombies trying to tear down your fragile barricade. Is not easy! If you manage to repair the old Chevy (by putting together the 5 necessary pieces) before time runs out, you have won, but if your barricade collapses or you run out of time, you will became another brainless wobblers.
TO SURVIVE, you will need to master all the resources of the game, from zombies to trash. With an easy to learn mechanic, and a deep fast paced tactic options, you get a replayable surviving game to play with all your friends. Challenge them all!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Touched by the Abyss Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Those who gaze upon the secrets of the Abyss do so at their own peril...

The stakes are grater than ever in Touched by the Abyss, the climactic conclusion of the "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game! Madmen, cultists, and daring investigators continue to shape the destiny of Arkham, Massachusetts and its surrounding area. While the faculty of Miskatonic University and government agents work to fight the spread of secretive cults, territorial thugs battle with terrible monsters. And the Order of the Silver Twilight seeks the means to forever banish from the world all those who would stop them.

This Asylum Pack's sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) relate the dramatic finale to the struggle for control of forbidden knowledge, bringing to light four new translations of the dread Necronomicon, six thematic conspiracies, and a host of new characters as humanity battles the forces from beyond for the power over life and death!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: The Walking Dead Board Game: The Best Defense – Event Promo Cards
description:
A set of 4 Event cards given to brick and mortar stores. They are not available online.

They are simply added to the event deck during setup.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Holiday Fever: A Family Tradition
description:
Players roll the die and move clockwise around the board, following the instructions of the space you land on. The outer edge of the board represents life during the holiday season. Players acquire debts, shop, pay bills, decorate a Christmas tree and earn Christmas spirit by giving speeches, sharing stories and singing Christmas carols.

The game ends when someone lands on Christmas. You win by giving your family the most valuable Christmas which is calculated by the value of your gifts, tree, stocking and Christmas spirit.

After the game ends, families are encouraged to flip the scoreboard and share something noteworthy about the game for keepsakes for your family to cherish and make a family tradition.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: Rattus: Boccaccio Promo Card
description:
Rules:
The player holding this card may, at the end of phase C, move one of his cubes to the palace area if at least one other player’s cube is killed by the Plague. The cube must be taken from a region adjacent to the region where the rat tokens are revealed (it doesn’t matter whether this region contains rat tokens or not).

End of the game: The player may move the Plague Piece one step in the final counterclockwise round. If the Plague kills another player’s cube in this region he can save one of his own cubes from a neighboring region.

Card combinations: If a player also holds a card depending on plague piece (Chivalry characters or Serf), he must apply the effects of these cards in the same region.

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Dance of the Dead" Promo Card
description:
Dance of the Dead
Type: Barrier

Traits: Trigger, Cache, Curse, Magic

Check to Defeat: Dexterity / Charisma 10

Powers:
When you examine this card, shuffle a random monster that has the Undead trait from the box into each open location deck.

If defeated, banish this barrier or display it next to the scenario. While displayed, after you defeat a monster that has the Undead trait on your exploration, shuffle an item from the box into a random open location deck, then you may explore your location.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiny Cold War
description:
A free Print and Play solitaire game based on the cold war. Perfect for educational purpose or just to have fun!

In this game, you are the leader of one of these two superpowers, and all you have is your strategy and instincts to help protect and lead your nation to glory. Can you outwit your opponent and come out on top?

The fate of your nation rests in your hands.

The game takes place in 18 rounds that retrace 18 real events during the cold war. Each event is represented by a card that describes the details of the event. The objective of the game is avoid a nuclear holocaust and, at the end of 18 rounds, being the nation with the highest dice value in at least two areas of influence and win the cold war.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kiválasztottak, a M.A.G.U.S. kártyajáték
description:
"Kivalasztottak, the Magus Kartya" (English translation: "The Chosen Ones, the Wizard Cardgame"), is a strategic collectible card game based on the Hungarian role playing game M.A.G.U.S. In the game, players are magicians who try to destroy the towers of the other magicians or to collect 19 victory points.

The game has been around for more than 10 years, and could be considered Hungary's answer to Magic the Gathering. Various sets for the game exist, including Árnyékháború, Krán Törvénye, Hétarcú Birodalom, Zászlóháború, and many others.

Most sets consist of either 54 cards (18 common, 18 uncommon, 18 rare), or 108 cards (36 common, 36 uncommon, 36 rare). Booster packs usually contain 12 cards, with distribution as follows: 7 common, 4 uncommon, 1 rare. Some preconstructed decks have also been released.
publishers: CCG Art Kft., Két Mágus Kft., Valhalla Páholy Kft.

name: Battles of Trenton and Princeton
description:
Medium complexity game of the Battles of Trenton and Princeton during the American Revolutionary War. Rare. Limited Printing.

144 counters
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Campaigns and Battles from the Age of Reason
description:
63 pages of rules and scenarios for Warfare in the Age of Reason.
Bohemian Blitzkrieg is a smallish 2-player campaign, Spain is added to the Sport of Kings campaign from the original game, and there are seven stand-alone scenarios.
Includes errata and Q&A for 1st edition Warfare in the Age of Reason.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Space Explorer
description: Described in the book Beyond Competition, Space Explorer is a cooperative game where players take turns controlling a space ship going from planet to planet. Distance and direction is determined by a deck of cards (1-6 in four suits). The game is a race against time measured in deck reshuffles.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Santa Claus Takes the Intercity
description:
A simple game of bidding for 25 intercity railway routes on a map of the Netherlands, self-published and sent to Han Heidema's gaming contacts as a Christmas gift in 1997.

Players needed to supply their own crayons or felt pens for colouring routes on the map, and each player needs a suit of 13 cards from a standard card deck.

Each turn, one card from a deck of 25 route cards is revealed. Players bid to win the route by each simultaneously playing a card from their hands. Highest untied card wins the route. The highest cards, winning cards, court cards and low cards (whose definition varies depending on number of players) are discarded after each bid. As each route is won it is coloured on the map to show its ownership, a la crayon rail games.

Each route is worth between 1 and 5 distance points. The winner is the player with the longest continuous route on the map when the 25 routes have all been won (or when all players are out of cards).

Simple but fun. The blue cardstock of the laminated map is the only downside, as it makes darker pen colours hard to differentiate.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Crayon Rail System, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: No Limit Texas Dreidel
description:
Texas Hold'em Poker with Dreidels!

Players get a couple of dreidels in the hole (not seen by other players) and together with a three more communal dreidels bet chocolate gelt against the other players that they have the best 5-dreidel combination.

The standard edition is for 2 to 4 players, but the deluxe edition has enough dreidels for 8 players.

Home Page: http://www.texasdreidel.com/index.php

name: You May Fire When Ready Gridley! Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Naval Wargames 1880 To 1905
description:
Fire When Ready covers actions with pre-dreadnoughts. They come with a set of rules for creating your game statistics for your vessels using published sources such as "Jane’s" or "Conway’s".

The rules features an choice of game systems. The "Duel" Game is intended for use with a small number of ships and each ship has a captain and crew generated individually. The "Battle" system is for large battles such as Tsushima and ships operate in formations, each of which has a Commander and ships' crew ratings are generated for a formation.

There are alternative gunnery systems offering simultaneous effects (which can be used with the "Duel" Game) or sequential effects based on initiative, in which shooting follows in order of initiative (highest scores shoot first) and where damage is applied immediately (this can be used in either game system).

The gunnery rules include the effects of "crossing the T" and other features. It is now possible to achieve significant amounts of damage and multiple special hits.

There are 10 scenarios and ready calculated ship data is provided so you can sit down and play any of them.

(Publishers Description)

name: Hansa 1400
description:
An expansion map for Hansa, the launch of which is planned for July/August 2011. Available for online play at Schacht's website.

Uses the same rules as the basic game, and may be combined with the Extrakcarte/Changing Winds expansion rules:
- may sail (roll) against the wind (direction of the arrows) for 2 coins
- end-game bonuses of 2/3/4/5VP for player with tallest stack of markets / who triggered last round / markets in most cities / most single-barrel tokens sold.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Fief: Les Reliques
description:
Essen 2011 promotional mini expansion for the game Fief.
Include 5 holy relics (reliques) and each holy relic has a special power that its possessor may use if they wish.
Available in the Plato Magazine issue #41

name: The Strategy Game (2 player)
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that The Strategy Game is a non-authorized version of Blokus Duo.




In this two-player game, players place geometric figures onto the board, but must place such that their new piece touches at least one of their previous pieces, but at corners only. The player who gets the most of his or her pieces placed by the end of the game is the winner.

Though named the same, this is not identical to The Strategy Game, a similar unauthorized replica but of Blokus i.e. for four players.

name: Temple of the Feathered Serpent
description:
This is it. This is where the weathered parchment pinpointed the Temple of the Feathered Serpent, lost since the conquistadors who had drawn the map disappeared over 500 years ago.

Pushing aside the great cycad fronds from the clearing you see the ancient pyramid before you. The entrance, you know, is at the top.

Climbing, you hear those sounds coming from the jungle behind you again. Something has been tracking you, waiting for an easy meal. It doesn’t matter. The treasures of the Incas lie within this ziggurat and an entire jamboree of ravenous jaguars couldn’t turn you away now.

Pushing aside the stone door at the top, you begin to descend the slick stone steps. What could go wrong now that you’re so close?

Temple of the Feathered Serpent (TotFS) is a tile laying game where you you are trying to navigate the ever changing maze to escape an ancient temple. Watch out for the deadly jaguars and snakes. The monkeys might sneak up and steal your hard won treasures.

Hey Look! We have a microbadge:
categories: Adventure, Maze, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Inkermann 1854
description:
Inkermann 1854 is a tactical game simulating one of the battles of the Crimean War between Russian troops and the Anglo-French troops November 5, 1854 in the East of Sevastopol.

Inkermann 1854 offers two scenarios: a tactical scenario which starts with the first Russian attack on British positions and a grand tactical scenario which allows battle plan change, adding more units and which starts when the Russians troops begin to move at night.

A number of optional rules can be added.

A game turn represents 45 minutes, a unit one or two infantry battalions, one or two artillery batteries or one cavalry regiment.

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Starship: Panic
description:
Starship: Panic is a Print & Play 1-7 player, co-operative game about a team of Space Explorers attempting to survive disaster. To survive, the team must work together and keep the pile of metal and bolts known as their Starship intact. The players will have to deal with internal and external threats by activating various stations aboard the ship.

The game features a tile-based ship and multiple player characters creating a large amount of variation.

The players win by completing a set number of Red Level Events which can change depending on the desired challenge and length.

Starship: Panic takes place over a series of rounds. Each round consists of each player taking a turn.
A player's turn involves: taking actions, activating event cards, and drawing new event cards.

Each player is permitted 2 actions: Move, Station Action, Combat, Repair, or Trade. Then any event cards the player possesses, is activated. Finally, a new event card is drawn.

The Starship: Panic PnP files includes 2 pages of rules and 17 pages of printable pieces included tiles, cards, tokens and player sheets.

Additional Components needed: 6 blank white dice (16mm), 7 blank black dice (16mm), 1 d8, 2 x 1cm wooden cubes

Optional Components: A lot of red cubes to mark damage, At least 12 black cubes to represent Invaders, 7 Player Pawns- one in each color.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Council of Blackthorn: Council Member Expansion Pack
description:
This is 2 more promotional Council Members for the game Council of Blackthorn. These were stretch goals that were unlocked during the crowd-funding campaign that all backers will receive.

The Black Widow allows you to spy on your opponents' treasonous activities while the Admiral Prestige can gamble you to riches...or ruin!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dreadball Challenge Cup
description:
The ultimate tour for the Galaxy’s Greatest Sport, as teams venture across the quarantined Hazard System, vying it out for the Challenge Cup Title. From games played in utter darkness to matches dodging deadly lava flows, it isn’t just the other team that presents a challenge in this contest! Four brutal new MVPs complete the excitement. Your campaigns will never be the same again!

This set contains:

40 Page DreadBall Challenge Cup Rulebook
Challenge Cup Map
Challenge Cup Card Deck
Challenge Cup Counter Sheet
MVP Alo-khan
MVP Blitz
MVP Eko'o
MVP Hexan

Copies of DreadBall, DreadBall Xtreme and the DreadBall Xtreme Xpansion will be required to use the various parts of this set.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Norsaga: Gen Con 2016 Promo Cards
description:
4 promotional cards from Gen Con 2016.

2 cards that expand Norsaga
Saga: Fallen Bryr - The Valkyrie (tons of Might and tons of Lore)
Saga: Fallen Bryr - The Valkyrie (tons of Craft and tons of Faith)

2 cards that expand Norsaga: Into the Myths
Legend Skald: Egretta Greyhame
Wanderer Skald: Skurl Gylfinning

Gameplay
The 2 Saga cards function identically to other Saga cards.

The new Wanderer Skald and Legend Skald hybrids function similarly to the hybrid Skalds from Norsaga: Into the Myths.

The Legend Skald obeys all rules for both Legends and Skalds. It is considered to be white, purple, red, green, blue, and yellow while it is in your hand. When played, first place an inheritance marker into it from your Saga, then it grants its Skald Embellishment. While in play on a family tree, it is considered white, purple, and the color of the inheritance marker on it.

The Wanderer Skald obeys all rules for both Wanderers and Skalds. It is considered to be a purple card. At the end of your turn, if the Wanderer Skald is in your hand, you must discard it.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era
description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

The Lock ’n Load Tactical Compendium Volume 2 collates, in a re-edited and updated format, all of the essential Modern-Era LnLT articles, maps and scenarios from every issue of Line of Fire magazine, plus some new content.

In the Compendium Volume 2 you can read indispensable articles on forces and tactics and how to deploy them in games such as Heroes of the Nam, Heroes of the Falklands, Heroes Against the Red Star and Day of Heroes. Get up to speed on modern tank tactics. Read about the Long Range Reconnaissance Patrols (LRRPs) in Vietnam and then play two scenarios that feature them. Plus, historical articles that feature tactical insights on both Heroes of the Nam and The Bear & The Jackal provide insight and perspective into mastering the scenarios in those games—and, more importantly, in how best to defeat your opponent. And much more.

Scenarios, and more gameplay, are what most gamers want, and there are over 20 in Volume 2 of the Compendium. From a bold rescue mission in the jungle of Vietnam in 1972 to the Falkland Islands in 1982 and the Cold War gone Hot in 1985, there are battles to be fought, and desperate struggles to unfold.
