With over 100 pages, over 20 scenarios and 1 map, this Compendium has something for everyone who’s a fan of the Lock ’n Load Tactical series’ Modern-Era games. And it’s all right here: One game system, one era. one place!

name: Minimal Creation
description:
Once upon a time, there were no lands, and it was the time for creation. There were two gods — the god of the sea and the god of the mountains — who created the world, but each loved their own creations more than anything else, so they came into conflict.

In Minimal Creation (a.k.a. 小さな創世記), players are these two gods and to end their conflict, they each decide to send one of their followers deep into the other's territory to steal a relic that sits there. Over the course of the game, you lay terrain tiles on the game board to expand your territory and lead your follower, moving it along the terrain to the opponent's temple in which the relic lies. The opponent loses a lot of victory points if you successfully steal their relic, but you also need to place tiles to accumulate small points along the way. How much effort you commit on expanding territory and stealing the relic will determine the outcome of the game.

When a follower successfully reaches the opponent's temple, the temple is removed and the game ends. If you have made any 2x2 squares of your territory, each square is worth one point. The temple is worth points if not removed (the invading follower destroys it). The player with the higher score wins.

Designer's summary

貴方たちは世界を創る海の神と山の神です。ある時二人は争いを始めてしまい、冒険者を相手の領域に送り込み秘宝を奪わせることで決着としようと決めたのでした。
　「小さな創世記」では相手と同一のボード上でタイルをつなげて配置して世界を創りながら、その世界の上で自分の冒険者を導き相手の神殿に向かわせます。限られたアクション数の中でこの二つの行動をどう配分するかで勝敗が分かれるでしょう。
　いずれかの冒険者が相手の神殿に到達した時点で、秘宝を失った2×2のマスがなくなりゲームが終了します。自分が司る地形が2×2マス以上にまとまっていればその面積が得点となり、得点が高い方が勝者となります。
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement
publishers: A Gamer's Studio (とあるゲーマー工房)

name: Ambyria: Starlight & Vengeance
description:
Description from the publisher:

Starlight & Vengeance is the expansion to Shroud of the Shadow Demon. Starlight & Vengeance includes two entirely new decks, represented by heroes, Melevanie and Ingduhl.

Like in Shroud of the Shadow Demon, your goal is to collect more Ember Stones than your opponent. The expansion offers new cards and strategies for you and your friends to play with.

name: Lovecraft's Revenge
description:
Lovecraft's Revenge is a tabletop game by Two Hour Wargames that plunges you into the world created by horror writer HP Lovecraft. It's about persons who dug a little too deep, driven mad by knowledge never meant for mortal minds. It's about places with thoughts and souls of their own. And it's about things whose very existence cackles at the laws of nature. These creatures defy accurate description, view people as mere insects, and can drive you out of your mind (sometimes literally) simply by standing before you.

This game can be played by any number of players; either solo, same side, or head to head.

In Lovecraft's Revenge, players control one or more characters in an rpg-like Lovecraftian adventure. Each adventure has a goal and the goal is attained by collecting clues and managing to survive the ordeal with mind and body intact. The game unfolds through a number of scenes at various general locations. Each location will likely have some kind of encounter. Some encounters will surely be of a combat nature, but others might involve solving puzzles or interacting with npc's within the adventure.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Early Bird Special Play Promo Card
description: Pre-order copies of Blood Bowl (2016 edition) ordered directly from Games Workshop received a copy of a web exclusive promo card while supplies lasted. 'The Early Bird' is a Special Play card which grants a player Pro skill for the first half of the match and a chance to be KO'd in the 2nd half.

name: SandiaMix
description: Concentration card game where the players should match the number of seeds of watermelon on the table and their hands.

name: Infinity: Uprising
description:
This is a new expansion book that will mark a before and after in the history of the Infinity Universe. Through the long-awaited JSA and Mercs, the Infinity background goes forward in a way unexpected for many. The Japanese Uprising and their schism from Yu Jing bring forth the Non-Aligned Armies (NA2), a new faction that encompasses JSA, plus StarCo, the Ikari Company, and the Druze Bayram Security, the new Mercenary Companies. Also, Infinity Uprising contains all the Dire Foes, with new material that reveals how their stories are linked and contributed to the Japanese Uprising. After Infinity Uprising, the Infinity Universe will never be the same!

This is a new book for Infinity that provides all the details about the new Non-Aligned Armies (NA2), including the mercenary companies StarCo, the Ikari Company, and the Druze Bayram Security. It also contains first-hand information regarding the Japanese Uprising and the fate of the JSA.

In this book, you will also find the background of all the Dire Foes and their seven new, ready-to-play scenarios, in normal or narrative mode and adapted to the ITS format, and the Sectorial Army Charts of the new JSA and the new mercenary companies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Castle Madness
description:
Castle Madness is a Lovecraftian inspired cult-building game in which 2-4 players take on the role of an unfamous Old One from the other dimension.

During the game, players will try to make their cult of followers grow by carefully choosing and planning their action cards and the various other cards from their library deck.

With these cards, the Old Ones can recruit more cultists, summon monsters and buildings, open en explore other dimensions to find spells and artifacts, sacrifice cultists to increase their power, ...

In the end, all these actions are done to achieve one thing: the completion of rituals. Each completed ritual is worth victory points but also brings the game closer to the end. The goal is to complete your rituals first (and score more points in doing so), before the game ends, because only the most powerful Old One can awaken to destroy the world!

—description from the designer

name: Nova Aetas: Manticore
description:
This includes a miniature, hunt missions, and the required cards to add this new enemy and new epic equipment for the heroes to the game.

Contents:
1 monster size miniature
2 prey cards
17 prey action cards
1 hunting side mission
tokens
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Trouble on the Mains
description: The first expansion for the Traveller CCG, it is a set of 60 cards that enhances piracy and provides more ways to meddle with opponents. Three copies each of 20 distinct cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: ¡Apuren el Corralito!: The Second Battle of Alihuatá, December 1933
description:
Apuren el Corralito! is a two player print and play, free game depicting the climactic battle of 2nd Alihuatá (Dec. 1933), during the Chaco War between Paraguay and Bolivia (1932-35), which ended with the surrender of the bulk of the Bolivian army in a clearing of the “chaco” bush known as Campo Vía, and resulted in the first truce in the war.

The game is a Battalion level simulation, the map depicts a 30 x 35 mile area (each hex is 1mile aprox.) and turns are 1 day each (the battle lasted for 10 days). The game includes:


280 two sided counters.
Four A4 sheets map. (Or 1 x A2 map).
One air placement auxiliary sheet.
One rulebook with playing aides.


Although the battle was mainly a one sided business, with the Paraguayan conducting three successive envelopments (thanks to initial Bolivian command sclerosis and lack of reserves), the Bolivian player still has a lot to do, husbanding his forces and trying to save as much as he can from the Paraguayan onslaught.

On the other side, the Paraguayan player must at least accomplish what historically was done: envelope and force to surrender two, out of three, Bolivian divisions and tear down the front, forcing his opponent to abandon the battle area. And this means having the noose tightened up to the end, and sticking to a strict schedule.

Being the Chaco an extensive bush country, intelligence on your enemy is a key to carrying out enveloping maneuvers. Remember that this was ”MG time” and you couldn’t just walk naively into an entrenched killing ground. The game provides rules for intelligence gathering in order to simulate surprise.

—description from the designer

name: Word Hunting
description:
'Word Hunting' (FA: اسم‌کارتیل) is a card game based on the well-known traditional pen and paper game of The Categories (DE: Stadt, Land, Fluss).

The box consists of two decks of cards: The Alphabet deck, and the Subject deck. The main goal of the game is to find a word that starts with a specific letter and related to a specific subject!

Word Hunting can be played in 4 different ways including a real-time version, a turn-based push your luck version, and a team-based version where one of the team members holds his breath (as teams timer!) while his partner tries to match the letters with subjects as fast as she can!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Drako's Adventure
description:
In Drako's Adventure each player takes on the role of Drako (in different player colors) and heads out for some adventures to find the sacred grail of meatballs!

The game is a race to get to the meatballs at the end of the map and players draft action cards and program them to walk, run, jump, fly and flamebreath in the race to be the first pet dragon to make it to the end!

There's of course obstacles to be faced with on the map, a menhir, a puddle of water or mud or a scary Elk! To make things even harder there's also vikings at some spots on the map, and since Drako loves vikings he just have to stop and admire the mighty (but bored) viking for a bit and so the player loses one of their cards in their programming.

It's also risky to be in the lead, the other dragons might breath fire and hit you wich will also result in a lost card in the programming. Also look out for bad weather as a storm cloud could stop you from flying!

To boost your movement you can eat a meatball that you brought to the adventure or found on the way through some meatball bush or meatball tree!

Whoever can handle their pet dragon the best and make it to the end first will get all them juicy meatballs and be the winner of Drako's Adventure.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Neko Harbour 2
description: Promo Card Seaside Town: An extra place to visit and see 4 penguins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Wave One Energon Edition
description:
Each Energon Edition contains:
-6 of Wave 1’s most prized character cards, printed on heavy, semi-transparent plastic with exclusive, brand-new art by fan-favorite artists:

Optimus Prime, Battlefield Legend by Marcelo Matere
Megatron, Living Weapon by Marcelo Matere
Cliffjumper, Renegade Warrior by Dan Khanna
Slipstream, Strategic Seeker by Dan Khanna
Bumblebee, Legendary Warrior by Ken Christiansen
Nemesis Prime, Dark Clone by Ken Christiansen

-3 copies each of a Battle Card tied to each of the 6 characters (total of 18), printed on foil for the very first time with brand-new art!

Agility of Bumblebee
Bombing Run
Cargo Trailer
Fusion Cannon of Megatron
Ion Blaster of Optimus Prime
Start Your Engines

-18 Energon Cube Damage Counters

-30 Wave 1 Booster Packs, contained in two storage art boxes

The Character Cards, Battle Cards, and damage counters are all housed in a beautiful, foil Energon Cube box, the lid of which also allows for a display configuration for the character cards.

The Energon Edition is the most deluxe expression of the Transformers Trading Card Game ever, and a must-have for any collector and Transformers superfan.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Tavern Brawlers: Legends of Runya Season 1
description:
You play a character in a small town, just beginning your journey towards being an adventurer. However, your town is really small (1 tavern) and there aren't very many quests or odd jobs so you have to take what you can get....even if that means occasionally just hiring on as labor at a farm.

But at night, you gather in the tavern with your fellow would-be adventurers and fight to see who is the strongest and who's training is paying off the best!

In this fast-paced dice rolling, press-your-luck style game you get to complete quests for awesome rewards, level up to get stronger and FIGHT to be the best in town!

—description from the publisher

name: Colt Express: Promo Cards
description: 13 cards for Colt Express. Although they were distributed separately as promo cards (at Brussels Game Festival 2019), these cards are identical to the Round and Train Station cards from Colt Express: Marshal & Prisoners.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Trains
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Programmed Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Presidents versus Trump
description:
Presidents versus Trump is an action-packed, fun-filled, 30-minute card game for 1-4 players. The American presidents, from George Washington to Barack Obama, are so offended by Trump sitting in their chair that they’ve all come back together to kick him out. But while the portal to the past was open, a rogue’s gallery of villains from American history, from Benedict Arnold to Bull Connor, have come back to defend Trump. The battle for the honor of the American presidency is on!

The game is shamelessly Ameritrashy, with keywords, variable powers, stuff from real history, light deckbuilding and lots of dice. It's suitable for casual play - with a partner, with coworkers and friends, as an offbeat filler option on game day, or during the commercials when streaming presidential election debates.

The designer ran a successful Kickstarter to fund artwork for the game. Final art is expected before the November election. The images uploaded here on BGG are samples of the final art.

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/presidentsvtrump/presid...

The core of the game is 24 presidents, divided up evenly among the players. Every turn, you draw five cards out of your deck and play them. Each president has a presidential power based on that president’s actual strengths (integrity, popularity, party building, policy leadership or maneuver). Presidents can also gang up to attack villains or recruit new cards into your deck.

After the other 12 villains have been defeated by the players, it’s time for a massive Final Showdown with Trump himself. If Trump captures all the presidents, he wins; if the players defeat him first, the player who is holding the most captured villains wins – but Trump himself counts as three villains for determining who wins. With this system, you can’t afford to sit back and let the other players do all the villain-fighting during the game before the Final Showdown, but in the end, victory will still hang on how well you do in that Final Showdown!

The game is already fully designed, playtested and web-published, so you can download it for print and play.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Ashigaru
description:
Ashigaru is a card game in which you have to try to gather the best and strongest army of Shogun and fight against other contenders for Shogun's position.
That's why you have to choose your forces wisely, and in the meantime, if you get a chance, hit the enemy.
The game is designed for 2 to 4 players and its rules vary from number of player.

10 samurai cards are randomly placed on the field and each player is given 5 cards. Players must count on the right side of their card based on the number on their card, and after passing the identical cards with their card number, remove their similar card from the remaining cards and add it to their board.
These cards are used to fight the end of the game and create your army. Of course, players can be killed enemy forces before the final battle by hiring ninjas and change the outcome of the battle in their favor.
Finally, the cards that the player collects from different colonies enter the battle face to face with each other, and finally, the winning cards are determined by adding the remaining card numbers.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: That's Just Wrong!
description:
You'll examine real legal cases about careless, irresponsible acts that resulted in injury and damage to property.

One player is appointed "Chief Judge" and (Step 1) draws one of the 120 Case Cards included with the game (they are intended to be played through sequentially). The Chief Judge reads aloud the basic information on the case, then directs an open discussion (Step 2). Then, at the bottom of each Case Card are one or more "Consider Questions which the Chief Judge then reads aloud (Step 3), kicking off a second discussion in light of the new topics raised (Step 4).

Eventually, each judge arrives at his or her own decision about the case (Step 5), stating it, and these are then recorded, as the Chief Judge flips the Case Card over and reads aloud the court's actual decision and reasons (Step 6).

Judges who got it right then level up from Court Level 1 to Court Level 2 (levels are points), the Case Card is discarded, the next player clockwise from the Chief Judge takes over as the new chief, and the game continues through six cases. The judge who has reached the highest Court Level wins!
As the game includes 120 legal cases, there are 20 full plays in the box, and the cases get more interesting and complicated as you go. The real-life cases were chosen because they were crazy memorable, legally important, or about everyday life.

name: Astro Wars
description:
Exciting battles in space!

Explore asteroids and planets to recover resources, move across the hyperspace, and fight your enemies across the galaxy.

You roll the die to see how many squares you can move your spaceship or space cruiser, then if you are at close range you can fire your laser, and if you are at long range you can launch your thermonuclear missiles.
The battle computer will decide the combat results. Red - target destroyed, yellow target damaged, green no damage.

You will need oxygen (to travel in hyperspace and to repair damage), titanium (to repair damage), energy for your lasers and missiles... so you have to visit planets and asteroids to gather resources.

You can also travel in hyperspace... but you risk arriving on a supernova or a meteor field, so be careful.
categories: Electronic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Warfighter: Multi-Era Expansion #1 – Soldiers and Action Cards
description:
Adds 112 Soldier Cards and new types of Action Cards to your Loadout!

This expansion provides cards for:

Modern Daylight
Modern Shadow War
Modern PMC
WWII Europe
WWII Pacific

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, World War II

name: Cato
description:
Cato is played with a standard 32-card pack. In each hand players are dealt five cards and one is turned up to determine trump.

After the deal players alternate deciding whether or not to bid (meaning they undertake to take 31 card points) or exchange. Of both players agree to exchange they each discard some cards and draw replacements. This continues until someone bids, or in the revised version published on the web, when the deck runs out the hand is played misère.

Play is standard trick-taking with players being obliged to win the trick if possible.

A game ends when someone has 121 points and match-play points are scored based on the degree of victory.

name: Bandido: Missão Impossível
description:
Bandido: Mission Impossible is a set of promo cards exclusively available in Brazilian edition.

Players choose how many (from 1 to 4) and which (5 or 6 exits) cards they will add to the base game to make it difficult to block all tunnels and prevent the prisoner from escaping!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Nanga Parbat: Hidden Objectives
description:
Score bonus points at game end by completing secret objectives with this 7-card pack.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration

name: Viewpoint Revisioned
description:
Viewpoint Revisioned, the first set in the episodic Viewniverse card game series, introduces players to the Blinkers as they are transported from Myclopia to the savage world of Triclopia. Join the Blinkers on their adventure as they attempt to avoid a grisly end to their unplanned journey. If the Blinkers escape Triclopia, catch them in the next episode - Eye vs Eye.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. Viewpoint Revisioned gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Math, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus – Etho
description: The Etho expansion puts a focus on the Theocrate faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Theocrates. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one Theocrat character, Etho.

name: Tabannusi: Builders of Ur – Tantrum House Promo
description:
Available during Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

This promo adds 3 Ship tiles and 1 Harbormaster tile

1x Size "1" ship, brown
When you place a Water tile onto a space with a printed bonus, receive that bonus (once per turn).

1x Size "1" ship, white
Whenever you Construct a Building, you may (only once) pay any 1 green Resource to place 1 Water tile and 1 Garden tile (both in the same space).

1x Size "1" ship, yellow
Whenever you Construct a Building, you may pay 1 Gold to immediately score the Building (ignoring any surrounding Gardens).

Harbormaster tile
Move up once on each Mastery track.

name: Tekhenu: Book of Challenges
description:
The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players, each adding a twist to the normal setup procedure and some additional flavor to the game play.

Ancient High-Tech
With this setup, each player receives a significant boost in the form of starting Technologies that synergize well with each other and a predetermined Decree. But do not let this powerful beginning trick you into believing that you can take a more relaxed approach to your actions. Quite the opposite! You must constantly stay alert to make sure no action goes to waste. Recommended for experienced players only.

Restricted, Yet Flexible
Here, you start with a distinctly unique Technology and a flexible blessing. This is countered by only being able to draft a single Starting card. You must exercise great care to ensure that your starting draft offers as much power and flexibility as possible. Of course, the other players will undoubtedly attempt to do the same. Recommended for experienced players only.

Wide Open Strategy
Powerful and balanced card sets and a much less restrictive Card Market truly opens up the game for a proper battle of strategic minds against each other. Recommended for experienced players only.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Mixtape Massacre: Snack Attack Killer Pack
description: Adds 3 new characters to the game. Delicious movie snacks have turned into killing fiends. The Kernal, Frank and Bubbles are on the rampage!

name: The Magnificent: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Cards
description:
Each master card will have as a bonus that for 3 coins you can move the wagon 1 to 3 spaces and the card scoring is 2 VP for each pip of a certain die color.

Each master card will be for one specific color (as well wagon as die): green, orange or purple.

Originally available as part of Pack E from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape from Sin's Curse
description:
In Escape from Sin's Curse, it is the year 2911 and the Earth is a desolate wasteland, both physically and spiritually. You are part of a group of scientists trying to figure out where everything went wrong.

Searching through an ancient library, you discover the Bible, which has been lost for centuries. After reading the story of Adam and Eve, your team of scientists decide to take a time machine back to the Garden of Eden to stop Adam and Eve from eating the forbidden fruit and putting a curse on all mankind.

Arriving on the scene just moments too late, you find yourself on a fact-finding mission to discover if there is any way to reverse sin’s curse.

Escape from Sin's Curse is an easy to learn escape room game with the cards slowly introducing players to new puzzles as the team progresses. As the team travels through time to different Biblical events, players will need to look up relevant Biblical passages to solve some of the puzzles that appear. Once Escape from Sin's Curse is solved, the team may give the game to another group since the game is reusable!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lord of the Bins
description:
Can you find the treasure in trash?

Under the tyranny of the wealthy, JunkLand has become the world’s garbage dump. This once pristine land has been reduced to a stinky landfill. But for the Lords of JunkLand this place is a goldmine. There are treasures in the trash that help them earn a living and keep the world safe and clean. They are the unsung heroes of humanity!

Lord of the Bins is a strategy card game that tests players’ knowledge about segregating trash and your ability to outwit opponents. It involves elements of hand management, placement, trick taking and push-your-luck.

How to Play?

Segregate the waste in the Trash Cards and put them in the 4 bins - dry waste, wet waste, e-waste and hazardous & sanitary waste. Remember to put them in the correct bin and collect treasure to play special powers!


Trash Marketplace - Players first collect Trash Cards from the marketplace. You can choose what to collect, but you place gems on what you skip! When you pick cards, collect gems too!
Take Out The Trash! - Once you've picked cards from the marketplace, then you can drop them in the correct Trash Bin. Either play 1 Trash Card or play any number of gems for special actions!
It's Garbage Day! - Here's the catch - Only 6 Trash Cards fit in a Bin then it's full! Also you must play the cards in a number sequence only! Gems, however, give you special powers to strategise and win!
Let's Talk Trash! - If a player puts trash in the wrong bin, you can challenge them. The loser must wear the Raccoon Hat! Best to refer to the Trash Table Card to learn Trash Item goes in which Bin.
Lowest Score, Wins! - Once all the bins are full and no players can play any gems, the game ends! Add all the Trash Cards left with you, this is your score. Player with the lowest score, wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Market, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Talisman: Harry Potter – 2022 Promo Card Set
description:
A pack of 2 promo cards for Talisman: Harry Potter to go with the 2022 localisation of the game into Italian and Polish.

Now also released as a promo pack in English.

Bezoar - Outer Ring Encounter Card

Felix Felicis - Middle Ring Encounter Card

Note: The pack will be available separately as well.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Morels: 10th Anniversary Booster Pack
description:
Contains 11 cards: 5x Chicken of the Woods, 4x Giant Puffball (Day), 1x Giant Puffball (Night), and 1x Moon. They can be added to the deck as is, or can be swapped out for the Chanterelles and their night card.

The booster pack is not planned to be sold by itself except during the Morels 10th Anniversary Kickstarter campaign.

name: Aldabas: New Professions
description:
Mini-expansion that introduces three new Professions, each with their own powers and scoring conditions.

Bankers can steal coins from other players' vaults, and they love when you use money to influence people.

Merchants multiple your profits when you gain coins, and they reward a focus on one door color.

Doctors are welcome everywhere, allowing you to switch doors from one place to another and they award points directly at the end of the game.

New Professions comes with rules for integrating it into your games, creating whole new cardplay possibilities.

name: Serviam
description:
Even if this is blasphemy, I have no regrets, all for prosperity

The tyrant has fallen ill and a power struggle is taking place. The people who have been suffering from oppression are looking forward to the arrival of the virtuoso, but as venerable merchants, we must see reality rather than dreams.
What we should think about now is how to get into the influential people of the new era.

Players embrace the powers to become the owner of a venerable merchant and solidify their position. It is also good to give a gift that the person in power likes. It is also good to use dark means. If you increase the influence of those in power with support, you will get a big reward, but sometimes you may benefit another family.
In addition to the normal mode for 2 to 4 people who can enjoy deep bargaining, a mode for 1 person is also installed.


A card game for 1 to 4 players who aims to be the best merchant with the joy of those in power.
Is it a sweet candy to prepare to outsmart the business enemies? Or is it a black envelope?


-Equipped with a solo play mode to prevent the Bazzi-Betti family's plot

The game consists of 7 rounds , during which you will play a single card from your hand to one of your available contacts alter the influence board sometimes activating unique effects and then score for the position of that contact.
at the end of the game (and after end game scoring) the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

Serviam is a hand management game in which players need to make decisions based on who they have contact with , who other players have contact with , positions of those contacts and if they should gift or threat them.

—description from the designer

name: Ducks in Tow: The Bugs & Slugs Expansion
description:
Another sunny day in the Duck Sanctuary! Along with the seeds you have been feeding the ducks, you also want to give them tasty treats. With your brand new bug jar, you're ready to collect some bugs.

The Bugs & Slugs Expansion adds player boards, duck cards and bug tokens. There will be bug tokens on the board that you can collect and feed them to your ducks. The player boards and duck cards have token slots on them. Once the token slots are all filled, they grant you special abilities that can be used on your turn.

Each duck card matches 1 of the 4 coloured rows on your location cards. At the end of the game, completed duck cards will gain you points based on the connected rows of ducks on your completed location cards.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Madrino 2
description:
Madrino 2 is a roll-and-write game where the players work for an architecture firm, attempting to design the house of a mercurial client who only informs the firm of their desires in small drips.

In this expansion for the base game, the players will now work in teams, with one player designing the first floor of a house and the other designing the second floor. The players have a limited ability to discuss their designs. The game includes components for elevating the transparent second floor design and visualizing it atop the first floor design.

The team whose plans the firm decides to present to the client wins.

name: ChronoCops: Jules Vernes Parallelwelt-Paradoxon
description:
ChronoCops is a time-travel adventure packed with wacky humor and lots of tongue in cheek. The game idea is based on point-and-click adventures in video game history. As ChronoCops, agents of the most prestigious research department for time travel, the players travel through time to famous people and places where they have to solve puzzles. To do this, you need to bring the right things together to think outside the box, clear obstacles out of the way, and work together to stop the insane Professor Knix, the former mentor of the ChronoCops.

The players explore different timelines, which can be opened up only gradually by successfully solving puzzles. Each timeline has different jump markers that players can travel to, some in the past or future, others in alternate realities. There are clues and objects hidden everywhere that the ChronoCops can collect and combine with the Chrono Decoder to use at a specific location. The group can also get tips on the back of the chrono-decoder if they get stuck.

In ChronoCops: Jules Vernes Parallelwelt-Paradoxon, mad Professor Knix has hidden himself in an inaccessible timeline. In order to stop him, the players must find Atlantis, where all timelines converge. Jules Verne can help them, but the way to him is blocked because Professor Knix has conquered the most important of all timelines: Gemini.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Memory, Storytelling

name: Votes for Women: Two-Card Promo Set
description:
A two-card promo set for Votes for Women.
Per the designer, tuck them into the Late deck for each side.

name: Dead Grandma
description:
Dead Grandma is a competitive game of inheritance, full of ruthless rivalries, and strategic sibling shenanigans.

Players will compete for their Grandma's possessions. The first player to win three possessions of one color or three possessions of different colors wins.

Each round, a possession card is revealed and players will play a number card to bid on that possession. After the initial bid, players can play action cards to help themselves get a higher score or sabotage other players. The round continues until all players have passed. After each player has passed, whoever has the highest score wins the possession card and places it in front of them.

Play continues until one player has a winning set.

-description from publisher

name: Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition
description:
Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition is the compact, streamlined version of the Ultimate Rapid Strategic Fantasy. Imagined as the love-child of fantasy tabeltop miniatures games and "explosive" party games, Reign Absolute: Umbrous Edition is about bringing the fun and excitement of competitive fantasy-themed conquest to an audience that would otherwise be put off by a grueling set of rules and complicated setup requirements.

The game is a grid based conquest game where each player has an unique set of Faction units, and the objective is to locate and defeat the opponent's Faction unit, at which point that player is eradicated from the game.

Players take alternating turns playing an Action followed by drawing a Reinforcement Card. Reinforcment Cards provide varying tactical benefits and supplement individual unit's combat strength. Aside from random draw of units during setup and the drawing of the Reinforcement Cards.

—description from the publisher

name: The Gilded Realms
description:
The Gilded Realms is a euro-style kingdom builder board game set in a medieval fantasy world, where players will be tasked with ruling over their young but ambitious kingdoms.

In this hybrid simultaneous turn-based game of economic management and risk assessment, you and up to three other players will command a unique Faction and compete for the title of ultimate regent.

Through careful planning of two builds a turn and management of your resources you must develop your five provinces and construct a thriving income, all the while, fending off competing kingdoms and the invading Sarrukar forces with your armies and fortifications.

Players can also earn Gold and Gems from successful caravan trading and management of their kingdom’s stance during economic events. Or they can send armies into other player’s Hinterlands to raid their Caravans and take Endeavour cards for themselves!

At the end of the 12th round of play, players earn prestigious titles based on their Victory Points, the highest earning the Serpens Champion and declared winner of The Gilded Realms!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Layering, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Trading

name: 隅田川 (Sumida River)
description:
隅田川 ("Sumida River") is a card-shedding game in which you can't play the same number of cards as the previous player.

The deck contains 52 cards: three 3s up to ten 10s. The game includes a swapping rule that allows you to exchange all the cards in your hand, picking up an "almighty" card each time you do so, giving you the opportunity to make weak cards stronger.

name: Speedport
description:
The best server workers gathered together to finally decide, who would be the fastest. The servers are waiting. The cables are red hot. Let the race begin!

Speedport is a dexterity game, where all that matters is your speed. Players must create patterns on their boards using cables, and only the fastest will win!

HOW TO PLAY? IT’S SIMPLE:
Take your server and 4 cables.
Put one pattern card on the table.
Lay out this pattern as fast as possible by plugging the cables into the server.
The one who arranges the pattern first needs to shout SPEEDPORT!
If the pattern matches, the pattern card goes to the player as a point.
(The game is played up to 5 points. Do not remove the cables from the server after the first round of the game).

—description from the publisher

name: Café Baras
description:
Everyone in town is looking for a cozy little café where they can relax with a good book, something to nibble on, and, of course, some delicious caffeinated beverages. As a capybara with a love for coffee, it’s always been a dream of yours to open your own shop. Now is the perfect time! But you’re not the only one opening your doors in hopes of enticing customers. Rival coffee shops are popping up all over town and it’s up to you to ensure that you have the right food, drinks, and decor to turn your drop-ins into regulars. Put together a delicious menu and decorate your shop to capture the perfect aesthetic. You just might have the busiest little café in town!

Each turn, you play a card from your hand, either buying it as a food, drink, or decor item for your café or serving the customer on the card and earning money. If you meet a customer’s needs completely, they become a Regular and earn you extra end game points!

Café Baras is a card drafting, tableau-building game brought to you by the creative team behind the critter classics Creature Comforts and Maple Valley. Designed by Roberta Taylor and featuring illustrations by Cindy Monroy, it plays 2-4 baristas in about 30 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Way of the Samurai: Roll & Write
description:
Play as Miyamoto Musashi and experience epic duels against formidable opponents!
The game is packaged in a metal spiral-bound booklet, with pages in high-quality, European-produced paper. The game book also comes with a pencil, an illustrated eraser and a bookmark (weapons).
For added variety in combat, each booklet comes with a bookmark featuring 4 different weapons. At the start of a duel, you can choose one of the 4 weapons to use against your opponent. Each weapon adds an advantage and a disadvantage throughout the fight.

name: 57th Panzer Korps: Russia, December 1942
description:
One of the keys to the decision to re-issue 48th Panzer Korps: Battles on the River Chir - Battles on The River Chir, is that Designer James Zoldak has gone forward with the companion wargame, 57th PANZER KORPS The Strong Right Hook, that deals with the struggles at Kotelnikovo and between the Rivers Aksay and Mishkova. The German thrust had to breach the Soviet blocking position at Vasilevka before Operation Donnerschlag ("Thunder Clap" -- the planned breakout by the forces in the Stalingrad pocket) could begin.

57th PANZER KORPS The Strong Right Hook presents key military challenges to both sides: The Germans know where they must go... and the Soviets know it too; The Soviets must seek to stop the relieving advance in a contest of mobile forces where the Germans have the edge in skill, but not in numbers.

57th PANZER KORPS - The Strong Right Hook contains:
one 22 by 34 inch map
200 die-cut counters
rules booklet in Counter Attack Folio Format.

57th Panzer Korps (CHS version) contains

one map (4 pieces)
one rulebook
one play aid card
2 counter sheets, mounted but not die cut
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Bonsai Games, Chris Harding Simulations, Pacific Rim Publishing

name: Imperial Stars II:  Expansion #1
description:
From the publisher:

In this first expansion kit for designer Chris Taylor’s tiny titan of a 4X game, Imperial Stars II, the wars between the imperiled human factions have received greater consideration with the addition of epic gameplay. Player options are now expanded into the realm of technological development (to make each civilization more distinctive), and development of Planetary Systems allows for some critical modification of the economic and military lay of the map.

With the enhanced narrative provided by the addition of Events each Galactic Cycle, social and political considerations are brought into play along with some old-fashioned surprises. Both sides have new Defense Satellite units, plus their own unique ships for both factions including those with Keel Guns, Torpedoes, and Phase Defense Arrays. New Planet markers add spice to the variety of discoveries, and a special Long Game scenario is also included for even more epic-ness!

There is a great new feel to the game courtesy of the smooth, elegant systems and components included in Imperial Stars II Expansion Kit 1.

name: Deadly Dinner: Killing Woodstock
description:
San Francisco, 1970: A quiet commune, a rock band and a tough motorcycle club are united by their love of music and mind-expanding drugs. Together they want to revive the legendary Woodstock Festival. But when the commune's guru is murdered, it's all over with Love, Peace and Happiness.

The host invites his guests to a communal dinner, where everyone assumes the role of a murder suspect. One of the guests has committed the murder, but they all have secrets they'd rather keep to themselves. Over three rounds, they try to get behind the secrets of the other players without making themselves suspects. The common goal is to solve the murder case - or get away with the bloody deed.

A game of Deadly Dinner consists of three rounds, in which each player gets new secret information about the crime. Players must discuss their information and clues as a group in order to identify the perpetrator in the end. To prepare, each player should receive their character's starting information a few days before playing the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Last Aurora: Promo Card Pack
description:
Do you need a new vehicle?
A crazy big weapon?
Or helpful Survivors?
No problem!

This module includes new additional cards you can add to the Exploration deck.

name: Dectana
description:
Dectana is a game of finding and defending the most valuable territories on a board made of cards. You will need to grow an army of pyramids, make best use of your hand of cards, and even invoke the powers of the board itself. Can you retain your stake at victory against your opponents’ competing endeavors?

Dectana reimplements the Icehouse games Zarcana and Gnostica (which use Tarot cards) for use with the Decktet. As in Zarcana and Gnostica, cards are played to create an abstract network of territories. Players use card powers from their hand or the board to manipulate their pyramid minions. The four suits of the Tarot are replaced with the six suits of the Decktet, making for more and different suit powers. The endgame is triggered when someone hoards, then discards, three Aces.

Complete rules and player aids available at:
http://ceruleansgames.tripod.com/dectana.htm
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Aussie-ASL '96 Pack
description:
This pack contains ten scenarios for people to do battle from China and Korea to Russia. These scenarios were designed and tested by Paddington Bears' ASL club in Australia.

PBP 1: Red Sorghum, Yellow Earth
PBP 2: The RHA at Bay
PBP 3: Children of the Kunaii
PBP 4: Driven to the Bottle
PBP 5: U.S. Forces
PBP 6: Raw Deal
PBP 7: Piece of Cake
PBP 8: Terminator
PBP 9: Last Roundup
PBP 10: First to See Will...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Valhalla: Riders of War
description:
Riders of War

Legend has it, that Sleipnir, eight-legged horse of Odin is father of the sleipnir breed. Riders of war, powerful force in the battle. Deadly, fast, almost unstoppable. They bring force and weapons to the battle, supporting their allies.

Riders of War is a Big expansion inspired by Odin’s mythical horse, as well as Asgardian warriors fighting for Odin. The expansion contains 40 cards and 18 special weapon dice.

How the expansion works?

Riders of War fall under the “deck expansion” category, but it’s bigger than any other.

When you play the game with that expansion, each player gets 3 special Riders dice and places them near their player board. They are similar to the regular dice, with one big exception – they X symbol is changed by a new, special symbol.

If you activate a Rider of War in your battle party, you get one Rider's die, roll it and add to the pool. If you manage to activate a second Rider of War in the same battle, you get 2 Rider's dice more, roll them and add to the pool.

Those special dice allow you to arm your warriors since they have regular weapon symbols.

But if you roll the special symbol, it can activate a Rider's ability. So besides adding dice to your pool, and adding strength to the battle, they also may activate a special ability.

A lot of new gameplay variability and exciting decisions in the battle.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Wicked Woods Supplement
description:
Picking your way through the Olde Woods, filled with rotting trees and haunted memories, the forest, itself, seems to want to consume you! But, there are magical items and allies to aid you in your fight against evil!

This 15 card Game Supplement for the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game is themed for the Olde Woods outside of Shadowbrook and adds new Gear, Allies, Minions, and more, some utilizing the new Roaming mechanic first introduced in the Colonial Horror Expansion. It also includes a new set of Shifting Trees and Creeping Vines cards to thwart your efforts! Explore the Olde Woods, but watch out for dangers among the darkness!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Power Void
description:
"The Monarch has died and has left a Power Void; splitting the Factions.
“Which Faction will reign supreme?"

In Power Void, you must seek the demise of your foes through murder, suggestion, and fratricide, to become the next Monarch.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Each game is randomized thanks to the use of a bag.

Files can be found at:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1_UVhvIP_WAWMJe4Q8Q6K...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Puzzle, Renaissance
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Combopolis III
description:
A 6-card combo pack that allows you to combine Agropolis and Naturopolis (to mix farmland with wilderness).

Unlike the original rules for both standalone games, this variant eliminates the use of card-passing. Rather, players shuffle each game deck individually, flipping a single card from each to reveal 2 scoring conditions. Then, a 3rd card is drawn at random from the 6-card combo pack to reveal the 3rd and final scoring condition. A separate card from this pack is used as the starting tile, displaying 2 "blocks" from those terrains included in each game respectively.

On a player's turn, they draw 1 card from each game deck and must choose 1 to play and 1 to discard. In this way, both game decks with run out at the same rate. End game occurs after the last 2 cards are drawn and played/discarded.

Players score for the largest 2 block groups from each game, lose points for individual roads, and score/lose points according to the 3 scoring condition cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Territory Building

name: Starfire: The Gorm-Khanate War
description: Starfire, The Gorm-Khanate War was an expansion to Starfire 2nd Edition (Boxed Set). This expansion introduced new rules, and a new race and empire to the game, the Empire of Gormus. In addition, it provided a campaign based on the war between Gorm and the Khanate of Orion using the campaign expansion Starfire: New Empires for Starfire 2nd Edition.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Starfire Design Studio, Task Force Games

name: The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD
description:
The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD is an operational level game.
This September battle changed the course of the war. One player (or team) controls the Allies (France and Britain), while the other controls Germany.

Contains:

11x17" hard-mounted map
Playing pieces
Rulebook
Player Aid Card

name: Imperial Skies
description:
'Imperial Skies' is a table top miniatures-based wargame of airship, dirigible, Zeppelin and aircraft battles, played out over the land, sea and skies of the early 20th Century.

"Fleets of flying ships are pitted against each other in fast-paced aerial tactical combat. Gather powerful fleets of your favourite nation including Battleships, Dreadnoughts, Cruisers, Destroyers, Aircraft, Bombers and Patrol Boats."

Imperial Skies is set in an alternate historical period ranging from the late 19th Century through 1920. Although designed around the Brigade Models 'Aeronef' line of miniature figures, the system does include guidelines for creating game profiles for original creations and figures from other miniature lines.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Nautical, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: 100 Swords: The Multi-User Dungeon Expansion
description: 100 Swords is a sword based dungeon crawling micro deck builder! The Multi-User Dungeon Expansion or (M.U.D. Expansion) adds support for additional players. (This expansion requires two of the base dungeons to play!)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory

name: Red Flags: Expansion One
description:
Have your terrible dates fallen into a stale routine? With this general Red Flags Expansion, you can re-live that first magical moment, and fall in love with your terrible dates all over again.

Red Flags: Expansion One adds 75 perks and Red Flags to your game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Netherlands East Indies: 1941 to 1942
description:
Netherlands East Indies: 1941 - 1942 is an operational wargame of the campaign in 1941-42 in which the Japanese seized control of the Dutch colonial empire in the South Pacific. NEI is a combined naval-air-land campaign, in which operational capabilities can be decisive. The game system shows the effects of various operations over the course of a scenario. Players conduct Actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence and other operations. A player can conduct one or more Actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system. The system shows the interaction of naval, air and land forces. At stake: the resources of the South Seas and the gateways to the Indian Ocean and Australia.

Originally published in World at War magazine #87 (Dec 2022 - Jan 2023).

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 weeks
Square: 245 miles / 400 kilometers
Units: Regiment/Groups/Fleets

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (176 5/8" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 1 or more
Playing Time: 2-4 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

name: Sagrada: Promo 16 – CuseCon 2021 Window Pattern Card
description: A new promotional, double-sided window pattern card distributed at CuseCon in 2021.

name: Endangered: Monarch Butterfly Scenario
description:
The march of humankind’s progress threatens the survival of Monarch Butterflies. It's up to you and your team to save them!

Work with your fellow conservationists to save the Monarch Butterflies from extinction, featuring a new 'drop' mechanic as the butterflies move through the environment on their annual migration.

This is an expansion for Endangered and requires the base game to play.
categories: Animals, Dice, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Battleground Historical Warfare: Alexander vs. Persia
description:
This is an expansion for the Battleground system, although it can be played as a stand-alone game since it contains both opposing armies and the rules, containing the armies of Alexander the Great and the Persian Empire and explores Alexander's invasion of Persia. Alexander vs. Persia is compatible with all other Battleground armies; each AvP army can be played against any others in the Battleground system.

To simulate Alexander and his generals leading from the front, the Alexander army features the ability to attach general-specific command cards to a unit and then to replay the card on that unit. The large and relatively unwieldy Persian army enables its general to sacrifice command actions at the start of the game in order to receive extra points for army building.

There are official solitaire rules for the Battleground series of games downloadable at the company website.

name: Fortress
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to collect the specified gold pieces (depending of the number of players) and move any player out of the fortress.... or to be the last surviving player.

Each player places four men on the board, which is a map of the fortress.

On each turn, a player does four phases
Movement phase - determined by roll of the dice. You can move any or all of you men.

Combat phase - you fight with anyone you have moved next to.
combat is fought with dice. The number of dice thrown is determined by the type of character. The loser of the roll must move back one square... the attacking character eliminates his opponent by winning 10 rolls (or he can't back up any more)...losing one means he stops fighting.

Spellcasting phase - If you have a spell casting card, you may play it now.

Collection phase - If you are on a treasure coin you can take it and exchange it for a treasure card.

name: Take it Away
description:
Take it Away was published in A Gamut of Games. A word by Sid Sackson:
"Take it Away is the name of the game and not, I hope, the verdict of the reader. Compared to Focus and Network, which demand extreme concentration to be played at the highest level, Take it Away can, and should, be played in a relaxed manner."

Take if away is based on Solitaire but is designed for up to four players. It uses a checkers board and poker chips in different colors. The first player take the first chip and creates a hole in the board, then the play continues with each player doing a solitaire-like move. Each chip captured counts to that player score, different colors have different values.

Any player can give-up playing at any time, except the last, that must continue play until no more moves are allowed. This last player has a penalty to his score based the chips remaining on the board.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Schwerpunkt: Volume 15
description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play by the Tampa ASL Group.

Expands:
