Karcag, Hungary, 12 October 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Marignan 1515: la chevauchée de François 1er en Italie
description:
Marignan 1515: la chevauchée de François Ier en Italie (Marignan 1515: the ride of Francis I in Italy) is the new opus of the “Gold & Steel” series started with Les guerres de Bourgogne (Wars of Burgundy).

This is an historical simulation of the 5th War of Italy - July 1515 to February 1517 – featuring Marignano battle: a French victory that shapes the relationships with the Swiss confederacy for centuries in ending their supremacy on battlefields and will reach this year its 500th anniversary

One player leads the French armies and their allies (Republics of Venetia and Genoa and the other one is in command of the Swiss Confederacy and its allies – the Holly League - (Papal states, Duchy of Milano, Holly Roman Empire, Kingdom of Spain). The goal of both of them is to take control of the Duchy of Milano and Venetian territories hold by the Empire, win pitched battles or major sieges, and neutralise the opponent's allies.

One key element of the game is collecting enough resource each turn (the gold) to pay all the mercenaries troops (the steel); German landsknechts and Swiss soldiers. Otherwise they will quit the battlefield… The money can be used to neutralize enemy allies as well.

This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map representing Northern and Middle Italy and units fighting on a tactical map featuring a typical XVIth century battleground. Units are men-at-arms, pikemen, crossbowmen, halberdiers, harquebusiers, swords & bucklers, jinetes and stradiots (both light cavalrymen) pioneers, cannons, from 1,500 to 2,000 men at full strength, 750 to 1,000 horsemen or 100 cannons of all calibres. The specifics fighting elements of that period are added with tactical chits (rolling shots, infantry or cavalry charges, harassment, ditch, fence, clash of pikes, feint, hedgehog, cannon battery, etc.), arms combination – early Tercios - and events such as rain, snow, minor ally no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment, no money no mercenaries, Alle Freunde (all friends). Optional rule includes a hidden crossing of the Alps Mountains.

The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Kingdom of France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) Strategic move
3) Attrition phase
4) Combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Holy League
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: NecronomiCards: Volume 2
description: The first expansion to NecronomiCards. Match arcane symbols to summon elder gods, demons, & mythological monsters. Vol 2 adds new strategic elements & up to 8 player games.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Gang War II
description:
This supplement includes new rules for Necromunda: Underhive (2017).

Gangs of House Orlock: Rules and background for the House of Iron.

Hired Guns and Hangers-on: Adds additional characters to your gang.

Underhive Perils: Rules for using the Badzone Delta-7 tile set.

Dramatis Personae: Pre-generated profiles for a cast of characters that bring the underhives to life.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: It's a Wonderful Kingdom: Promo Pack
description:
5 promo cards/Promo kaarten (5 kaarten) with images and no text.

2x Steengroeve / Stone quarry

1x Huurlingen / Mercenaries

1x Paleis / Palace

1x Doolhof van Fenhror / Maze of Fenhror

name: Battlecrest: Korvu – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Skullcleaver. The Moving Mountain. Peerless Champion of the Drakundra. Korvu has earned many titles over a lifetime of brutal combat. Though many have tried to topple this living legend, the Sakkan fighter has never been defeated. His up-close fighting style is as direct as his philosophy: the first battle you lose is the last.

Components:

Korvu Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 4 Action cards.
Korvu AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fairy Concerto
description: In Fairy Concerto, players vie for the best orchestra for their concert. Players will draft fairies to meet orchestra requirements. Players can also earn points from set collecting.

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Unspeakable Pages Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Some secrets should never be brought to light... Murder, madness, and terrible realities haunt the pages of Abdul Alhazred's horrifying tome, the dread Necronomicon.

The "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game moves to its penultimate Asylum Pack, The Unspeakable Pages. The game's rival factions delve into four versions of the Necronomicon, and a host of new characters seek to gain power from its secrets. Meanwhile, the ignorant masses continue their mundane routines, blissfully unaware of the Ancient Ones, monsters, and magicians who seek this dark knowledge to manipulate reality itself. While the key to the fate of the world may lie in Abdul Alhazred's dread tome, the "Revelations" cycle moves toward its climactic finale. Sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) deepen the game's eerie Lovecraftian horror as cultists, lunatics, and investigators all delve into The Unspeakable Pages!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: The War of the Empires 1914-1918
description:
The War of the Empires 1914-1918 is a turn-based board-wargame for up to 6 players, with two confronted sides: Central Powers vs Entente (the number of players on each side doesn't need to be equal). The number of army units of every country in the game is proportional to the real military powers at the begining of the First World War. This is Sven Nemet's game before he become a boardgame geek (it was made in 1997). The duration of the game can be up to 4 hours, but there are also shorter versions, for example Russian empire against Austria-Hungary for 2 players (cca. 45 minutes).
Die is used for fighting, but bonuses can be added to the number rolled on die if you: have a double number of units in a fight, have surrounded your enemy, have modernized your units, have used a tactical advantage card…
You can buy infantry, ships, planes, harbours...
Both sides draw event cards in every round – Russian winter, famine, the possibility to get some neutral country to fight on your side, American intervention etc.
There is the factor of luck in the game, but hey, it adds to the excitement!

Go and let the best one win!
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: The Second World War
description:
The Second World War is a grand-strategic, historical simulation game about World War II. Players represent the major powers involved in the conflict and have at their command the forces with which to wage war and achieve victory for their country or alliance.

The game covers the European, North African, and Pacific Theaters on three maps and four counter-sheets.

Difficulty is rated at a 6 out of ten, ages 12 and up.

Design Notes:
The Second World War was prototyped by Peter Bertram and Randall Mac Innis in 1985. It was originally envisioned as a medium-complexity wargame to fall somewhere between the existing designs, Axis and Allies and World in Flames, which were either too pedestrian for us hard-core, grognard wargamers or too massive to be played within the confines of our housing. This final version is exactly what we envisioned when we started: a fun game about WWII with a lot of meat, but not so complicated that you need to be an accountant to enjoy it.

The game scale, the 3-map composition, and the use of megahexes to regulate naval movement were originally set by Peter and Randall. They are the only elements that remained intact throughout development. While designer John D. Powers had to make many trade-offs between realism and playability, the latter was the primary concern. Once the nuances of the system are understood and exploited by all players, you will find that historical strategies will yield surprisingly historical results.

I hope that players find it to be enjoyable, and despite its high-level, granular view, the most accurate grand strategic game about WWII yet to be published.

What You Get

2 22x34 inch full color maps
1 17x22 inch full-color map
4 Full-color, die-cut sheets of 5/8 inch counters
1 Book of Rules
1 Book of Scenarios
Charts and Tables
Dice


(source: One Small Step website )
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Producer
description: As producers of their own movies in the aptly named Producer, players scramble to hire actors; line up plot elements such as characters, problems, and resolutions; and toss in a few bonus items such as costumes in order to make the best movie they can. They can trade with other players or sabotage those competing productions. The final round starts when the first player wraps, and victory is a combination of cards played and how well each player tells the story of her movie.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Brass Empire: Kickstarter Promo Expansion
description:
Brass Empire: Kickstarter Promo Expansion contains 21 Promo Cards from the original Brass Empire Kickstarter. The set expands every corporation's identity with powerful corporate ID cards, a gadget, a new faction reserve card and a unique mining platform for all 5 factions (20 cards). It also includes a Single Player Boss Card: The Pirates of the People which is a unique solitaire variant and challenge for the game.

This item was originally only offered to Kickstarter backers and people ordering directly from the publisher.

name: Widower's Wood: Dead Men Walking
description:
THE CLUTCHES OF DEATH BECKON…

An ancient cult of necromancers stirs throughout the darker reaches of western Immoren and bids the dead to rise up against the living. From the crumbling subterranean passages of the Undercity to the swamps of the Widower’s Wood, these masters of death work toward unseen ends more nefarious than any might imagine. Only those brave few willing to face their own mortality can have any hope of stopping the sinister plots unfolding in the shadows. Steel yourself and prepare to send wraiths, boneswarms, and other unspeakable horrors back to the grave!

The Dead Men Walking expansion contains six new scenarios that pit players against hosts of undead servants and their ﬁendish masters. These compelling scenarios can be played on their own or mixed into the larger campaigns of The Undercity and Widower’s Wood.

—description from the publisher

name: Scoffton
description:
Welcome to Scoffton, can we get you some bread?
You have just stepped back in time into the worst All You Can Eat buffet in town, Scoffton. Nothing has changed here since 1985, including the prawns!
Will you have the intestinal fortitude to bring home the bacon in this souper restaurant romp by gaining the most Value For Money points?
Plan ahead by matching recipes on the Menu Selection cards to score serious Value For Money!
Push your luck at the Claw Machine for the chance to win RAD prizes!
Win the game by being the player to extract the most Value For Money from this less than salubrious establishment all whilst avoiding Management’s shameless attempts to fill you up on bread. 
And whatever you do don’t eat the poisoned prawn!

Scoffton is the worker placement game of belly management that takes about 60 minutes to play and can accommodate 2-4 players, age 10+.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Fireteam Zero: Operation Harbinger
description:
Play an all new multi-mission Operation!

Forward observer base Gecko near Tobruk is reporting sightings of watchers just outside their perimeter. Army intelligence is discounting the reports due to the insistence of the men that the watchers are "devils" and chalking the reports up to battle stress.

Despite being unable to match the descriptions to known entities, Division Zero HQ is convinced that something is very wrong at Gecko. Survive 3 new Acts in Operation Harbinger and discover the fate of Forward Base Gecko.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Geisha
description:
In Geisha, each player will seek to become the geisha with the best reputation in Kyoto. For this, it is necessary to practice different arts: Haiku (poetry), Ikebana (floral arrangements), Ocha (tea), Shamisen (musical instrument) and Uta (singing). The more these arts are practiced, the better the attributes of the geisha: patience, discipline, creativity, dedication and elegance. These attributes will allow the geisha to travel to many teahouses throughout Japan and gain even more reputation.

The player will do so by placing three workers each turn. The spaces to place workers are unique minigames to practice arts and improve their attributes or go to teahouses throughout Japan to directly raise their reputation. At the end of the game, the player who has visited more prefectures will have a better reputation.

The game lasts for 12 rounds, marked with an incense. It marks the duration of a geisha's tea ceremony in reality, so this game takes that idea to mark the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (Translated)

En Geisha, cada jugador buscará convertirse en la geisha con mejor reputación de Kyoto. Para ello, es necesario practicar distintas artes: Haiku (poesía), Ikebana (arreglos florales), Ocha (té), Shamisen (instrumento musical) y Uta (canto). Mientras más se practiquen estas artes, mejores serán los atributos de la geisha: paciencia, disciplina, creatividad, dedicación y elegancia. Estos atributos a su vez permitirán que la geisha pueda viajar a muchas casas de té a lo largo de Japón y ganar aún más reputación.

El jugador hará lo anterior colocando tres trabajadores cada turno. Los espacios para colocar trabajadores son distintos minijuegos para practicar artes y mejorar sus atributos o bien ir a casas de té a lo largo de Japón para subir directamente su reputación. Al final del juego tendrá mayor reputación el jugador que haya visitado más prefecturas.

El juego tiene una duración de 12 rondas, marcadas con un incienso. Èl marca la duración de una ceremonia de té de una geisha en la realidad, así que este juego retoma la idea para marcar el final del juego.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Memory, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Franchise: Queenie 2 – Rewards
description: Franchise: Queenie 2 is a mini-expansion for Franchise that adds twenty reward tiles and two reward tokens to the base game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building

name: Snake Oil: Crude Oil
description:
ADULT EXPANSION: Combine this Crude Oil adult expansion pack with the Snake Oil party game to spice up play with 3-10 players age 17+. Gameplay lasts 20-30 minutes.

MATURE CONTENT: Includes 170 new edgy Word Cards and 15 adult Customer Cards (30 customers). Mix with Snake Oil core game for over 15 million new NSFW play combinations!

—description from the publisher

name: Warfighter: Modern PMC Expansion #45 – More Money!
description:
Adds 56 cards to your PMC core game! Includes a little bit of everything from PMC Soldiers to Action cards!

-description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: The Hunters & The Hunted
description:
When the celebrations and dancing have ended for the night, the citizens of Rio de Janeiro wander home, but in the darkness and afterglow, danger lurks: Coteries of vampires seek their prey, while Hunter cells research and investigate the unknown.

Rivals is an expandable card game for 2-4 players based on the popular roleplaying game set in the World of Darkness. Each player controls a group of vampires or Hunters who seek to dominate their Rivals by attacking their foes, starting Conspiracies, advancing Agendas, and hunting mortals and monsters. Both Hunters and vampires can appear in the same game, so be ready for anything!

Vampire: The Masquerade – The Hunters & The Hunted is a new core set that contains everything you need to play right out of the box, including four pre-constructed player decks: 2 Hunter Cells (Faithful & Inquisitive) and 2 Vampire Clans (Ministry & Caitiff). The game includes a crypt pack with additional cards to customize your decks.

—description from the publisher

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – CHAPTERS: Items Booster
description:
This set of 12 unique cards for Vampire: The Masquerade — CHAPTERS are items that will enhance and ease your gaming experience.

A bit overpowered, and surely collector!

This pack was available in the CrowdOx Pledge Manager to help raise funds to cover additional shipping costs of the Kickstarter.

name: Thunderstone Quest: Dragon Whelps
description:
A Monster Pack (Level 3) available during Kickstarter campaigns.

Includes:
- 2x separators (one in cardboard and one in plastic)
- 15x monster cards

name: Woodcraft: Spielbox Promo Cards
description:
Two cards that are part of Spielbox 04/2023.

They are:

An early-game helper: Cost: 3 blueberries. Gives you in each income phase 1 production of a helper.
A late-game order: It starts at 2 reputation. Fulfillment requires a value 1-die of each of the 3 different colors. The reward is 3 blueberries.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spirit
description:
Spirit, the game of mysterious communication around a Divination Table.
Mediums and spirit communicate on the Divination Table. Their goal? To evoke the past life of the spirit, discover what matters to it, and thus help it reach the Beyond.

Cooperation, delicacy, and sensory listening put you in connection with the spirits.

Sit around the table and trust your sensitivity, you are about to communicate with someone who requires your help.
In Spirit, become a Medium or Spirit and learn to exchange silently, not with words, but with the tip of your finger. If you let everyone express themselves and take their place in this strange discussion, you will manage to save many Spirits...

Question the Spirit.
Decipher its answers.
Deduce its dearest wish.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Finale Ending, Point to Point Movement

name: The Cubes of Europe
description:
As a European noble with a small amount of land, you have big dreams of becoming a European noble with a significantly larger amount of land. Cleverly use dice to acquire and place unique cubes, manipulate the game state with their special effects, and score as many points as possible by the end of the game.

Disclaimer: This game is directly inspired by Stefan Feld’s The Castles of Burgundy. My goal with this project is to instill that large experience into a solo game that is still playable and fun, using only nine cards, some dice, and a ton of cubes.

—description from the designer

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module P6 – The Galactic Smorgasbord
description:
Description from the back of the cover:

All new challenges for Star Fleet Battles, F&E, Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Assault!

The Early Years: The Paravian Raptor Light Cruiser with its fiery Quantum Wave Torpedoes is here to kill Gorns or die trying!

The Vudar Enclave: A subject race rebels against the Empire! Their War Destroyer rampages through Klingon space with Ion Cannons blazing, protected by the Ion Pulse Generator.

New Weapons and Rules: Megaphasers! Megaphotons! Mini-photons! Stonefish Drones ! High Energy Decelerations ! Comets get in your way! Drag Space got you down?

New Scenarios: A Crab inhabits the nebula and will eat your ship for lunch! An alien Derelict ship deserves investigation. Can you escape the Ambush Over Remus?

The Hispaniolans: A new simulator race armed with the rapid-fire Proton Torpedo and Gatling Phasers, complete with four new SSDs!

New Ships: Dreadnoughts, Cruisers, War Destroyers, and variants will bring the Deltans, Britainians, Canadi’ens, and Flivvers into your campaign! The Frax join in with their new X-Ships!

New Stuff for Prime Directive (Vendetta) and Federation & Empire (ships from R6)!

Designer Notes: Just what will be in Module V – Operational Movement, Module C3A – The Andromedan Threat File, Module X2 – Second-Generation X-Ships, the Tactical Intelligence Handbook, the Ship Comparison Chartbook, and Star Fleet Assault? Answers are here!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: First Strike
description:
This is a DTP game, with a sticky back counter sheet to mount. It is a two-player game set in 1983, with one person playing the U.S., and the other person playing the Soviet Union. The game comes with two programmed scenarios, Bolt from the Blue (a one turn scenario) and First Strike (standard ten turn scenario) and instructions for varying the First Strike scenario if desired.

As would be expected in a game featuring nuclear war, it is quite possible for both players to lose utterly. Also, one side can lose utterly, while the other side may not achieve "victory conditions" in game terms. All involved in the design and production of this game make it clear that if this hypothetical situation had played out, incredible horrors would have been unleashed upon the world and there would not have been any winners in any real sense.

From the designer:
"First Strike is a game about thermonuclear war between the superpowers during the Cold War, in November 1983. This is based on actual historic incidents and persons wishing to become acquainted with them can read 'Comrade Kryuchov's Instructions', about Operation Ryan, or 'War Scare: Russia and America on the Nuclear Brink'"
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Two Khans
description:
Two Khans is a quick hidden identity and deduction game based on intelligence, accuracy and quick awareness.

In this game time is against you and each player only knows the identity of ONE other player. Now it’s up to players to figure out who’s who and find their way to find Khans. Whichever team first finds and kills the other team’s Khan, wins.

Story: The story goes back to thousands years ago in Persia, where the king is dying and has no relative successor to take the throne. If the king dies, his Senior Minister will take the throne but the problem is that the king does not trust any of his staff, specially the Senior Minister! So he writes two secret letter to the two famous khans of north and south, explaining the reason and inviting them to his palace…
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Shuri and Okoye
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Shuri and Okoye allows you to add two new characters to the Marvel: Crisis Protocol miniatures game.

Shuri – sister to T’Challa, the Black Panther – has proven herself a hero through her innate genius and fierce dedication to her people. With her spirited personality and intellectual prowess, Shuri has become the top innovator and inventor within the technologically advanced nation of Wakanda, and she puts her innovations to good use to defend her home and its people by whatever means necessary.

One of Wakanda’s greatest warriors, Okoye proudly protects her country’s king and his family alongside the Dora Milaje, Wakanda’s elite royal guard. As wise as she is deadly, Okoye stands as one of T’Challa’s most trusted allies and companions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare
description: This is the Silent Death Supplement for running tournament and events.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: 拉斯維加斯 Las Vegas
description:
In Las Vegas, each player has eight dice of a different color, which they take turns rolling. When you roll your dice, you can choose to place them on the relevant casino cards; for example, a die showing a 1 will be placed on the casino mat marked "1". You must place all dice of one number on one casino in your turn. All players take turns doing this until all the dice have been used. Finally, the player with the most dice on each casino card takes the money associated with it. In case of a tie, the next non-tied player takes the highest-valued money card at that casino.

The Boulevard expansion includes:
Eight dice in two new colors to allow for up to seven players.
A purple die for each player that allows you to remove an opponent's or own die when placed (with enough purple dice to have up to eight players).
A large die in each color, except purple, that counts as two dice when determining who scores at a casino.
Two white dice to play the basic variant with up to 7 players.
Rules for playing a solitaire version of the game.
Rules for playing a variant of the game.
Bills worth $100,000.
Bills worth $50,000 for each bill of a specific color you collect.
One-shot action cards, with each player receiving one such card at the start of each round.
Special cards of variable random value.
A new, seventh casino; on a turn, a player can place all the dice he rolled of a single number in this casino, but then no more dice of this number can be placed in this casino by any player.

name: Kettle Hill
description:
Kettle Hill is a narrative solitaire wargame that tells the story of the U.S. Cavalry during the Battle of San Juan Hill on July 1, 1898. In the game you take on the role of a Color Sergeant in either the Tenth U.S. Cavalry (the Buffalo Soldiers) or the First U.S. Vol. Cavalry (the Rough Riders).

Using action dice, operation cards, and strategy you must lead your fellow soldiers to the top of Kettle Hill and San Juan Hill by the end of the last Round.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: On to Moscow Solitaire
description:
The Axis invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941 had the goal of ending the war in one massive quick campaign. They believed Leningrad, Moscow and southern Russia could be occupied within four to six months, bringing the war to a close, thus altering the course of World War II. In December 1941, the harsh Russian winter ended the campaign with the Axis armies on the outskirts of Leningrad and Moscow, near but ever so far from achieving their goal.

Now you are in command and the decisions are yours…

On to Moscow Solitaire has 25 game plays. It is a World War II strategic game that highlights the Axis campaign waged in the Soviet Union from June through December 1941 and the other theaters of war that influenced that campaign.

All you need to provide is 2 dice, a pen, and a sense of adventure to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Dice, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Planet Hysteria
description:
Planet Hysteria is a game of hidden identities for 5-15 people. Depending on a few modular game mechanics, it can take anywhere from 1-3 hours to play.

In the game, you are a group of specialists sent to terraform a new planet, and the survival of the human race depends on you. On the last day of your mission, your shuttle was destroyed. This left you stranded on a planet that is about to be transformed, killing you but terraformimg humanity's new home. At that moment, you realized the planet was already inhabited by a shape-shifting alien race, and it's natives won't give up without a fight.

The game is broken up into two phases, a morning and an evening. In the morning, players take actions to repair equipment and maintain the group's health and sanity. In the evening, players discuss a course of action. Those two phases make up a day, and players only have a few days to root out the aliens that have infiltrated the group.

The game ends when the shuttle is repaired and players vote to leave. If all people on board are human, humans win. But, if humans failed to test enough players, and even one hidden alien is on board... Aliens win.

And to make the game even more panic ridden, each in game location is in a different real world location. That means that every morning, things are happening in secret; and you have to judge for yourself if the other players are lying or telling the truth. Two humans may go to a location, but if one is a hidden alien, two aliens might come back. Without developing tests and merciless interrogation, you will never know.

Only trust what you've seen with your own eyes, because even the most helpful human might be an alien vying for a seat on the shuttle.

name: Beneath
description:
BENEATH - an underground adventure for 1-4 dwarves (2-4 players with the core game)

A board game of sometimes-cooperative mining and mayhem in a quest to restore the Dwarven Kingdom. 1-4 players, 60 min. per player.

In Beneath players take on the roles of brave but ruthless Dwarves seeking untold riches and the crown of the Dwarven Kingdom. Mining, trapping, stealing and fighting through the uncharted passages beneath the city of Stonewatch, players race to be the first to find the legendary King’s Gift, a vein of ore so valuable the Dwarf that finds it will be crowned ruler of all the Dwarves, if they can survive both the monsters and their own colleagues...

Only time will tell if you have what it takes to survive what lies beneath.

Beneath is easy to set up. Each dwarf has a unique player board to track their equipment and abilities. Each scenario map in the campaign shows exactly how to set up the challenges your dwarves will face, creating a uniquely 3D board for each step of your adventure.

Once players select their Dwarves, each with unique abilities, they can further personalise their strategy by purchasing weapons, items and skills from their local merchant. Whether you prefer your treasure hacked from the lifeless bodies of your enemies, or thieved from the pockets of your fellow Dwarves, Beneath lets you Dwarf the way you want to Dwarf.

Fully equipped, players they take turns as they journey through the mines, digging through rock and ancient granite, searching for treasure that all Dwarves crave and monsters to slay. A streamlined skills system keeps play dynamic and exciting whilst allowing incredible breadth in how your particular dwarf faces the dangers below.

But what good is treasure if you’re not alive to spend it? Each foray into the world of Beneath is also a race to find your way back out and do so with pieces of ancient scroll that show the way to the King’s Gift.

With enough pieces of scroll any dwarf will win the game, but there’s no honour among dwarves in the dark catacombs, and no crown for second place. Pinching those pieces of scroll from each other? ‘Accidentally’ blowing up your fellow miners, blocking the exit to tie your shoelaces whilst your friend is slowly devoured by a colossal tremor worm? First rule of mining – they can’t submit a formal complaint if they’re inside a giant worm. This is semi-cooperative dungeon crawling at its most semi.

With enough pieces of scroll any dwarf will win the game, but there’s no honour among dwarves in the dark catacombs, and no crown for second place. Pinching those pieces of scroll from each other? ‘Accidentally’ blowing up your fellow miners, or blocking the exit to tie your shoelaces whilst your friend is slowly devoured by a Gigantic Igadon?

First rule of mining – they can’t submit a formal complaint if they’re inside a giant reptilian. This is semi-cooperative dungeon crawling at its most semi.

name: Football Resurrection
description:
Football Resurrection is a collectible trading card game based on Association Football (Soccer). It combines card collecting and trading with game play that requires both strategy and skill.

Two players go head to head in a game of football, with each directing their own personalized team. Through collecting uniquely designed footballer character cards, each with their own special skills, players have a limitless choice of strategies and tactics so no two games are ever the same.

Play centres on taking alternate turns to build your footballer character cards into attacking and defending moves whilst the footballer character special skills enable you to enhance your moves or disrupt your opponents.

There are no restrictions placed on formations or style of play. You can pick a team of bruisers with special skills like "Body check" and "Thundering tackle" or try to cheat your way to victory with "Covert cynical tackle" and "Diver cheat" or play the classy way with "Playmaker" and "Attacking pace" or blend them altogether.

It's a language-level2 game as play centres on the text on the cards, although once payers become familiar with their cards this text is seldom used.

The first release of cards is entitled "Hell In The Pacific - The Unity" and includes 81 unique footballer character cards from 40 countries. These first edition cards may be hard to come by as the publishing company is rolling the game out through Hobby stores, Bookshops and Football Club Shops in the UK on a regional basis.

Further releases of cards "New Blood" and "The Final Conflict" which increase the number of strategic and tactical permutations are scheduled for 2009 and 2010.

Home Page: http://www.footballresurrection.com
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Sports
publishers: Portal Games Ltd, Sneaky Prawn Games

name: Zum Kuckuck
description:
The eggs lay hidden in the nests. Each player has to find out where the 3 eggs of his color are located. Whoever has collected 3 "Nest cards", is allowed to take his eggs out of the nests. But, woe, you got the egg of a cuckoo!
Each player who has collected 3 nest cards, is allowed to turn his 3 eggs over during his turn. Winner is the player with 3 found eggs.

name: Kyoto Shogi
description:
Kyoto Shogi is a Shogi variant played with specialized pieces on a 5x5 board. Its most unusual feature is that every move ends by "promoting" (flipping) the piece moved.

The pieces in Kyoto Shogi are non-standard pairings of standard Shogi units:

Tokin / Lance
Silver General / Bishop
King
Gold General / Knight
Pawn / Rook


Rules for dropping are the same as in the closely related game, Microshogi.

name: Panzer Corps (2)
description:
The second game of the Panzer Korps system. It's a very simple & playable Game system.

It portrays the battles of:

Smolensk (all editions)
Market Garden (all editions)
Gazala (in the second and third edition only)


Translated in English.


First edition was published as Command Magazine Japan #74 in 2007.
Second edition was published as Command Magazine Japan extra "Command The Best" #13 in 2013.
Third edition was published as Command Magazine Japan extra "World War Series" #9 in 2020.

Banner Of War published Chinese edition in 2019.
publishers: Banner Of War, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Raiders of the North Sea: The Old Heroes
description:
Raiders Promos:
1 x Hero: Rod & Pep
1 x Hero: Ceedee
1 x Hero: The Meeple Men

Note: All 3 of these promos were originally offered separately. This pack is designed for those who missed out on getting them originally. The card stock may vary slightly compared to the original game, but the card size is identical.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: X MAS M.T. Motoscafi Esplosivi
description:
Solitary game on the attacks of the X Flotilla MAS against the Royal Navy bases of Malta and Suda Bay, in Crete.

Parabellum magazine X, Spring 2022

name: Bastille: Queenie 3
description: Bastille: Queenie 3 gives each player one new influence tile numbered 5 to their supply. This tile, once acquired, is very powerful and can gain you a lot of coins or spaces on the bastille track, and it can make convincing people to fight for your cause even cheaper.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game

name: Zen Solo
description:
ZENタイル ソロ (ZEN Tiles Solo) is a solitaire board game that challenges you to look at yourself objectively while placing emotion tiles on a 24-hour timeline.

To win, you need to find a spot to place twenty different emotion tiles above these time boards, so think carefully about "your yesterday". You might have become happy about yourself — "I had a positive thoughts!" — or were perhaps surprised: "I didn't realize that I have negative feelings every time when I see this person."

"Knowing yourself" is one of the most important processes to find a way to make our life better, and it is ZEN. Giving five minutes each day to yourself to play this game alone in a quiet place and listen to your soul could be good meditation for the people who feel tired every day.

ZEN Tile Solo is a game through which you can learn your hidden emotions and organize them to make your life calmer and better.
publisher's summary

ZENタイル ソロ (Zen Tiles Solo) published in 2019, has wooden components in a small, silver foil stamped box. It is a one player game. There are 20 Emotion Tiles, a time track and 1 Elegant Stone. The rules are in English and Japanese, with both languages shown on the Emotion Tiles. ZenTiles are from Fukui Prefecture, where the Eiheiji Temple, also known as the birthplace of Zen, is located.
user summary

name: Panzer Grenadier: Siege of Leningrad
description:
From the publisher's web page:
For 900 days, German troops ringed the city of Leningrad, trying to capture the Cradle of the Revolution while Soviet soldiers and militiamen fought just as desperately to keep them out. Nazi savagery caused the deaths of well over a million civilians.

Repeated assaults failed, as did Soviet attempts to break the siege. "St. Petersburg," raged Adolf Hitler, "must be erased from the face of the Earth." Not until January 1944 did the Red Army finally drive the Germans back from the city's outskirts.

Siege on Leningrad is a supplement based on the German assaults on Leningrad's defenses, and the Soviet attempts to re-open communications.

Mike Perryman has designed ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles that took place along Leningrad's defensive perimeter.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front and Road to Berlin games and Red Warriors and Sinister Forces supplements.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series

Expands:

Eastern Front: A Panzer Grenadier Game
Road to Berlin: Platoon Level Combat in World War II – A Panzer Grenadier Game
Red Warriors
Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Make-a-Million
description:
A partnership trick-taking game, which includes rules for up to eight players. In the partnership game the object of each side is to capture tricks. Players have both Number and Money Cards and try to capture tricks where Money Cards have been played. The side first scoring a total of a million dollars wins. The privilege of naming trump color and collecting a face down widow go to the highest bidder. Failing to meet a bid means that a partnership loses the amount of their bid from their score.

In addition to Number and Money Cards, players must reconcile with three special cards: the Tiger, the Bull, and the Bear. The Tiger card (the most powerful card in play) gives players an automatic highest trump, while at the same time functioning as a wild card. The Bull allows players to double the value of the current trick, while the dreaded Bear cancels the values of the current trick.

Rules include variants for 4, 6, and 8 players.
publishers: Juegos Crone, Packard Technologies, Parker Brothers

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Kingsguard
description:
"Bran was going to be a knight himself someday, one of the Kingsguard. Old Nan said they were the finest swords in all the realm. There were only seven of them, and they wore white armor and had no wives or children, but lived only to serve the king." –George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce the upcoming release of The Kingsguard, the third Chapter Pack in the "Kingsroad" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game!

A man’s word can be broken. A knight’s honor can be tarnished. Any man can harbor secret ambitions, even a member of the Kingsguard. The seven Sworn Brothers of the Kingsguard wear white armor and take vows to serve the crown, and only the crown. However, each Sworn Brother is a man at his core, and susceptible to the temptations and ambitions and doubts that plague all men. Each has his secrets, and the sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) in The Kingsguard lend shape to their ambitions, their deceptions, and their deadly talents.

Like each of the Chapter Packs in the Kingsroad cycle, The Kingsguard returns players to a Westeros changed by the War of Five Kings, countless treacheries, and new alliances. The balance of power between the game’s six Houses has changed, as have the faces of those Houses. As part of this return to Westeros, each Chapter Pack in the Kingsroad cycle explores one or more of the game’s existing themes or mechanics, adding new depth of strategies and deck-building options while remaining light on new rules.

Accordingly, as it explores the secret ambitions of the seven active Kingsguard, The Kingsguard adds new depth to the game’s Shadows mechanic, featuring not only Shadows-crested versions of the Knights of the Kingsguard, but of other characters and locations, as well. In total, no fewer than twelve of the Chapter Pack’s twenty different cards feature the Shadows crest.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module R8 – System Defense Command
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

The ships that protect the home front. National Guard cruisers, destroyers, frigates, carriers, and escorts. Heavy police ships and police carriers. Heavy auxiliaries. Auxiliary cruisers. Tugs and salvage ships. Skiffs. Klingon police warships. Sector bases. Hospital ships. Luxury cruise liners. Executive transports. The original Klingon light cruiser. Romulan police flagship. Tholian police cutter. Orion National Police. Andromedan gun sleds. The ISC early years ships (refitted for the General War).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Hawaiian Islands
description:
This new Age of Steam expansion is a solo puzzle!
Each island represent a city and link is represented by connections between the islands.
The aim of the game is to clean the cubes on the link when you pass through the link...

—description from the publisher

name: Girl Genius: The Works – Master Payne's Circus of Adventure
description:
Girl Genius: The Works is a non-collectible card game that consists of several standalone decks of cards. You can play the game with any one of those decks, while also being able to combine some or all of those decks into a single deck for a longer game or a game with more players. Each deck contains many unique cards, but the gameplay is the same in all cases.

Each player gets a five-card hand and twelve cards are laid out face-down in a patchwork pattern. Each card has colored symbols along each side, as well as a point value and special instructions. On your turn, you reveal one face-down card, then spin any face-up card 180º. After spinning, if any of the symbols on the edges of the spun card match the symbols on one or more of the surrounding cards, you "pop" the card(s) with the most matching symbols. "Popping" a card means that you must follow the instructions on the card (whether helpful or harmful), then (usually) add it to your score pile. Cards in your hand are used to replace any popped cards. The game is played until one player has 70/50/40/30 points with two/three/four/more than four players.

Master Payne's Circus of Adventure contains story elements from Agatha's time in the circus as well as her visit to Sturmhalten. Unique character blocks in this deck include Circus Cards, Mimmoths, and some fairly nasty Villains. Roughly ten cards in this deck are part of Master Payne's traveling circus. Although these Circus Cards have different effects, popping some — such as André and Lars — grant you an automatic win if you have five or more Circus Cards in your score pile!

Many of the other cards are designed specifically to help you get closer to the Circus Card goal. Baba Yaga, for example, lets you steal a Circus Card from another player's score pile. The Horse Monster Beastie, on the other hand, scares all the Circus Cards from play back into the deck!

The Mimmoths — tiny, wooly, adorable mammoths — travel in herds, so whenever you pop one of them, you get to steal all the others from every player's score pile! Though Mimmoths are only worth three points each, there are six of them in the deck, and they can snowball into an 18-point block.

name: Latvijas Neatkarības Karš 1918-1920
description:
On November 18th 1918 Latvian Republic declared independence. But Latvians still had to fight for their independence and had to free their territory from the enemy forces.

In this co-op wargame players control Latvian and their allied forces, and fight for the freedom of Latvia.
Players will recruit army units, fight battles, supply their forces and help wounded units.
Historical figures like Kārlis Ulmanis, Oskars Kalpaks and others will assist players in a form of cards.

The game has three scenarios, each covering a period of the war.

Each scenario has their own winning condition and loosing condition. Usually Latvian forces need to gain control of certain territories and hold on to them till the end of game.

Game is driven by a cooperative deck building. Players draw and play cards from a common deck, that they build up together.

name: Shadowrun: Edge Zone
description: Some of you likely remember the Shadowrun trading card game from back in the ’90s. Well, we’ve been updating the graphics, putting in some new art, tweaking a few game elements here and there, and getting it ready for re-release! It will come in two boxes, the Magic deck and the Machine deck, that lets you choose your area of emphasis. You can build two decks and get playing with either deck, or you can get both boxes to make your deck exactly the way you want it to be!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Airships at War 1914-1941
description:
Re-Implements Luftschif published by Sierra Madre Games. For the 12th Anniversary of the Game, Sierra Madre Games published an updated version of the game now called Airships at War 2nd Edition (12th Anniversary 2005 Edition). For owners of the original Luftschif game an expansion module was made available called CRZV.

From its description, the combined 2nd edition adds a final challenge: to command the awesome U.S. flying aircraft carriers of the inter-war years (the Acron, Macon, and never-built ZRCV). Imperial Japanese Navy units are included, and a dozen scenarios cover hypothetical War Plan Orange actions and re-implements Luftschif. As stated this was made available seperately for owners of Luftschif.

In support of the Luftschif 1st edition, Sierra Madre Games published the Expansion Riesenflugzeugabteilungen. Which include the large bombers of the war. The 1st edition is an expansion for Luftschif. It was updated at the same time the 2nd Edition (12th Anniversary 2005 edition) of Airships at War was released and they updated the cover thus reflecting 12th Anniversary 2005 Edition. Additoinal planes were added to the expansion set 2nd edition.

A 3rd edition of the game was made available from RJWargames.com which include a reformatting of the rules and contains the same plane data as Airships at War 2nd edition. The Riesenflugzeugabteilungen is also available from the company.

Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea was developed and released. It is a stand-alone game using the same game system but for WWII.

1st Edition:
Luftschif - Main Game
CRZV - Expansion
Riesenflugzeugabteilungen - Expansion

2nd Edition:
Airships at War (Combines Luftshif and CRZV)
Riesenflugzeugabteilungen - Expansion with updates

3rd Edition:
Airships at War (Combines Luftshif and CRZV) Reformatted Rules
Riesenflugzeugabteilungen - Expansion Same as 2nd

Stand-Alone
Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea (WWII) using the same system.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
publishers: Sierra Madre Games, Sonic Quill Publications

name: Super Dungeon Explore: One Shot
description:
With the crack of her rifle and the smell of gunpowder, One Shot brings her signature ranged warfare into Super Dungeon Explore with deadly effect. Terrified monsters flee in panic, but they can't run fast enough. One Shot has them in her sights!

Contents:
One Shot Hero Model
25mm Base
Game Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Paparazzoo
description:
“Have you ever tried to lead a group of tourists through a crowded zoo while being chased by a giant gorilla?”

In real life, this might be a little too exciting, but in Paparazzoo it’s the scene of a tactical and interactive board game. In Paparazzoo, 3-5 competitive tour guides lead strings of tourists through a zoo – the central game board. The tourists strive to photograph as many animals as they can, while being hindered by a gorilla on the loose. Players draft action cards to move or expand their group, take pictures or direct the gorilla to the rival guides! The player to best guide the tourists’ movements, while staying out of the gorillas way, wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Take That

name: Genotype: Tool Cards Promo Pack
description:
Introduces two new Tool Cards:

Tool Box: Play to copy any face-up Tool Card in the Tool Shed.

Spyglass: Play when another player Validates a Trait to Validate the same Trait.

name: Solomon Kane: Red Shadows
description:
Hunt down the evil Le Loup in an epic, continent-spanning campaign
5 Acts - 50 Chapters
23 Miniatures
15 new Tiles
150 Chapter cards
200 Discovery cards
Story Book
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: GoodCritters: Promo Card Set
description:
A 6-card set of promo cards for GoodCritters consisting of:


Blackmail
Crystal Ball
Custom Tommy
Magician's Jewel
Rare Fossil
Vintage Wine
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation

name: Jaws: Deep Red Sea
description:
Just when you thought it was safe to go back into the water...

Once again, unsuspecting vacationers begin disappearing in the waters off the small resort of Amity, and also further up the sun-drenched coast. Only a few people know the truth.

Each player takes on the role of a desperate mayor, managing a small seaside town in the midst of a blood-soaked crisis, fending off an unknown number of Great White sharks.

Jaws: Deep Red Sea is a fast-playing, non-authorised, non-profit, and non-collectable card game based on the films: Jaws, Jaws II, Jaws 3D, and Jaws: The Revenge. For 2-6 players, this game is a shark-filled, blood pumping experience, where all players draw from the same central deck. Each player manages their hand of cards - to defend their beaches with Fend off with High-pitched Screams, Brody's Service Revolver, Improvised Explosives, Rifle and Gas Cannister Ploy, Crushed Beer Cans, Kick feet desperately, while shrieking, The Orca, and Undersea Power Cable Trick, etc, as well as play scarily large Great White Sharks against their opponent's swimwear-clad vacationers.

Each player may also recruit grizzled experts from around the world to safeguard their beaches from closure. Such shark hunters include Quint, Matt Hooper, Philip FitzRoyce, Hoagie Newcombe, and Chief Brody.

The mayors can also utilise, to save themselves from monstrous fish, some of the following example cards: "Sh-sh-sh-shaaaRRRRKKKKK!" and Eat Screaming Woman - Brandishing a Flare gun while soaked in petrol and Moonlit feed, and the strutting Adonis, Shelby Overman, and Eat Powerboat Water-skier, and "That's some bad hat, Harry," and Eat Diving School and "Overman was killed inside the park. The baby was caught inside the park. Its mother is inside the park," and "Love to prove that, wouldn't ya? Get your name into the National Geographic," and Consume Rescue Helicopter and Pilot, and "You tell Shelby Overman for me he can take a flyin' leap in a rollin' doughnut on a gravel driveway, you hear?" and "Don't be silly. That would indicate a shark of some 35 feet in length," and Bite off leg, and "Lens my ass!" and "Karateing the Picket Fences," and "I don't believe it! Two barrels, and he's going down again!" and "Bad fish. Not like going down the pond chasin' bluegills and tommycods. This shark, swallow you whole," and The Indianapolis Yarn, and "This was no boat accident!" and "You're gonna need a bigger boat," and lastly "What d'ya have there - a portable shower or a monkey cage?"

Money is spent in the game buying Shark Hunters and equipment. Players can also, at any time, spend cash to alter Shark Attack dice rolls, setting the situations up whereby opponents' bathers may be devoured by monstrous Great Whites. Also, some cards, like "Beach Closed," cost the target mayor cash, from revenues lost, forcing them to buy less Anti-shark gear. Money is generally in short supply. Steal or swindle it from other mayors if you can.

Each player starts with 10 vacationers and $10,000.

Last mayor with his beach still full of bathers wins.

NOTE: There is no player elimination. When a mayor has run out of holidaymakers, all his cards and poker chips are removed, and then he can only play Shark Attack cards on the players remaining - attacking the mayor with the most vacationers left in play (he's got the most bathers in the sea). If there is a tie, the player playing the Shark Attack card decides who to devour.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Chaos Isle: Survivors
description:
She was born from a cesspool of mutating Virus and Zombi corpses, a toxic pit dug by the Survivors to dump their defeated enemies in. She is the manifestation of Dr. Z's lixir, arisen to exterminate the Survivors and to make the walking dead her immortal slaves.

The remaining Survivors, the last of the living, finally band together in a last desperate struggle for survival and to rid the Isle of the Virus-Infected Undead once and for all.

Chaos Isle: Survivors is a 28-card Character Replacement Upgrade for Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck. The deck contains every Character ever made for Chaos Isle, six brand new Characters, and the all-devouring Brood Mother, a sort of anti-hero Character with her own set of rules. All cards have brand new artwork and design. Also included are rules for Outbreak: an entirely new way to play the game using strategic cooperative play, and Split Personality: a new way to enhance Mission-Based game styles.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden: Maisy Ballentyne
description:
Promo neighbor included for KS backers, but available as a promo or mini expansion as well.

(From the game piece back)
Maisy Ballentyne...is Callahan's one time fiancee and the Grande Dame of gardening around these here parts.
Eager to impress her, the neighbor with the second highest number of Neighbour tokens will be activated.
If two or more neighbours are tied for second highest number of tokens, there is no effect.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Baruka
description:
The Temple of Baruka is a sacred altar in a secret realm where the Baruka tribe worships their God of Totems, Baruka. The Baruka people invite many emissaries to participate in the yearly Totem High Priest Coronation Feast. You will be an emissary and use the totems to complete the Divine Oracles of Baruka. The participant who can genuinely please the Baruka will be crowned by the God of Totems and become the supreme high priest.

In this game players will prepare and place totems on public Altar to worship Baruka. Each players have unique missions (mainly a combination of totem arrangement) to accomplish, which provide rewards. These missions can be accomplished by other players because we are playing on a public Altar, so make sure to pay attention to what your opponents are heading on! Players also can score from “Sacrifice”, placing totems and form the indicated shapes with the Totems of each color. Furthermore, players may hire helpers to help placing totem. Some helpers may provide extra totems, some may give you ability to knock out/ transform/ rearrange current totems on Altar, and some can provide different ways of scoring. After a few rounds of competition (depend on the number of players), the player with highest score wins the fame and good luck as the supreme high priest of Baruka!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Matching, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up

name: Fleet Commander: Forge
description:
Fleet Commander: Forge

With the Forge mini-expansion, you will be able to add to your fleet some of the most powerful and sophisticated warships ever seen in the galaxy. Using the hulls of standard warships, the "Forge" managed to develop a new mix of capacities according to the requirements of their customers. As a Commander of the Hegemony of Amycles, you can now add the dangerous class 2 Assault-ship and class 3 Gun-ship to your fleet. As a Phoeban Commander, count on the fast Strategic Cruiser and the sturdy Turtle Ship to master the battle zone. Finally, intelligence agencies intercepted transmissions about "specific special weapons" inbound to system PA-FF-104. Has the "Forge of Fendrix" already equipped Battleships with such unique devices, or are they still only plans? The answer is in the battle to come.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: 1565, St. Elmo's Pay: Promo Pack
description:
1565, St. Elmo's Pay: Promo Pack includes eight brand new, unique, and gorgeously illustrated cards to add to your games of 1565: St. Elmo's Pay – The Great Siege of Malta as well as two brand new promo cards for the game 1066, Tears to Many Mothers: The Battle of Hastings.

Four new real life events from the Greatest Siege in History, and four more unsung heroes from the battle - including the courageous Salih Reis, and the bold Vincenzo Anastagi - add even more stunningly realised and richly researched content to your Ottoman and Malta decks. Enhance the variety of your gameplay options, and find new ways to surprise your foe - simply shuffle these promo cards into your game and you are ready to go.

The promo cards for the game 1066, Tears to Many Mothers: The Battle of Hastings are:

1x Saxon Character (TP1) - Hereward the Wake - Fearsome: Destroy 1 non-Leader enemy in this card's Wedge.
1x Norman Character (TP2) - Richard FitzGilbert - Fearsome: Destroy 1 non-Leader enemy in this card's Wedge.

—description (with minor edits) from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tug of War

name: Credibility Gap
description:
In 1967, Amherst Game Company prefaced this game with the phrase: "The CREDIBILITY GAP game is intended purely for the entertainment of its players. It is not intended to have any special reference to the present Administration in Washington whose concern for the truth is well known. Ideally the players should regard the game as set in some distant future time."

With this "Tranquilizing Myth", 2-4 players are invited to partake in Credibility Gap, a political satire game published during the time when the term "credibility gap" was in greatest vogue. It remains equally timely today.

Players ferret out the Truths of the Administration from the Big Wheel, recognizing Brittle Analogies, Solemn Platitudes, and other variants while avoiding the dreaded Snow Job. They are aided by cards which, in proper combination, will permit them to give opponents Good or Bad advice, make Demands, gain access by phone or mail to the Big Wheel, or seek for the Big Wheel's Truth Vault itself to attain the elusive Truths. The first player to accumulate 20 Truth markers is the winner.

Components include:

4 wooden Liberty Bell movers,
80+ wooden Truth markers,
a four piece puzzle board,
36 "Administrative Pack" cards, and
58 "Citizens' Deck" cards.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stalingrad: Pivot on the Volga
description:
"If we do not stop retreating, we shall be left without bread, without fuel, without metal, without raw materials, without factories, without railways." [Stavka Order No. 227, July 28, 1942]

Stalingrad: Pivot on the Volga is a two-player game about the military drama that unfolded in southern Russia during the last half of 1942, culminating with the surrender of the German Sixth Army at Stalingrad on February 2, 1943.

One player takes on the role of the collective Axis theater commanders, chafing under the Fuhrers directives and orders embodied in the game's victory conditions. His opponent takes on the role of their Soviet counterparts, struggling to turn the tide after a year of catastrophic losses, fortunate enough to have a commander (Stalin) who allows more operational freedom, but who does not tolerate defeat.

The 11 x 17" map covers the Southern Russia at 55 km per hex. The 280 counters represent the German and Soviet troops at a divisional/corp/army level.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The War in Virginia: 1862-1865
description:
The War in Virginia is a military board game based on the action in the Virginia Theater during the War between the States. The product of extensive research, it is designed to simulate the major strategic options available to the supreme commanders of the contesting forces at the beginning of the second year of the War.

A game of generalship encompassing the elements of strategy and grand tactics. Designed for historical accuracy in an easy-to-understand format.

Components include:
22x26" map
140 counters
2 combat cards
16 half-page rules

name: AAARGH!!
description:
Aliens vs. humans in a classical inside-ship fight. This game was published in a scientific Italian magazine (Scienza & Vita).

In the designer's notes, author wrote that this game was inspired by:

Intruder
The Wreck of the B.S.M. Pandora
Snapshot
Azhanti High Lightning
Space Warrior
The Awful Green Things From Outer Space

name: Beat the Cat
description:
A snowmobile racing game ("Cat" refers to the "Arctic Cat" model of snowmobile) with individually rated machines and drivers. Hard to find and collectible, it has a plastic-covered board with slots for vehicle and driver cards, so that maneuvers can be marked during the course of the game.

The board is divided into regions with different speed characteristics, and there are numerous hazards (bumps, grooves, and ice) that drivers must take into account when making moves. There is also the ability to "force over" other drivers, even off the racing surface - giving the game a more gladiatorial twist. Movement and reaction to hazards are effected by dice rolls, though some drivers provide the ability to move at "maximum speed" during the turn.

name: Eaux Vives
description: The ecosystem game in which you play fish. You try to keep yours alive, by eating the opponents', and you have to be careful to not run out of food. It's about the food chain.

name: Chess Variations  Ancient, Regional, and Modern
description:
This book contains over 40 chess variants including rules and sample games. Most of the variants are historical or well known regional and modern variations.

Some of the chess games included: Chatturanga, Shatranj/Medieval Chess, Oblong Chess, Byzantine (round board) Chess, Timur's (Tamerlane) Chess, Turkish Grand Chess, Courier Chess, Chinese Chess (Hsang Chi), Shogi, Tsiu Shogi, Double Chess, Martian Chess (Jetan), Capablanca's Chess, Nieuchess (the Avalon Hill game--which isn't very chess-like at all).

According to some later writers the rules given for some variants have significant errors.

name: CEP: Combate en el Espacio Profundo
description:
Adapted From Ediciones Sombra's website:

"CEP: Combat in the deep space is a new product of Edicions Sombra. Though shares the same ambientación Exo RPG is perfectly compatible with this one, CEP is an independent product that can be used with or separated to the RPG, and can be adapted to other games of science fiction. CEP, with an agile and intuitive system will allow you to recreate innumerable spatial combats between fighters, merchant ships, ships wetnurse and small battleships.

The game contains two hexed color isomorph boards of 24 x 34 centimeters, two frames of counters with more than hundred ships to your disposition, two cards players aids whit the sequence of play, and a rules manual of 44 pages that includes rules for the creation of ships (extended of the included ones in RPG), the rules of spatial combat, the description of the usable ships directly in the game and three introductory scenarios (one of them to play in solitary)."
